description:
More and more companies are using GitHub Enterprise, so the support team is growing. When our customers have problems, they contact us and it is our goal to help them as quickly and awesomely as possible. We're looking for Enterprise Support Engineers in Asia Pacific. This is the current list of countries in which we are set up as an employer in Asia Pacific, so legal working authorization is required: Japan, Australia, and New Zealand.

Your main responsibility will be to work with our customers to solve support tickets. Tickets are usually opened by internal system administrators, and can include investigating load or networking issues, debugging application errors, and discussing feature requests. You'll also work with our engineering team to prioritize issues and development, and our documentation team to improve customer-facing resources. You don’t need to be a Git expert, but you do need to have technical experience and a passion for helping people. The position reports to an Enterprise Support Manager and works closely with other teams and leaders across the company.

GitHub works remotely and asynchronously as much as possible. While this role does not require you to live near our office, it will require some travel to meet with co-workers or attend company events.

Responsibilities:

*Solve complex customer support tickets often involving Linux servers, source code, and web application issues

*Effectively communicate technical information to customers and engineering groups at GitHub

*Work proactively with customers on activities such as coordinating upgrades, communicating upcoming features, and ensuring their installation is running smoothly

*Identify bugs and improvements in the GitHub Enterprise codebase

*Manage urgent customer outages during business hours

Qualifications:

*Must have current legal working authorizaton

*General understanding of how modern web applications work

*Prior experience providing technical support

*Excellent problem solving skills

*Familiarity with some flavor of production-level virtual machine (e.g., VMware ESX, Xen, KVM)

*Enthusiasm for working directly with customers

*Stellar English and grammar skills

Bonus points if you have:

*Worked closely with large complex customer accounts

*Familiarity with Git and GitHub

*Experience with phone support

*Ability to look through and understand code (Ruby / Bash)

*Previous experience as a System Administrator

*Previous experience as a Linux System Administrator

About GitHub

WHO WE ARE

GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over ten million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com, our desktop and mobile apps, and GitHub Enterprise, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write better code, faster.

We have a lot of exciting things to do, and we’re looking for the right people to grow with us!

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN

Working at GitHub is, to put it simply, a special slice of the universe. We're committed to transparency, collaboration, experimentation, and always staying classy.

Because of this unique perspective, we've established one of the most flexible and well designed physical workspaces around that encourages you to work as you work best. Right now, over 60% of our employees are based outside of our San Francisco (SOMA) headquarters and work according to how they get their best stuff done.

Ensuring that GitHubbers are healthy, motivated, focused and creative is how GitHub stays awesome. Part of this is ensuring that our benefits* are out of this world.

In a nutshell, we've built and are growing a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people with many different backgrounds and lifestyles, and we like it that way. We invite applications from people of all stripes. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences that people imagine to discriminate against one another. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate.

*Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions don't hesitate to ask your recruiter!

description:
Job Summary:

GitHub helps companies and organizations succeed by allowing them to build better software, together. We're looking for experienced Solutions Engineers to provide pre- and post-sales support for our rapidly-growing customer base. A Solutions Engineer is responsible for the technical relationships with customers and prospects and works internally with sales and product development to identify and communicate solutions to meet customers' business needs. This person acts as a resource for the sales and customer success teams, our front-line technical support team, and other functional departments within the company.

We're extremely passionate about the quality of our work. If you are technically sharp and people oriented, you might be a fit for this role!

Pre-Sales Responsibilities:

  • Identifying customer business requirements and matching them to product features
  • Building joint customer strategies with enterprise sales and field services to encourage product adoption
  • Providing live demonstrations of GitHub Enterprise to prospective customers
  • Answering GitHub product questions and helping customers and prospects to take full advantage of the GitHub product
  • Answering GitHub technical questions and helping customers integrate GitHub with their existing development tools and workflows
  • Building relationships with key decision makers, visiting customers on-site, and serving as a customer's technical point of contact
  • Educating prospects on product implementation and usage
  • Learning about customers' successes and challenges, sharing customer feedback within GitHub, and advocating for customer interests
  • Maintaining awareness of internal GitHub initiatives and the Source Control Management (SCM) industry

Post-Sales Responsibilities:

  • Acting as intermediary between sales and other technical teams to best meet customer needs
  • Communicating customer feedback and perspectives to appropriate teams to be considered in product strategy
  • Documenting technical considerations, collecting existing articles, and contributing to internal knowledge bases as a resource for other teams, customers, and partners

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in sales/solutions engineering, technical consulting, or system integration project management for enterprise accounts; customer-facing experience is a must
  • Ability to travel up to 50%
  • Team-oriented and possess strong collaboration skills
  • Passionate commitment to quality and success
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to quickly solve technical and business-related challenges
  • Able to relate technical concepts to customers of all technical backgrounds
  • Knowledge of Source Control Management (SCM) tools and workflows
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working in or with large software development teams
  • Ability to work across different time zones
  • Knowledge of Git and GitHub workflows
  • Knowledge of Salesforce.com workflows
  • Knowledge of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
  • Knowledge of continuous integration, continuous delivery

About GitHub

Who we are

GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over five million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com, our desktop and mobile apps, and GitHub Enterprise, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write better code, faster.

We have a lot of exciting things to do, and we’re looking for the right people to grow with us!

Why you should join

Working at GitHub is, to put it simply, a special slice of the universe. We're committed to transparency, collaboration, experimentation, and always staying classy.

Because of this unique perspective, we've established one of the most flexible and well designed physical workspaces around that encourages you to work as you work best. Right now, over 60% of our employees are based outside of our San Francisco (SOMA) headquarters and work according to how they get their best stuff done. Remote GitHubbers also come visit SF often and are encouraged to stay as long as they like!

Ensuring that GitHubbers are healthy, motivated, focused and creative is how GitHub stays awesome. Part of this is ensuring that our benefits are out of this world.

In a nutshell, we've built and are growing a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people with many different backgrounds and lifestyles, and we like it that way. We invite applications from people of all stripes. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences that people imagine to discriminate against one another. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate.

description:
The GitHub Professional Services team is looking to have a talented teacher join our group. The job centers around in-person, virtual, and recorded means of teaching students the best ways to leverage Git and GitHub in the context of collaboratively developing great software. The job involves working with a wide range of GitHub teams, developing and refining curriculum, hosting webinars with customers and curious developers, traveling to customer sites for full-day workshops, and recording asynchronous training sessions in partnership with team members.

Qualifications:

  • Eager to acquire Git and GitHub skills
  • Background as a developer or technology teacher
  • Ability to convert knowledge into learning experiences
  • Ambition to help students learn job skills
  • Must possess a relaxed, knowledgeable, and classy disposition in front of people
  • Willingness to speak to a wide range of range of audience sizes
  • Ability to critically discuss and write debriefs of training events
  • Ability to collaborate and work well with others, including clients and team members
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Must be willing to travel 50% to customer sites
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States

We'd love if you have:

  • Experience as a technology trainer
  • Git and GitHub skills
  • Continuous integration and application lifecycle management (ALM) knowledge
  • Experience building screencasts
  • Great stage presence or ability to be comfortable on camera

description:
GitHub is looking for an experienced Product Design Manager to join our product design team. GitHub’s product design team works closely with engineering, product managers, researchers, and support teams to iteratively design, build, and ship features to our users.

As a Product Design Manager, you'd be responsible for managing a small team of product designers and providing design direction across their projects. Critical analysis of product development and strategy is important, but so is a strong background of visual design, interaction design, and implementing features alongside engineers.

Qualifications

  • Experience leading or managing a design team.
  • Strong mentoring and coaching skills.
  • History of shipping successful, well designed products.
  • Experience using research and data to inform design and product decisions.
  • Portfolio demonstrating strong understanding of visual design, interaction design, and product strategy.
  • Exceptional communication skills, especially written communication.
  • Experience working with distributed teams is a plus.

Responsibilities

  • Regularly provide high level design direction to your team members for key company initiatives.
  • Have regular 1 on 1 meetings with design team members.
  • Contribute to the development of the Design team at large alongside fellow managers.
  • Manage and mentor a small team of designers working across many projects.
  • Work with individuals to plan both short and long-term career path.
  • Recruit and interview designers, build a diverse design team.
  • Work with the designers to define and develop best practices to ensure a high quality, consistent product experience.
  • Set clear goals and work with designers to prioritize work and execute on ideas to meet those goals.

description:
The Professional Services team at GitHub focuses on helping customers successfully get started and grow with GitHub. The Services Engineer is a combined consulting services and customer training role. We're looking for an amazing individual who loves to connect with people and help them solve problems with GitHub.

GitHub is an amazing platform that can revolutionize the way organizations work. We want to help our customers by giving them a great experience from the very beginning of their use of the platform.

As a Services Engineer, you'll be the expert that:

  • Helps organizations properly implement and expand their GitHub usage
  • Works with customers on-site and remotely to get started on the GitHub platform. This entails:
    • Implementing GitHub Enterprise and integration with customers' existing infrastructure
    • Educating customers about the GitHub workflow through hands-on demonstration
    • Developing and updating materials and tools to aid customers in their ongoing use of the GitHub platform
    • Documenting and sharing best practices and standards with GitHub customers

During customer engagements, areas of focus may include:

  • Organization administration - help define and implement a strategy for orgs, teams, permissions, and LDAP/Active Directory/Single-sign-on integration
  • Infrastructure administration - advise and set up backup, recovery, high-availability, monitoring, upgrades, GitHub support flow
  • Platform integrations - discuss options for integrating 3rd party services with GitHub (examples: CI, chat, project management & issue trackers)
  • Platform customization - assist customers in learning and employing the GitHub API to customize their workflow

Customers have a wide variety of development processes and tools. To best guide customers, the ideal candidate will have many of the following attributes:

  • Experience with Git and GitHub
  • Software development experience and an understanding of several of these methodologies and tools:
    • Software development methods such as Agile, Scrum, Lean, Waterfall
    • Software project tools like JIRA, Pivotal Tracker, Trello, Asana, and MS Project
    • Development environments like Eclipse, Xcode, VisualStudio, IntelliJ, and NetBeans
    • Continuous integration and build automation with Jenkins, TeamCity, TFS, TravisCI, CircleCI
  • Experience configuring the following technologies:
    • LDAP, ActiveDirectory, and other SAML/Single-Sign-on services
    • VMware vSphere, ESXi, and other virtual infrastructure tools
  • Demonstrated ability to connect with people, lead client projects, and help clients solve problems with GitHub
  • Strong ability to manage client expectations and project scope before and during client engagements

Candidates must have authorization to work in the US for this role and be willing to travel 50%.

description:
About Madefire

Madefire has a consumer-facing lineup of native mobile digital comics apps, across iOS, Android, Windows 8, Windows Phone, Android TV, Apple TV, and soon coming to VR and AR.

Madefire also sells an enterprise product called Motion Book Publisher; an end-to-end mobile digital publishing platform. IDW Publishing, Transformers Comics, Archie Comics, and many other publishers power their mobile storefronts with Motion Book Publisher.

Position: Lead Developer-- Javascript / Node / Electron

Madefire has pioneered a new format for digital reading called "Motion Books". We have a web-based authoring tool, the Motion Book Tool, that our artists, animators, sound designers, and publishers use to create Motion Books. We are embarking upon a ground-up rewrite of the Motion Book Tool, using open web technologies, as well as Electron for native OS access. This position represents a rare opportunity to build a significant creative tool, with an existing V 1.0 in the market that enjoys significant adoption by the creative community. You will have access to the world's best creative talent as you design the tools that will help these artists create new forms of storytelling. This is also a team lead position, so it is expected that this position will build the team required for the product development.

You can check out the end results by downloading the Madefire app and browsing through the Motion Books section. You can also take a look at the existing Motion Book Tool at https://create.madefire.com, and read some of the documentation and tutorials at http://kb.madefire.com/.

Here are the technical characteristics of the person we're looking for:

  • Architecturally-minded
  • Experience with application (as opposed to website) development
  • Deep in Javascript
  • Experience or interest in Electron
  • Experience or interest in Node
  • Experience designing or adding to standard formats or custom formats (JSON, XML)
  • Experience with building products as platforms
  • Degree in CS, MS preferred or equivalent professional experience
  • Experience or interest in building and leading a team

Here are the temperamental characteristics of the person we're looking for:

  • Love of the startup lifestyle
  • Passion for the arts (preferably a practitioner of art, music, drama, or literature)
  • Ability to GSD
  • Healthy balance of strong opinions while keeping dogma in check
  • Platform agnosticism (Mac, Windows, iOS, Android, HTML5; it's all good)
  • Tolerance for ambiguity
  • Willingness to do it "ugly" whenever necessary
  • Obsession with doing it "right" whenever possible
  • Ability to start
  • Ability to finish
  • Elevate co-workers (i.e. not a ball-hog)
  • Enjoy being in the office, but be able to be productive from home

From a cultural perspective, Madefire is a grown-up startup. We believe in a sustainable pace, so we keep reasonable schedules. We also have a high degree of autonomy, so schedules are flexible, as long as everyone is considerate towards the team regarding availability.

The engineering team works remotely on Wednesdays and Fridays.

We like to have a pace that minimizes meetings, so Slack and a five-minute Google Hangout usually does the trick.

There's a great mix of art and technology going on in the office. It's also a very nice setup; high ceilings, fun location, fresh air, good light, and no bad smells.

We're comics-focused, and we're in Berkeley, so if those two things appeal, it's a very nice setup.

Design, art, and technology are all very important to Madefire. If you are obsessive about design, you'll find like minds at Madefire.

Candidates from diverse backgrounds strongly encouraged to apply.
title: Lead Developer - Javascript Node Electron - Berkeley CA

description:
We’re on a quest for an extraordinary back-end engineer who will join us to help build and maintain clean, modern applications.

You are a self-starter with a bias for action, and you can take projects from start to finish. You want to work as part of a small, tightly-knit team that moves quickly and pushes changes to production many times a day. You always admired your friends in science, but your knack for computers led you to programming.

Every day, thousands of scientists improve the efficiency of their research by using Quartzy. Our team is passionate about accelerating scientific research through well-designed, meaningful tools for labs. We recently raised a new round of funding and are gearing up for rapid product development.

What you'll do

  • Design and implement new functionality from the ground up
  • Work closely with your team to design and develop a robust REST API
  • Measure and improve site performance and scalability
  • Write well tested code that is resilient to heavy iteration

What we're looking for

  • Demonstrable experience writing clean, thoughtfully crafted PHP that scales
  • Experience with other parts of our technology stack: MySQL, Redis, Beanstalkd, NGINX, Git
  • An entrepreneurial attitude that gets high-quality projects done quickly
  • Ability to work efficiently and communicate clearly
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the US

What we'd love

  • Experience implementing the JSON API specification
  • Familiarity with SOLID practices and/or domain driven design
  • Experience working with money in code
  • Familiarity with asynchronous worker queues
  • Occasionally, you end the day with more lines of code removed than added; and that feels great

Does that sound like you? We'd love to hear from you. Click here to apply: http://grnh.se/wn8h0f
title: PHP Engineer

description:
The Caporaso Lab at Northern Arizona University is hiring a software engineer to develop open source bioinformatics software (primarily in Python 3) as part of the widely used QIIME 2 and scikit-bio projects.

The Caporaso Lab is a grant-funded, startup-like environment. We employ agile development practices on a daily basis to design, implement and ship stable, high-quality, and rigorously tested bioinformatics software. We love open source software and publish all of our projects on GitHub.

We develop and apply tools to study microbiomes and to teach bioinformatics, including QIIME and An Introduction to Applied Bioinformatics. QIIME is very widely used, having been cited over 4000 times since its initial publication, including in top scientific journals such as Science and Nature. One application of QIIME in the Caporaso Lab was recently covered in the Washington Post and The Onion. More details on QIIME 2, which was recently funded by the National Science Foundation, can be found in Dr. Caporaso’s recent post on the American Gut Blog: QIIME 2 will revolutionize microbiome bioinformatics.

Primary Duties

  • Development, testing, and documentation of bioinformatics software as a member of a multidisciplinary team.
  • User support via email, online forums, hands-on workshops, and in-person or virtual meetings to assist users of software developed in the Caporaso Lab. Occasional travel may be required to assist with teaching bioinformatics workshops, attend conferences or software development “sprints/hackathons”, or visit collaborators.
  • Detailed iterative code review of software developed by others, prior to integration into software packages developed in the Caporaso Lab.
  • Assistance with development of software design plans.
  • Preparation and testing of software releases.
  • Assist with management of a team of programmers.
  • Leadership in development of software design plans.
  • Publish software releases.
  • Assist with writing manuscripts for publication in the primary literature.
  • Assist with preparation of grant reports.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Associates degree in Computer Science or related field, and four years of programming experience; OR,
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field and two years of programming experience; OR
  • Six years of programming experience; OR
  • Any equivalent combination of experience, training and/or education.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience developing and testing Python software.
  • Experience using GitHub.
  • Experience working with command line software in Linux and Mac OS X environments.
  • Past history of contribution to open source software. Ideally this can be demonstrated through GitHub activity.
  • Past history of working with teams of software development. Ideally this can be demonstrated through GitHub activity.
  • Past history of software release management.
title: Bioinformatics Research Software Engineer

description:
Looking for an innovative, creative, passionate, and fun company in OC. Then let us introduce ourselves. We are MobilityWare and we make fun for a living and do it better than most! Our mobile games have been rocking the app store since its inception and we regularly show up in those top two, top five, and top ten lists for most popular games. We recently reached over 200 million downloads, which is like 3/4's of the US populate!

We're 100% self-funded and awesomely profitable. Basically, that means we don't have some control freak investors calling the shots on your work and we aren't freaking out about where our next check is coming from.

We were voted 2015 Best Places to Work in Orange County by the Orange County Business Journal and OC Register!

Job Description

Love games? Always wanted to work in the game industry? Excited about writing systems that are used by millions of people each day? We need a server ninja and it could be you!

We are looking for a highly creative, organized and talented software developer with incredible interpersonal skills and the programming experience to match. Our services are the glue that carry our players from game to game and enable great social experiences. We build the systems that give insight into what our players love about our games and help us deliver more of what they love. We build developer tools that help our game teams get great content into the players' hands faster and more reliably.

What You Will Be Doing:

Work closely with the lead server engineer.

Build a kick-ass, rock-solid build and deployment pipeline for games and services.

Use convention-over-configuration to ease the mental burden in the studio around builds, environments, and tooling.

Write automation to construct VMs for fully repeatable build agents across all of our operating system and tool configurations.

Write shell scripts (bash, etc.) that run on our farm of build machines to automate common tasks.

Develop templates for common build tasks.

Work with engineering stakeholders around the studio to drive adoption and adherence to standards and conventions.

Design integrations to configure 3rd party tools such as content management systems

Support the operation of live systems including responding to issues and failures in a timely fashion.

Work with server engineers to develop deployment automation that involves 0 down-time.

Strong preference for someone who is also interested in contributing to service design and development.

Qualifications

At Least 2 years of experience being an awesome software engineer / game developer / programmer and sensei like coding skills using Maven for Java, Visual Studio/MSBUILD for C#, xcodebuild for Objective-C.

Demonstrable knowledge of Unix variants including OSX and Ubuntu.

Demonstrable skill with shell scripting.

Strong skills with version control systems including SVN and Git.

Polyglot with skill in at least one mature server language and tools (Java, .NET, Python, Scala, etc) and interest in learning more.

Demonstrable knowledge of server operating systems.

Basic knowledge of service oriented architectures especially RESTful systems.

Knowledge of Agile project management principles and how it applies to software engineering practice.

Knowledge of and desire to work in a DevOps oriented software organization that deploys and supports what they create.

Demonstrable knowledge of cloud technologies especially AWS.

Purple Squirrel Credits for All of the Following:

Android Development iOS Development Game Development Front-End Development GUI Development Agile/Scrum Additional information

Why you should work for us:

Awesome Perks: free lunch, free snacks, free soda, free coffee, free trip, free dental, free vision

Casually awesome workplace - yes, flip flops and shorts are pretty much an everyday thing

Growth, growth, growth - we are growing and we would love to take you on the ride

We also want to take care of our team so we've got profit sharing incentives, medical, dental (100% paid), vision (100% paid), UNLIMITED PTO, life insurance (100% paid), and 401K

Awesome office smack dab in the middle of OC and 2 minutes off the 5 freeway

Amazing talent: We've got some heavy hitters from the industry who embody both brilliance AND humility (seriously no A**holes!)
title: Sr. Software Engineer - Game Sever

description:
Voxy is changing people's lives for the better every single day. That’s not an overstatement, it’s the truth. Learning a new language is the single hardest things that you can ask an adult to do. We make it happen. Every. Single. Day.

Voxy provides a cloud-based English language learning platform that’s based on 20 years of cutting edge scientific research into language learning. It’s proven effective, in the lab and in the wild. It’s a tough problem, but that’s okay, we like tough problems and you should too.

Come join a growing start-up as we tackle the old-school entrenched players in a $60B/year industry that hasn’t seen any real innovation in decades. If it’s a kick-ass culture, paying customers and top-tier investors that you’re looking for, well, we have that.

These things are important to us, and they should be important to you too:

  • Communication - we firmly believe that communication is the key to success and the way we work relies heavily on great communication skills. You should be an outstanding communicator, both verbally and written.
  • Organization - our engineers practice, and love, eXtreme Programming. While you might not have actually practiced XP you should have experience in running an Agile product process, and understand why it’s the better way of doing things.
  • Management - we have a team of 12 highly functioning engineers in New York and Sao Paolo. You will have 2 plus years experience managing a team of at least 5 engineers - bonus for managing or working with a remote team.
  • Vision - we believe the director should also be on the ground coding with the team. You will have 5 plus years engineering experience including at least 2 years experience at the "architect" level, or higher and experience with larger scale, customer focused, web-based applications.
  • Flexibility - we’re fast paced and sometimes things change. We all need to be able to shift gears quickly and deal with the unexpected. Embrace chaos.
  • Respect - we love new ideas and discussion, and while we don’t always agree with each other our strong opinions are loosely held.

What we’ll ask of you:

You’ll be responsible for day-to-day management and technical leadership that the engineering team needs, and will spend around 50% of the time hands on with engineering. At Voxy engineering and product are very closely aligned and you’ll work with the VP of Product to help define, refine and contribute to the product roadmap. Responsibility for communication between the engineering team, product team and Senior Leadership will be yours.

Working at Voxy:

  • Competitive salary (base/bonus)
  • Great benefits: Medical, dental, vision, Flex Spending (FSA), gym reimbursement, mobile service reimbursement, Citi Bike and free on-site language classes
  • Ongoing professional development and reimbursement for attendance at industry or professional conferences
  • Incredible team of super bright, creative, talented and passionate individuals
  • Awesome office space in downtown Manhattan that’s easily accessible by many trains

About us!

Voxy is a leading web and mobile-based English learning platform that provides personalized language instruction to major educational institutions, corporations and governments in North and South America, Europe and Asia. Voxy’s proven approach draws on more than 30 years of academic research on second language acquisition. Every online course combines adaptive learning technology and authentic, real-world content to support learners’ unique needs in real time. Voxy launched in 2010 as one of the most disruptive technology startups of the year, and has since been used by millions of learners around the world. It has been recognized for its innovative approach by major media outlets including the New York Times, Forbes, CNN, Veja and Fast Company, and is backed by leading education and technology investors including Rethink Education, ff Venture, Contour Venture Partners and Pearson PLC. Voxy is headquartered in New York City and has an office in São Paulo.

description:
Real Estate Arts NYC is looking for a mid weight front-end developer where you will get to work across high profile client projects. As part of our agency your days will be filled with developing websites that are promoting the most creative and dynamic real estate projects. You’ll have a keen eye for the finest details, be able to interpret pixel perfect designs that work across all devices and have a general understanding of JavaScript. Experience with any CMS systems (specifically wordpress) would be preferred. Working closely with UX/visual designers/Design Directors and project managers you should be comfortable working under your own initiative and able to deliver projects on time ideally having worked in an agency environment before. We offer a fun, relaxed work environment, competitive salary based on experience.

Please include examples of recent work and/or links to a Github repository.

**** NO RECRUITERS ****

REQUIREMENTS

  • HTML5
  • CSS/CSS3/CSS preprocessor LESS/SASS
  • Grunt/Gulp
  • Responsive design techniques
  • JavaScript including jQuery
  • Ability to write well structured, semantic, maintainable code
  • Excellent understanding of crossbrowser and crossplatform issues.
  • Ability to complete and juggle multiple projects while meeting strict deadlines.
  • Basic SEO best practices.
  • Experience with version control (GIT)
  • Website optimisation experience. (GZIP, file minification/compression, image optimisation)
  • Know your way around Photoshop

DESIRABLE

  • Previous agency experience
  • CMS experience

About Us

A building is more than available square feet, fixtures and elevator banks. It’s a destination, a lifestyle. In an increasingly sophisticated and competitive real estate market, it’s no longer about selling property—it’s about envisioning experiences.REA is a brand and marketing agency that turns breakthrough ideas into transformative experiences. We bring together a diversity of talent and perspectives that allow us to see opportunities others don’t and bring brands to life in fresh and unexpected ways. More than ten years ago, we set out to change the game in real estate branding and marketing. Since then, working in partnership with our clients, we’ve been connecting big ideas with bold experiences to move brands and businesses forward.

description:
Scout -- https://scoutapp.com/

JOB OPENING: FRONT-END DEVELOPER Scout is building the next generation of APM (Application Performance Monitoring). We take a lot of pride in our product (making it awesome), our work (making it fun), and our co-workers (making them happy). We're passionate about building the best possible tools for developers.

YOUR MISSION: DELIGHT USERS WITH A SMOOTH, BEAUTIFUL, EASY-TO-USE WEB UI Developer tools aren't known for amazing UI & UX -- but Scout is an exception! We place huge importance on ease-of-use and a thoughtful, focused web UI. We need you to:

We use jQuery, Slim, Backbone, bootstrap, and D3 - *exposure to those specifically is nice but not required *experience with data-driven applications. Think charts, dashboards, etc. *good intuition on layout and composition. You don't need to be an design expert *to play well with back-end developers. Every feature touches back- & front-end, and you'll need to hash out solutions together

BENEFITS -- Competitive salary, health care reimbursement, unlimited vacation time, sneak out for a bike ride/hike on a beautiful day. Newest-model retina Macbook pro supplied.

LOCATION -- We're located in Fort Collins, Colorado. We'd like someone local, but open to a remote employee if they are in the same time zone or 1 hour time difference. United States only.

HOW TO APPLY -- Resumes are fine, but a more personal email is better. Email to punch.the.clock@scoutapp.com.

description:
Dekeo Team Lead Developer

Are you driven to build problem-solving applications? Do you get energized by collaborating -- and learning alongside -- super-talented team members? Are you passionate and pragmatic about the craft of writing code? Do you like to have fun while you’re at it? Would you enjoy doing it on an international tropical island? If so, then read on.

About Us:

Dekeo is a new branded site being spun out of a fast-growing, profitable company. Dekeo is creating a global ecommerce marketplace for promotional products (putting company or team logos on t-shirts, water bottles, and stickers). While the company is still very much at a growth stage – there's a huge number of technical challenges still to solved, exciting ideas to pursue, and value to be built.

What we'd like to see in the candidate:

  • BS in computer science combined with 6+ years of work experience
  • Deep knowledge of Ruby on Rails and with modern JavaScript libraries and tooling
  • An appreciation of object-oriented design principles and the ability to pragmatically apply them to your work
  • Experience working with large, custom search systems using Solr or ElasticSearch
  • Previous experience building end-to-end machine learning systems
  • Experience with AWS RedShift, Spark, or Hadoop
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools (e.g. Git)
  • Fluency in any backend server language, and expertise at writing complex SQL queries
  • Deep understanding of relational database schema design and performance tuning
  • SQL and general database knowledge
  • Mentor other engineers towards technical excellence – in your team and across new growth through pragmatic use of our technology core

Compensation

  • Globally Competitive Salary paid in USD
  • Work permit
  • 10 paid vacation days, plus major holidays
  • $1,000 annual employee travel home allowance
  • Global first class medical insurance (BUPA)
  • Generous stock options

Relocation

If you make our short-list, we will fly you out to Phuket for in-person interviews. We also like to have candidates work in the office for a week to determine great mutual fit. Our job offer includes the following relocation assistance and benefits:

  • Relocation flights and temporary accommodation
  • Local orientation session and language lessons
  • Home, school and transportation search assistance
  • Visas for dependents

description:
GitHub is looking for a full-time Business Systems Manager to join our Business Systems team to manage, scale, and expand our Hire2Retire processes and technology.

This position offers great opportunities for teamwork, leadership, planning and career development in a fast growing company. As a Business Systems Manager of Hire2Retire, you will be responsible to govern, implement, and scale our Business Processes and Systems and integrate with other business systems (Lead2Order, Order2Cash, Financials, and BI). You will be expected to develop new ideas, find new capabilities, recommend best practices, evaluate and recommend business systems of choice, and drive their implementations/integration.

You'll be an important contributor and join a tight-knit environment of technical and business-minded individuals. We're a group that enjoys mastering new and sometimes difficult subject matter, strives for efficient and effective processes, and works both independently and as part of a goal-oriented team.

Succeeding in this position requires you to be a self-starter with proven problem-solving skills. You should enjoy becoming a subject matter expert in multiple areas and have a strong affinity for efficient end-2-end processes, well-integrated business systems, and a passion for structured data.

This position is based in our San Francisco office and reports to our Head of Business Systems.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the effort of Global HRIS/Payroll vendor selection through well proven methodology
  • Manage the Global ATS/HRIS/Payroll implementation and integrations with other business systems
  • Lead the design and development of a People information systems and document management roadmap to include business process design, system implementations, project management, change management, training, information security, and compliance
  • Manage system administration to leverage full system capabilities including subsystems, such as: Time Management, Onboarding, Performance, and Compensation Administration to maximize efficiency
  • Ensure people data integrity in HR system, providing a source of truth for people data via reporting, analytics, and outputs for consuming systems
  • Maintain effective security roles for HRIS and Benefits, ATS and document storage systems, so managers and employees can see the right data and participate in the right workflows
  • Represent People team on key cross-organizational teams addressing business process and information systems integration and improvements
  • Translate people's transaction data into metrics and actionable insights
  • Write, maintain, and support a variety of standard reports and queries to create ad hoc reports that help GitHub manage more effectively
  • Collaborate with leadership across HR, Payroll, and Finance to ensure accurate data for payroll operations, benefits management and administration
  • Maintain professional knowledge and skill relating to HR compliance, technology and best practices and make recommendations for process or service improvements, cost reductions, and efficiencies
  • Partner closely with Finance (Accounting and SP&A), Security, GRC, Product, Sales, Marketing, Engineering to identify and translate business requirements into systems-driven solutions
  • Set technical direction for the team, drive the evolution of the system architecture, and make appropriate technology choices
  • Collaborate with leadership across all functions to drive decisions and execution plan
  • Maintain professional knowledge and skill relating to security, compliance, technology and best practices and make recommendations for process or service improvements, cost reductions and efficiencies
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of work experience in project management, and implementation of HRIS and Technology related projects from initiation, launch, and maintenance
  • In-depth understanding of business processes: Hire-2-Retire
  • Hands-on experience with HRIS, Payroll systems
  • Technical background and understanding of technology architecture, API’s, and integration best practices
  • Experience with SaaS systems, such as: WorkDay, BambooHR, GreenHouse, or ADP
  • Experience with international business requirements, policies, and processes
  • Excellent managerial, organizational, analytical, written and oral communication skills
  • Strong technical, systems, project management, and business process acumen
  • Strong problem solving skills (critical, strategic and evaluative thinking)
  • Ability to work with all levels of stakeholders
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, agile software development environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States
  • Ability to comfortably manage confidential data

Preferred Qualifications

  • Familiarity with NetSuite, Okta, SFDC, CallidusCloud
  • Experience working with a distributed team across timezones
title: Business Systems Manager (Hire2Retire)

description:
Disruptor Beam is building a new generation of games for every screen, based on popular universes like Game of Thrones and Star Trek. This is an opportunity to join a rapidly growing company, alongside a veteran team, working with some of the most iconic brands in entertainment.

Are you a Software Test Engineer or Test Automation Engineer? Or Are you a Software Engineer in Test? That LOVES Video Games?

Do you have side projects that you can't wait to show off and are looking for a place where your contributions matter. You consider yourself a hacker and enjoy figuring out how systems are intended to work just so you can break them. You pay attention to detail, take pride in doing things the “right” way and you’re excited to play a big role on a small team.

What You’ll Do

Develop and maintain scripts and tools used by Content, Art, Engineering and QA teams. Develop and maintain hardware compatibility/performance automation scripts. Participate in technical design discussions in regards to automation workflow and tools. Provide reliable and accurate time estimates for tasks. Assist QA teams with tool/script creation, implementation and testing. Develop general automated testing best practices/processes for mobile games. Document tools/scripts thoroughly, both in terms of design and implementation. Maintain significant familiarity with emerging engineering techniques and technologies. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by the manager. What We Seek

3+ years’ experience in direct software verification and validation, including white-box and black-box testing. 3+ years’ experience in software QA methodologies and practices. 2+ years’ experience with C# application development, coding, debugging, and testing. Familiarity with testing for both iOS and Android. 2+ years’ experience with a scripting language, such as Java or JavaScript 2+ years’ API testing experience. 2+ years’ experience with SQL or equivalent. Experience working in an agile environment Have exposure using either: Selenium, TestNG, or other Automation tool. Experience with continuous integration and deployment Automated Functional testing experience. Nice to Have but not necessary

Experience with the Unity3D game engine Automated Performance, Memory, Stress, and Load testing experience. Networking testing experience and network protocol knowledge A strong interest in Mobile Games and gaming in general. Having shipped mobile games, ideally in the free-to-play market Experience with AWS technologies such as ec2 and elastic beanstalk Experience with .NET engineering practices and frameworks Experience configuring and using Perforce and JIRA What You’ll Get

We offer world class health insurance. You'll have access to a national network of doctors that provides comprehensive coverage when you need it most. We believe that rest unlocks creativity, so we encourage our employees to take advantage of our open vacation policy. Our employees take as much vacation as they want, when they want it, as long as they’re getting their work done. Start work earlier or later according to your inner clock as the core office hours don’t start until 10 am. About Us

Disruptor Beam is a Boston-area game company that transports fans of beloved movies, literary and television series into the worlds they love. By linking game content to episodes and books, players become a part of the world as stories continue to evolve around them. The company's games are available on the App Store for iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch; on Google Play for Android devices; and on the web. Founded and led by game industry veteran and serial entrepreneur Jon Radoff, Disruptor Beam is backed by a group of technology and gaming entrepreneurs from the Boston area. For more information, visit www.disruptorbeam.com.

At Disruptor Beam, we we celebrate, support, and thrive on hiring people from different and diverse backgrounds. Disruptor Beam is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

To all recruitment agencies: Disruptor Beam does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Disruptor Beam employees or any other company location. Disruptor Beam is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

description:
Disruptor Beam is building a new generation of games for every screen, based on popular universes like Game of Thrones and Star Trek. This is an opportunity to join a rapidly growing company, alongside a veteran team, working with some of the most iconic brands in entertainment.

As an Engineer for our Marketing Technology platforms, you will contribute to our cutting edge digital marketing efforts focused on automation, big data, testing and associated analytics. You will contribute by bringing a broad base of skills including the ability to create tools, automate solutions and debug complex advertising execution issues. The role is a balance of architectural oversight combined with a penchant for finding problems and devising solutions. In addition, the role spans the continuum of digital execution from cutting-edge dynamic serving and buying platforms all the way to supporting sophisticated analytics tools and dashboards across desktop, video and mobile environments.

As part of the Engineering organization, you will work directly with world-class teams including Marketing, Data Science, Platform Engineering and Finance to develop innovative solutions that improve and optimize our digital marketing tactics. We are looking for someone to bring the ideas, energy, and dedication needed to reach and engage the next 100M gamers.

If you like to think big, move fast and build cutting edge solutions with outstanding colleagues, we’d like to talk with you.

What We Seek

Previous responsibility for designing, developing, integrating, and maintaining features for the Marketing Technology platforms (Targeting Engine, Machine Learning, E-Mail, Partner Networks, Paid Search, Paid Social, and more) Experience developing for at least two of the three following front-end environments: Unity, Web (HTML/CSS), iOS (using Objective C) or Android. Experience working with elements of the digital advertising tech ecosystem: adserver (DoubleClick, Atlas etc.), Demand Side Platforms, DMPs, bidded social buying, etc. Experience building back-end systems using a recent application server environment (RoR, Scala/Play, Python/Django, node.js, or similar) that utilizes data persistence in SQL and/or NoSQL (MongoDB, Redis or similar). You don't need to know the exact technologies we use, but you do need a modern understanding of back-end architecture. Strong fundamental understanding of multi-threaded, object-oriented programming High adaptability: because we develop for a range of devices, you need to be constantly learning to apply your skills to new technologies and platforms. When the tools and systems you use are sub-optimal, you are not content until you find a solution. What You’ll Get

We offer world class health insurance. You'll have access to a national network of doctors that provides comprehensive coverage when you need it most. We believe that rest unlocks creativity, so we encourage our employees to take advantage of our open vacation policy. Our employees take as much vacation as they want, when they want it, as long as they’re getting their work done. Start work earlier or later according to your inner clock as the core office hours don’t start until 10 am. About Us

Disruptor Beam is a Boston-area game company that transports fans of beloved movies, literary and television series into the worlds they love. By linking game content to episodes and books, players become a part of the world as stories continue to evolve around them. The company's games are available on the App Store for iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch; on Google Play for Android devices; and on the web. Founded and led by game industry veteran and serial entrepreneur Jon Radoff, Disruptor Beam is backed by a group of technology and gaming entrepreneurs from the Boston area. For more information, visit www.disruptorbeam.com.

At Disruptor Beam, we we celebrate, support, and thrive on hiring people from different and diverse backgrounds. Disruptor Beam is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

To all recruitment agencies: Disruptor Beam does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Disruptor Beam employees or any other company location. Disruptor Beam is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
title: Marketing Software Engineer

Help us create amazing social games for tablet, smartphones and the Web built around our award-winning formula of Strategy RPG storytelling and collectible content based in universes like Game of Thrones and Star Trek.
