title: Mobile Software Engineer

description:
We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer (C++) to build and enhance our core low-latency, quantitative electronic trading applications. Working with small agile teams and directly with traders and scientists, you will be exposed to some of the brightest minds and some of the hardest problems in the industry.

If you are an experienced C++ developer with a Linux background and you share our values, please contact us. Bonus points will be awarded for experience building low-latency components and/or experience in the financial or trading industry.

Our values

  • SOLID design principles
  • Test Driven (TDD) implementation process
  • Teamwork
  • Simplicity
  • Intellectual agility
  • Continuous learning
  • Experimentation

What are you going to be doing? As Quantlab software engineers, we do work that impacts the bottom line. The applications we build and the code we write are directly tied to how much money our trading systems make. On any given day we find ourselves doing any or all of the following (and then some):

  • Writing fast C++; writing code in several languages; optimizing code; pair programming
  • Building trading system applications; analyzing system performance/trading data; building applications that parse and stream data; debugging CPU cold-path problems; increasing system resiliency
  • Working with our research scientists to deliver their algorithms and models
  • Learning how exchanges work; learning how trading works; learning how the company operates; teaching and mentoring others
  • Helping build talent on the team; mentoring summer interns; managing summer intern projects; interviewing candidates; giving and receiving feedback

Who should you be? (Who’s successful here?) In our tech-driven, team-focused firm, you will work on teams whose top priority is to get it done. You will work with people whose goal it is to bring out the best in each other and to build things that can’t be built by one person alone. Our developers love what they do. We have more nerd-geek per square inch here than on most development teams. If you work here your hobby is software too; you love this stuff and keep thinking about it on your drive home. To be successful on our team you have to be:

  • Test focused and passionate about developing great software; you build things you’re proud of and believe in software craftsmanship. Bugs bug you.
  • A continuous learner, passionate about technology and a full-time tinkerer; you want to know how things work and you take things apart to figure them out because you can.
  • Productive. You measure first, refactor as you go; you take initiative, you own your work, and you are persistent in seeing what you do through to production and beyond.
  • Smart. Difficult problems excite you; challenges—bring ‘em on; you want to do things better than they’ve ever been done before. And you are skilled enough to handle them.

Quantlab Financial Established 16 years ago, Quantlab Financial is a successful proprietary global trading organization (similar to a hedge fund, but no outside investors.). Technology and Scientific Research are central to our business and key to our success. We are constantly pushing the boundaries of technology.

We attract talented, collaborative people who bring fresh ideas to our trading systems. Our casual environment has an entrepreneurial spirit that encourages creativity, agility, and continuous improvement. Some bennies include:

  • Liberal paid vacation, attractive bonus structure, and generous 401k company match
  • Fully paid health insurance premiums for individuals
  • Free catered lunches every day with snacks and beverages provided daily
  • Weekly in-house professional massages
  • Tickets to sporting and theater events
  • Company events, often including employees' families.

See more of our jobs at www.quantlab.com
title: Senior Software Engineer

description:
McKinsey & Company (www.mckinsey.com) is a premier global management consulting firm that serves the world’s leading companies on issues of strategy, operations, finance, marketing, and organization.

McKinsey’s North American Knowledge Center (NAKC), located in Waltham, MA (20 minutes west of Boston), provides research and analytic support to McKinsey consultants. The Center hosts several industry and functional research teams as well as a few specialized teams, including the Geospatial Analytics unit. Geospatial Analytics is a cutting-edge capability that supports consulting teams on a wide range of business issues that are geographic in nature and often cut across several industries and functions.

Detailed Description:

The Geospatial Analytics team has distinct capabilities that leverage spatial analytics such as spatial statistics, optimization, visualization and modeling. The team developed several tools and applications that bundle these analytics into user friendly interfaces and standardized workflows for greater impact and efficiency.

We are looking for creative web developers focused on spatial-centered development to join our team and drive new, full-stack web application development using open source libraries. You will work in a highly collaborative environment within an entire ecosystem of analytics practitioners, including geospatial and non-geospatial data scientists, platform architects and engineers, and analytics consultants, as well as Firm clients. You will have the opportunity and responsibility for developing full-stack geospatial applications, including backend and frontend web development, in order to bring business and geospatial insights to clients.

Desired Skills:

  • Strong academic qualifications; a degree in programs such as Computer Science, GIS, Geography, Mathematics, Engineering or other related fields
  • Demonstrated experience in object oriented programming, open source libraries including Javascript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Node.js), and full stack development
  • Experience in web mapping and spatial application development including web mapping libraries (e.g., Leaflet, Mapbox) and spatially-enabled relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL/PostGIS, MySQL, MongoDB, etc.)
  • Experience creating highly visual web apps, using D3.js and similar libraries
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to meet deadlines
  • Strong interpersonal and communication (both oral and written) skills
title: Geospatial Analytics - Web Developer
company_name: McKinsey & Company, North American Knowledge Center

description:
WE’RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHO HAS

A Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, or an equivalent field.

Strong track record in software development, with four years’ experience developing software preferably within the Java open source ecosystem.

A solid understanding of how to build testable, decoupled and maintainable code.

Strong working knowledge of key tech including Java 8, Spring, ORM/Hibernate, SQL and relational databases. An understanding of integration tech including RESTful APIs, JSON/XML, Structured Logging.

Experience with version control, preferably Git.

Strong written and verbal communication skills. We want team players here, so we need someone who can get along well without any fuss.

The ability to build scalable and maintainable software-as-a-service apps using modern Java.

A team-player attitude. We work together here and there are no lone wolves, so you’ll need to be fun, friendly and dynamic!

IT WOULD ALSO HELP IF YOU HAVE

Experience with front end web development tech such as: HTML, CSS/SASS, JavaScript and Angular

Skills in: Linux/UNIX and Ansible Experience in development of POS apps Experience with Nginx, Redis, Spark and Splunk Test automation and Continuous Integration experience
title: Senior Java Developers

description:
Job Description

Solium needs developers who want to write great programs.

Do you want to work with a system that gets a half million logins from one hundred thousand users per month? Do you want to write code for an industry-leading financial services platform that transacts more than ten billion dollars a year? Do you think it would be cool to be a part of the team that expands this platform to transact one trillion dollars for ten million users?

You aren't dogmatic; you're pragmatic. You know that "agile" doesn't mean scrum but adapting to deliver value to customers. You care about automated tests and code reviews, and when the build breaks, you don't run git blame. You find the root cause and fix it. You embrace the hard problems like localization, security, and timezones.

It doesn't matter if it's Ant or Gradle, Struts or Spring, jQuery or GWT - you know it or you can pick it up. You care about building commercial products that people use - technology is just a means to an end. We are looking for developers of all experience levels to help us build a fast, reliable, secure, and resilient enterprise platform on a global scale.

Things we believe:

  • Results matter, not the clock.
  • Code and technology are what we use to solve problems, not the whole of our job.
  • Free tools are great unless they aren't the best. We use high-end Linux workstations with big monitors and tools like IDEA, JRebel and the Atlassian suite to keep us in the zone.
  • Languages can be taught, we want great programmers

Things we like:

  • Prior experience with production large-scale distributed systems
  • Prior experience with technologies we use (Java, Spring, GWT, Struts, JPA, EJB, REST)
  • A hunger for tracking down root causes - no matter how deep the rabbit hole
  • A BS in CS is appreciated but not necessary with the right background

What you'll do:

  • Be customer focused - learn about the business to help bring value to our customers
  • Act technology driven - design, implement, and test new functionality
  • Work closely with QA - we fix our own bugs
  • Work with Product Management to deliver material value to our clients
  • Do full stack dev from the DB to the UI
  • Leverage your experience to help the whole team get better

What you'll get:

  • Market rate salary based on experience
  • Participation in annual bonus plan and stock incentives
  • Share Purchase Plan with company contributions (we are public and profitable!)
  • Casual Environment - we aren’t a bank, they just happen to be clients
  • 20 Paid Days off + 11 stat holidays (and 4 week sabbatical after five years)
  • The occasional spontaneous Nerf War

If you've read this far and you're thinking "I want to be a part of this", we agree! Email us and we'll talk about how your career is about to get better.

Skills & Requirements

This job is a full time position in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. In addition to being a Canadian citizen or having permanent resident status, you must live in Calgary or be willing to move. We can assist with relocation for the right candidates.

About Solium

Solium is a fast-growing company that provides cloud-enabled services for global equity plan administration, financial reporting and compliance. Through innovative technology and services, we power efficiency and accuracy of share plan administration and equity transactions. With operation centers in the United States, Canada and the UK, Solium serves more than 2,800 corporate clients with employees in over 80 countries.

Solium is a fast-growing company where every team member is vital to success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment with customer interests and strong problem-solving skills, Solium welcomes your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
title: Software Developer

description:
Genius began as a website for decoding rap lyrics and has since evolved into the Internet’s best source for musical knowledge, with more than 40 million monthly unique visitors and tens of thousands of contributing users. Our mission is to be the layer on top of culture that helps you understand and appreciate it—in other words, to “annotate the world.”

Engineers at Genius have an unusual amount of leverage. Although we’re working on a huge project, and although we’ve raised more than $55 million, we’re still a small team. So every engineer is intimately involved in the product planning process. You’ll never work on a feature that you don’t think is a good idea to build.

Engineer in Test

Genius is looking for an Engineer in Test to ensure the quality of our products by leading both our automated and manual testing efforts. As Engineer in Test you’ll push the engineering team as a whole to build better and more robust software by identifying, diagnosing, and following up on issues and building automated testing tools that can keep up with our rapid deploy cycle. Based on strong performance, new hires as Engineer in Test may advance to full-stack engineer or another technical or product role.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop detailed knowledge of Genius’ products and an intuition about how to break it and expose bugs before users do
  • Drive adoption of testing best practices, metrics to monitor application changes associated with releases, bug prevention strategies, and other quality measures
  • Maintain and expand existing automated test suites for the web application frontend (Angular.js) and server backend (Ruby, Rails)
  • Evaluate and incorporate new testing and infrastructure tools to increase automated test coverage
  • Work with mobile developers and product managers to verify new mobile application features and identity regressions before release
  • Follow up on incoming bug reports from staff, users, and exception reporting tools

Qualifications:

  • Strong background in web design and development, including testing best practice
  • Proficiency with at least one general-purpose programming language
  • Experience working on and supporting moderately sized to large production applications
  • Exceptional candidates will have experience building testing harnesses for large, high-traffic web applications

>> Apply here
title: Software Engineer In Test

description:
Roost is the fastest growing peer-to-peer marketplace for parking and storage space. Based in San Francisco, we're a small but very passionate team working on an exciting new vertical in the sharing economy.

We’re looking to hire talented software engineers (junior through senior) with a deep understanding of full-stack web development to help us change the way the people think about their space. You will be working on our web app and API. Our ideal candidate will be instrumental in implementing new features, improving existing functionality, optimizing our tech stack, participating in code reviews, and maintaining a strong engineering culture at Roost.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Ideate, design, and build new product features, and improve existing ones
  • Find and address performance and modularity issues
  • Collaborate with other departments to formulate achievable solutions to new challenges

REQUIREMENTS:

  • 3+ years in relevant work experience
  • Strong attention to detail - you put care into every line of code
  • Ability to write high-performance code for responsive API endpoints and front-end components
  • Expert knowledge of modern server-side web frameworks and tooling (Node.js, Ruby on Rails, Sinatra, Django, Flask, and/or Laravel/Lumen)
  • Experience with modern Javascript libraries and tooling (React, Riot, and/or Angular)
  • Experience with Postgres or MySQL databases and ORM concepts
  • Awareness of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance

BONUS POINTS:

  • Dev ops experience
  • Unit testing experience
  • Contributions to open source projects on GitHub
  • Mobile development experience
  • Comfortability with agile development cycles
  • Experience with project management tools (Jira / Asana)

NOT REQUIRED:

  • Degree
  • Suit and tie
  • TPS reports

COMPENSATION:

  • Salary -- $70K - $150K (depending on experience)
  • Equity -- 0.5% - 3.0%

COMPANY BENEFITS:

  • Dual monitors
  • Dogs in the office
  • Company outings
  • Happy hours
  • Trips to the beach
  • Quarterly retreats
  • Unlimited vacation
  • Health insurance, etc
title: Full Stack Engineer
apply: Send one résumé + one bad joke to: careers@roost.com

description:
TES is looking for senior software engineers to build and scale our quickly-growing education technology platform.

About Us

TES USA, based in San Francisco, encompasses Wikispaces, Blendspace, and TES Resources. We are part of TES Global, based in London, and together we serve over 6.7 million teachers, giving them the tools to be the very best that they can be.

We are a small, smart, fast-moving team, working on big web applications, where you'll play a huge part in the success of our mission and our business. We don't like big specifications or heavy planning processes; instead, we work on small projects, ship code frequently, and write tests. We're a built on a microservice architecture powered by Node.js, MongoDB, Docker, React, and we love to use new technology. Over 50 million unique visitors come to our sites every month. If you want to be challenged and rewarded for your success, have real impact, and want life to be free of meetings, office politics, and big-company boredom, drop us a line.

What you'll do

There's lots to do: You'll work on our San Francisco team designing and building new microservices to help teachers in their classrooms. You'll collaborate with our London teams building REST APIs and writing front-end javascript. You'll write code that powers simple and beautiful UI and makes teachers excited to use the platform. You'll work with our AWS data pipeline to make sure that the work you're doing is having a meaningful impact.

Who you are

You are fluent in Node.js, PHP, Python, Java, or Ruby and can pick up a language from this list you don't yet know. You have personally built large, interesting, or complex web applications before, and can show us what you've done. You're perfectly comfortable with relational databases like MySQL and know the ins-and-outs of writing and optimizing queries against large datasets. But you know when it makes more sense to use MongoDB, Redis, Cassandra, or Hadoop to solve a problem. You can talk about a wide array of trade-offs facing web developers: use of frameworks vs. in-house code, what caching strategy to choose, how to select 3rd party libraries, what to do when table X hits 500 million rows. You're not a platform zealot, but you think Linux is a fine choice as a server OS.

Above all, you love to build and ship products that real people will use every day.

Candidates only. Seriously. Recruiters, we appreciate your interest but please don't be offended when we do not take your calls.
title: Senior Node.js Engineer
apply: Please email us at career-software-2014@wikispaces.com with a copy of your resume as .doc, .pdf, .odt, or .rtf. In your email, please introduce yourself and, importantly, don't just tell us why you want a job like this. Tell us why you want to work with us specifically.

description:
Skyport Systems is developing groundbreaking, security-focused solutions for the enterprise.  We are an early-stage startup looking for skilled, passionate individuals that want to make a direct impact on product.

At Skyport, you will be part of the team responsible for developing our data analytics/warehousing engine.  We securely collect data from our server platforms in the field, perform ETL with stream processors, and feed the UI through RESTful API endpoints.  Help us enable new user-facing, data-driven features that will become part of our value proposition.

Qualifications

  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science with 3-5 years of experience

  • Experience in any of these: Spark, Druid, Hadoop, Kafka, Samza, or Storm

  • Familiarity with data mining techniques

  • Backend development in production environments

  • Understanding of application end-to-end (browser to cloud to backend data store)

  • Experience and understanding of multiple programming languages, including Java

  • Inquisitive, enjoy learning


Bonus

  • Experience in RESTful API development

  • Working knowledge of basic cryptography and cryptographic best practices

  • Knowledge of defense in depth and secure coding in a challenging environment


We offer:

  • A seasoned leadership team with a track record of success

  • The ability to make an impact  and grow your skills

  • Location, location, location! We are in the heart of downtown Mountain View, just two blocks from Caltrain
title: Data Engineer

description:
Welcome to 21st century healthcare. In the 20th century, we built hospitals to address communicable disease. Today, Omada Health is on a mission to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease. As a key member of our engineering team, you will help design, build and maintain systems necessary for rapid growth. Our team practices pair programming (at least 50% of the week) so you will have the opportunity to learn new techniques and share your skills.

How you can make a difference:

  • Impact the health outcomes and happiness of our participants
  • Collaborate with other developers to write maintainable code and solve problems effectively
  • Build new products and applications using Ruby on Rails
  • Enhance customer experience by improving our analytics platform
  • Solve big problems including improving customized interventions, making data actionable for users
  • Collaborate across the whole company to create life-changing experiences via web and mobile applications
  • Work in an Agile, test driven, pair programming environment
  • Scale a high-performance system using Redis and PostgreSQL
  • Research and adapt new technologies quickly in a dynamic work environment

What you need for this role:

  • 2+ years experience building consumer web applications or B2B services
  • Solid web skills, ideally in Ruby on Rails
  • JavaScript (MVC and the fancy shiny stuff)
  • Extensive understanding of HTML5, CSS, Ajax, jQuery, JSON
  • Good OO design skills and an understanding of design patterns
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Intellectual curiosity, positive attitude, and a desire to influence the products being built
  • Other technologies we use: Coffeescript, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Git, Ansible, Backbone.js, Node, Unicorn

What you’ll get from us:

  • Competitive salary
  • Stock options
  • Unlimited vacation
  • Parental leave
  • Health, dental, and vision
  • Healthy snacks and lunch
  • Wellness events (e.g. running club)
  • Community volunteering

About Omada Health: We’ve pioneered digital behavioral medicine: an innovative approach to tackling the growing epidemic of type 2 diabetes, heart disease, and obesity. Our online programs combine world-class science, technology, and design to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease. Named one of Fast Company’s “50 Most Innovative Companies in the World,” our team includes passionate and talented individuals. Our approach has been embraced by major employers across the country, including Costco and Iron Mountain, as well as leading health plans, such as Kaiser Permanente and BlueCross Blue Shield of Louisiana.

We carefully hire the best talent we can find, which means actively seeking diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and ways of thinking. We strive to build an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated and leveraged to inform better design and business decisions. Omada is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer.
title: Software Engineer

description:
Charles River Analytics is developing software solutions that integrate with wearable devices aimed at sensing neurophysiological and physiological measures and assessing their relationship to human state and performance. The platforms we are developing interface with a variety of different hardware devices such as EEG, EMG, fNIRS, SpO2, and eye trackers and are being used by the U.S. Armed Forces, NASA, and the National Institute of Health. The selected candidate will work closely with neuroscientists who will help them interpret the relationship between the data being collected and what it indicates about cognitive function or neurological state. The candidate will define and implement signal processing and machine learning algorithms to automate this interpretation of sensor data.

In addition to being technically competent, we are looking for engineers who work well with a team, who love to learn, and who have a track record of self-motivated investigation and tinkering. If you have pursued non-work or non-school related projects simply because you like building things and are not afraid of the challenges associated with exploring and learning outside of your comfort zone, we want to hear from you.

Major Responsibilities/Activities:

  • Use open source SDKs to develop applications that interact with hardware devices such as MS Kinect, biosignalsplux, FLIR thermal cameras, and EEG devices
  • Develop software implementations of signal filtering and noise reduction algorithms
  • Develop feature extraction methodologies and implement them in code for real time signal analysis
  • Work with team members to understand project goals and translate those goals into technical requirements
  • Interact with customers, users, and domain experts to analyze and understand challenges
title: Physiological Data Processing Engineer

description:
Ben je pas afgestudeerd op het gebied van Technische Informatica en wil jij je carrière een vliegende start geven? Heb jij originele en frisse ideeën op het gebied van Software Development en durf jij buiten kaders te denken? In ons Young Profesisonal Traineeship leer je hoe de wereld van Technische Automatisering in elkaar zit, hoe je navigatie software voor bijv. grote schepen of voor transport voertuigen maakt of hoe je bruggen en sluizen op afstand bestuurbaar maakt. Is het zien van kansen en deze ook grijpen jouw stijl? Dan is dit traineeship op je lijf geschreven.

Trainee Software Engineer

Als startende Software Engineer hebt je één doel: jezelf binnen anderhalf jaar ontwikkelen tot een volwaardige vakinhoudelijke Engineer. Als trainee ga je direct aan de slag binnen de business unit van Axians die gespecialiseerd is op het gebied van Technische Automatisering zich onder andere bezig houdt met technologieën zoals Python, C++, Java, ontwikkeling van besturingssystemen en vertaalt deze naar praktische en werkbare oplossingen.

Hoe komt jouw dag eruit te zien?
Het is allemaal nieuw. Je bent in jouw nieuwe leasewagen komen aanrijden op ons kantoor. Je maakt kennis met wie Axians is, je collega's, de wijze waarop wij werken en hoe wij georganiseerd zijn. Dat is nog maar de 1e dag. De dagen erna ga je aan het werk en verdiep je je inhoudelijk in de wereld van Technische Automatisering. Allemaal interessante trajecten waar je in het hart van een organisatie aan het werk bent. Al snel werk je aan verschillende klanttrajecten en heb je al gesprekken met je coach. Zo leer je de organisatie optimaal kennen. En dan moet het opleidingstraject nog beginnen waarin je samen met andere ambitieuze Young Professionals jezelf ontwikkelt naar het model van een professional 3.0!

Wat ga je doen?
Je gaat gelijk werken binnen de business unit Technical Systems, waarbij je vooraf een inhoudelijke keuze maakt waarin jij je als toekomstige ICT professional wilt ontwikkelen. Als Software Engineer ben je actief en nauw betrokken bij het ontwikkelen van software voor producten en/of diensten binnen de High Tech sector. Denk hierbij aan het maken van besturingssoftware voor een machine die met lasers wafers in stukjes snijd, het maken van navigatie software voor grote schepen of voor transport voertuigen op een volledig geautomatiseerde containerterminal, het op afstand bestuurbaar maken van bruggen en sluizen, het bouwen van de software om reizigers van informatie te voorzien omtrent actuele aankomsttijden van openbaar vervoer of het maken van software voor high tech medische apparatuur.

Om jou als high potential snel naar een hoger niveau te tillen bieden we jou een programma wat zich focust op zowel de soft- als de hardskills

Enerzijds start je met een uniek en uitdagend anderhalf jaar durend traineeprogramma binnen Axians. Dat bestaat uit een mix van werken, leren en persoonlijke ontwikkeling + heel belangrijk FUN. Een extern trainingsbureau challanged jou en haalt je gegarandeerd uit je comfort zone. Je leert vaardigheden waar je vooraf niet wist dat je ze nodig had. Je zal je drijfveren ontdekken, communicatiestijlen ontwikkelen, conflictoplossing ervaren en nog veel meer.

Naast keihard werken aan je persoonlijke ontwikkeling helpen we je ook in het zadel met je Software Development vaardigheden. In het traineeship leggen we de lat hoog. In de eerste weken van je nieuwe functie krijg je een actief programma van trainingen in verschillende basistalen, denk hierbij aan C en C++. Daarnaast bepalen we samen met jou jouw focus gebied. Waar liggen je sterktes en waar wil jij je ontwikkelen. We stellen het trainingsprogramma samen en bieden jou de trainingen om de verschillende basis certificeringen te halen (bv Java OCP of Microsoft MCSE) en skills op te doen in de belangrijkste frameworks, databases en talen waarin wij werken. Hiermee wordt je in no-time klaargestoomd voor de grote en complexe projecten.

Wie ben jij?
Jij bent een starter op de arbeidsmarkt of hebt reeds 1 jaar werkervaring. Je bent ambitieus, hebt passie voor techniek, staat stevig in je schoenen en je hebt de instelling en bereidheid om jezelf de komende tijd te ontwikkelen in een uitdagend en snel ontwikkelend vakgebied.

Je voldoet minimaal aan de volgende criteria:

  • Een afgeronde opleiding op HBO of WO niveau, bijvoorbeeld Technische Informatica.
  • Aantoonbare affiniteit en/of ervaring met technische automatisering, software development, programmeertalen als Java, C++, C#, Python, .Net of andere talen.
  • Fulltime beschikbaar vanaf de startdatum van het traineeship.
  • In bezig van een geldig rijbewijs B vanaf de startdatum van het traineeship en de bereidheid om te reizen.
  • Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, kennis van de Engelse taal is een pre.

Wat bieden wij jou?
Als trainee in het Young Professionals programma krijg je een marktconform salaris en een auto van de zaak. Na een positieve beoordeling van je CV nodigen we je graag uit voor de Young Professional selectiedag en krijg je uitgebreid informatie over Axians en het programma. Daarnaast maken we een analyse van jouw persoonlijke kwaliteiten en heb je een uitgebreide serie gesprekken. Sluiten we de dag goed af, dan bieden we je graag een contract aan.

Wat als ik deze baan graag wil?
Ben jij de Young Professional Software Engineer waar wij naar op zoek zijn? We nodigen je graag uit om te solliciteren via deze link. Of wil je graag meer informatie? Neem dan contact op met Stephanie Zweekhorst, Recruiter, tel: (0)6 – 29 14 9971 of stephanie.zweekhorst@axians.com.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Trefwoorden: Vacature, Fulltime, Rotterdam, Starter, Traineeship, Software developer.
title: Trainee Software Engineer

description:
Software Developer

Jane Street is a proprietary quantitative trading firm, focusing primarily on trading equities and equity derivatives. We use innovative technology, a scientific approach, and a deep understanding of markets to stay successful in our highly competitive field. We operate around the clock and around the globe, employing over 400 people in offices in New York, London and Hong Kong.

The markets in which we trade change rapidly, but our intellectual approach changes faster still. Every day, we have new problems to solve and new theories to test. Our entrepreneurial culture is driven by our talented team of traders and programmers. At Jane Street, we don't come to work wanting to leave. We come to work excited to test new theories, have thought-provoking discussions, and maybe sneak in a game of ping-pong or two. Keeping our culture casual and our employees happy is of paramount importance to us.

We are looking to hire great software developers with an interest in functional programming. OCaml, a statically typed functional programming language with similarities to Haskell, Scheme, Erlang, F# and SML, is our language of choice. We've got the largest team of OCaml developers in any industrial setting, and probably the world's largest OCaml codebase. We use OCaml for running our entire business, supporting everything from research to systems administration to trading systems. If you're interested in seeing how functional programming plays out in the real world, there's no better place.

The atmosphere is informal and intellectual. There is a focus on education, and people learn about software and trading, both through formal classes and on the job. The work is challenging, and you get to see the practical impact of your efforts in quick and dramatic terms. Jane Street is also small enough that people have the freedom to get involved in many different areas of the business. Compensation is highly competitive, and there's a lot of room for growth.

You can learn more about Jane Street and our technology from our main site, janestreet.com. You can also look at a a talk given at CMU about why Jane Street uses functional programming (http://ocaml.janestreet.com/?q=node/61), and our programming blog (http://ocaml.janestreet.com).

We also have extensive benefits, including:

  • 90% book reimbursement for work-related books
  • 90% tuition reimbursement for continuing education
  • Excellent, zero-premium medical and dental insurance
  • Free lunch delivered daily from a selection of restaurants
  • Catered breakfasts and fresh brewed Peet's coffee
  • An on-site, private gym in New York with towel service
  • Kitchens fully stocked with a variety of snack choices
  • Full company 401(k) match up to 6% of salary, vests immediately
  • Three weeks of paid vacation for new hires in the US
  • 16 weeks fully paid maternity/paternity leave for primary caregivers, plus additional unpaid leave

More information at http://janestreet.com/culture/benefits/
title: Software Developer (Functional Programming)
location: New York, NY; London, UK; Hong Kong
apply: Please apply through our web app form at https://www.janestreet.com/join-jane-street/apply/

description:
Job description You will need to work closely with business experts and customer IT services for an optimal integration. In your role of Senior Software Developer, you will be part of a product team responsible for designing and implementing one of eVision products. Versioning of changes, integration with customer source systems, modeling the business processes, and scalability will be your main focus areas.

The core tasks and responsibilities of this position are: implement product future requirements and fit the solution for those requirements into the existing software design or decide how to change the existing software design such that the solution will fit work closely together with our UX team and product manager in finding the most useful solution for customer and market needs keep the solution lightweight for on premise installation purposes and cloud ready for our SAAS offerings in close cooperation with our chief technology architect communicate and coordinate with other teams whose software assets you need to integrate into the product

You work with: You’ll work in a fully agile team, so you will align with your peers continually You’ll cooperate closely with the Product Manager to make sure you understand the vision for the product, the customers and market needs Your very own Development Manager, that helps you grow and be effective as a professional

Desired Skills and Experience Bachelor’s degree or equivalent You are proficient in developing in C# Strong knowledge of HTTP and how to work with HTTP-based APIs Familiarity and/or practical experience (preferred) with BDD, TDD, CQRS, Event Sourcing, especially DDD Familiarity with DevOps practices is a plus, think automation scripts, build maintenance Knowledge of and experience with Git Experience working in an agile development environment Good communication skills in English, both written and verbal

Please insert your GitHub or other opensource account, so we can review your code.

Once your application has been submitted into the eVision recruitment database, it will be reviewed in accordance with the requirements of the vacant position. Due to the large volume of applicants, only short listed candidates will be contacted by the eVision recruitment team. If you have not been contacted within two weeks, your application has not been shortlisted. All submitted CV’s will be kept on eVision’s database for one calendar year from the date of submission to be contacted for suitable vacancies that may arise in the future. If you object to that, please feel free to contact us.
title: Senior Software Developer

description:
Är du i början av din karriär och söker ett jobb som webbutvecklare? Då har du kommit rätt! Hos Infor i Linköping kommer du att arbeta med UX (User Experience) och vidareutvecklingen av Infors molnbaserade e-handelsplattform ”Rhythm”. Utvecklingen sker med den senaste tekniken och enligt agila arbetsmetoder. Hos Infor får du också möjlighet att lära mer av erfarna kollegor. Låter det intressant? Sök då tjänsten idag!

OM TJÄNSTEN

Academic Work söker för Infors räkning webbutvecklare. ”Rhythm” är ett högt prioriterat projekt internt hos Infor, och därför vill man ta in konsulter som kan stötta upp vid utvecklingen av plattformen.

Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten eller om uppdraget får du gärna höra av dig till mig via mail eller på telefon: 07366444830.

Uppdraget är en del av vår personaluthyrning. Du kommer vara anställd av Academic Work och arbeta som konsult hos Infor under en period om 6 månader. Efter den initiala konsultperioden har du goda möjligheter att erbjudas anställning direkt hos Infor, förutsatt att bägge parter är nöjda med samarbetet.

ARBETSUPPGIFTER

Som webbutvecklare på Infor kommer du att arbeta med vidareutvecklingen av Infors molnbaserade e-handelsplattform ”Rhythm”. Med ”Rhythm” vill Infor förändra hur kunder handlar online. Syftet med ”Rhythm” är att skapa en lika stark köpupplevelse via dator, tablet och mobil som kunden upplever i den fysiska butiken. Utvecklingen sker i HTML5, CSS3 och JavaScript. Om du har erfarenhet av nyss nämnda språk är det mycket meriterande för tjänsten.

Tjänsten passar dig som vill arbeta i ett globalt företag och med den senaste tekniken inom webbutveckling.

VI SÖKER DIG SOM

Vi ser att du har en för tjänsten relevant eftergymnasial utbildning. Vidare tror vi att du är nyutexaminerad eller i startgroparna av din karriär. För att du snabbt ska kunna komma in i rollen bör du ha kunskap om webbutveckling (främst HTML5, CSS3 och/eller JavaScript) men framförallt har du ett genuint intresse för programmering och problemlösning. Vidare tror vi också att du är en person som uppskattar utmaningar, samarbete och ny teknik.

ÖVRIG INFORMATION

Start: Omgående.

Omfattning: Heltid. 6 månader. Med goda chanser till överrekrytering.

Placering: Mjärdevi, Linköping.

Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.

Academic Work är Home of the Young Professionals. Vi vänder oss till dig som är akademiker och fortfarande studerar på högskola/universitet, är nyutexaminerad eller har några års arbetslivserfarenhet. Vårt erbjudande till dig som heltidskonsult hos Academic Work inkluderar utöver kollektivavtalsenliga villkor och dedikerad konsultchef också rabatter och erbjudanden genom vår konsultportal. Läs mer om vårt erbjudande här: https://www.academicwork.se/vart-erbjudande-till-heltidskonsulter.

SKYDD FÖR DIN PERSONLIGA INTEGRITET När du skickar in din ansökan till Academic Work godkänner och samtycker du till att Academic Work behandlar dina personuppgifter enligt Personuppgiftslagen. Läs mer under vår PuL-sida.

INFORMATION OM FÖRETAGET

Infor är världens tredje största tillverkare av affärssystem och har över 70 000 kunder i 194 länder. Infor erbjuder branschspecifika lösningar och affärsapplikationer skapade för att vara snabba, användarvänliga och flexibla. Infors uppdrag är att skapa snygga sociala system som sticker ut och förändrar branschen. Just nu söker de nya medarbetare för utveckling av applikationen Infor e-Commerce för den molnbaserade plattformen Rhythm. För mer information om vad Infor arbetar med just nu klicka dig vidare till deras hemsida och läs mer: http://www.infor.com/company/work-is-beautiful/
title: WEBBUTVECKLARE TILL INFOR I LINKÖPING

description:
Streetline is seeking a Senior Ruby on Rails Software Engineer responsible for the design and implementation of Streetline’s SaaS platform for enterprise and consumer-facing applications.

We’re looking for an engineer with a broad set of skills who is ready to work at the intersection of big data, mobile, and the Internet of Things. Streetline’s systems span embedded sensor hardware, mesh networking, and signal processing all the way up to Cloud-based SaaS/web and mobile user applications — this position calls for very strong problem solving, systems thinking, technical breadth and creative innovations well beyond the typical web or desktop applications.

Responsibilities

You will contribute to the design of software architecture, data collection and infrastructure that support the entire suite of Streetline products and services. You will translate customer and business requirements into high quality software designs. You will also contribute to the design and implementation of internal and external web applications.

Skills and Experience

Required:

  • 8+ years’ experience software development
  • Ruby and Ruby on Rails
  • Proficiency in at least one other programming language such as Java, Python, C++, C
  • Hands-on; individual contributor
  • Interact with product management and internal customers: interpret needs, requirements, specifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent relevant experience
  • Must be comfortable working in a Linux-based DevOps model where you are highly involved in how your systems are deployed, monitored and utilized internally and externally in our production SaaS platform
  • Strongly motivated and/or experienced in test driven development and test automation
  • Experience building scalable, robust and high-performance RESTful web services that satisfy multiple use-cases and users, for use by internal and external systems and applications
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving and data mining skills
  • Strong software engineering and data modeling/database experience, including high volume MySQL environments or equivalent

Desired:

  • AJAX, HTML, CSS, high-level JavaScript framework or equivalent, scripting languages
  • Experience in UI implementation and utilization of MVC pattern
  • Flexible, team oriented and excellent communication skills
  • Experience in real-time and ETL processing of data for various data warehousing, analytics and real-time applications
  • Combination of start-up and large company experience

Streetline is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

LOCAL candidates only

H1B transfers will be considered

NO relocation available

Must work onsite full-time in San Mateo, CA

About Streetline, Inc.

Streetline is a leading smart parking company delivering smart data and advanced analytics to solve parking issues for customers worldwide. Streetline’s pioneering technology makes the parking experience for consumers easier, while making cities, university and corporate campuses more efficient. Our vision is simple—to solve parking and make smart cities a reality.

Streetline is a privately-held company headquartered in San Mateo, CA with smart parking deployments in over 20 locations worldwide. The company was named one of Fast Company’s 10 Most Innovative Companies in Transportation, as well as IBM Global Entrepreneur of the Year. Streetline was named Best Mobile Innovation for ‘Smart Cities’ for Parker at the 2013 Mobile World Congress, a Gartner 2013 Cool Company and was recognized with the 2013 Frost & Sullivan North American Competitive Strategy Leadership Award.
title: Sr. Ruby on Rails Software Engineer (2 openings)

Please submit your resume and cover letter to:

careers@streetline.com
