description:
You are an experienced graphics engineer who has worked on a number of shipped titles and you will be collaborating closely with the Art Director and other artists to bring their vision to life by wringing every drop of power from our target hardware. You should bring a wealth of knowledge of real-time rendering techniques to the team along with hugs for when you need to tell the art team that their prized creations are over budget.


Our team is small and you will be expected to play a significant part in developing the team's technology and engineering practices, as well as evaluating ideas for technical feasibility. As the team's graphics engineer you will be focused on ensuring that the game looks great on all supported devices and that it runs smoothly in all situations. Your colleagues will be looking to you for help and advice on optimization and debugging difficult bugs.


Ideal candidates will have completed at least one project on Android and/or iOS. Unity knowledge is a plus and like all of our hires, you need to be a good team player.


 What you’ll be tasked with:



  • Working with the Art Director and art team to create a beautiful game by

    • Quickly prototyping ideas to evaluate options

    • Developing suitable prototypes into production code which is optimal and bug-free



  • Helping to ensure that the game runs at target frame-rate on all supported devices

  • Tracking down and fixing the gnarliest of bugs

  • Explaining complex problems clearly and presenting potential solutions and their advantages and disadvantages
title: Mobile Game: Graphics Engineer at Magic Fuel Games (San Leandro, CA)

description:
Sprout Social is searching for an Android developer to join our Mobile Engineering team. You will help us deliver a quality application to thousands of users that exceeds our users’ expectations as well as Google’s prescribed best practices. Our Android team is a small one, which allows our engineers to not only take ownership of the code base, but also weigh in on user experience and design discussions. We build features that match and complement our web application so that customers have a seamless experience wherever they consume Sprout. 


Our software is used by more than 16,000 brands around the world. Companies like Adobe, Pivotal Labs, Google, Marvel, and Evernote rely on Sprout to create stronger relationships with their customers through social media. If you are excited about building new features that are innovative to the mobile experience, are performant, and are reliable with any type of network connectivity, we’d love to talk with you.


Responsibilities



  • Be a major individual contributor of coding on the team

  • Design and develop software features based on visual mockups or user stories

  • Monitor the mobile ecosystem for Android changes and innovative apps that can be leveraged internally for performance or user experience improvements

  • Extend testing capabilities by writing unit tests, creating integration tests and assisting in QA testing during development

  • Ensure reliability by always taking into consideration performance and different network connection scenarios

  • Prototype user experience concepts prior to new feature implementation

  • Demonstrate a deep appreciation for good design
title: Android Developer at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)

description:
Rackspace is seeking talented developers to help build our Fanatical Support for AWS business. Our product consists of tooling and automation that enables our customers to get the outcomes they want from their AWS infrastructure, including high availability, security, performance, and cost optimization.



We're a small team working to continuously grow this new business, so we're looking for developers who ship early and often while maintaining healthy engineering discipline. We write automated tests for everything we build, and we deploy to production several times daily. Because we're distributed, we're remote-friendly -- we collaborate with Slack, Screenhero, and video conferences.



We use React, Redux, and ES6 in our customer-facing web application along with Node (and a bit of Python) for several API services that power specific features. We host on AWS and take advantage of a wide cross-section of the AWS portfolio, including EC2 Container Service, Dynamo, Lambda, and numerous others. In short, we choose technologies that let us  deliver quickly with high quality, and focus on our product's value.



Responsibilities:



  • Deliver product features for our UI and APIs

  • Write clean, maintainable code using engineering best practices

  • Collaborate with other engineers, product managers, and user experience designers on a daily basis to identify the right technical solutions that achieve product goals

  • Continuously broaden and deepen your skill set to solve new technical challenges

  • Mentor and guide less experienced team members to provide technical direction

  • Provide Fanatical Support for our production system by fixing bugs and triaging alerts
title: Senior Software Developer at Rackspace, the #1 managed cloud company (San Antonio, TX) (allows remote)

description:
We're looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer with impressive JavaScript and .NET experience. In this role, you will enjoy great diversity in your work. Tasks might include creation and maintenance of our C# middle tier, development in our AngularJS front end, building our next generation of mobile apps using Cordova or Xamarin, or implementing our RFID applications with technologies like ASP.Net Core, and SQL Server. You will need to be familiar with modern programming techniques like inversion of control using dependency injection, ORMs, and more.


This is where you want to work. We enjoy the best development tools and conditions money can buy. Strategic Systems & Technology is a meritocracy that develops packaged web, RFID, PC and mobile software applications for businesses. We also offer custom development services for enterprise clients. You will never be bored.
title: Sr. Full Stack Developer | JavaScript & .NET at Strategic Systems & Technology Corp. (Suwanee, GA)

description:
Sprout Social’s Engineering Team practices a DevOps culture. We work together to build new technology and to keep production systems and code happy. As we grow our customer base and product offerings, you’ll help build and maintain the mission­-critical infrastructure that keeps it all up and running. We have a good deal in place today, and we're excited to grow and evolve. We want you to play a big role in that. 


Sprout Social’s software is used by more than 16,000 brands around the world. Companies like Adobe, Pivotal Labs, Google, Marvel, and Evernote rely on Sprout to create stronger relationships with their customers through social media. We’re looking for smart, creative, and driven people to join our DevOps team. If you have a passion for uptime and automation, we’d love to talk with you.


Responsibilities



  • Work on a high-­impact, small­-team with tight timeframes

  • Carry out monitoring and performance analysis using Nagios, New Relic, and statsd

  • Automate administrative tasks with Python or Perl

  • Build and deploy new services using Chef

  • Monitor and tune production MySQL servers

  • Monitor and tune production Cassandra clusters
title: DevOps Engineer at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)

description:
In this role you’ll design, code, and grow our backend services, the lifeblood of our product. We have a strong focus on scale, reliability, performance and product agility, and that means picking the right tool for the job, while being pragmatic and scrappy. We build services in Python and Java using technologies like Cassandra, Redis, NSQ, and MySQL. A little about our company, Sprout Social is used by 16,000 brands around the world. Companies like Adobe, Pivotal Labs, Google, Marvel, and Evernote rely on our products to create stronger relationships with their customers through social media.


We’re looking for smart, creative, driven people to build great software with us. If you’re the best at what you do, we’d love to talk.


Relocation is offered for this role, if applicable.


You want to solve hard problems? Here are some of ours…..



  • Today our customers receive 4x more social messages than from just one year ago! Scale that.

  • One of our largest customers drove 33.5 million social messages in only a 90-day period! Store that.

  • On average, we process roughly 1,000 social events every single second. Scope that.

  • How much social data do we store? Try 75 terabytes among multiple NSQ databases. Analyze that.

  • In 2015 we saw 384 deployments and changes to our Web application. That averages out to 1.5 deployments per business day! Maintain that.


Responsibilities



  • Be a major individual contributor of coding

  • Promote and nurture good team practices such as TDD, code reviews, and pair programming

  • Own and share responsibility for strategically scaling our systems

  • Bring vision to the team in the form of new technology recommendations, ideas and approaches

  • Proactively mentor junior engineers

  • Drive project teams to build in Sprout’s best interests by being cognizant of business requirements, market need, customer pains, etc.
title: Senior Software Engineer - Platform at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)

description:
In this role, you will work on the Platform Team as a manager and contributor, working to design, code, and grow our backend services, and to nurture our growing team. We have a strong focus on scale, reliability, performance and product agility, and that means picking the right tool for the job, while being pragmatic and scrappy. We hire strong platform engineers who build services in Python and Java using technologies like Cassandra, Redis, NSQ, and MySQL. Sprout Social is used by 16,000 brands around the world. Companies like Adobe, Pivotal Labs, Google, Marvel, and Evernote rely on our products to create stronger relationships with their customers through social media. Our Engineers create the products to help make this possible.


Embedded as a member of one of our engineering squads, you will be part of the day-to-day Agile development environment.  Part of this will be supporting and developing other members of the team - conducting regular check-ins, providing career and professional support, coaching and advising, conducting performance reviews, etc.  While you should be excited about writing production-level code, we want you to be equally excited about the trajectory of your team and your part in forming them as stellar software engineers.


We’re looking for smart, creative, driven people to build great software with us. If you’re the best at what you do, we’d love to talk.


Relocation is offered for this role, if applicable.


You want to solve hard problems? Here are some of ours…..



  • Today our customers receive 4x more social messages than from just one year ago! Scale that.

  • One of our largest customers drove 33.5 million social messages in only a 90-day period! Store that.

  • On average, we process roughly 1,000 social events every single second. Scope that.

  • How much social data do we store? Try 75 terabytes among multiple NSQ databases. Analyze that.

  • In 2015 we saw 384 deployments and changes to our Web application. That averages out to 1.5 deployments per business day! Maintain that.


Responsibilities



  • In addition to functional coding responsibility, you will also have the managerial responsibility to support the careers of fellow software engineers

  • Promote and nurture good team practices such as TDD, code reviews, and pair programming

  • Share responsibility for strategically scaling our systems

  • Act as a leader in a matrix organization of over 50 engineers

  • Bring vision to the team in the form of new technology recommendations, ideas and approaches

  • Proactively mentor junior and mid-career engineers

  • Support and enhance the Sprout Social culture

  • Drive your project team to build in Sprout’s best interests by being cognizant of business requirements, market need, customer pains, etc.
title: Engineering Manager - Platform at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)

description:
At Goldman Sachs Engineering, we build.


As a Goldman Sachs engineer, you’ll build solutions to some of the most complex problems, creating transformational technologies and developing systems that drive business and financial markets worldwide.


From automated trading systems to risk management techniques, data architectures and distributed computing platforms, our developers and quantitative professionals build and provide robust, scalable best-in-class solutions to some of the most complex problems in the industry.


At Goldman Sachs, we offer our professionals the opportunity to work with interesting challenges and influential leaders, while our team-driven culture leverages and rewards individual talent. Come see what you can build at Goldman Sachs. More information can be found on our Engineering homepage.
title: Software Developer: C++, Java, Python at Goldman Sachs (New York, NY)

description:
Farmers Insurance is one of the nation top insurers and providers of financial services. Today, the Farmers Digital Transformation is a new strategic initiative that was formed to drive agility throughout our business and to respond faster to market demands. A critical part of the initiative is to build a new engineering team for mobile and the innovation labs to foster innovation and to promote more lean, agile processes while delivering products in two key areas: mobile and API platform/Big Data. A career at Farmers Insurance offers compelling ways of delivering something that is not only impactful for the organization but also for our customers.


We have assembled a initial team of top-notch tech and product individuals to work on an exciting mobile project that has a potential to disrupt the insurance industry.


Qualifications



  • Proactively seek, identify, and communicate issues business and product issues. Analyze trends and work with internal stakeholders and external partners to improve vendor system functionality, product usability, integrations, and data integrity

  • Help drive the mobile project and be responsible for every phases of the development lifecycle, including project planning, product development, releases, performance, and quality control

  • Conduct timely code reviews

  • Participate in functional and technical discussions in mobile, data, and backend development

  • Leverage best practices from industry in influencing and driving technical and operational improvements. Make recommendations on code and architectural changes and conduct cost/benefit analysis of potential improvements
title: Mobile (iOS) Engineer at Farmers Insurance (Los Angeles, CA)

description:
NAVIS is looking for a creative, motivated Software Development Team Lead to join us as a critical member of our Engineering Team in beautiful Bend, Oregon.


The Team Lead will architect, design, develop, optimize and test client/server and web applications in an Agile setting based on both Open Source and .NET technologies. As part of the Engineering Team, you will collaborate closely with the Chief Technology Officer (CTO), the VP, Product Solutions, the Director of Software Development, and other Product Team members, to architect and design exceptional software / product solutions to meet client needs.


If NEW software architecture and development is appealing, this position could be a great fit! The Engineering Team has multiple projects that often start at the concept stage and develops new products and/or product features from scratch. Our products are constantly evolving with our client needs - we are not simply maintaining existing products.


NAVIS is currently evaluating brand new technologies and we have already implemented some cutting-edge technology in use right now.  It's a great time to be at NAVIS!


The primary focus of this position is two-fold:


1)  You will be responsible for performing as a technical lead for a team of developers dedicated to a specific product(s). These developers could be senior-level through junior-level from an experience perspective, so you will be responsible for offering the appropriate amount of technical mentoring and guidance.


2)  You will be responsible for architecting and coding as it relates to a specific product(s). This is a hands-on, "player/coach" type of role that will enable you to stay close to the technology while setting a technology direction for a product(s). Although you will lead a team from a technical standpoint, there is no direct supervision accompanying this position.


You will have technical responsibility for the functionality and operational performance of a product(s). The candidate must be willing to take on all aspects of the development process, and be ready to support a technical team in production environments. He/she may be asked to test code sets, document software, and implement products and related solutions. Strong knowledge of design patterns and software development best practices must be shown at all times. A high degree of creativity and motivation is required of the successful candidate, who is expected to operate with limited direct supervision. This Team Lead needs to have a willingness to do whatever it takes to make the products and the company successful.


At NAVIS,our employees to live our Core Values:



  • Golden Rule: Treat others as you would want to be treated

  • Integrity: A person of your word, highly trusted

  • Innovation: Open and involved in creating or executing on 'new'

  • Passion: Love the TEAM, the clients and the work we do

  • Attitude: Consistently display a positive, can-do attitude


ABOUT NAVIS:


Based in Bend, Oregon, NAVIS is the leading provider of sales and marketing solutions to hotels, resorts and vacation rental management companies in North America. Building on our rich 25-year heritage with humble beginnings, NAVIS is strategically focused on the critical value of providing accurate, timely data for our clients. Our clients view NAVIS as the best source of solutions, and employees view NAVIS as THE best place to work.


We are proud to have been named by The Oregonian as a "Top Place to Work in Oregon" FOUR years running!


NAVIS was a finalist in the 2015 Oregon Tech Awards Technology Company of the Year in the Growth category!!  


WHY WOULD YOU WANT TO WORK FOR NAVIS?



  • Check out our Company Page on Stack Overflow: http://careers.stackoverflow.com/company/http-www-navisresorts-com-  

  • NAVIS is growing fast due to high market demand for our products. Our products are successful because they truly help our clients succeed and grow. We demonstrate our value to our clients every single day.

  • We are building new technologies and enhancing existing ones - we are NOT standing still. We are re-architecting our products from the UI through the database. This means we need strong, creative, intelligent developers with great ideas that love to build awesome software products.

  • Our technology is blossoming and we will be utilizing some of the latest and greatest technologies on the market today.

  • As stated above, The Oregonian has listed NAVIS as a "Top Place to Work in Oregon" in 2012, 2013, 2014, and 2015!  We live the core values listed above - they are not window dressing.

  • Strong technical leadership in a team-based atmosphere

  • Your work matters; your impact will be visible

  • Local, established Oregon-founded and based company

  • Healthy financial foundation

  • We give generously to local charities and offer opportunities to participate to directly help those in need

  • Very competitive salaries with a 10% annual bonus target and a full benefits package, including matching 401(k)

  • You get to LIVE and WORK in Central Oregon - what could be better than that?


LOCATION OF THIS POSITION:


To foster a highly-collaborative team environment, this position will be located in beautiful Bend, Oregon.

description:
Req ID: 116329

What does your future look like?

We are on the brink of the Networked Society - a technology revolution that will change the world for good through instant global connections and expanded freedom and opportunity.

Ericsson is a world leader in the rapidly changing environment of communications technology – providing equipment, software and services to enable transformation through mobility

Headquartered in Stockholm – Sweden, Ericsson is a publically listed company with more than 115,000 employees

More than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Technology is at the heart of our business. Ericsson engineers, researchers and scientists around the world are working on what’s next in information, communications and telecommunications (ICT).

A connected world is just the beginning. Your passion determines what comes next! Apply your ideas and insights to empowering people, business and society.

Come and discover what makes YOU + ERICSSON a powerful combination

We welcome the opportunity to meet you!

http://www.ericsson.com/careers
 

BUSS

Business Unit Support Solutions develops and delivers software-based solutions for operations and business support systems (OSS and BSS), real-time, multi-screen and on demand TV and Media solutions as well as solutions and services for the emerging M-Commerce eco-system.


Job description

We are looking for you who want to be in the forefront of large scale software development, within our near real-time Business Support Solutions with focus on Revenue Management. Our systems are developed with industry standard technologies, geared for virtualization and cloud environment, with great user experience in mind.


You will join a software development team working in all phases of the product's life cycle, including prototypes, demos, requirements specifications and analysis, design, implementation, verification and maintenance of our products. Our ways of working are based on agile principles, where Continuous Integration and Automation are corner stones in our development methodology. Working with continues improvements is also part of your role.

You will be part of our global development organization and interact with peers in different parts of the world.

Position Qualifications

  • We see that you have a Master or Bachelor´s Degree in Software Engineering or Computer Science, and 3-5 years of work experiences in software development.
  • You shall have deep and documented knowledge in software programming languages, preferably Java and/or JavaScript, as well as being very familiar with industry standard frameworks like JEE, OSGi, etc.
  • You shall have knowledge from software applications using databases and information models, multi-threaded applications and distributed systems.
  • You shall have knowledge in software development tools like Git/Gerrit, Jenkins etc.
  • It is meriting if you have experiences of user interface development and have competence in UX principles.
  • You are able to make technical presentations adapted to different audiences.
  • You have work experiences from Lean & Agile principles, and like to work in team environment.
  • You have ability to lead teams and coach other developers.
  • We see you that show inter-personal skills, are flexible and willing to adapt & respond to change.
  • We see you being creative and like to find new ideas and solutions.
  • We work in a global environment which means English skills are a must, and a second additional language is meriting.
  • It is meriting if you have experiences from multi-cultural and distributed development.
     

Trust – Innovation - Performance: These are the core values that define Ericsson reputation and guide us in our daily work and in the way we do business.
 

Useful Liks

http://www.ericsson.com/thecompany

http://www.ericsson.com/thinkingahead/networked_society


 

Application

Please submit your application in English as soon as possible - we are working continuously with candidate selection.

For specific questions please reach out to anu.hirvikallio@ericsson.com

description:
JOB TITLE:            DevOps Engineer – Cloud Infrastructure (AWS)



DEPARTMENT:      Digital Application Development Dept.



PAY STATUS:         Salary based on work experience



EFFECTIVE:          Immediately





HeBS Digital is a full-service digital technology and marketing firm working with leading hotel brands and hotel companies throughout the world.  We have built an excellent team of top industry professionals, and enjoy a fun and friendly work environment. Our services include digital technology applications, website design, full-service digital marketing: search engine optimization (SEO), search engine marketing (SEM), email marketing, social media, mobile marketing, online media and retargeting, direct response online advertising, research and analysis, as well as website revenue optimization consulting services.



Company offers comfortable boutique business environment with an emphasis on results while retaining work/life balance. Provides excellent opportunities to build responsibilities and grow with company. Position based in Midtown Manhattan, New York City.



 Once in a lifetime opportunity to become an industry digital technology expert!



HeBS Digital is expanding its team of talented professionals by adding a passionate and deeply technical Cloud DevOps Engineer to our New York office to focus on our fast-growing number of customers in the AWS Cloud environment, and to further optimize our Cloud stack (including test automation, deployments and continuous integration), as well as work with key stakeholders and other departments to scale our platform beyond current limits.



At HeBS Digital, we strive for excellence in everything we do. In order to achieve this you need to be open to learning on your own as well as with the help of your team. Self-motivation to develop in an international business environment is essential.



The ideal candidate for this DevOps Engineer position is willing and ready to help our company to handle a growing number of customers in the AWS Cloud environment, and brings invaluable Cloud DevOps knowledge and skills to our talented team; has right attitude, is absolutely passionate about DevOps, is eager to learn and adapt new technologies, and definitely is a solid team player.



This position reports directly to CTO; works with key stakeholders, programming, development and data departments.



As a DevOps Engineer – Cloud Infrastructure (AWS), your responsibilities include:



  • Maintain and further improve our current Cloud Hosting Stack in AWS

  • Work with Project Management team onboarding new customers

  • Improve automation tools to deploy new stacks more efficiently

  • Always looks for ways to lower cost and improve deployment time

  • Implements necessary Cloud monitoring tools & techniques for HA/DR

  • Provide recommendations, tools and best practices:

    • Security

    • Code Structure

    • Performance

    • Deployments



  • Provide monthly reporting and usage cost analysis



Requirements:




  • Bachelor’s degree is required

  • 3+ years’ experience is required

  • Proficient in Cloud Computing, AWS platform and its services:

    • AWS Certified Solutions Architect certificate is a big plus



  • Strong Software Engineering knowledge

  • Solid technical skills:


    • Amazon EC2 / Linux server management

    • MySQL / RDS DBA skills

    • NoSQL databases: MongoDB / Redis / Neo4j

    • Infrastructure automation – AWS OpsWorks / Chef / Puppet

    • Agile development / JIRA / Git

    • Continuous Integration & Cloud Testing

    • Scripting languages (Python, Bash, PHP, JavaScript, Node)

    • Exposure to NGINX + PHP-FPM a plus

    • High Availability / High Throughput

    • Backup & Disaster Recovery

    • Security best practices in the Cloud




What we are looking for:




  • Collaborative, team focus

  • Professional attitude and appearance

  • Confident and creative team-player who takes initiative

  • Diligent work habits and ability to meet hard deadlines


If you are DevOps Engineer who take pride in working with a team of talented professionals who are passionate about software development and building web-based solutions, apply today!







Please reply with resume, cover letter and salary expectations.



  • Location: Midtown Manhattan, New York City

  • Compensation: Competitive Salary + Benefits + PTO + Medical/Dental + 401K/SIMPLE IRA

  • Principals only. Recruiters please don't contact this job poster.

  • Please, no phone calls about this job!

  • Please do not contact job poster about other services, products or commercial interests.





About HeBS Digital


HeBS Digital is the hospitality industry’s leading full-service digital technology, website design, full-service digital marketing and consulting firm (www.HeBSDigital.com).



HeBS Digital has pioneered many of the best practices in hospitality digital technology and marketing. The firm has won over 250 prestigious industry awards for its digital marketing technology and website design services, including numerous Adrian Awards, Davey Awards, W3 Awards, WebAwards, Magellan Awards, Summit International Awards, Interactive Media Awards, IAC Awards, and others.



A diverse client portfolio of hospitality clients: from restaurants to major hotel brands, luxury and boutique hotel chains, resorts and casinos, hotel management companies, franchisees and independents, and CVBs are benefiting from HeBS Digital’s direct online channel strategy and digital marketing expertise.
title: DevOps Engineer  Cloud Infrastructure (AWS) at HeBS Digital (New York, NY)

description:
Moin!

Wir, hmmh, sind viel mehr als eine der führenden Digitalagenturen Deutschlands, wir sind „Leading in Connected Commerce”. Mit mehr als 300 Mitarbeitern an vier Standorten (Bremen (Hauptsitz), Berlin, Hamburg und München) und als Teil der Plan.Net Gruppe, der größten unabhängigen Digitalagentur Europas mit über 25 Standorten weltweit, entwickeln wir ständig neue digitale Kommunikationsmaßnahmen für die vernetzte Welt. Wir realisieren Websites, Apps, Portale und Online-Shops und sind verantwortlich für die Konzeption und Umsetzung der digitalen Aktivitäten rund um diese Entwicklungen. Unser Hauptaugenmerk – für Kunden wie airberlin, bonprix, Gerry Weber, hessnatur, mavi, Nestlé, Otto, Schaeffler, Schneider und Tchibo – liegt dabei auf der Verknüpfung der einzelnen Touchpoints und Kanäle zu einem reibungslosen digitalen Erlebnis. Das passt alles zu dir? Dann haben wir bestimmt den richtigen Job für dich.


Überzeug dich:

- Als TYPO3 Developer erstellst und betreust du in deinem Team qualitativ hochwertige Web-Anwendungen - von der Beratung bei der Angebotserstellung, über die Konzeptionierung bis zur Realisierung ist alles dabei
- Extbase, Fluid und TypoScript sind für dich keine Fremdwörter
- Du erweiterst TYPO3 Portale auf PHP-Basis und übernimmst die Konzeption und Realisierung von Schnittstellen
- In unseren PHP Projekten entwerfen wir komplexe Extensions basierend auf den anspruchsvollen individuellen Anforderungen unserer Kunden
- Unser besonderes Augenmerk gilt einer hohen Code-Qualität unter Einhaltung von Code Conventions


Überzeug uns:

- Du bringst ein relevantes abgeschlossenes Studium und gleichwertige Berufserfahrungen in der Software-Entwicklung (PHP) mit
- Tiefgreifende Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen in PHP 5.6 (und höher), OOP sowie MySQL zeichnen dich aus
- Deine Erfahrungswerte beinhalten u. a. die Einbindung und Konfiguration von gängigen TYPO3-Extensions und die Integration von Templates in TYPO3
- Des Weiteren bringst du Erfahrungen aus der TYPO3-Core-API, der Entwicklung von Frontend- und Backend-Extensions mit Extbase und Fluid sowie in TypoScript mit
- Idealerweise bist du mit gängigen Webtechnologien, Libraries und Frameworks (HTML5, CSS, JavaScript (jQuery), Foundation, Bootstrap) vertraut
- Dein Profil rundest du mit einem sehr hohen Anspruch an die Qualität deiner Arbeit ab und bist auch mit agilen Methoden wie Scrum vertraut

description:
JOB TITLE:            Junior PHP Application Programmer - Digital Technology


DEPARTMENT:      Digital Application Development Dept.


PAY STATUS:        Salary based on work experience


EFFECTIVE:          Immediately


HeBS Digital is a full-service digital technology and marketing firm working with leading hotel brands and hotel companies throughout the world.  We have built an excellent team of top industry professionals, and enjoy a fun and friendly work environment. Our services include digital technology applications, website design, full-service digital marketing: search engine optimization (SEO), search engine marketing (SEM), email marketing, social media, mobile marketing, online media and retargeting, direct response online advertising, research and analysis, as well as website revenue optimization consulting services.


Company offers comfortable boutique business environment with an emphasis on results while retaining work/life balance. Provides excellent opportunities to build responsibilities and grow with company. Position based in Midtown Manhattan, New York City.


Once in a lifetime opportunity to become an industry digital technology expert!


HeBS Digital is expanding its team of talented professionals by adding a high energy Junior PHP Application Programmer to our New York office to focus on creating and maintaining of a wide range of digital technology systems and applications.


At HeBS Digital, we strive for excellence in everything we do. In order to achieve this you need to be open to learning on your own as well as with the help of your team. Self-motivation to develop in an international business environment is essential.


As a Junior PHP Application Programmer, together with other team members, you are responsible for creating and maintaining of a wide range of digital technology systems and applications. You have knowledge in a variety of areas and a strong understanding of how to combine new technology with creative innovations. You continually educate yourself on the latest technologies, and try to stay on the professional edge. The ideal candidate should have solid experience developing using PHP5, MySQL and jQuery.


As a Junior PHP Application Programmer, your responsibilities include:



  • Working with our team (e.g., team leads, executives, sales team) to plan program code enhancements and changes to the award-winning proprietary software, including all aspects of programming

  • Maintaining software repositories, keeping our client software up to date, configuring servers, installing patches.

  • Developing high-performance, test-driven, highly available hospitality industry oriented client software with flexibility and code reusability in mind.

  • Helping other team members with extensive knowledge you have.

  • Taking part in maximizing software functionality (either back-end or front-end related), optimizing and improving user experience.


Requirements:


What you need for this position:



  • College degree is required, preferably in Computer Science

  • 1+ Years solid work experience as a PHP programmer

  • Proficiency with MySQL database schema design and performance

  • Experience writing well-documented, test-driven (TDD) PHP code

description:
The Senior Software Developers at World First build a wide range of applications that include:



  • Our online foreign exchange (FX) trading platform

  • API powering our mobile apps

  • Back office system for managing trades, making payments, handling compliance events

  • Market automation platform.


World First runs a completely in-house IT team consisting of ~45 talented people and growing. We cover all areas of support, systems, websites, front and back end applications and we are passionate about producing great quality systems and software to drive our business forward.


How we do it…


Aside from building great software, we use several tools and methodologies to ensure that we empower the development teams and help them to achieve their best. Every line of code goes through reviews and we use continuous integration tools to run our tests, measure complexity, and make sure the code matches PSR-2 coding standards. We have separate development servers, staging environments and live environments. We also don't just use LAMP, we have message queues, caches, round robin databases, proxy servers, and anything else that helps us build robust and elegant systems.


We use scrum to ensure developers know what they're working on and are able to bring up ideas and get feedback quickly. We have a project management team dedicated to higher level prioritising, requirements gathering, and helping write the stories.

description:
We’re continuing our growth path and we are expanding our team. We are looking for the people who wants to join us become even more competitive, more innovative, and more agile. We work in cross-functional teams where team spirit is one of our key success factors. We have a shared passion to deliver the world's leading financial systems to our global customers.


Look closely…can you see yourself in this picture?


As a developer at Cinnober, you are part of a cross functional agile team that includes testers and business analysts. Together, you develop our products and tailor them to our customer’s needs. Our customers are demanding — they want solutions that processes huge amount of data at lightening speeds where robustness is a key factor. We solve these kinds of challenges, often within a fixed time scope. You eagerly take responsibility for making it happen, and you never disappoint. But even when our customers are satisfied, you are not. You’re a driven sort of person who gets a real kick out of constantly looking for ways to make improvements that add value for the customer.


The results of your work will be used by Tier 1 exchanges and clearing houses around the world and customers with high standards for quality and performance. This is your dream — you are absolutely passionate about developing systems fulfilling customers’ business requirements. In your world, quality is not an accident. You strive for it. You achieve it.


Our evolving tech stack contains both open-source and proprietary components. For example, we have our own databases, message layers and fail-over mechanisms all tailor made for a demanding environment where we have 100% control. You have an interest and the technical skills to tackle complex problems with the appropriate techniques.


But your interests are broader than just pure technology. You are fascinated by our customers’ business area, and are curious about how you can use your skills and insight to transform the latest technology into solutions that help our customers succeed. Your curiosity drives you to continuously look for better solutions, and to strive to develop your knowledge every day. You are at the top of your game when you are part of a high-performance team that applies test-driven development and pair programming to produce the very best solutions.
title: Skilled Java Developer at Cinnober Financial Technology AB (Umeå, Sweden)

description:
Onvoy, LLC is currently seeking an experienced Principal Engineer to join our team in Boulder, CO.


This position is also available in Minneapolis, MN and Englewood, CO.


Job Summary:


This position is primarily responsible for architecting, designing, and supporting lab and production network deployments of Voice over IP switching equipment, software, and applications. Additionally, this position is primarily responsible for a portion of the Onvoy Production network and acts the SME for these aspects. This position is also responsible for interfacing with multiple aspects of the organization including customers, vendors, and internal engineering and operations teams by performing the following duties.


Job Responsibilities:


Core duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.



  • Works with other principle and software developers to design, deploy and maintain Onvoy’s production voice network and systems

  • Leads a team of highly technical resources in support of principle engineer’s primary network responsibility

  • Acts as SME in the areas of VoIP systems, protocols, and platforms deployed in Onvoy’s production and lab environments

  • Leads assigned projects and issues to prompt and verifiable resolution

  • Collaborates with product managers, internal developers, vendors and other principle engineers to develop best practices and designs for product and service implementation

  • Contributes to the development and modification to Onvoy’s network architecture.

  • Researches and self-educates on new or unfamiliar technologies, protocols, and applications

  • Works with customer/vendor personnel to plan and engineer any new circuit, feature, or equipment deployments

  • Supports and designs systems interacting with Least Cost Routing (LCR) engine including Linux operating system, rate selection applications, and basic Oracle database administration

  • Supports and designs systems interacting with Short Message Peer-to-Peer (SMPP) platform including Linux operating system and SMPP application

  • Supports and designs systems interacting with internally developed Local Routing Number (LRN) rating and provisioning platform including Linux operating system and application support

  • Designs, builds, and deploys customer and vendor trunk groups on the various vendor, open source and internally developed platforms

  • Performs and directs initial testing on equipment to verify proper installation and configuration

  • Creates and documents testing requirements and plans and generating and executing appropriate test cases

  • Communicates effectively, clearly and concisely (both written and verbal) with management, customers, and internal engineering and operations peers

  • Leads and directs work with vendors, developers, customers, and other equipment manufactures through interoperability testing and subsequent issue resolution

  • Drives to appropriate resolution any issues that are discovered with Sonus equipment either personally or by working with Sonus support/engineering staff

  • Provides escalation of operational customer and Onvoy voice platform issues for the Network Operations Center

  • Completes follow-up on all issues and items
title: Principal Engineer at Onvoy, LLC (Boulder, CO)

description:
Sky Tickets - Python Developer

Sky Tickets
  • As a leading UK entertainment company we're committed to bringing our customers better choice, better technology and better entertainment.
  • Sky Tickets is an exciting new venture which launched in March 2014. We're focused on extending the entertainment we provide in the home to the best entertainment out of the home - we call it 'sofa to seat'
  • Our vision is to create a better way to buy sports, music and entertainment tickets. Our customer proposition is simple
    • Value - we sell tickets at face value & we never add any booking fees - the price you see is the price you'll pay
    • Quick & Easy - a simple four step process from choosing your tickets to having your booking confirmed
    • For everyone - Sky Tickets is for everyone, whether or not you're a Sky customer
    • Safe & secure - you can trust us to keep your personal details secure
    • Exclusive - we'll always look to bring you special offers and experiences that you can't get anywhere else
  • We're a lean start-up backed by Sky so we have access to the great marketing, rights holders, technology and commercial relationships across Sky


Overview
  • You will join a scrum/project team that uses cutting edge technology to provide applications that put Sky first for event ticketing, customer service and sales
  • We ask for the very best from our development teams, so we'll make sure that you get experience you need to have an enjoyable and fulfilling time with Sky
  • As a Developer you'll be drawing on your know-how to drive high quality product development and mentor others so that they can get up to your level. You are experienced in, and follow best practice in, Agile and software development methods


Role & Responsibilities
  • Be a constant source of technical information and direction for the team
  • In weekly iterations using Scrum you will showcase the functionality you have completed to the Product Sponsor, customers and stakeholders and deliver high-quality working software to a production environment.
  • Mentor and develop more junior Developers as we bring them on board with your help
  • Continuously challenge the ways of working to ensure continuous improvement within the team
  • Develop software specific to any number of features/functions of our product.
  • Agile Agile Agile Software development.


Requirements & Skills
  • Delivery experience within the agile and web/mobile arenas
  • Collaborating with a highly skilled self-organizing and cross-functional team to deliver high-quality, high-value product to users - a true team player that gets their kicks by knowing how they helped others succeed
  • You've obtained a level of mastery in Python using the Django framework, are obsessed with keeping up-to-date with the latest in the technical communities and have a track record of delivering scalable backend solutions and APIs. Prowess with Express and Restify frameworks is very desirable. Even better if you also have experience of Couchbase, Cassandra and Redis.
  • You are brilliant at building complex applications within a micro-services
  • Solid programming foundation; expect to spend a significant amount of time writing code.
  • Working knowledge of one or several other object-oriented or functional programming languages.
  • 5+ years' experience developing software.
  • Bachelors' degree or equivalent industry experience


The Person
  • Closet scientist - formulating hypotheses, running experiments & doing research, reaching actionable conclusions
  • Insightful - you love to visualize data and information
  • Steady head - you've got a cool, rational head in the midst of a crisis
  • Tenacious - you've got a track record of overcoming challenges and getting the job done
  • Quick on your feet - you're an expert at learning on-the-fly and coping with ambiguity
  • Focused - you're very, very. Very. Detail-oriented
  • Passionate - you're loud and proud of the work you produce
  • Self-starter - you're self-directed and know how to motivate yourself and manage your own workload
  • Talk the talk - you communicate in technical English with fluidity and grace
  • Up for it - After all that, want to knock our socks off?

description:
Bluecore is an NYC based startup. Our eCommerce personalization platform analyzes billions of eCommerce behavioral events -in real time- per month.


With a team of just four engineers, we've built products that are used by some of the biggest eCommerce sites and international brands. We believe in hiring for potential, rather than a high correlation of pure skill-sets for the roles we have.


Having said that, our technology stack on the back end is in Python on Google App Engine. Our front-end integration is in JavaScript and Coffeescript. We have also developed a domain specific language to describe eCommerce personalization in terms of predicates on customers and products.


We build many internal and customer facing tools, including an innovative template editing CMS on top of Github.


Even though our first application is currently focused on email, we are a company that deals with massive amounts of data. We ingest massive amounts of data about customers, and the products they look at, the size, color, brand etc - and process all of that in real time!


** Why work at Bluecore?


1. We handle very large real time datasets; we're 18 months old and have a 12TB well structured dataset.  
2. Our engineers are given large responsibilities. We consider them smart creatives not shackled with 4-hour tasks. 
3. We have about 700 unit tests. We parallelize them on many machines to ensure that the test suite always runs in under 3 minutes. 
4. We handle many thousands of requests per second, but that increases every day as we grow. 
5. We deploy many many times to production every day.
title: Software Engineer at Bluecore (New York, NY)

description:
Do you want to build on our international SaaS product as part of a close-knit team of other full stack developers? If yes, then we might have the right job for you.


To be more specific: Currently we are looking for a Full Stack Web Developer to join our Copenhagen team.


You will be working on Reviso, an online accounting application running on a micro service enabled Microsoft/JavaScript stack. We're a small team of 6 dedicated developers, so if you thrive in an environment where you get to wear many different hats and where everybody chips in when something needs to get done, our free seat may be for you.


At the moment our toolbox includes stuff like C#, React, SQL, Node.js, RabbitMQ, Heroku, AWS, and Azure. But we constantly evolve, and so does our technology - so perhaps you can bring some new things to the table?


We believe strongly in:



  • Having fun at work

  • Automation

  • Continuous Delivery and short feedback loops

  • Transparency

  • Cross-functional teams


Please ask us about any of these topics when we meet - we love a good discussion.


Skills & Requirements


You are:



  • Excited to learn new things and solve tricky issues in the simplest possible way.

  • An expert in building web applications and you know your way around both server side and client side code.

  • Motivated by taking a new feature all the way from the initial inception, through research, design, development, and deployment up until it’s actually being used by our customers.


About Reviso


Accounting – the language of business – used to be easy to learn, but has somehow become something very complicated. Reviso is on a mission to make accounting accessible again – so business owners and their accountants can talk together, in the same language.


We’re creating an advanced online accounting software platform, with an intuitive and fast to learn interface - while keeping a strong focus on efficiency and collaboration.


On top of this we’re building a state of the art mobile app that makes the daily business flows an ease and help facilitate the collaboration between business owner and accountant.


We’re headquartered in in the heart of Copenhagen, Denmark – with offices in London, Berlin, Madrid and Milan.

You’re a great communicator and you know that communication also means the other part — listening. You’re good at that too. You know that you may not have the full answer but you can rely on your teammates to get you across the line. You know that feedback isn’t an insult but a way to build upon ideas and make things better. You embrace the constant of change and are flexible and open-minded.

description:
Here at LateRooms.com we’re dedicated to delivering value fast and frequently, to support this we have a wide range of technologies in use across a large estate. Our Infrastructure and Operations team looks after the tools and platforms our Product Teams use to deliver multiple releases a day, and we’re looking for our next addition to help shape our future…


Working in autonomous product teams with a collaborative, quality engineering culture, we work with some of best technology in the world to make it happen for our customers.


We’re a problem solving bunch, so we’re looking for somebody who can make decisions and can tackle an issue, seeing it through from start to finish.



About the Infrastructure and Operations (IO) team…


The LateRooms.com IO team is responsible for the tools and platform the teams use to deploy and run their products.  With responsibilities ranging from Continuous Delivery tooling to monitoring the live estate and applications, we both provide the platform, and support the teams in implementation.  A few of the tools we use are:



  • GO for Continuous Deployment

  • Chef for Configuration Management

  • Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana for monitoring

  • Icinga for Alerting

  • AWS for cloud

  • A little bit of Docker and Kubernetes


We’re excited about new technology, and want you to be excited about it too.  We’re exctremely active in the community, so check out our blog, or some of the local Manchester community events if you want to find out more of what we do!



How you can shape our future…


As a LateRooms.com Platform Engineer, you will be responsible for the control and operation of our platform. You will define standards to support our product teams in deployment, future planning and support processes. You will be an advocate of best practice and will encourage the teams to effectively support the platform incidents themselves.


You will be well-versed in TDD, and have demonstrable experience in either C# or NodeJS, with a keen interest in automation and monitoring (chef, docker, elasticsearch, etc.).  It would be great if you also had experience with continuous integration/delivery tools such as GO CD, Team City or Jenkins. We’re expected to get stuck in with all elements the team manages, so above all, an ability to take a problem, and stick with it through to the solution is key.



And how we can shape yours…



  • Personal Development – Sharpen your skills with mastery time, brown bags, and bespoke training from our in-house Software Development Coach

  • You’ll have the chance to work with Developers and Engineers at the top of their game in multi-skilled teams
title: Platform Engineer at LateRooms.com (Manchester, UK)

description:
Casumo is small and quick and we expect you to take on a wide spectra of tasks. Together we will work to realize our dreams and visions of how the world’s best gaming site should look and work. We are looking for developers who are driven and won’t say no to a challenge, we would rather have to hold you back than to push you forward. We are offering you the possibility to build something truly great, no legacy code and a great atmosphere in a growing company.



  • Is native in Java, but speaks and writes bash, SQL, Python, Javascript and Scala. If you have any experience with Clojure, Erlang or Go it’s not impossible that you’ll get to practice that too.

  • Has an interest both for the big picture and for the small details, a key to work in our tightly knit team.

  • Likes freedom with responsibility and would feel comfortable in an environment of developer anarchy.

  • Has a desire to take full ownership of features and code, from inception of ideas to deployment, maintenance and keeping it running.

  • Is a nerd who eat, live and breathe code and has a true interest that reaches beyond any course or education.

  • Gets curious when we say CQRS/Event Sourcing, (D)DEDA and is open to a heterogeneous architecture.

  • Feel very comfortable in a Linux environment and working with tools like Git.

  • Would be stoked to build the world’s best gaming experience together with other Casumos from our headquarters in sunny Malta.


It’s a plus if you have in depth experience with transaction heavy, distributed systems, messaging, micro services and tools such as MySQL, RabbitMQ, Docker, Spring, Dropwizard, Erlang OTP or Akka.
title: System Developer - Location Barcelona or Malta Office at Casumo (Is-Swieqi, Malta)

description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 80 million users per month!

Due to our firm belief at trivago in embracing change and challenging traditions, we have embraced Scrum and Agile methods to aid and improve the development process of our applications. This is very important to us as we rely heavily on our software engineers to create world class technology that keeps us on top of our game. We are currently looking for an exceptional Agile Coach with a passion for agile methodologies to join our team and help us shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search engine. If you are a fountain of Scrum knowledge and pride yourself on your organisational skills then we want to hear from you!


 Your tasks:



  • You will handle all things Scrum and Kanban by organizing required meetings and retrospectives for our teams.

  • You will ensure the development process runs smoothly by removing impediments and solving conflicts that are hampering the team’s advancement.

  • You will become an agile/scrum ambassador and promote a clear understanding of the theory and methods behind the development framework by providing training for development teams, stakeholders and anyone else that could benefit from Scrum and Kanban.

  • You will be a crucial link between the developers and the product owner. You will be responsible for transparency and understanding from both sides and communicate information to the relevant recipient in an efficient and coherent manner.

  • You will collaborate with the technical project managers and aim to build a strong, productive relationship in order to ensure goals are met and projects delivered on time.

  • You will continuously seek to improve the current agile process and strive to improve the use of Scrum and Kanban throughout the different teams.
title: Agile Coach / Scrum Master at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)

description:
„Wir lieben was wir tun!“ Spaß an unserer Tätigkeit, Freude an unseren Produkten, Kreativität und Teamwork der rund 100 Mitarbeiter sind die Grundlage für die erfolgreiche Entwicklung unseres Unternehmens. myposter ging 2011 live und wir gehören jetzt schon zu den führenden Online-Unternehmen in unserer Branche. Du hast Lust, Verantwortung zu übernehmen, spannende Projekte anzustoßen, Ideen umzusetzen und mit uns zu wachsen? Dann bewerbe Dich bei uns!


Wir suchen zur Verstärkung unseres Entwicklungsteams einen Web Frontend Entwickler (m/w) in Vollzeit. Zu den Aufgaben gehört vor allem die Weiterentwicklung unseres Online-Shops. Dies fängt bei Landing-Pages an und endet bei komplexen Online-Konfiguratoren. Dabei spielt das Thema Mobile und allem voran Responsive Webdesign eine große Rolle.


Unser Setup



  • Moderner Frontend-Stack: Sass, BEM, Flexbox-Layout, ES6 + Babel, Gulp (aktuell in Entwicklung)

  • Eine iOS App (Swift) und eine Android App (beide aktuell in Entwicklung)

  • Backend auf Basis des Zend Frameworks und Doctrine (bald auf PHP 7)

  • Unit- und Integration-Tests mit PHPUnit

  • Continuous Integration mit Jenkins inkl. QA-Tools

  • Eigene API zur White-Label-Anbindung von externen Online-Shops

  • 25 Server inkl. Load Balancer, Storage Server, Message Queue, Redis, Graylog, u.v.m.

  • Provisionierung der Server über Puppet

  • Verteilung von Aufgaben über die Message Queue an Worker

  • Lokale Entwicklungsumgebung mit Vagrant

  • Versionskontrolle über Git

  • Coding Guidelines


Deine Aufgaben bei uns:



  • Erstellung von Frontends mit HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript inkl. Responsivem Webdesign in einem Scrum-Team

  • Verwendung neuester Technologien und Tools, u.a. Sass und Compass, BEM, Flexbox-Layout, ES6 + Babel, Gulp

  • Entwicklung neuer Features für unseren Online-Shop

  • Integration neuer Tools für das Marketing

  • Kontinuierliche Verbesserungen der Webseite

  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit allen Abteilungen um optimale Lösungen zu finden

  • Kontinuierliche Evaluation und Integration von neuen Frontend-Technologien
title: myposter sucht Web Frontend Entwickler! at myposter GmbH (München, Deutschland)

description:
Vorausgehen heißt: Neuland betreten. Neugierig sein. Herausforderungen annehmen. Gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden wollen wir die IT der Zukunft gestalten – und brauchen dazu besondere Menschen. Mal Überzeugungstäter, mal Diplomaten – aber immer Teamplayer. 


Wir bei Bosch Software Innovations, dem Software- und Systemhaus der Bosch-Gruppe, konzipieren, entwickeln und betreiben weltweit innovative Software- und Systemlösungen. So bringen wir unsere Kunden voran – sowohl im Internet der Dinge als auch im klassischen Enterprise-Umfeld.


Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Junior Software Developer (m/w) für die Lösungsentwicklung im Umfeld Industrie 4.0 für unsere Standorte in Immenstaad am Bodensee, Waiblingen oder Berlin.


Was Sie erwartet:



  • Als Mitglied unseres Entwicklungsteams gestalten Sie innovative Softwarelösungen im Bereich Industrie 4.0, u.a. mittels Anbindung von Sensorik im IoT-Umfeld

  • Sie entwerfen, implementieren, testen und dokumentieren selbstständig Softwarekomponenten

  • In Architektur- und Designdiskussionen bringen Sie sich aktiv ein


Was Sie mitbringen:

  • Sie besitzen erste Berufserfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung und Kenntnisse in der Anwendung aktueller Java-Frameworks und Web-Technologien (z.B. OSGi, JEE, REST, HTML5/JavaScript etc.)

  • Idealerweise können Sie Praxiserfahrung innerhalb der Branchen Fertigungsindustrie oder Logistik vorweisen

  • Sie entwickeln gerne Softwarelösungen im Team, arbeiten lösungsorientiert, sind flexibel und können Ergebnisse gut kommunizieren

  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab


Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? - Dann starten Sie mit uns durch - denn jeder Erfolg hat seinen Anfang.


Nutzen Sie unser Online-Bewerbungsformular und Ihre Daten kommen schnell und sicher bei uns an.


Kontakt Human Resources: Julia Spieler, Tel.: +49 7545 202-538

description:
Doxee combines industry-leading cloud computing technology with deep communications expertise and experience to deliver CCM solutions that make customer communications interactive and highly personalized.


Our solutions dramatically improve operational efficiency and ensure regulatory compliance. From banking and telecom to utilities and healthcare, Global 500 industry leaders count on Doxee to produce high-impact communications, with game-changing speed and agility.


As Application Engineer you will design, build and test components of the Doxee Enterprise Communication Platform. The Doxee Platform is a multi-tenant PaaS running on AWS and other IaaS services across the world which allows clients and partners to develop Customer Communications Management and Customer Experience applications using a set of web tools including a document designer, BPM-based workflow designer and an ETL.


The product offers large scale, distributed batch processing or on-demand production of documents and is based on a fully compliant J2EE architecture including several open source components such as Activiti, JPPF and Hazelcast. Doxee has built a comprehensive suite of software layers that define the applications stack.


Application Engineers are part of the Product Management division which is responsible for product development and go-to-market decisions. Doxee is looking for skilled engineers that desire to design and improve all layers of the technology stack, from the operating system to frontend and REST APIs.


The responsibilities of Application Engineers inside Doxee include:



  • Collect and analyze client needs to make products that fulfill the expectations from functional and non functional perspective.

  • Contribute in defining the product roadmap, technology adoptions, research direction of the R&D team (Doxee Labs). The responsibility includes joining and following Information Technology communities that lead the way of cloud services and infrastructure.

  • Design the architecture of new products or improvement of the Doxee Platform together with their peers.

  • Implement critical components on which Doxee holds complete control in order to achieve the maximum quality and flexibility.

  • Experiment on new technologies to determine the applicability on the product evolution.

  • Cooperate with an international team of experts that work together with agile methodologies towards the evolution of the first PaaS in the Customer Communications Management market.

  • On occasion, build bespoke demos and POC for important deals which require product customization or development of new modules.
title: Application Engineer: Enterprise Communication Platform at Doxee spa (Modena, Italy)

description:
We’re looking for a creative, independent software developer who’s comfortable with ASP/MVC web development. We have both internal data applications and client-facing apps of various stripes that could benefit from a steady hand.


An understanding of music is good to have! Most of the challenges lie in the best way to present (complex) music data while keeping the screen clean and easy to understand. We work with designers for the final touches, but the ergonomics are very important.


The work is independent and fairly self-contained, though you’d be working with other members of the team for data, and external partners who contribute APIs. This is a front-facing role, so a positive attitude and a good poker face will go a long way.

Working in collaboration with other members of the Operations and product development teams you will build the fundamental tooling and automation that lets our Service Reliability Engineers manage tens of thousands of production systems with a small, nimble team that has a really big impact. On a daily basis, your work and innovation will contribute to the processes, performance and scalability of our applications and systems allowing our business to operate efficiently. 


Working within a fun, sharp and supportive team, technologies you can expect to be involved with include:



  • Perl, python, ruby

  • Operating Systems, Linux system administration

  • Virtualization Cloud (AWS), VM

  • Puppet, Jenkins, deployment pipelines

  • Disks, networks, servers, databases

Your day-to-day

  • Communication and coordination with Development, QA, and user-base

  • Triage and resolve immediate production impacting issues

  • Analyze, scope, and document new tool requirement in accordance with standards
title: Senior DevOps Tools Engineer at Proofpoint (Belfast, UK)

description:
We’re looking for talented Front End Developers to join us in building and bettering the world’s smartest financial technology, Aladdin.


The Web Tools & Technology (WTT) team is part of the Aladdin Product Group (APG) and is responsible for delivering BlackRock’s online presence, including websites and client tools, and driving the overall digital user experience for the company. WTT is organized into three main functions: Product Management, Product & Platform Development, and User Experience & Design.


The successful candidate will be involved in all front-end aspects of developing and maintaining BlackRock’s Global web sites and applications, from requirements definition and functional design to project planning, technical design and implementation. 


Key Responsibilities:


Work as a front-end web developer with server-side developers, test engineers, project managers, technical leads, business owners and analysts through the whole SDLC, understanding and refining front-end and user interface requirements, designing and writing code, clearly documenting the development process.


Participate in setting front-end coding standards and guidelines for BlackRock web sites, identify and document best practices.


Develop and maintain JavaScript libraries, making sure they support the creative and engineering standards of BlackRock.


Stay abreast of the new front-end web development technologies and integrate them to further enhance the usability and efficiency of the sites.

Your responsibilities


In this position you are actively involved in the whole design and development process of our gaming platforms. You will be responsible for conception, development, operation and optimization of our Casino sites and some backend support systems.


Several times in year you will participate in technical review and suggest technical improvements, technology upgrade, architecture change, etc.


Depending on your expertise and your interest, you are free to define your area of responsibility within this position yourself!

description:
As the largest social network for language learning in the world we’ve already had some great success, but there is so much more that we want to build and improve on. We’re looking for smart, agile, independent engineers who can help us take our Android apps to the next level, providing more amazing ways for our users to interact with one another and further improve their learning. We’re looking for someone who loves the user experience, can build beautiful and efficient apps and isn’t afraid to share opinions on the best way to design the APIs they’ll be consuming. 


Our project is based on an MVP architecture. Working in an agile team (Scrum), we like to brain storm during pair programming and seeing green bars using TDD. We make use of Dependency Injection and libraries such as Retrofit, JobQueue, Ormlite, EventBus and others. But we’re always open to change and the best tool for the job should be the one we’re using.


We’ve got users spread out across the world, with some of our biggest markets being in Brazil, Russia, Turkey and China. You’ll need to think not just about the latest technology, but also how our users, who may not be using the latest and greatest devices, will interact with our product.


Why is an Android Engineer important at busuu?


The Android platform is the fastest growing mobile platform in the world, especially in the emerging markets that we count among our biggest countries. Android at busuu is growing faster than ever, leading the switch to mobile in greater and greater numbers. We’re live in more than 40 across the world, and we want to keep adding to that and to the features that we’re bringing to our millions of users. The reach and impact that our Android app has across the world, is to enrich users’ lives through easy access to language learning, meaning it is incredibly important to us to continue to build world class Android applications that are accessible to everyone.


What does an Android Engineer do at busuu?


As an Android Engineer, you’ll be working on our flagship and region specific apps, shipping to over 40 countries throughout the world in over 10 languages, offering our users a huge variety of languages to learn from. You’ll get to think about how users interact with our learning experience, how to help them learn better and faster and then build an experience that everyone can enjoy learning with.


You’ll get to work on brand new and existing features, shipping often and supporting your application all the way to production and beyond. You’ll get to work with an amazing, experienced team of Android engineers, and think about the entire life cycle of the application, from architecture to automated testing. We’re not afraid to do the right thing, refactoring when necessary while at the same time ensuring that we’re shipping new features to consumers as fast as possible.
title: Senior Android Developer: World's largest social network for language learning at busuu (London, UK)

description:
We’re looking for the brightest Quantitative Developers to join us in building and bettering the world’s smartest financial technology, Aladdin. The Aladdin Trading System is one of the most critical components of the BlackRock technology stack and is designed to handle multiple asset classes on a unified platform.


This role sits within the Portfolio Management Tools team is responsible for building and maintaining BlackRock's core portfolio management platforms supporting the firms portfolio managers as well as our BlackRock Solutions Aladdin Clients. The team is organized into two primary teams: Core Tools and Quantitative Tools.


This role is with our Quantitative Tools team, who support the quantitative tooling needs of Equities (Scientific Active Equity and Fundamental), Fixed Income, and Multi-Asset, in addition to leveraging these tools across the firms more broadly. This role will work with Model Based Fixed Income Credit portfolio management team; in particular working with researchers and portfolio managers to develop mathematical models and processes used in managing portfolios ,building Risk Models, performing quantitative analyses, and implementing research ideas.


In this role you will:



  • Work as a member of a global team partnered with business users.

  • Design, develop, maintain and support mathematical models proposed and used by Model Based Fixed Income Credit Portfolio Managers and Researchers.

  • Work with senior Portfolio Managers, Researchers and Strategists to implement models used for making investment decisions.

  • Assume responsibility for the key analytical models used in our investment process as well as supporting these models in production environment.

description:
Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have produced groundbreaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV, Fire phone, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?



Work hard. Have fun. Make history.



The Role:



As a Software Development Engineer - device and cloud services, you will engage with an experienced cross-disciplinary staff to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative devices. You will work closely with an internal interdisciplinary team and outside partners to drive key aspects of product definition, execution and test. You must be responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open, collaborative peer environment.

  • Be responsible for system architecture and development for new product initiatives and feature development

  • Investigate, prototype and deliver new and innovative system solutions

  • Work in an Agile/Scrum environment to deliver high quality software

  • Establish architectural principles, select design patterns, and mentor team members on their appropriate application


An ideal candidate will:

  • Be highly effective and thrive in a dynamic environment with multiple, changing priorities

  • Know what is important when releasing software to developers and has been through the process from start to finish

  • Be comfortable with proactive outward communication and technical leadership and never shy away from a challenge

  • Be open to feedback and determined to improve your skills




  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

  • 3+ years of experience building production software systems

  • Experience building scalable systems/applications in a complex, distributed environment

  • Experience taking product requirements and developing software architectures and designs to bring them to life

  • Experience working with networking or communications devices in an embedded environment




  • Experience defining system architectures and exploring technical feasibility tradeoffs

  • Knowledge in many disparate technologies, ranging from front-end user interfaces through back-end systems and all points in between

  • Development experience on multiple platforms and mobile devices

  • Excellence in technical communication with peers and non-technical cohorts

  • Demonstrated ability to mentor other software developers to maintain architectural vision and software quality

  • Master's degree in Computer Science

  • Proficiency in the tools of the trade, including a variety of modern programming languages (Java, JavaScript, C/C++, Python) and open-source technologies (Linux, Android, OpenGL, Eclipse)
