At Sky, we love to share what we are doing and how we are doing it, whether this is through brown bag sessions, guilds, chapters or show and tell. We even hold our own external tech events where you can be involved as much as you like from helping promote to being a speaker. There is much more to being a developer at Sky than just writing code.

As part of a dynamic squad, you will have a voice that will be listened to and help influence the shape and direction of product development through daily stand ups on the latest high profile projects. You will receive the development and support required to help take you to the next level of your career whilst working with the hottest technologies. There is also the opportunity to be involved in brown bag sessions, guilds, chapters and the external tech events we host.

We'll expect you to have a solid understanding of Go and/or Ruby development as well as experience with XP principles such as pair programming, CI, TDD and OO development and design patterns.
title: Developer (GoLang, Go, Ruby) - Sky Technology, Leeds at British Sky Broadcasting (Leeds, UK)

description:
Job Description





Be a part of an energetic and fast moving team that delivers incredible, innovative improvements to our products. We create a rich, interactive and engaging user experience. Our engineers write and test code that binds the front and back ends of our products together and makes the customer experience and product usability as good as it gets (and it gets pretty darn exciting). This role will be responsible for whole vertical slices of functionality—from front end UI to back end product functionality. This role will be constantly working on and delivering new features and functionality through software improvements in small, high performing teams and continually optimise the performance of our products. You’ll collaborate often with other developers to write the best code for the project and deliver amazing results that our users love.



You will be joining a brand new, kick-arse team to start an Android development practice right here in Sydney, with modern development tools. Your team will build high-quality, design-centric mobile applications to delight knowledge workers around the world. 



More about you


This is very much a hands-on development role, so we’d love you to have at least four years experience developing native Android apps. You’ll have shipped at least one application on Google Play (including a link in your CV with your application). We’ll need you to be pretty proficient with Java and Android SDKs as well as up to date with most modern Android development practices. You’ll be familiar with JSON and REST-based APIs. Your natural curiosity will translate into enthusiasm about learning new languages, frameworks and tools. Most importantly, you care about quality user experience as well as writing quality code.


You have an exceptional sense for design, an ability to see an app through conception, development, testing and release. Sound enterprise application architecture experience in design patterns, concurrency and performance would be awesome. You’re naturally curious and up-to-date with the latest trends in Android development and you’ve worked in an Agile environment previously.



More about our team


We are always growing, learning, and adapting, in and out of the office. You’ll be joining a team that is crazy smart and very direct. We ask hard questions and challenge each other to constantly improve our work. We are self-driven but team oriented. We're dedicated to agile methodology and big believers in 'lean' (which means we don’t do documentation for documentation's sake). We know the importance of validating our assumptions about users and implement various types of testing to prove ourselves right (or wrong). Our bottom line is improving our user’s experience- no matter what.



More about the perks


Our offices are open, highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some killer perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, five paid volunteer days a year for your favorite cause, plenty of food and drinks (including our famous 'Charlie's bar'), ergonomic workstations with Aeron chairs, 20% work time for your passion projects, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and more.



More about Atlassian


Software is changing the world, and we’re at the center of it all. With more than 40,000 global customers (including 85 of the Fortune 100) and a highly disruptive business model, we’re advancing the art of team collaboration with products like JIRA, Confluence and HipChat–and we’re just getting started. Driven by honest values, an amazing culture, and consistent revenue growth, we’re out to unleash the potential of every team. From Amsterdam and Austin to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who are powered by passion and eager to do the best work of their lives in a highly autonomous yet collaborative, no B.S. environment.



Note: 


Atlassian is able to provide relocation assistance and sponsorship to work in Sydney for this role.






Additional Information



All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
title: Atlassian at Atlassian (Sydney, Australia)

description:
Fed up with feeling like a tiny cog in a huge machine? Bored with the strict work practices, outmoded coding standards and draconian time management? By joining a small company, you are guaranteed to be a key a part of our team from day one.


pebble {code} is passionate about crafting outstanding software. We are signatories to the Software Craftsmanship Manifesto and believe in contributing to, not just consuming open source projects. We are advocates of continuous integration and won’t be shy if you ask about our test coverage. 


There are opportunities for JavaScript developers to work on full-stack applications for industry-leading clients and startups. This is a full-time, permanent position, and you will be working with UX and UI designers and will become part of a growing JavaScript team. We foster developer empowerment and keep management layers and meetings to a minimum. We believe in hacking and experimentation over lengthy discussions.


Candidates should be self starters, not afraid to ask when they don’t know, and capable of managing their own time. You will be working as part of a small team, at times working directly with another programmer using a single computer, so you must be comfortable working in this kind of environment.


The way we work


We believe in employee empowerment and development, only working on projects that excite us and that unnecessary management layers* are, well, unnecessary.


* Not every project has a defined technical lead, and some might have a project manager on the client side, the point is, we don’t enforce a strict hierarchy for the sake of it. Projects for us are fluid, dynamic, and evolving. We adapt according to the needs of the project. Our developers are not just expected to code, they are also an integral part of creating the solution.


If you like being trusted to get the job done, want to work with highly talented people and cutting edge technology, want to look back on your career, and know that you were a vital part of building an awesome company, then this role is for you.
title: Full-stack JavaScript Developer at pebble {code} (London, UK)

description:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Job Summary:





Intelligent use of open source software is a key component of delivering world-class software projects in today's technology industry, and Comcast Cable has been making use of it internally for years. Similarly, contributing bug fixes and enhancements to projects that are used is not only a community-oriented point of view but also makes good business sense. Finally, technology companies, including Comcast, have increasingly released internally developed software under open source licenses.





The ideal candidate for this role is familiar with emerging trends in the open source software community and in the technology industry as a whole, and will be able to understand both how those trends should impact the company's strategy as well as understanding how open source can support the company's strategic objectives. This is a highly collaborative role that must cross organizational boundaries to socialize a vision for the way the company should approach open source software and its associated communities.



Responsibilities




  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams drawn from internal technical, legal, and intellectual property disciplines

  • Inform company policies related to the use of, contribution to, and release of open source software

  • Streamline processes for use and contribution that balance risk management and enabling efficiency in work by technical staff

  • Establish mechanisms to socialize and inform technical staff and management about current policies and procedures related to open source

  • Represent the company externally on topics related to open source software

  • Lead and direct programs related to open source (e.g. open source advocacy, open source collaborations with universities, etc.) that support Comcast's strategic objectives, including budgetary management

  • Establish and maintain tight working relationships with executives, key stakeholders, and delivery teams

  • Act as a subject matter expert to advise staff maintainers of open source projects the company has released on the topics of proper maintenance procedures and community building and management



Preferred Skills:




  • 12+ years professional experience, preferably in the software industry

  • Thorough understanding of open source software licenses and their interactions

  • Familiarity with software development methodologies and practice, particularly as it relates to the incorporation and use of open source software; ability to establish credibility with internal technical staff

  • Experience as a contributor to or maintainer of open source software projects

  • Passion for working within a team environment

  • Display strong leadership skills to either directly lead or influence the work of others establishes strong interpersonal relationships.

  • Proactive self-starter with a strong initiative and ability to get things done

  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills

  • Location may be negotiable.





Job Specification:




  • Bachelors Degree or Equivalent

  • Computer Science, Engineering

  • Generally requires 12+ years related experience

title: Dir 3, Software Architecture at Comcast (Philadelphia, PA)

description:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Comcast is going to change the way America looks at television. Sound exciting? Then be a part of our next big thing. We're building the perfect product development environment and are hand-picking a dream team.





Are you passionate about digital media, entertainment, and software services? Do you like big challenges and working within a highly motivated team environment? If you rock, we want you here!





The VIPER team is a new, small and fast-moving team of world-class experts who are innovating in end-to-end video delivery. We are a team that thrives on big challenges, results, quality, and agility.





We are looking for an Agile Support Engineer (ASE) to operate and help innovate our most advanced, all-IP video delivery platforms.





As an ASE you will collaborate to identify and resolve issues impacting customers and apply your growing expertise to improve operational efficiency, increase system up-time and enable new innovation. Along the way, you will practice and evangelize an ethic of constant improvement within the team.





This role reports into a VIPER Operations Manager and requires close coordination with critical internal customers in a DevOPs fashion with Engineering, Operations (big data, video delivery, mobile applications, networking, security) and Program Management as well as exceptional leaders across the enterprise.





What are some interesting problems you'll be working on? In your role, you will be upgrading, maintaining, and improving the IP cDVR infrastructure which includes tracing defects through a cutting edge service oriented architecture to find root cause. You will also develop scripts and utilities to automate data collection from hundreds or thousands of servers. You will evaluate new code releases for basic reliability and systems integration support, providing guidance to QA teams who will perform functional and load testing.





Where can you make an impact? You'll be working with the best and brightest minds in Comcast to roll out the video delivery infrastructure that will power the next generation of television. Success in this role is characterized by a higher speed to market, with fewer customer-facing defects and outages.





Responsibilities:




  • Day-to-day 24x7 support of our Cloud Infrastructure that delivers IP based DVR and Live Linear Video to our customers.

  • Work with engineering teams on more efficient ways to automate and operate our infrastructure.

  • Assist in all deployments of new services, and capacity augments.

  • Development and maintain a capacity model for our growing Cloud architecture.

  • Participate in the ground up design and planning for all future products and services for Comcast's IP Video platform.

  • Troubleshooting errors with proprietary and open source applications in production and pre-production environments

  • Identifying, implementing, and documenting of technical SOPs for maintenance tasks

  • Monitor the health and status of systems under your management

  • Ability to create and maintain policies, standards and overall system documentation

  • Troubleshoot infrastructure and network issues as possible causes of poor service performance.

  • Respond to alerts, including those escalated to you by our Product Support team.

  • Contribute in writing and in person to root case analysis meetings as part of process improvement.

  • Support code deployments to Development and Production environments.

  • Work closely with peer teams to deliver high availability and optimum performance for critical "internal customers" -- video and metadata engineering, Business and Product.

  • Provide occasional, scheduled 24/7 escalation support as part of an on-call team.

  • Occasional day and over-night travel for training and cross-team meetings.





Here are some of the specific technologies used in our architecture:




  • Linux

  • Python

  • JavaScript

  • HTML5/CSS

  • Git

  • Mpeg

  • Nginx

  • Centos

  • Cisco UCS + VMWare

  • Couchbase





Qualifications:




  • The ideal candidate has a strong Linux Administration background along with scripting experience (BASH, Python, Pearl, etc.). Operations experience is also a plus.

  • BS/BA in a related field or equivalent experience is required, e.g. Computer Science, with 4+ years related experience.

  • Advanced knowledge of Linux OS, shell scripting and GNU tools




  • A keen analytical, structured and detail-oriented approach to problem solving required.

  • Formal training and experience in object-oriented and/or functional programming required.

  • Significant application support background, e.g. Unix / Web middleware development and/or QA

  • High confidence in the following required: J2EE app servers, Java, Groovy, XML, http

  • Familiarity with REST, SOAP or XML-RPC; extensive knowledge of network protocols; as well as Web software architecture and frameworks.

  • 2nd and 3rd tier technical support experience in Jetty/Web/Java type applications required

  • Performance-oriented understanding of software and hardware architecture.

  • Production operations experience required, e.g. Root Cause Analysis and process improvement.

  • Strong foundation in the following technologies desired: Python, Perl, MemSQL, Couchbase

  • Familiarity with Windows Server OS, .NET framework and IIS.

  • Experience in virtual networks (VMware), Web Services, e-commerce & streaming media a plus

  • Customer-first attitude and strong written and verbal communication skills.

  • Adept and comfortable working in a rapidly changing matrix environment required.

  • Video encoding and transcoding systems administration and operation a big plus.

  • Familiarity with Web content management systems (e.g. Brightcove, thePlatform) a big plus.

  • Good communicator and able to clearly articulate complex issues and technologies

  • Great design and problem solving skills

  • Willing to take ownership of problems and see them through to resolution

  • Comfortable working in a fast paced agile environment. Requirements change quickly and our team needs to constantly adapt to moving targets.





About Comcast VIPER (Video IP Engineering & Research)



VIPER(Video IP Engineering & Research) is a startup division within Comcast's Technology and Product Division that spun out from IP Video and online projects originated within Comcast Interactive Media. VIPER is based in downtown Denver, CO. We are a cloud-based, IP video infrastructure that's been built to deliver a broad mix of on-demand video, live TV streams and an assortment of other digital media to an array of connected devices in the home.Check us out at: http://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/comcast-viper

title: Engineer, VIPER DevOps at Comcast VIPER (Denver, CO)

description:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Job Summary:



The Voice Control Platform is part of Comcast Cable's Technology & Product (T&P) organization and serves the larger company with advanced NLP technologies for searching and discovering any type of content in the entertainment catalog available.



The Voice control Platform needs an engineer that is familiar with scalability principles and micro-services. We will be handling voice requests of millions of customers and are transitioning our platform that operates reliably and efficiently with the latest at-scale technologies.



You will work with other engineers and researchers with backgrounds in advanced fields such as natural language processing, information retrieval, and knowledge representation. As a key member of the team, you will help define, refine, and test state of the art algorithms, and scale the associated systems for high performance, stability, and availability.



Comcast T&P encourages career development with regular opportunities for training and programs for innovative cross-team projects such as week-long Hackathon and job rotation programs over the summer.



Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests, and assists with the integration of new applications. Oversees the documentation of all development activity.Trains non-technical personnel. Assists with tracking performance metrics. Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities.Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and shares expertise.





The job involves:



- Writing production-quality, tested code.

- Understanding the code base for your components in depth.

- Producing technical designs and documentation at varying levels of granularity

- Collaborating with our quality assurance and technical operations teams.

- Participating in code reviews and helping the team to be effective and agile.

- Staying educated on technical developments and tools necessary for the design and maintenance of complex, distributed platforms.

- BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field.

- 4+ years of relevant work experience, including extensive programming experience and strong object-oriented skills including Java server-side development.

- Experience as part of a team doing state-of-the art, object-oriented software development including continuous integration, test-driven-development, automated unit and integration testing.

- Experience with versioning tools. GIT a plus.

- Must demonstrate an understanding of software design patterns and the practical application of those patterns.

- Experience with high-scale, distributed web service development (hands-on experience with RESTful web services).

- Experience with SQL and distributed databases. Cassandra a plus.

- Experience developing service oriented architectures and an understanding of design for scalability, performance and reliability.

- Knowledge of major open frameworks and platforms including Spring, Docker and Zookeeper.

- Experience with Agile development methodologies and practices.

- Experience with edge services like Zuul.

- UNIX/Linux background: facility with command-line utilities; familiarity with system administration tools and concepts.

- Familiarity with distributed systems and micro-services a plus.

- Experience with Elasticsearch and Lucene.

- Experience with various data interchange and representation formats such as JSON, XML.

- Strong initiative: must be able to take high-level requirements, ask questions and get clarifications, decompose into deliverable software components, design and implement solution to meet functional, performance, and quality acceptance criteria.

- Excellent communication: must be a good listener, willing to ask questions, and able to clearly communicate ideas with team members and external groups.





Core Responsibilities:



- Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.

- Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under development, and customizes current applications. Develops software update process for existing applications. Assists in the roll-out of software releases.

- Trains junior Software Development Engineers on internally developed software applications.

- Oversees the researching, writing, and editing of documentation and technical requirements, including evaluation plans, test results,technical manuals, and formal recommendations and reports.

- Keeps current with technological developments within the industry.





Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews literature, patents, and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.

- Provides technical leadership throughout the design process and guidance with regards to practices, procedures, and techniques. Serves as a guide and mentor for junior level Software Development Engineers.

- Assists in tracking and evaluating performance metrics. Ensures team delivers software on time, to specification, and within budget.

- Works with Quality Assurance team to determine if applications fit specification and technical requirements.

- Displays expertise in knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, and skills and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty.

- Displays expertise in process design and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design, and technical choices to internal audiences.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.





Job Specification:



- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent

- Engineering, Computer Science

- Generally requires 7-11 years related experience

Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer
title: Linux and Software Development Engineer, Development and Architecture at Comcast (Reston, VA)

description:
Req ID: 116739

Ericsson Overview

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help shape a more sustainable world.

We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & an innovative & engaging environment where employees enhance their potential everyday. Our employees live our vision & core values. They share a passion to win & a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning & growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge & skills necessary to reach your career goals.

We welcome the opportunity to meet you!

Position Summary

As a Developer you will develop & maintain products (units, nodes, networks, systems and solutions), including development activities like requirement analysis, design, integration, verification, configuration management, PLM support, product documentation.

Education
B.E.(Bachelor of Engineering)/B.Tech.(Bachelor of Technologies) preferably in Computer Science or Electronics or Masters in Computer Application (MCA)

Experience
6-8 years of relevant experience

Essentials for the Role

  • Having 6-8 years of software design and development experience.
  • Must be an expert in using core JAVA, J2EE and OSGi
  • Good knowledge of Linux
  • Version control and GIT/Gerrit knowledge is added advantage
  • Knowledge of Build Scripts like Maven
  • Knowledge of Application Servers eg JBOSS, Tomcat
  • Knowledge of protocols e.g. RPC, XML-RPC, HTTP
  • Good command on
    • Algorithms and data structures, OOAD, state machines,
    • Client-server systems, distributed systems
    • Multithreaded programming,  socket, signaling and messaging
  • Must have good analytical skills
  • Experience of working in an Agile environment will be a plus
  • Must be a good Team Player

Responsibilities for the Position


Developer is a part of the Node design team, within a project, which could be of nature of R&D activity, Design Maintenance or Product Customization.

Responsibilities of a Developer include:

  • Participate in the requirement analysis session with the Domain Architecture team (DAT).
  • Write design related documents such as Implementation Proposals (IPs) for a subsystem, High and Low level design documents within the project.
  • Coding and Unit test (CUT) using the defined technologies.
  • Testing (for own code and for Function testing of other designers in Agile Team) including automation
  • Adhere and follow all the design processes laid down by the unit where design project is undertaken. The

processes are such as Agile development, Test driven development, peer reviews, risk based testing, pair programming etc.

  • Fix trouble reports (TRs) or bugs.

Ericsson provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetics.

Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. In addition, Ericsson supports the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights and the United Nations Global Compact.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and development.

Ericsson expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetic information.

title: Full Stack Engineer (PHP, Angular) at QuikOrder (Chicago, IL)

description:
We have a full-time developer position available. We're looking for someone with great programming skills, awesome people skills, a fair amount of cleverness, and the ability to learn new things.


We value your happiness and job satisfaction above all else, and you'll be pleasantly surprised at the quality of our team, the growth opportunities, and our un-bureaucratic nature. Having our head office in New Zealand means we do things a bit differently. You'll get to work on other people's code, and also have the opportunity to really take ownership of coding new features. You'll be working on an interesting and innovative SaaS product that is currently used by tens of thousands of customers.


Your main colleague will be in Dublin, Ireland, and you can choose to work from our office there. However, you can also work remotely.


Your main desired skills will be:



  • Python (we use the Flask framework)

  • PostgreSQL (Postgres) programming

  • Git

  • Linux (we use Debian)


Bonus points if you are skilled in:



  • PHP

  • Exim

  • HTML/CSS

  • UI/UX design


You'll need:



  • Great communication skills (perfect English please) and the ability to work within a remotely distributed team and deal with other people's code.

  • Great programming skills. You should regard yourself as one of the top coders you know.

  • A large amount of common sense and the ability to just "get it".

  • Good time management skills. You'll need to be organized, motivated, and (dare we say) a "self-starter".


Neat things about working with us:



  • Hours that can be flexible.

  • Relaxed, ego-free, family-friendly work culture.

  • Very competitive salary.

  • Opportunity to grow, travel to attend relevant conferences if so desired, and up-skill.
title: Python and Postgres developer (Interesting SaaS company) at SMTP2GO (Dublin, Ireland) (allows remote)

You will be a part of a dynamic team and help us build amazing web applications and infrastructure technology. As part of our team, you can contribute to all of our web projects and be able to both learn new skills and share your know-how with colleagues. You must take pride in your work and accept both exciting and routine tasks with the same level of engagement - everybody counts in our small but skillful scrum team!

description:
Goldstar.com is looking for an experienced Rails developer to join our existing team and help grow our system of applications and services. This position is located in either Pasadena, CA or Portland, OR.

Rails developers are in high demand. You dont need us to tell you that. What we can tell you, though, is what sets us apart from the others: We're not a start-up, but we're still entrepreneurial. We're an established leader, but still scrappy and innovating. We're profitable, not waiting to hit some mythical milestone to get another round of funding. And with 100+ employees, were not-too-big yet not-too-small and still growing. See this profile on us on 37Signals' blog.

We have a small (8 developers) backend team that works directly with the rest of our ~20 person team and were looking to bring in someone to help create a world class experience for our millions of members. Our backend developers work on all sorts of applications, from a large 7 year old "monorail" to small services. They work directly with each other and with designers, front end developers, mobile devs, and product to build sites, APIs and micro-services.

You will have significant influence on the architecture and technical decisions of the projects you work on. Youll work collaboratively with the rest of the company to build a world class user experience. Youll be helping millions of people go out more and experience their community and youll be helping out thousands of theaters, musicians, and comedians by building their audience.

We're looking for professional and experienced Rails developers that can ship code on a daily basis. We have no time or patience for "Rockstars" or brogrammers. We actively encourage diversity on our team and overall company. We have offices in Pasadena, CA and Portland, OR. We're excited to help relocate the right people within the US, but were not really into telecommuters right now, although there are always exceptions. We're looking for people that know how to ship great applications.


Benefits


  • Top of market salaries based on experience
  • Stock options in our fast growing company
  • Complete 401k package that includes both traditional and roth 401k plans with a company match
  • 100% paid medical, vision and dental insurance including coverage for spouses and dependents at no additional cost
  • Employee comp tickets to great events
  • Flexible, professional work environment that is still fun and family friendly
title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer at Goldstar (Portland, OR)

description:
Goldstar.com is looking for an experienced DevOps/Sysadmin to join our existing team and help grow our infrastructure and to help . This position is located in Portland, OR.

Developers and System Administrators are in high demand. You dont need us to tell you that. What we can tell you, though, is what sets us apart from the others: We're not a start-up, but we're still entrepreneurial. We're an established leader, but still scrappy and innovating. We're profitable, not waiting to hit some mythical milestone to get another round of funding. And with 100+ employees, were not-too-big yet not-too-small and still growing.

We're looking for professional, experienced Systems Administrators and Developers to join our small (3) team. We have offices in Portland, OR. We're excited to help relocate the right people, but not really into telecommuters right now. We're open to mid-level with great potential and senior technology leads.

About the Job

You will be working with a small (3) agile team and have an opportunity to make influential decisions regarding the technical platform. You will be able to contribute to a coveted operations environment that's a joy to work on, and still be able to get home at a reasonable time to hangout with your family and friends. We want you to help us transition from our current stack and infrastructure to a container based one. We're looking to expand our infrastructure from millions of users to tens of millions of users, and to get those users to go out more, experience their community, and enjoy life.

Technologies We're Using

  • Ruby on Rails
  • MySQL
  • RedShift
  • Postgres
  • Riak
  • Redis
  • AWS
  • New Relic
  • Ubuntu
  • Consul
  • Chef
  • Slack (and some ChatOps)

Benefits


  • Top of market salaries based on experience
  • Stock options in our fast growing company
  • Complete 401k package that includes both traditional and roth 401k plans with a company match
  • 100% paid medical, vision and dental insurance including coverage for spouses and dependents at no additional cost
  • Employee comp tickets to great events
  • Flexible, professional work environment that is still fun and family friendly
title: DevOps/Sysadmin at Goldstar (Portland, OR)

description:
Trendage is a technology and fashion startup, focused on personalizing the online shopping experience. With Trendage, everyone can mix & match apparel on their own digital bodies. Trendage's unique body and apparel visualization technology will be available on iOS, Android & Web and will be integrated directly on retailer websites & apps.


You will be directly responsible for building & scaling key parts of Trendage’s product and infrastructure. You will enjoy significant autonomy in architecting Trendage’s production environment from backend to frontend, integrating APIs, and rolling out Trendage’s unique technology for web & mobile devices. This is your chance to be on the ground floor of selecting and working with the latest technologies to build the next big apparel ecommerce platform. In addition, you will be working alongside technical founders and a dedicated team of professionals and play a key role in building out the Trendage development team.
title: Full Stack Developer at Trendage, Inc. (Santa Clara, CA)

description:
Madefire has pioneered a new format for digital reading called "Motion Books". We have a web-based authoring tool, the Motion Book Tool, that our artists, animators, sound designers, and publishers use to create Motion Books. We are embarking upon a ground-up rewrite of the Motion Book Tool, using open web technologies, as well as Electron for native OS access. This position represents a rare opportunity to build a significant creative tool, with an existing V 1.0 in the market that enjoys significant adoption by the creative community. You will have access to the world's best creative talent as you design the tools that will help these artists create new forms of storytelling. This is also a team lead position, so it is expected that this position will build the team required for the product development.

You can check out the end results by downloading the Madefire app and browsing through the Motion Books section. You can also take a look at the existing Motion Book Tool at https://create.madefire.com, and read some of the documentation and tutorials at http://kb.madefire.com/.

Here are the technical characteristics of the person we're looking for:

   - Architecturally-minded
   - Experience with application (as opposed to website) development
   - Deep in Javascript
   - Experience or interest in Electron
   - Experience or interest in Node
   - Experience designing or adding to standard formats or custom formats (JSON, XML)
   - Experience with building products as platforms
   - Degree in CS, MS preferred or equivalent professional experience
   - Experience or interest in building and leading a team

Here are the temperamental characteristics of the person we're looking for:

   - Love of the startup lifestyle
   - Passion for the arts (preferably a practitioner of art, music, drama, or literature)
   - Ability to GSD
   - Healthy balance of strong opinions while keeping dogma in check
   - Platform agnosticism (Mac, Windows, iOS, Android, HTML5; it's all good)
   - Tolerance for ambiguity
   - Willingness to do it "ugly" whenever necessary
   - Obsession with doing it "right" whenever possible
   - Ability to start
   - Ability to finish
   - Elevate co-workers (i.e. not a ball-hog)
   - Enjoy being in the office, but be able to be productive from home
title: Lead Developer - Javascript Node Electron - Berkeley, CA at Madefire, Inc. (Berkeley, CA)

description:
Sentient has built the world’s most powerful distributed artificial intelligence system, which powers innovative products that solve some of the world’s toughest problems.


Combining evolutionary computation, deep learning and other AI techniques, running on one of the world’s largest computing grids, the Sentient platform enables us to understand truly massive data sets in a profound way, enabling cutting-edge products in the financial and e-commerce markets, along with scientific research in health and other domains.


The Sentient R&D team includes world-renowned experts in evolutionary computation, deep learning, artificial life, and distributed computing. The quality of Sentient’s team and technology has attracted some of the world’s most influential investors, making Sentient the best-funded independent artificial intelligence company.


We are seeking an exceptional technical manager to lead our Distributed Artificial Intelligence platform team. This team is building a coherent AI platform that integrates a diverse set of machine learning capabilities behind a common interface, and scales our deep learning capabilities. Product teams use this platform to build novel consumer- and business-facing applications in trading, e-commerce and other domains. Over the next year, your primary goal will be to lead this team to achieve its goal to distribute machine learning algorithms on a massive scale. This is a key role that will have a large impact on the success of our company.
title: AI Platform Manager at Sentient Technologies (San Francisco, CA)

description:

Responsibilities include helping design the UI and helping build, test and maintain all of our web interfaces. Proficiency with HTML/CSS/Javascript are a must as well as experience with a modern frontend web framework - either AngularJS or Backbone.js.


Verre has a fast-moving but relaxed workplace culture. We allow all employees to work on side projects and encourage taking the time to learn new technologies. Funds are available to attend tech conferences and hackathons.


Our offices are in NYC in Nolita (right next to Soho) near world renowned restaurants and shopping.


Come say hello!
title: Lead Frontend Web Engineer at Verre Inc (New York, NY)

description:
Information Technology is a life-saving technology at UCLA Health. UCLA is one of the worlds most respected hospitals, and the complex systems and networks we build support patient care, research, medical education, billing, staffing and communication. Our IT needs can be unique, so we frequently develop our own applications. And because everything we do at UCLA Health is to serve the needs of the patient, our IT professionals are engaged in work that ultimately advances human health. We are currently offering telecommuting options for several of our positions.

Working under the direction of the Application Manager, the Application Coordinator (AC) functions as the primary build expert to configure, build & install the application. The AC will perform in depth and precise investigation and documentation of future- state operational specifications and application functionality. The AC must achieve in-depth knowledge of the software application as well as understand the policies, procedures and constraints of the clinical or business operation supported by the application. The AC develops and documents internal procedures, collects information and prepares specifications of system enhancements, analyzes functionality in new releases and tests each new release. The AC also assists in the development of user training aids and may train end users in workflow and use of the application. ACs functions as the primary contact to troubleshoot problems and questions from end-users during training, go-live and stabilization periods.
title: Application Coordinator: Hospital Billing EPIC at UCLA Health System (Los Angeles, CA) (allows remote)

description:
Job Summary


As a senior member of the team reporting to the Vice President, Engineering and Client Services, you will provide technical expertise and support for all aspects of Distrix’ customer and partner engagements, including presales support such as customer technical presentations, product demonstrations, and planning and implementation of customer trials with the support of the Distrix technical team. Given the customer and partner growth in the Company, this role can grow to become a full Sales Executive, Product Management executive, or other senior role if desired by the candidate. Travel to customer, partner and trade shows is expected in this role, focusing on North America, but could also expand to other regions depending on the candidates’ desire and ambition.


Primary Goals & Responsibilities



  • Work closely with Distrix’ Sales organization and Management Team during the sales cycle to provide technical expertise and relevant industry experience

Help us solve automated intelligence. Led by professors from Stanford, Berkeley, and MIT, we are focused on moving mature machine learning research into the hands of industry. description:
The Software Engineer (GUI role) plays a key part in building out our core software products – and may play a role on complex client development efforts.  The primary focus of the role will be on software product development – in particular developing the GUI front end to our tools.  We are looking for high energy, creative developers that are interested in making a big impact on our software – and in turn – on the world of data users that can deploy our technology.


As we are a small team, this role will have a high impact on our product development – and as such, we are looking for developers that can both:  1) code to a given software design; and 2) create their own software designs and implement them.  This is your chance to make a significant mark.


Key Responsibilities



  • Investigating current applications and tools that are currently being used to: 1) understand what we are doing and how we are doing it; and 2) identify how to make improvements

  • Participating in the design and development of the user interfaces of our products

  • Developing software solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes; investigating problem areas; following the software development lifecycle

  • Interacting with both internal company users as well as with customers

  • Testing and debugging code to ensure that it operates satisfactorily

  • Providing reliable solutions to a variety of problems using sound problem solving techniques

  • Performing technical root cause analysis and outlines corrective action for given problems
title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER - GUI Role at SynGlyphX (Arlington, VA)

description:

description:
Farmers Insurance is one of the nation top insurers and providers of financial services. Today, the Farmers Digital Transformation is a new strategic initiative that was formed to drive agility throughout our business and to respond faster to market demands. A critical part of the initiative is to build a new engineering team for mobile and the innovation labs to foster innovation and to promote more lean, agile processes while delivering products in two key areas: mobile and API platform/Big Data. A career at Farmers Insurance offers compelling ways of delivering something that is not only impactful for the organization but also for our customers.


We have assembled a initial team of top-notch tech and product individuals to work on an exciting mobile project that has a potential to disrupt the insurance industry. We are looking for an Android lead engineer or an Android engineer who is aspired to take up a leadership role.


Qualifications



  • Lead and manage an engineering team responsible for developing Android apps

  • Proactively seek, identify, and communicate issues business and product issues. Analyze trends and work with internal stakeholders and external partners to improve vendor system functionality, product usability, integrations, and data integrity

  • Help drive the mobile project and be responsible for every phases of the development lifecycle, including project planning, product development, releases, performance, and quality control

  • Conduct timely code reviews

  • Participate in functional and technical discussions in mobile, data, and backend development

  • Leverage best practices from industry in influencing and driving technical and operational improvements. Make recommendations on code and architectural changes and conduct cost/benefit analysis of potential improvements
title: Mobile (Android) Engineer at Farmers Insurance (Los Angeles, CA)

description: We are currently looking for well-rounded, curious, and competent developers (Jr, Mid, Sr Level) who put teamwork ahead of ego and cares deeply about creating quality products.
title: ASP.NET/C#/Javascript Developer at HousingManager.com (North Little Rock, AR)

description:
We have an opening for a Principal Data DevOps Engineer to join our product team. You will be responsible for building and managing distributed compute clusters that collect, clean, and analyze data in real time to help accelerate our domestic pricing growth.


The position reports to the Executive Architect of Profit Acceleration who is leading multiple platform development initiatives for the company. This role will require a significant amount of upfront and ongoing learning to ensure we take advantage of the latest best-practice technologies and architectures – a learning mindset will be required for success.


You will architect, develop, and maintain data platforms that ingest billions of records and Terabytes of data per day. You'll design data structures and deploy appropriate databases for storing large data sets. All while using big data frameworks like Spark or Hadoop to implement algorithms designed by business owners or data scientists.


Essential Duties



  • Implement data analysis algorithms using big data frameworks, based on requirements defined by business owners and data scientists.

  • Identify business requirements, select appropriate technologies, coordinate with vendors as appropriate, and deploy components to the big data platform. Example big data components include Hadoop HDFS, Cassandra, Mesos, Spark, Shark, Flume, Storm, and Sqoop.

  • Manage platform applications, including deployment, configuration management, backup, and performance tuning. Utilize tools such as Puppet, Chef, or Salt to efficiently manage large clusters.

  • Develop user interfaces to modify algorithm parameters, review algorithm outputs, submit compute jobs, and monitor job execution status.

  • Select appropriate data storage technologies and design data structures to support analysis and decision making.

  • Employ best practice documentation, version control, and continuous integration techniques.
title: Data DevOps Engineer Principal at Level 3 Communications (Broomfield, CO)

description:
The Twilio platform enables companies to integrate communications directly into their applications via simple cloud APIs and with on-demand global reach.  Twilio is therefore challenged with abstracting away a world of complexity so that our customers can go global without concern for managing a global communications network, carrier integrations and relationships throughout the world.


About the job:


As a member of the messaging team at Twilio, you will enhance and scale the SMS and MMS platform that touches millions of people every day. To take it to scale, you will be developing a complex distributed platform in Scala and Java and will be concerned with availability, throughput, latency, and data integrity. There will be a significant data component so you will be working with distributed SQL and NoSQL databases and caches.  At the core are cloud technologies that enable deployment and management of computing resources globally.  


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with Product Managers, Architects and Engineering leaders to define, architect and build new customer-facing features.

  • Own, operate, and maintain your team’s services in a distributed production environment. Employ Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to customers.

  • Drive quality by writing unit, functional, load and performance tests.

  • Release, monitor, and maintain features in a responsible, reliable way as part of our integrated DevOps practices.

  • Excel as an engineer and be a productive member of the team where leadership is a behavioral trait, not a title.
title: Sr. Software Engineer - Messaging at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)

description:
As a data scientist you will be responsible for developing tools to collect, clean, analyze and manage the data used by strategic areas of the business. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand complex business problems. The team is responsible for leading advanced decision analyses and optimization projects.


Essential Duties



  • Clearly communicate methods and conclusions with simple language and innovative visualizations to management and executives.

  • Design and implement programs and automation to collect, mash up, process and analyze distributed real-world data.

  • Provide expertise in analyzing and visualizing large, complex, and unique data sets. Create new insights that will drive business growth and profitability in the short and long term. Deploy analytics code with a continuous integration environment incorporating version control, build servers, and test servers.

  • Work effectively on a team as well as a self-driven individual to do research and develop cutting edge and effective solutions for the business. Manage the network layer and compute cluster to support extensive analysis.
title: Senior Data Scientist at Level 3 Communications (Broomfield, CO)

description:
NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies in the development, production, and marketing of entertainment, news, and information to a global audience. NBCUniversal owns and operates a valuable portfolio of news and entertainment television networks, a premier motion picture company, significant television production operations, a leading television stations group, and world-renowned theme parks. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

NBCUniversal is seeking an experienced Software Engineer for Android who possesses a passion for pushing mobile technologies to the limits and will work with our team of talented engineers to design and build the next generation of our news applications. The role is in a fast paced and growing team with the NBC Owned Television Station division which offers a unique opportunity to put your stamp on applications used by millions of our users daily. Responsibilities
  • Architect, design, develop and test of the NBC Owned & Operated Stations news applications.
  • Collaborate with Software Engineers for the design and development of back-end services.
  • Aid UX in promoting best practices within Android design and ecosystem.
  • Aid Product and Stakeholder to define requirements.
  • Self-motivated, productive, and works well even with/without formal structure.


Requirements:
  • Solid background in Android UI, Android SDK, Android design patterns.
  • Minimum 5+ years of professional software development experience.
  • 3+ years of experience building applications with the Android SDK with extensive knowledge of the android platform.
  • Published 2 or more applications available on Google Play.
  • Has strong knowledge and demonstrated experience using Android Studio.
  • Experience interacting with RESTful API and data formats like (JSON, XML...etc).
  • Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle.
  • Experience in working with Video, Static content and advertising.
  • Exoplayer experience a plus.
  • Understanding of Activities, Fragments, Custom Views, Services, Volley, Support library, and 3rd party libraries.
  • Solid background in OOP and knowledge of software design patterns/best practices is essential.
  • Proficiency in Java. Worked with JDK (Collections, Generics, Networking, Core Java). Understands Java concurrency, memory management.
  • Understanding of Unit-testing and Functional-testing.
  • Experience using Source Control (Git).
  • Passion for mobile user experience and design
  • Experience working on-site and off-site teams and management.
  • Self-motivated, proactive and works well within a formal structure.
  • Previous experience developing an iOS applications for the media industry.
  • Aided in development of applications for the Android platform.
title: Software Engineer, Android at NBCUniversal (New York, NY)

description:

description:
EVENT CONFERENCING SERVICES POSITION DESCRIPTION



Position Title:            Senior Network Engineer


Department:              Event Conferencing Services Inc.



ECS is seeking a passionate self-driven individual who will be in charge of designing and deploying custom tailored conferences to meet client and venue demands. The Senior Network Engineer will provide onsite and remote network deployments and ongoing management of client networks of various sizes and levels of complexity. Since our clients rely on ECS as their sole technology resource onsite, this position requires handling a full range of tasks from managing complex Cisco, Linux and Ruckus configurations to managing 20 networking engineers onsite and being the single point of contact for priority customers.



The individual we seek enjoys handling complicated challenges of all sizes, and finds reward in helping businesses make the most of their technology. In addition to being well organized, efficient, knowledgeable with Microsoft, Cisco, VMware, and possessing the ability to work with limited supervision, the candidate must have strong written and verbal communication skills. Time management ability is a must.



Key Responsibilities:


Operations Support



  • Design, deploy, support and manage custom technical requirements specific to client needs, remote and onsite.

  • Work with Project Management and Engineering (PM/ENG) in developing internal processes and training surrounding but not limited to: Site Surveys, Ordering Equipment, Configuration, and Pre/Post documentation including Scope of Work, Network Topology, and Bill of Materials.

  • Support Engineering and Sales in finalizing a Bid Calculator that captures both Sales and Engineering components.

  • Own and be the single point of contact surrounding the product development of internal software implementation and changes needed.

  • Provide guidance and training for Sales Engineers and Engineering.


Sales Support



  • Work with New Footprint Sales (NFS) to develop key client presentations.

  • Support NFS team with in-person presentations and meetings with technical and non-technical contacts.

  • Support Sales team in creation of technically accurate bids for specific opportunities.

  • Review NFS bids prior to submission to potential customers.

  • Assisting in managing the technical needs and requirements on pre-sales and sales calls.


 Trade Show and Event support



  • Lead and represent ECS at key trade shows and events when called upon.

  • Develop, set up, and present key product demonstrations at events.

  • Provide support in answering technical questions from trade show/event attendees.


Sales Training



  • Work with Director of Global Operations and Sales team to develop technical training material that conveys the technical details of the ECS solution in a manner that allows sales representatives to present the material in a meaningful manner to Meeting Planners.

  • Work with Director of Global Operations and Sales to develop an on-going training program that incorporates subject-matter-experts to present details of their area of responsibility (hardware engineering, software engineering, project management, finance, IT, etc.).
title: Senior Network Engineer at Guest-tek Interactive Entertainment Ltd. (Calgary, AB, Canada)

description:
Reelio is an online marketplace and platform, matching independent video creators to Brands looking for relevant content. Our goal is to create a balanced marketplace driven by quality content and fair compensation for everyone involved. We use data to create and qualify the matches, and then help them manage the campaigns.


We are looking for an experienced Front-End Developer that can help us build intuitive and immersive user experiences. You will be working with a brilliant and motivated team and will have direct impact and decision-making in product development. We are venture-funded and have been growing rapidly for the last two years.
title: Front-End Developer at Reelio (New York, NY)

description:
Ahrefs Research is looking for backend developer with deep understanding of operating systems, networks and taste for simple and efficient architectural designs. Our backend is implemented mostly in OCaml and some C++, as such proficiency in OCaml is very much appreciated, otherwise a strong inclination to intensively learn OCaml in a short term will be required. Understanding of functional programming in general and/or experience with other FP languages (F#,Haskell,Scala,Scheme,etc) will help a lot. Knowledge of C++ is a plus.



The ideal candidate is expected to:



  • Independently deal with and investigate bugs, schedule tasks and dig code

  • Make argumented technical choice and take responsibility for it

  • Understand the whole technology stack at all levels : from network and userspace code to OS internals and hardware

  • Handle full development cycle of a single component, i.e. formalize task, write code and tests, setup and support production (devops)

  • Approach problems with practical mindset and suppress perfectionism when time is a priority


These requirements stem naturally from our approach to development with fast feedback cycle, highly-focused personal areas of responsibility and strong tendency to vertical component splitting.
title: OCaml server-side developer at Ahrefs Research (San Francisco, CA)

description:
Working as a Software Development Engineer in Test, you'll use and build cutting edge testing tools with agile processes to plan and conduct functional and acceptance testing of our software products. You'll be part of a product team using a number of test frameworks and methods to ensure that we provide the best possible experience to our customers through quality driven products.


What You'll Do:




  • Collaborate closely with product teams and stakeholders to correctly identify issues




  • Understand and help define acceptance criteria, utilizing that information to write test requirements. Apply that research and knowledge in the development and implementation of test plans.




  • Organize and carry out functional and non-functional testing within an iterative development methodology.




  • Create, review, and maintain robust automated regression and data-driven tests




  • Contribute to the company and our culture




  • Automate testing using Javascript and/or Python




  • Engineer tests to verify and validate performance




  • Write and/or review unit or API tests
title: Software Development Engineer in Test at Workiva (Scottsdale, AZ)

description:
Workiva Devops Software Engineers develop ways to build, deploy, and support our solutions across the Google Cloud Platform and Amazon AWS infrastructure.  Our entire company is built on the cloud, and we are looking for people who can help us leverage the cloud to its fullest.


Workiva culture is highly innovative and team-oriented. We encourage autonomy and provide you the opportunity to develop mastery in areas about which you are passionate. As an DevOps Software Engineer at Workiva, you will clearly understand the needs of our customers and the benefits our software provides them and their community.  To support the innovative solutions that we, as an organization, develop, you will be playing a part in developing tools and products that will work for not only specific use cases, but an entire organizations use cases.


What You’ll Do:




  • Be an integral part of our DevOps team where you are crucial link between development and production support




  • Helping plan and develop tools to be utilized throughout the organization




  • Understand the solutions developers are building and work on supporting those solutions.




  • Work with a variety of development and production teams to provide assistance, guidance, and solutions to help achieve organizational goals




  • Serve as an educator to both the development and production teams.  By serving as a critical gateway between the two organizations, you will have the unique opportunity to touch both worlds and streamline the processes that we use to move our code from a developers desktop to a highly scalable and highly available runtime environment.




  • Help us move to a deployment environment based on Docker containers - help figure out what makes sense to containerize and what doesn’t, where things fit, and how we scale.
title: Senior DevOps Engineer, or Operations Guru if you will. at Workiva (Englewood, CO) (allows remote)

description:
Our developers have been contributing code to major organizations and open source projects for over 25 years now. They’ve also been writing books, speaking at conferences, and helping push software development forward -- changing companies and even industries along the way.


As consultants, we work on-site with our clients to ensure we’re delivering the best possible solution. Our Lead Dev plays an important role in leading these projects to success.


Curious what makes a developer a Lead around these parts? A lead is:



  • Often the day-to-day primary point of contact with our clients

  • Able to strategically lead a project team to successful delivery

  • Excited to mentor, influence and lead a team of ThoughtWorkers and clients

  • An expert in at least one language or domain, and maybe in 2 or more
title: Lead Software Developer - Consulting & Delivery! at ThoughtWorks (Addison, TX)

description:
Magic is a Y Combinator-backed software company in San Francisco, CA that is building a hyper-intelligent, ubiquitous executive assistant and concierge service available over SMS.


We provide world-class service 24/7 to our influential and diverse user base, many of whom use Magic dozens of times per day and say they couldn't live without Magic. We have a large waitlist of customers that we are scaling up to roll out our product to.


Magic was founded in 2015 by a team of software engineers with one simple premise: create a natural language interface to the complexity of the world, delivered by a combination of artificial intelligence and human expertise. We are hardcore developers at heart, we are highly iterative, and we are relentless. We are minimal and focused on writing code that really matters. We don't stop until we are done.


Our primary technologies right now are Node.js, MongoDB, Meteor, Ruby, PostgreSQL, and Twilio. Experience with these are nice but not required. Bonus if you have experience with C/C++ or some type of Lisp. We believe in using the right tool for the job.


We are currently hiring for senior, mid-level, and junior engineering positions. You will be given a high degree of autonomy and will be expected to deploy impactful code to production in your first week. We're less concerned with your resume and more concerned with your ability to get real stuff done.


Come build the future of human-computer interaction with us.
title: Software Engineer at Magic (San Francisco, CA)

description:
Position Overview:


The Center for Effective Philanthropy (CEP) seeks an experienced Developer to help us maintain and develop back-end Python applications processing data from SQL Server and design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code. This is a contractor position paid on an hourly wage basis commensurate with experience and skill level.


The position requires a commitment of 8-16 hours per week. Working closely with CEP’s full-time Software Architect, the developer will troubleshoot bugs, test code, and develop new software features. We have strong preference for local candidates in Boston and surrounding areas.


In the first two months, ideally, the contractor will attend some in-person orientations with CEP staff to have a firm grasp of our codebase and technology stack. After two months, the contractor can work from a remote location and come into CEP’s office when in-person assistance is required.


The right candidate will be mission-minded, forward-thinking, creative, smart, and flexible. An excellent communicator, she or he will be comfortable working closely with the Software Architect as a thought partner, advisor, and implementer. She or he will also possess a high level of attention to detail and quality control. The hourly is competitive and dependent upon level of experience and geographic location.


Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:



  • Developing a thorough understanding of CEP’s data systems: how data is collected via vendors, processed using SQL stored procedures and Python, and displayed in client reports

  • Maintaining and developing new features for CEP’s Python data application

  • Troubleshooting bugs with these applications in a timely manner

  • Working in Ruby on Rails and collaborating with a designer to devise technical solutions for improving client experience with CEP’s online reporting application

  • Working closely with the Software Architect to strategize and perform code review
title: Contract Position: Python and Rails Developer at The Center for Effective Philanthropy/YouthTruth (Cambridge, MA)

description:
Company Overview

uShip is the world's first and largest shipping marketplace. Consumers and businesses can compare and book bids from hundreds of thousands of customer-reviewed transportation service providers, ranging from independent owner-operators to the largest freight carriers and brokers.  Customers save money and service providers use their empty cargo space - everyone wins! We're an Internet company focused on solving a real-world problem and having loads (pun intended) of fun along the way. Our service providers are even featured in A&E's real life drama, 'Shipping Wars.'

Since launching uShip in 2004, our mission has been to be the world's leading online solution for shipping anything, anytime, anywhere. We are passionate about empowering buyers and providers of transportation services to efficiently conduct business on an unbiased, transparent and competitive platform.

If you are a motivated, smart, and driven individual who wants to work in an energetic and entrepreneurial environment with outstanding career and growth opportunities, then this is the career opportunity for you!


What you'll be doing:

  • Designing and implementing features of the uShip E-Commerce, Pricing and Trust & Safety platforms using Microsoft .Net and open source technologies.
  • Collaborating with other Payments Team developers to deliver individual features and larger strategic initiatives.
  • Working with Stakeholders, Development, Product and Quality Assurance to define user stories, identify acceptance criteria and test cases.
  • Creating REST API endpoints in MVC 4 and WebAPI 2 with C# to be consumed internally and externally.
  • Helping to develop best practices around performance, code quality and readability via pair programming, code reviews and collaboration with technical leadership
  • Operating with a "test-first" approach to write behavioral unit and integration tests.
  • Documenting application features and API endpoints

Skills you have include:

  • Fluency in C# and .NET 4+
  • Knowledge of relational database platforms like SQL Server or Oracle, both using stored procedures and an ORM like Entity Framework or NHibernate
  • Writing automated tests using NUnit or an equivalent
  • First-hand experience integrating with external payment APIs and processors such as MES and PayPal
  • Knowledge and experience working with fraud prevention & monitoring systems like ThreatMetrix.
  • Multiple years working on building, maintaining and improving E-Commerce systems
  • Understanding of PCI Compliance and security practices for handling payment methods.
  • Familiarity with ACH and electronic transfers.
  • An understanding of payments systems supporting multiple currencies
  • Using distributed version control, preferably Git or Mercurial
  • The ability to understand and recognize design patterns
  • The ability to communicate cross-functionally among other departments
  • The ability to write code that is safe for Continuous Integration

(Note: Candidates without E-Commerce and Fraud Prevention experience WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.)


Ideally, you also:

  • Have built web applications using an MVC framework
  • Have built or worked on a RESTful API. Experience with Microsoft WebAPI is a plus.
  • Have worked with at least one NoSQL platform
  • Have client-side experience in one or more JavaScript frameworks
  • Have worked in a Continuous Deployment environment
  • Are familiar with international payment processing


Why work at uShip?

Who says work can't be fun? Not us. Not only is uShip the world's largest online shipping market place, we've also got a few tricks up our sleeves to make sure our employees want to come to work every day. We know that shipping doesn't always sound that amazing on paper, so we though a little Q&A session would help you realize you WANT to join the online shipping revolution:

Q: Can I get 100% paid employee medical/dental/life insurance? A: Done!

Q: What about 401(k) matching? A: Yep!

Q: How about ability to acquire pre-IPO stock options? A: Your wish is our command!

Q: I want a companywide team building event every first Friday of the month. A: Look no further!

Q: What about free breakfast and lunch?  A: Not only do you get that, we'll 1 up you. How about having that food cooked for you by our in-house chef?

Q: Can I bring my dog to work?  A: You bet!

Q: How about the ability for senior mentorship, accessibility to the executive team, and cross-departmental projects? A: Check! Check!! and CHECK!!!
title: E-Commerce & Fraud Prevention Developer at uShip (Austin, TX)
