description:
Are you one of top Software Architects in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 10x more productive than the typical developer? Are you interested in earning $100,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. At Aurea, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world. Sound too good to be true? Take a closer look...


What to Expect as a Chief Software Architect at Aurea

At Aurea you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architecture problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.


Compensation

At Aurea, you’ll earn extremely competitive wages while enjoying the flexibility of working from virtually anywhere on the face of the earth:

  • Salary: 50 USD/hr

  • Position type: Full time (40 hours per week)

  • Location: Global


The Type of Chief Software Architects We’re Looking For

Aurea values a culture of excellence. We need technical genius who thrives in an entrepreneurial environment and in solving complex problems for customers with high expectations. The position is only a great fit for someone who takes a truly hands-on approach to product development, design and engineering. It's a great opportunity to secure a high impact technical lead role in an expanding global software company that is growing both organically and through acquisition. The opportunity for exposure to new challenges is immense, as the acquisition of several new products and customer bases every year creates extremely interesting learning opportunities for motivated professionals who strive to create value in their work and to personally grow.


Your key responsibilities will be

  • Developing expertise in one or more of our proprietary enterprise software products.

  • Leveraging your broad technology capability set and maintain a level of excitement in using various technologies to architect, develop, and iteratively deploy real enterprise class software

  • Achieving an expert level understanding of our customers’ environments and their use of our products.

  • Architecting and leading weekly technical delivery of one or more products in a way that maintains an unyielding focus on quality while matching the needs of the target customer base.

  • Creating solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs for solutions that scale to the customers enterprise/global requirements

  • Leading a small team of Software Engineers to apply software engineering practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery

  • Manage accountability of team members, with pinpoint focus on quality; Personally accountable for resolution of the most technically challenging issues

  • Ensuring our customers are supremely confident in the advantages and quality of our product and solution, and the technical services you lead to deliver them.

Aurea is partnering with Crossover to recruit for this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing top talent around the world.
title: Chief Software Architect Java - $100K at Crossover () (allows remote)

description:
Senior full stack software engineer.


To sum up, we are looking for people who are smart and get things done.


eBay is a large company in the beginning of a major transformation. We need great software developers with a passion for what they do to build the next generation of eBay technology.


Looking for senior full stack web/api developers, especially those who:



  • Are a strong problem solver

  • Love writing software

  • Know how to coach and mentor others

  • Have a passion for Linux (and Unix mindset generally)

  • Are interest in working on the full software stack (from database to api to web to html/js to testing)


Especially if you have strong experience with:



  • Relational and NoSQL databases

  • Building APIs and Using APIs

  • User interface and user experience

  • Developing software on and for Linux

  • Python and Java


“If I had asked people what they wanted, they would have said faster horses.” - Henry Ford



  • Able to collaborate with others, but in the end maintain ownership and deliver the right solution, not the one that is asked for.

  • Help prioritize work for the team

  • Make technology decisions

  • Team building, interviewing candidates

  • Mentor and Coach other engineers

  • Write great software
title: Senior Engineer at ebay (Netanya, Israel)

description:
As a Senior Developer at ThoughtWorks, here's what you can do:


  • Work on large-scale, custom distributed software systems using Java, Ruby and/or .NET

  • Be responsible for the quality of software and resolving any issues regarding client satisfaction

  • Be a mentor and role model to less experienced developers

  • Employ Agile development including task estimation, test automation, deployment automation, and Continuous Integration to improve overall execution speed and product quality

  • Travel the world

  • Learn something new everyday

  • Speak at conferences 

  • Write blogs and books

  • Start new offices in places you’ve never been before

  • Think through hard problems, and work with a team to implement a solution

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title

  • Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan
title: Senior Developer - Consulting & Delivery! at ThoughtWorks (New York, NY)

description:
Yes Lifecycle Marketing wants you to say YES to this exciting opportunity. We are seeking a Software Engineer - Java to join our Chicago office. This position is responsible for developing, programming, and maintaining business application systems, as well as testing and support of a diverse range of applications. This position is also responsible for analysis of systems and for the coordination of project efforts. Essential Job Functions:



  1.  Design, code, and test major features, as well as work jointly with other team members to provide complex software enhancements for databases.

  2. Hands-on Java/J2EE development experience.

  3. Analyze and suggest improvements in the overall development process.

  4.  Provide technical leadership and coaching to team members as well as solutions to complex software development problems.

  5.  Conduct code reviews in accordance with team processes/standards.

  6.  Construct and design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse.

  7. Interact with key partners and internal users regarding timelines, technical issues, and infrastructure integration.

  8.  Collaborate with DevOps team to add instrumentation and monitoring to support production environments.

  9. Develop strong working relationships with managers and analysts.

  10.  Analyze data needs and independently develop logical and physical data models.

  11. Provide leadership in the design and implementation of databases.

  12. Coordinate the implementation of database application components.

  13. Understand and work with data in fixed and delimited formats.
title: Software Engineer- Java at Infogroup (Chicago, IL)

description:
Join our Backend Java team in Oslo!


We connect patients easier against therapists and doctors by streamlining administration and communication, while continuously developing new innovative services.


we seek both Norwegian and English speaking Candidates


Pasientsky is a young innovative e-health company, We are now seeking a developer to our team in Oslo. This is an opportunity / position for those who wish to take part in a company and team where you can be part of creating innovation in a public critical area.


As a developer with Patient Sky you become part of a competent team, in a company with short decision-making and high tempo, where the use of new technologies is the focus and social activities are important. We have a good culture to share knowledge, while focusing on independence and ability to run own projects/development processes also are high.


To fit into the rest of the development team, it is an advantage if you get energy when you contribute with good solutions in an environment where code quality is important. At times, you should appreciate working in a hectic environment.


The position also requires some contact with users and customers. In order to create the best possible understanding of the challenges we continuously work to resolve for our clients.


We offers good conditions, eg 8 week of vacation, an exciting journey in a forward leaning technology / development company that has a strong foothold within E-health, a domain where much is still undone, and room for innovation is huge.
title: Java Dev.- OSLO |  We challenge eHealth in Norway |Leading tech corp. at PasientSky (www.pasientsky.no) (Oslo, Norway)

description:
Infogroup's Small and Medium Business Division has a BIG opportunity. We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our Papillion office. This position is responsible for designing, developing, testing, maintaining and/or deploying business application software or specialized utility programs.



Essential Job Functions:
1. Design, code, implement, and test application systems according to department standards and guidelines.
2. Execute on requirements as defined by the business
3. Analyze data, code, and test programs using appropriate languages and tools. Document programs and results. Coordinate implementation of completed systems.
4. Maintain systems and applications. Make required changes and enhancements to programs. Document and communicate changes. Identify potential areas of improvement in existing systems.
5. Troubleshoot technical problems to keep production operating within their schedule.
title: Front End Application Developer at Infogroup (Papillion, NE)

description:
Compose is an organization that is growing and scaling at an inspiring pace. Our goal is to enlighten other web businesses to do the same. We provide databases as a service to the development world. If you have experience with building out useful and fluid infrastructure for high capacity/bandwidth systems, we have a premier offer for you. You'll spend your day-to-day working in an industry bubbling with potential, applying interesting and fun tools, while being supported by a talented and close-knit team.


If you'd love sitting at the helm of a beautiful, interconnected distributed system, we think you'd have a blast with our team. This is an important role. There'll be lots of places to focus your attention. You'll assist our engineers and support staff internally while maintaining and building out our systems. We have a sane on-call schedule that we share between the Operation, Engineer and Support teams.


If you can speak fluently, amiably, and comfortably to both modern web infrastructure and human-beings, we have a wonderful team that would like to grow with you!


We know this is a different process than you're used to, but it's all part of an effort to minimize our own biases as much as possible. If you're the best person for the job, we want to take away all our human filters and allow you to show it. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.


We understand that a complex introductory work sample is a big first request, and so we'll spend as much time as you'd like talking with you to make sure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.


We look forward to meeting you!


Please note: At this time we are only able to accept candidates in the United States, Canada, and the UK.
title: Operations Engineer at Compose (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)

description:
We are searching for our next Digital Software Engineer to join our highly skilled and talented development team. Based in our HQ in Winchester (Hampshire, UK), you will use your strong background in C#, SQL Server, ASP.Net and HTML / CSS to develop new software solutions for our clients. AND we will promise to develop your technology talent with new and innovative digital projects and opportunities to train.


You will have tangible experience of delivering best practice CMS / CXM / eCommerce website projects (using technologies such as Umbraco and Sitecore), as well as developing and supporting bespoke line of site business applications.


You will have the opportunity to further your career whilst working on diverse & challenging projects with a great team around you. You will take ownership over projects and encourage and mentor others in the team as they progress their own skills. Working closely with the UX team, this role will see the successful candidate work on a mixture of Digital websites and applications.
title: Digital Software Engineer (C# / ASP.NET / MVC / JS / HTML / CSS) at profound. (Winchester, UK)

description:
In the present world of application development it's difficult to determine where the front-end stops and the back-end begins. While we don't feel wise enough to define where this point may be, we feel the right candidate will be adventurous enough to focus more on how to provide the strongest and cleanest user experience. We're seeking someone familiar with Rails and JavaScript who is interested in creating beautiful and functional work. Compose will lead you to opportunities to learn and grow, while providing excellent conventions (like our internal framework Megatron) to comfortably work within.


As an Application Developer with Compose, you'll make major contributions to the design, function and user experience of our product. You will join a talented and supportive team in a self-managing and open organization. We're remote first and have a diverse group of friendly people located all over the world. We'll give you the respect, freedom, and trust to contribute your talents in a way that you envision. 


With great respect/freedom/trust comes great responsibility, and as such it will be crucial that you have the right intrinsic motivators to work with little direction and oversight but still collaborate and seek alternative view-points. If you love making beautiful and functional things and want to have some fun, we'd love to see what you can cook up for us.


Think you're a match?


Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.

description:
Developing software appeals to those who love to solve puzzles and apply their creative energy -- and also to those, in our experience, who like working from home in their pyjamas. It is often said that one of the trickiest accomplishments in the development world is imagining, building and maintaining a complex and interconnected mental model of your entire infrastructure within your working memory. If you have experience applying this mental feat within some type of Software-as-a-Service and want to grow into something new, we have a tremendous challenge for you and a terrific team willing and able to support you through it.


We need crafty humans to help expand the Compose vision. Compose has grown into a vibrant work environment where folks can feel comfortable being themselves, living a balanced life. We welcome you to enjoy comfort when taking risks, collaborate with spirited peers, and to unleash your creative personality.


Think you're a match?


Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.


At any time during the process, we are available to chat (email, video, whatever you like) to ensure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.


We look forward to meeting you!

description:
Quidsi is a subsidiary of Amazon and entrepreneurial parent company to Diapers.com, Soap.com, Wag.com, Yoyo.com, Look.com, Afterschool.com, Casa.com, BeautyBar.com and Vinemarket.com. We deliver delightful experiences, products, and expertise by offering a curated selection of products, lightning-fast delivery, incredible customer service, and an easy-to-navigate shopping experience. We are a mom-centric retail technology company that sells products through our own websites and additional marketplaces.

The Quidsi marketplace business is the fastest growing channel and we are looking for a goal-oriented, highly entrepreneurial and analytical candidate to join our exciting and fast-paced team. He or she will help manage the P&L and drive financial results through selection, pricing, in-stock, marketing and catalog optimization. The successful candidate should not only possess analytical intelligence, technical expertise, but also comfortable with ambiguity and have great interpersonal skills for interacting with key business partners at Quidsi as well as Amazon.

Position Competencies include:

· Analytics / Data Driven: Gather and analyze data to support business cases and proposed projects from a functional and technical prospective. Looking for someone who geeks out over data!

· Process driven: Ability to execute projects based on existing Standard Operating Procedures but also to locate and define new process improvement opportunities.

· Systems / Technology Savy: Looking for a candidate who is able to identify areas where technology can lead to increased efficiency and productivity.

· Ownership: Can demonstrate the ability to take ownership and achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment.

· Collaboration: The ability to use both formal and informal influencing skills across Quidsi and Amazon's cross-matrix organization is critical to success in this role.

· Learn & Be Curious: Entrepreneurial drive and hungry to learn, test, implement, and train on new ideas.

Solutions Oriented: This candidate must be comfortable with ambiguity and express thoughts logically and succinctly. Ultimately finding their way to results through un-outlined processes.

· Bachelor’s degree (computer science, math, or economics a plus)

· Experience in financial and/or business metric analysis using Excel or Access and using complex data sets to analyze business trends, build business cases and develop strategies

· 1+ years of experience writing SQL queries and managing databases

· Experience with managing multiple projects simultaneously



· Excellent written and oral communication and presentation skills

· Demonstrated excellent judgment and the ability to drive a business

· Deep understanding of and passion for e-commerce is desired

This position is conveniently located in Jersey City, NJ, a four minute ride from the World Trade Center and just outside the Exchange Place PATH Station. Bordering the Hudson River, our offices have spectacular panoramic views of Manhattan and New Jersey.

Quidsi/Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer- Female/Minority/Disability/Vet. Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with all applicable local, state and federal laws.

StubHub reinvented the ticket resale market in 2000 and continues to lead it through innovation. The company''s unique online marketplace, dedicated solely to tickets, provides all fans the choice to buy or sell their tickets in a safe, convenient and highly reliable environment. All transactions are processed and delivered by StubHub and backed by the company''s FanProtect Guarantee™. Company partners include the San Francisco Giants and University of Texas, along with over 60 teams in the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL and NCAA, complemented with companies such as ESPN, AEG, Tickets.com, and Paciolan.

description:
We see this as an exciting opportunity to join our global software development team as a Lead Software Engineer//Manager working on our world-class enterprise software. Success in this role will provide a host of additional opportunities for technical and professional growth. Experience in a startup environment or on global software team is preferred.


What sets us apart?



  • We are a technology company that understands the importance of staying up-to-date and at the forefront of new and innovative technologies. We have been working in Cloud computing for 15+ years and now working on exciting projects in PaaS, Big Data and Predictive Analytics.

  • Global Scale?! We have over 20 million users in 192 different countries! Who even knew there were 192 different countries?

  • We make software that empowers people, and we think that is pretty cool! So much so, that we live it every day. Cornerstone offers monthly development days, along with countless training opportunities. Top it off with real career growth possibilities, and you have yourself a company for the long term!

  • Check out our office. Need a code break? Go play in our arcade, watch a movie in our theater, or even get a free massage in our dedicated massage room! Or, grab some free food and rest on our outdoor patio (Ocean view of course )

  • We also offer top of the line benefits! How does Company stock, unlimited PTO, a 401k match and top of the line healthcare sound?


In this role you will...

  • Provide mentorship and guidance to the team members to achieve highest levels of quality and productivity

  • Collaborate with QA and Product teams to release software in a timely fashion

  • Quickly become an expert on the product architecture and workflows

description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:


The Release Engineer plays an important role in the TruCare development process by maintaining key development environment infrastructure components such as source and configuration management, continuous builds, software packaging and installation and software quality metrics tools. The Release Engineer not only ensures robust software configuration management, but is also responsible for ensuring that software can be continuously built, packaged and delivered to QA and other internal stakeholders and for testing and validation.


Responsibilities



  • Configure, maintain, and support Maven builds for multiple Java-based enterprise applications. Customize and enhance builds according to new and changing needs using standard Maven build lifecycles, plugins, as well as Ant scripting. Assist developers with troubleshooting Maven build issues in their local development environments. Maintain Nexus-based corporate Maven repository.

  • Maintain Git repositories hosted in Atlassian BitBucket Server (formerly Stash). Administer and monitor BitBucket Server to ensure system health, as well as to facilitate and enforce Git development workflows. Branch, merge and tag shared branches maintained in central Git repositories. Assist developers with using Git effectively. Troubleshoot source control issues.

  • Configure, maintain, and support continuous build plans in Atlassian Bamboo as well as Jenkins.

  • Create GUI-based interactive application installers for the installation, configuration and upgrade of server-side enterprise Java applications. Create installers for service packs and hotfixes, as needed.

  • Configure, maintain and support builds for iOS as well as Windows Mobile applications.

  • Configure and maintain SonarQube-based system for generating and reporting code quality metrics.

  • Design and implement script-based ad-hoc tools to automate operational aspets of the source control and build infrastructure.

  • Execute software release activities in coordination with program management – release of Maven artifacts into the corporate Maven repository, creation, publication and announcement of release artifacts, source code tagging, source code escrow, etc.
title: Release Engineer Build and Install at Casenet (Bedford, MA)

description:
We're looking for a senior backend engineer to help own the development of the next generation of UrbanFootprint. Our product is used to view, analyze and edit geospatial datasets: from individual parcels to detailed tracts of conservation areas. We generate metrics that include species diversity all the way up to the impact of planning decisions on commute times across an entire region like Los Angeles.


We have lots of interesting problems to solve in the domains of scaling/performance, data modeling/versioning, and translating urban planning concepts into working code.


Today, we're primarily a Python/Postgres shop but are are actively assessing new technologies to improve all aspects of our web serving and data analysis pipelines. Responsibilities include researching and assessing new pieces of the stack, demonstrating their pros/cons, and making design decisions that carry into production implementations. This is in addition to standard feature development for supporting new functionality in our React-based web front end.


You are expected to have experience building scalable web applications and the ability to effectively communicate the process to stakeholders. We embrace code reviews and unit testing, and we release daily. We are always trying to improve our code and our process. If you like pushing your team to write better code, work smarter, and release often, then we want to talk to you!
title: Backend / Full Stack Software Engineer at Calthorpe Analytics (Berkeley, CA)

description:
Do you love rhetorical, grandiose, and/or bombastic opening hooks in job postings? Great! Are you a full stack engineer who wants to help shake-up the traditional role of software in healthcare delivery? Also great! Keep reading...


We are looking for a versatile Angular/Rails engineer who is as eager and passionate as we are about:



  • creating user experiences that help doctors & nurses make the best decisions possible

  • re-imagining the way that the latest medical evidence gets incorporated into delivering care

  • reducing the large -- and wasteful! -- amount of time that clinicians spend on documenting what they’ve done


… OK, you may not be super-passionate about this right now, but you will be! (And once you see the way this is currently done, you’ll be left scratching your head or worse).


Dorsata’s core SaaS offering (an HTML5 AngularJS/Rails SPA) -- along with it’s companion mobile apps (native iOS/Swift & Android) -- cohesively (and ambitiously) address all three of the above, but more on that later.


A Little About Us


We’re a tiny-but-mighty team that just secured our first round of venture capital financing.  As the newest member our growing product team, you’ll be an integral part of every aspect of our business strategy, dev roadmap, technology architecture decisions, and, undoubtedly, will wear a lot of hats.  


Ones of these hats -- besides your techie hat, of course! -- will almost certainly include the Customer Hat. At Dorsata, we are fervent (read: rabidly obsessive)  believers in frequent, high-touch interactions with our very involved, loyal customer base, who drives our roadmap.  Fair warning: this isn’t lip service to a trendy notion….you’re going to be on a first name basis with many of our customers ;).


Another hat you be wearing is your Design (Thinking) Hat. User/Job stories are only as good as the questions/assumptions you asked/made to get them -- that’s where Design Thinking comes in. It is an integral part of how we manage product/process/projects. You’ll need to be able investigate with both known and ambiguous aspects of a given Story/Goal in order to discover hidden parameters and open alternative paths which may lead to the “real” Story/Goal.


Bonus: all of the above hats coordinate very nicely with the Mr. Rogers-style sweaters that are currently in style (you’re welcome, neighbor!).


A note about the "Work Remotely" checkbox: we'd prefer it if you were in the DC-ish region, but are willing to entertain anyone who is 2-3 hours away on the Amtrak and willing to come in to the office occasionally.  Currently, 2 of our team are remote (Richmond & CVille)  and Am-trek it into DC once per week......
title: Full Stack Engineer at Dorsata (Arlington, VA)

description:
HubLogix is a SaaS based solution that empowers online retailers to manage inventory, orders and shipment tracking through an unlimited number of suppliers. We work with some of the leading shopping cart platforms (e.g. Channel Advisor, Magento, Shopify, Amazon, etc.) and a vast number of warehouses to automate the entire order life cycle opening up time for retailers to focus more on growing their business.

We're looking for outgoing and energetic people to become a part of our growing development team. Getting in early on our growth means getting hands-on experience working in a SaaS B2B start-up located in downtown Boston. We are located in the Cambridge Innovation Center at 50 Milk Street. Working with our team, you will have the opportunity to work hard and have fun learning in a well-appointed, relaxed environment.

What to expect:
You will develop data-driven solutions that connect our service to warehouses and fulfillment systems using multiple protocols and mechanisms as well as a world-class management portal and reporting dashboards. You will handle all the responsibilities of a full-stack developer, with a keen emphasis on data manipulation and database optimization. You will develop solutions that always keep performance in mind. Our primary stack has been developed in PHP, but we also have projects that use Ruby / Rails and future projects might leverage other technologies, depending on the the problem at hand.

What to bring:
A positive, can-do attitude that is manically focused on satisfying our customers. We emphasize a team-first attitude and willingness to learn above all else. Your passion for the position and what we do is essential.

title: Front End Engineer (Austin, Asheville, NC or Remote) at Q2 Software (Austin, TX) (allows remote)

description:
A Different Engine is looking for a remote Javascript Engineer full-stack developer who will work with our design and development teams in building frontend applications, tools and content management systems focused on ReactJS, Angular and the NodeJS and express stacks Candidates should be expert JavaScript developers comfortable with advanced JavaScript concepts. Day to day responsibilities will be as primary developer and technical lead on either React, Angular or NodeJS content management tools and projects. Ideal candidates should be able to architect and build large scale, JavaScript applications based on standard frontend Javascript tools and libraries and comfortable using build tools such as gulp, grunt, requirejs, or browserify. Some of our most recent applications have been written in ES6 using gulp, babel and browserify. As we expand as a team we are also adding automated testing to many of our tools and projects using tools such as Cucumber and Karma so experience with JavaScript BDD/TDD tools is a plus.


Candidates should also be comfortable with other front-end web technologies and tools such as HTML, CSS and tooling such as SASS or LESS (we use SASS mostly)


We are a client facing organization so candidates should also be comfortable speaking directly with outside clients as well as internal design teams, producers and stakeholders.


A Different Engine is looking for software craftsmen who take the vision from our design team and turns it into a reality for our clients. We are looking for folks comfortable across a variety of languages, platforms and frameworks, and can code, and get things done regardless of language. Our primary development work is done in JavaScript however we frequently need to build quick and dirty tools for our clients to host, or their existing CMS (Drupal a lot) so PHP is frequently used however we also have an affinity for frameworks such as Ruby on Rails, and NodeJS/Express when we can choose the full stack. Our projects generally are 3-6 month development projects and we maintain internal tools and frameworks to ease and speed development.


We are an interactive agency, who design and build bespoke applications for our clients. Unfortunately this frequently forces us into more of a "Waterfall" development methodology. We're trying to address this by using Agile and iterative methodologies as much as possible. From a management perspective we're looking for folks who have experience with using and adapting agile practices to less than agile projects so we're looking for candidates familiar with agile processes but able to adapt to our project realities.
title: Full Stack JavaScript Engineer at A Different Engine LLC (Mexico City, Mexico) (allows remote)

description:
A Senior Engineer on the Product Team delivers great features while supporting the other team members to achieve their best.


At FreeAgent, we love our customers, and our customers love us. They also trust us to produce useful and powerful software that just works. In the product team we like to keep them engaged by delivering really useful functionality that helps them nail that daily admin faster.


We work closely together to get our features shipped. We like to pair when we’re stuck on a problem, or just to share the knowledge. We’d love you to share your ideas and experiences and help us make our team even better. Specifically we’re looking for someone who can work closely with and mentor junior members of the team.


We operate in small, cross-functional teams with a great degree of autonomy. We like to help each other, learn from our mistakes, invest in self-improvement and have fun doing it. We invest in our platform (code health, scalability, security) as well as working on new features. We favour pragmatism over idealism and we really care about quality and long-term sustainability of our work.


Our engineers arrive with diverse programming backgrounds, though we primarily work with Ruby, Rails, Javascript, React.js, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch and Puppet. You don’t have to have all these skills, we’ll help you get up to speed!
title: Senior Software Engineer, Product at FreeAgent (Edinburgh, UK)

description:
Come change the way the world sees the cloud!

CloudWatch is the service that gives customers actionable visibility into the health of their applications and systems. Key features include web services for submission and retrieval of measurements, a console for presentation, and the ability to notify and automate based on results. Teams in CloudWatch solve problems of massive telemetric data scale, distributed systems/cloud computing, data visualization, and workflow.

We are currently looking for WICKEDLY AMAZING software engineers to help us deliver several new services. Is that you? How can you tell? For one thing, with you, It’s about The Code, which must be testable, maintainable, operable, and all those other “ables” that make working with it pleasure-able. You find problems in real-time data streaming, “Big Data”, “NoSQL”, and other such topics to be extremely fascinating, maybe even addictive. Your teammates love working with you, not only because of your extraordinary technical talent, but also because you’ve “got their backs.” You are noteworthy for coupling a continuous improvement mindset with an uncanny ability to deliver things quickly - and you’re pretty sure that these are two sides of the same coin. Finally, you insist upon giving customers what they want: high quality, highly usable, always-on services.

In this position you’ll get to:

· Set the example for your team in terms of code quality, engineering practices, and productivity

· Lead the architecture of new services and features that will be deployed and used at massive scale

· Provide guidance and mentoring to other engineers

· Collaborate with Amazon’s legendary principal engineers to find simple solutions to brain-contorting problems

· Interact with customers and other service teams to understand requirements and define solutions

· 7+ years of experience developing objected-oriented software, with mastery of one or more relevant languages (Java, C#, C++, Ruby)

· 3+ years of experience designing and building distributed systems

· 2+ years of experience providing technical leadership on projects

· Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, or a related field



Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

· Ability to work across multiple layers of an application, from front-end/UI to back-end/data storage

· Depth in data structures and algorithms, especially those dealing with concurrency or scaling

· Hands-on experience with designing, developing, operating, and maintaining Internet-based services, esp. web services

· Experience with “big data” systems, such as Cassandra, Hadoop, MongoDB, etc.

· Experience with search systems (e.g., Lucene)

· Experience with Agile engineering practices (continuous integration, TDD, etc.)

· Experience with monitoring and log analysis systems at scale

· Advanced degree in computer science, mathematics, or a related field
title: Senior Software Development Engineer  Amazon Web Services EC2 CloudWatch at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)

description:
We're looking for a senior front end engineer to help own the development of the next generation of UrbanFootprint. We're starting fresh with React to build a single-page, data-rich, map-centric interface for analyzing how the built environment affects a wide range of outcomes.


Our product is used to view, analyze, and edit geospatial datasets: from individual parcels to detailed tracts of conservation areas. We generate metrics that include species diversity in particular watersheds all the way up to the impact of planning decisions on commute times. We have lots of interesting problems to solve in in the domains of user experience, data visualization, and scaling.


We love open source, and try to leverage third-party software where we can. We're looking for developers with experience using modern JS libraries to streamline our development both in the browser (e.g. React, lodash, D3, Leaflet, MapboxGL, etc) as well as our team workflow (e.g. Grunt/Gulp, Webpack, SASS, etc) and we look forward to the day when the world runs on Web Components.


We embrace code reviews and unit testing, and we release daily. We are always trying to improve our code and our process. If you like pushing your team to write better code, work smarter, and release often, then we want to talk to you!
title: Front End Software Engineer at Calthorpe Analytics (Berkeley, CA)

description:
Come join a passionate team that builds the platform that powers Box for hundreds of thousands of businesses and some of the biggest companies in the world. We are creating the next enterprise content management platform that redefines how enterprises work and collaborate.

The Box Platform offers a broad spectrum of technical challenges - a highly scalable collaborative file system, SOA frameworks, enterprise workflow, policy engines, reporting etc. We are looking for people to join our full stack team and work with engineering and product leadership in defining the future of our platform and its architecture.

As a leader on our team, you'll have the opportunity to work across organizational and team boundaries to deliver decisions that align with the future architecture and company goals. Your leadership will help us drive significant technology initiatives from end to end and across multiple layers of architecture. We'll look for you to provide perspective on leading industry trends, recommendations on new and emerging technologies, thought leadership on code quality, and engineering process improvements. You'll collaborate with others to uncover, pursue, and resolve complex or uncharted technical problems and share key insights. As an engineering leader, you will be expected to lead teams, coach engineers, drive agreement and get things built. Help us reimagine the future of content! 

Roles and Responsibilities:


As a front-end member of the team, you will work closely with the members of your full-stack team to help build the front-end portion of our new features.  At the same time, you will also work closely with the other front-end engineers on the other Enterprise teams to build out the infrastructure and components to take Box's UI to the next level.  Currently that team is working on a full UI revamp using React.  As a senior member of this team, you will be expected to help lead the architectural direction and help shape the future of our front-end codebase.  You will also be expected to mentor other team members while working with them to implement and own complex enterprise features through their full development cycle.  We expect all of our engineers to be able to work closely with other developers, product managers and designers and to thrive in a small, highly collaborative and energetic, team environment.
title: Sr. Staff Software Engineer, Platforms at Box (Redwood City, CA)

description:
fromAtoB is looking for an experienced full-time Backend Engineer headquartered in Berlin or Aachen.


We unite lovers, families and businesses. We bring our customers from A to B. Thanks to our deep understanding of Europe’s traffic networks, we develop unique and intelligent routing algorithms that magically calculate the best path between two places. Traveling has never been easier or more efficient and we do all this without charging any extra fees.


Every search, intelligent routing, booking, payment, email and every other bit of logic we do, allows someone to travel. As a Backend engineer at fromAtoB your ambition and passion is required to convert people into happy travelers. In return, as one of our greatest assets, you will thrive from our exceptional team spirit, great benefits, and a culture where your achievements will always be acknowledged and highly valued.


This is you



  • you have very good experience with Ruby, Rails and Rspec

  • you love proper testing, no questions asked

  • you are a team player and culture is your passion

  • you always keep an eye on the customer

  • for you “it works” is not enough


Icing on the cake



  • you have realized projects in other languages and frameworks

  • you know that Sandi Metz is not a canadian politician

  • you still miss _Why as much as we do

  • you dockerize your cloud


This could be future-you



  • you have a big impact on our product, specification and decision making

  • you grew into technical leadership

  • you finally accepted that this is a never ending journey of learning, experimenting and understanding

  • you went beyond salary, demanding and finding purpose on a daily basis



Sounds like a good fit?  We’d love to talk! Please submit



  • Your complete application with salary expectations

  • Your GitHub ID


to join-our-team@fromatob.com or apply directly via https://fromatob.workable.com/ .



This job probably isn't for you, but maybe you have a friend who is a perfect fit? Send them this link and cc join-our-team@fromatob.com. Once they applied we'll get you a free ride. You happy. We happy. Win-Win!
title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer (m/f) at fromAtoB GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

description:
Amazon.com is looking to hire highly motivated, best-in-class Senior Network Engineers for our Internet Services/Backbone network team to drive the stability and sustainability of our next-generation networks and to discover innovative ways to automate and scale our network as we expand.

The ideal candidate will be expected to provide high quality first-tier network and network event management for Amazon’s worldwide network operations. He/she will demonstrate an excellent knowledge of networking and networking concepts and theory, and have experience participating in operational network support for a large-scale enterprise environment. He/she will have a proven track record of success in driving complex issues to resolution autonomously and/or collaboratively. A love for working with new technologies and pushing the envelope on existing technology is required.

This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon’s world class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies anywhere.

As a Senior Network Engineer working in AWS Networking you will:

  • have end to end ownership (architecture/design/scale) of our current and newly developing networks.

  • lead the design of highly available ultra-scale networks, driving them from concept to launch.

  • define and influence strategy within and outside the team.

  • lead project teams to deliver impactful benefits to our customers.

  • work closely with our software developers to fully automate network deployment and operations.

  • drive operational excellence projects to improve network performance and reliability.

  • troubleshoot complex problems and develop innovative solutions.

  • mentor and coach junior engineers.

  • review and implement changes on the network.




  • Substantial background in large scale network design.

  • Informal project management experience or experience leading project teams.

  • Proven experience designing and delivering complex network projects.

  • In-depth knowledge of and significant experience with major Internet protocols: BGP, OSPF, ISIS, MPLS, TCP.

  • Deep knowledge of network hardware and packet forwarding architectures.

  • Must be comfortable working in a Linux/Unix environment.

  • Demonstrated experience creating software to automate network deployment or operations.

  • Software development/programming/scripting skills are highly desired specifically Perl, or shell (bash, ksh, csh.)

  • Knowledge or awareness of IT best practice frameworks (ITIL, COBIT) and Operational Excellence concepts or methodologies is a plus.




  • Must be willing to support an off-hours, engagement only pager rotation.

  • Experience dealing with customers during problem resolution and operating efficiently under pressure.


Other Requirements


  • The ability to sit in front of computer for entire scheduled 12-hour shift with appropriate breaks while maintaining a high level of alertness and attention to detail.

  • Ability to move and lift computer equipment.

  • Must be able to work in a follow the sun shift (6am-6pm) across and including weekends and holidays.

  • Must be willing to support an off-hours, engagement only pager rotation.

  • Experience dealing with customers during problem resolution and operating efficiently under pressure.

  • Effective prioritization and time management.
title: Senior Network Development Engineer at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)

description:
Join our fast growing, highly motivated Traffic team as an experienced Software Engineer in Berlin, Germany.


In this position you will be responsible for designing and creating the new generation of Traffic Data services serving billions of transactions monthly. You will work directly with architects, developers, testers and DevOps engineers on a cutting edge software and technologies.


The responsibilities include (but are not limited to):



  • Designing and implementing software components used across several services

  • Close collaboration with development and system operations teams to ensure meeting functional and performance requirements by traffic services

  • Providing guidance on programming techniques and best practices to other team members

  • Hand in hand cooperation with test engineers


Our Offering



  • To join our fast growing team

  • To work with evolving and challenging technologies

  • To work together with specialists in an international team

  • To invent next-generation traffic services for world’s largest customers
title: Sr./Software Engineer Java (Traffic Team) at HERE (Berlin, Germany)

description:
Wir - die artegic AG - zählen mittlerweile >55 Mitarbeiter und sind als Anbieter von Standard-Software im Bereich E-Mail-Marketing Automatisierung und Systemintegration wahrliche Marketing ENGINEERS!


Dieser Technologie-Fokus wird auch dadurch deutlich, dass wir derzeit VIER verschiedene Entwicklungsbereiche haben. Und in jedem können wir neue Kollegen oder Kolleginnen gebrauchen.
Welche Aufgaben Sie also übernehmen, hängt davon ab, welcher Entwickler-Typ Sie sind und wofür Sie sich begeistern. Jeder Entwicklertypus ist wichtig und findet bei uns seinen Fähigkeiten und Vorzügen entsprechend seinen Platz.


Sind Sie also



  • Architekt: Ein Backend/API Entwickler (m/w) mit hohem Anspruch an Entwurf und Struktur?

  • Detektiv: Backend/Allrounder (w/m) mit Fähigkeiten zur systematischen Analyse und Forensik?

  • Feuerwehrmann: Allrounder (w/m) mit der Fähigkeit in jeder Umgebung, schnelle Lösungen zu finden?

  • Designer: Frontend-Entwickler (w/m) mit hohem Anspruch an Optik und Usability?


Worum geht's eigentlich?


Unsere ELAINE (eine Web-Applikation u.a. für Online-Dialog-Marketing) will weiterentwickelt, an individuelle Bedürfnisse angepasst sowie gewartet und gepflegt werden.



Die beschriebenen Entwicklertypen sind natürlich stark vereinfachte Bilder für die anstehenden Aufgaben. Sie vermitteln aber einen ersten Eindruck, worum es für Sie vornehmlich gehen kann.
Das konkretisieren wir sehr gerne gemeinsam mit unseren Entwicklern in einem persönlichen Austausch mit Ihnen.
title: PHP-Entwickler (m/w): Detektiv? Architekt? Feuerwehrmann? Designer? at artegic AG (Bonn, Deutschland)

description:
Amazon Fashion is seeking a high-performing, innovative, entrepreneurial, experienced, results-oriented marketing professional to lead and grow the team’s marketing organization. As Campaign Manager for Amazon Fashion, you will lead a team to create the marketing and messaging strategy for each season and develop a comprehensive, integrated marketing approach across onsite, digital and external marketing.

The ideal candidate must be able to think strategically and execute flawlessly. He or she will have a proven track record of delivering results. Keys to success will be the ability to utilize customer insights and data to build marketing programs and lead cross-functional initiatives by partnering with buying, design, site merchandising and fashion editorial teams.

Core Responsibilities:

  • Develop the seasonal brief that sets the framework for each season by identifying key target customers, initiatives, and featured product categories

  • Lead the hindsight for each season, identifying areas for innovation and improvement

  • Partner with the editorial teams to incorporate seasonal trends on site

  • Lead a cross functional team including Editorial, Design, Site Merchandising and Digital Marketing to create and execute integrated marketing plans

  • Manage the promotions calendar, balancing internal business needs, customer benefit and industry trends




  • At least 6+ years of progressive responsibility within marketing

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Proven leadership experience with 2+ direct reports, including performance management and development

  • Bachelor's degree required




  • MBA

  • Track record of building new things or processes, the right candidate will be highly entrepreneurial - comfortable with ambiguity and with a bias for action

  • Experience leading large, diverse cross-functional teams, while achieving goals on-time and on-budget.

  • Demonstrated experience using hard data and metrics to measure performance, determine improvements and innovations, and to support project requests from partner teams.

  • Passion for fashion industry is highly desired
title: Marketing Manager, Amazon Fashion at Amazon (Seattle, WA)

description:
Livestream's video playback experience team builds the clients that are viewed by millions around the world. This is an opportunity to develop at the forefront of video technology on the modern web, where technical challenges meet graceful interfaces.


We are looking for full-time developers that are adept with JavaScript and other derivations, such as ActionScript. In addition, strong candidates have built solid user experiences around video playback, coded full-fledged client-side applications, and are familiar with modern video protocols. Candidates should also be detail-oriented and work effectively in an agile team.

description:
HERE location services are used by millions of people every day on mobile devices, in cars, wearables and on the web. We are pushing the boundaries of, and extending the horizons for the highly-autonomous driving, Virtual Reality and IoT.


We in the Maps Search team make the world's addresses and places findable. Our daily work is all about data mining, string processing, efficient data structures, machine learning and ranking algorithms. We are proud to to have top software engineers, machine learning specialists and mathematicians in our team which is spread across offices in the USA and Germany.


We are looking for a passionate, experienced software engineer to strengthen our team in Berlin. Ideally:



  • you love writing testable, readable, maintainable code

  • you know the strengths and weaknesses of Java and are aware of how Java works under the hood

  • you enjoy developing better algorithms and data structures and can estimate time and space complexities on the fly

  • you are keen on tuning performance and profiling code

  • you are into automation and building tools

  • you are responsible, communicative and open


 As part of the team, you will:



  • analyze, design and implement software, that scales to serve high load volumes or improves the ranking of results

  • constantly work on efficiency and correctness of the existing software

  • constantly write/update tests and documentation

  • create/maintain automation and development tools

  • conduct peer reviews

description:
The Enterprise Architecture team are responsible for establishing and governing best practice IT design. This role owns the IT architecture elements of data & BI strategy and acts as internal consultant to the projects and initiatives involved across all our systems. The role also has ownership of the Central Systems domain architecture including our Finance and HR systems. It provides high level knowledge and expertise of how our systems and infrastructure fit together and a broader context of the external world of IT and eCommerce in general.


To shape and manage future technical direction of easyJet's applications by:
  • Developing and communicating data, BI & Central Systems architecture principles, standards, patterns etc. specific to easyJet's IT landscape and strategic direction.
  • Working with external parties, suppliers and internal members of the IT team and business units to research, define and document actionable data, BI & Central Systems architecture artefacts.
  • Work closely with Solution Architects and other senior IT designers to ensure data, BI & Central Systems architecture elements of major relevant projects are appropriately covered (esp. for Business Intelligence & Analytics; Customer Master Data Management; Major HR & Finance projects).
  • Internal and external networking, airline and eCommerce industry events and supplier and consultant briefings to be able to assess industry trends and their application to our organisation.
  • Interfacing with staff within easyJet to build and maintain valuable and productive working relationships and ensure that the technical direction supports short term business needs as well as long term strategy.
  • Leading the development and implementation of technical governance policies and practices within easyJet.


This role requires the ability to bridge business and IT issues assimilating the key business requirements that drive the architecture. Being an inspiring and engaging communicator is a key requirement of this role.

The individual therefore should be able to or have:
  • Be a business-focussed, creative, innovative pragmatic and positive team player.
  • Be confident in presenting technical architecture and strategy to both and IT and business audience.
  • A good working knowledge of eCommerce and an understanding of total cost ownership of IT assets and functions
  • Have a detailed understanding of key data, BI & Central Systems technologies and techniques. A good appreciation of solution architecture, software and solution delivery practices, IT infrastructure and application architecture.
  • Familiarity with patterns, practices and frameworks of Enterprise Architecture.
  • Clear experience of defining and delivering BI and Analytics platforms / solutions including semi-structured, unstructured data analytics and support for data science use cases.
  • An understanding of how data architecture and integration architecture align and complement one another, across a broad range of integration patterns & approaches.
title: Enterprise Architect (Data, BI and Central Systems) at easyJet Airline (Luton, UK)

description:
Mendeley is revolutionizing how research is done and has won awards for their social innovation which benefits society.   Built on world-class technology Mendeley has developed a product that customers love, and now the business is rapidly evolving with the significant investment in people and technology since being acquired.   Elsevier, a world-leading provider of information solutions, fully supports the Mendeley vision to drive change and have impact on a global scale across research communities. 


We’re looking for an experienced Backend Developer  to join the Mendeley Data team.  We expect you to think on your feet and be able to come up with practical, simple solutions to complex problems.  As well as having deep knowledge in areas related to back end development, you should also be knowledgeable in all things related to creating a quality user centered product.  As a back end developer, you will be part of shaping science’s next steps.


About us:



  • We are committed to building cohesive teams where communication, support and innovation thrives. Instead of taking a top-down approach to new ideas, all members of the team are empowered to contribute. Great ideas can come from anywhere

  • We adopt an Agile process, with daily stand-ups, sprints, demos, retrospectives and other Agile practices

  • All features are written as a user story, and we strongly believe in a user centred approach to design, as this is a user facing product. Many of our features come as a direct result of user testing, and therefore may not have been predicted in advance

  • We’re nearing the launch of the first part of our Mendeley Data product, but there are many areas we are yet to explore. You will initially be working on the core Mendeley Data product, but may move into other related areas soon after


 About the role:



  • You’ll work in the Mendeley Data team, a pizza sized team of individuals centred around a common goal — to make sharing research data easy, enjoyable and empowering.

  • You will contribute to the Mendeley API, a public API which is used both internally by Mendeley and externally by the general public to build client applications on top of (see mendeley.com)

  • Our stack is written in Java/MySQL and uses Hadoop and various AWS products, so you’ll already have or quickly gain a strong aptitude in these technologies

  • We’re looking for a passionate developer who has a history of self-direction on complex projects which are exploratory in nature and not fixed, responding to user feedback and working in a fast paced environment

  • Our ideal team is full of T-Shaped people, who are experts at areas of deep knowledge, as well as a having a broad understanding of other disciplines (see wikipedia.org/wiki/T-shaped_skills)
title: Senior Java Developer - be part of shaping the future of science at Mendeley (London, UK)

description:
Im HiDrive Backend Team (ca. 15 Entwickler) konzipieren und entwickeln wir das Backend (APIs, Services, Filesystem, etc.) für den Cloud-Storage-Service HiDrive auf Basis von Open-Source-Software selbst, um die Kontrolle über Funktionalitäten zu behalten und bei Fehlern schnell reagieren zu können. Auf dieser Basis optimieren wir die Performance der Services wie FTP, WebDAV, SMB u.ä. Dabei ändern wir auch Kernfunktionalitäten des Betriebssystems, wenn uns dies notwendig erscheint. Um einen sehr hohen Optimierungsgrad zu erreichen, arbeiten wir sehr nahe an der Hardware und unterstützen deshalb gelegentlich unsere Adminkollegen, wo wir uns verantwortlich fühlen.




Ihr Verantwortungsbereich:



  • Perl-basierte Entwicklung von Prozessen für die Installation, Wartung und Pflege unserer Software auf Frontends, Backends inkl. Filesystem

  • Entwickeln, Testen und Pflegen von systemnahen Libraries, Daemons und System-Services

  • Modernisierung von bestehenden Applikationen auch für Reporting und Datenerhebung

  • Konzeption und Implementierung neuer performanter Infrastrukturen
title: DevOps Entwickler (Perl&C/UNIX) für HiDrive (m/w) at STRATO AG (Berlin, Deutschland)

description:
Job Description



HookLogic Engineers develop proprietary software platforms used by the world’s largest e-commerce retailers. Our engineering team consists of talented, team-oriented individuals who are empowered to take advantage of the latest cloud and distributed technologies to deliver reliable, high-throughput applications. Our core languages are Java and C# and we commonly utilize technologies and platforms such as Hadoop, Storm, Spark, SQL Server, HBase, and AWS Services such as Redshift, Kinesis, DynamoDB, Lamda, and SQS. 


As a Data Engineer for the Platform Data Insights team, you’ll employ your skills to optimally store hundreds of millions of transactions per day in Hadoop and Hive. You will process data in Oozie or Azkaban jobs using SQL and Python. You will distill data into OLAP systems using SQL Server Analysis Services or similar products. You’ll aggregate and store data for highly performant retrieval from Amazon Redshift, and write reports using SQL Server Reporting Services and Excel. You will ensure integrity of the business and usage data through careful attention to detail and responsible archiving of data in a highly available way. You’ll know what data the company has, what data still needs to be collected, and how best to get at it, in order to fulfill business requirements both present and future.
title: Software Engineer, Data Insights at HookLogic, Inc. (Ann Arbor, MI)

description:

description:
Senior Software Engineer

Do you want to work with cutting edge technology? In a true Agile environment? Working on Web & mobile development, Adaptive / Responsive Designs?

This is software development at News UK's team dedicated to The Times and The Sunday Times digital products (including mobile, web & tablet) some of Britain's most iconic newspaper titles.

The environment in which we work has a flat organisation structure, with cross-functional self-managing teams resulting in empowered developers who get to choose their own development tools!

The role

As an experienced Senior Software Engineer at News UK, you confidently demonstrate your technical abilities, as you help to guide the team in the development of the next generation of technology to deliver first class products to our members. The company will fully support you to be across the latest developments in technology and engineering practice. With your hands approach your team will release higher quality production code in a CI/CD manner. If you think you have the ability, please read on.

You will be a polyglot full stack developer who has mastered several programming languages and leading edge mobile web development, practices, technologies and frameworks.

OO & Functional programming, JavaScript (front end and back end), Node.js, Java, HTML5, CSS, Tomcat, TDD, BDD together with other languages and frameworks. Native mobile development experience a bonus!

You really understand and apply agile software engineering practices in your day to day work.

The above skills are essential to contribute the following
  • To be a go-to Software Engineering person in the team.
  • Design and implement superior technical solutions.
  • Easily recognizes system deficiencies and implements effective solutions.
  • Facilitate improved cross team working practises
  • Lead by example employing the best software engineering practises
  • Mentor other software engineers in the team
  • Consistently deliver high-quality services to clients.
  • Work within Scrum framework in an Agile environment


We invest heavily in our people, with industry certified training. We have a modern, fast paced and fun environment to work and we are building exciting projects that will have a global reach. We use the best of class technologies and we are hiring people who will shape our future business and culture.

At News UK, you can develop your Software Engineering career. Contact us for full details.

About Us,

News UK is a great company full of talented, dedicated and creative people. We are a company which has journalism at its very heart. Our newspapers and associated websites are some of the most powerful media brands in the English speaking world, reaching 30 million people each week. They are very different products with different values and different strengths, but all are united by a commitment to independent journalism that connects with our customers.

News UK is a company which thrives on pace. Our people stretch themselves on a daily basis, challenging the status quo to produce the best service possible to our readers and customers. We embrace creativity and initiative and we have some of the most talented people in the industry.

If you want to work for one of the world's most exciting, challenging and creative media organisations then News UK is the place to build your career.
title: Senior (Principal) Software Engineer at News UK (London, UK)

description:
At LawLogix, we are a team of builders: our products run on variety of tools, such as C#, Python, Django, Angular, Postgres, etc. As an experienced Software Engineering Manager, you’ll lead, develop, and grow a team of engineers to create software that’s revolutionizing the HR compliance and onboarding experience. We are seeking a highly technical, experienced, and motivated manager who is passionate about using software to reshape business.



  • Lead by example — write some awesome code, provide relevant feedback through code reviews and set the bar for the team to match

  • Provide technical leadership — articulate high-level technical strategy and product vision, encourage technical discussions, promote cross-functional projects, and facilitate code reviews to drive the shipping of quality code into production

  • Collaborate with Product Management to create and launch product/platform initiatives from conception to deployment

  • Grow your team — work with recruiting to source, hire, and onboard talented and passionate engineers

  • Lead performance reviews and career development for new and existing engineers
title: Software Engineering Manager at LawLogix, a division of Hyland Software, Inc. (Phoenix, AZ)
company_name: LawLogix, a division of Hyland Software, Inc.

description: Be part of a focused, talented team that is creating a platform for product discovery and reviews. We want to empower our users to become smarter consumers by building an honest, interactive community where they can engage with their peers. You will have the opportunity to learn and grow by working alongside our experienced tech team. The team is small, so you will have the ability to make a meaningful impact from the start. Influenster is dynamic and fast-paced, so you will get to solve a wide variety of problems and get experience with many different technologies.
title: Full Stack Developer at Influenster (New York, NY)

description:
LawLogix’s products help people make life changing decisions - we’ve created a one of a kind platform that gives companies and people access to critical immigration and employment information at key junctures in their lives and careers. 


The vast majority of our operations are moving to our C#/Angular/Python/Django/Postgres stack, from filing for a new visa to getting a new job. We're building new tools, new workflows, and new infrastructure to solve the challenging problems of managing complex processes that directly impact people's lives.


Don't be intimidated if you don't have an HR compliance or immigration background; solving these problems fundamentally requires software solutions. We're looking for the best and brightest software engineers — strong generalists with solid CS fundamentals and practical software engineering intuition — to help us scale up to support millions of users.


If you're interested in working with modern web technologies, brilliant engineers and products that influence millions of people’s lives, this is the place for you.


Position Responsibilities




  • Sling code -- have a passion for writing software that improves people’s lives. We want engineers that can develop solid systems that are maintainable and work as advertised.




  • Design for real life – it is one thing to write good code, it’s another to write code that is easy to manage, monitor and support. Build in monitoring support and logging is critical to long term success.




  • Architect – participate in creating the long term architectural design of the solution




  • Collaborate with Product Management and Engineering leadership  to create and launch product/platform initiatives from conception to deployment using modern open source technologies
title: Software Engineer at LawLogix, a division of Hyland Software, Inc. (Phoenix, AZ)

This position is a technical leader in the software development life-cycle for the Marketing Technology team; performing software application technical analysis, architecture, design and development.

The position is responsible for the review of the development, implementation, maintenance, and support of all projects within the Marketing Technology team, which provides direct support numerous Marketing business areas. description:
Ben jij als C# ontwikkelaar op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging? Wil je geen 'radertje' in het grote geheel (meer) zijn, maar een belangrijke rol spelen van begin tot oplevering in een ontwikkeltraject? Of zelf overleggen met klanten en leveranciers en zo betere oplossingen realiseren? Zoek je afwisseling en uitdaging in je werk? Dan heeft Brunel de baan voor jou bij een opdrachtgever in Friesland!


Je bent medeverantwoordelijk voor het realiseren van grote en kleine projecten. Het programmeren van websites, registratiesystemen, webshops, offertesystemen, workflow management oplossingen en management informatiesystemen behoren tot de mogelijkheden, afhankelijk van je affiniteit met bijbehorende processen. Grafische vormgeving is geen belangrijk onderdeel van de functie.


In het team heb je direct contact met opdrachtgevers, en mede daardoor veel invloed op het uiteindelijke product.
title: C# / .Net ontwikkelaar at Brunel International B.V. (Groningen, Netherlands)

description:
CarMax is looking for a senior developer to drive innovation in our digital photography and merchandising space. This position will work directly with a product manager and user experience expert to design and develop tools for associates to capture, manipulate, and store images, as well as innovate new ways to display and manipulate our product images that will enhance our customers' online experience.
The primary responsibilities of this position revolve around our Online Merchandising product line working to discover and deliver opportunities to drive the team KPIs. This includes but is not limited to enhancing our ability to capture, process, manipulate, and display product images through various channels; influencing the customer's online experience; taking ownership of the entire stack of software development related to this project (working with .NET, Microsoft Azure, and Android); and ensuring that application development efforts consistently meet CarMax®: business requirements, direction, and standards.
This is a lead application development role that will report to an IT Manager. Associate will be responsible for the development, implementation, maintenance, and support of software solutions, as well as ensuring that software development meets CarMax®: quality expectations. Associates in this position must be experienced in programming skills and design patterns. Associate should be an excellent team player, highly qualified to lead medium to large development projects, and organize priorities and tasks. Associate will be a key contributor in the software development life-cycle, performing analysis, design, and application development, as well as driving development teams to achieve project goals.
The character of this position is one of hands-on development expertise and the oversight (technical or task management) of others. This position functions as a mentorship / technical leadership role of others in larger projects, able to serve as an expert in supporting an area of the business, can lead smaller sets of associates in projects, and is able to simultaneously handle multiple projects at one time.
title: Lead Senior Software Developer - Merchandising at CarMax (Richmond, VA)

description:
Do you love the web? Do you get excited about using leading tools and development practices to make software for a high-traffic website? Do you like Cars? (OK, that last one is not that important...)


Then we’d like to talk to you!


CarMax, one of "Fortunes Best Companies to Work For" has revolutionized the used car buying experience...and we couldn't have done it without technology.  Our Carmax.com team is growing and we are looking for those who want to build a career with us.  If you are interested in working with cutting edge technologies for a growing Fortune 500 that is an industry leader, click apply! 


Technical Expertise


* Deep understanding of HTTP, HTML, and current web development frameworks, patterns, and practices


* Experience with high-volume web architecture at both a software and infrastructure level


* Passion for software quality and experience with continuous integration and delivery practices


* Experience with automated testing


* Familiarity with common software design patterns


* Ability to mentor junior developers and help them weigh tradeoffs in design decisions


* Ideally a strong background or interest in C#, JavaScript, and .NET development


Software Development Methodology and Support


* Takes ownership of software delivery and accountable for successful releases

title: Software Developer - Application Systems at CarMax (Henrico, VA)

description:
Digital Shadows provides cyber situational awareness that helps organizations protect against cyber attacks, loss of intellectual property, and loss of brand and reputational integrity. Our flagship solution, Digital Shadows SearchLight™, is a scalable and easy-to-use data analysis platform that provides a holistic view of an organization's digital footprint and the profile of its attackers. It is complemented with intelligence analyst expertise to ensure extensive coverage, tailored intelligence and frictionless deployment. It continually monitors more than 100 million data sources in 27 languages across the visible, deep and dark web and other online sources to create an up-to-the minute view of an organization and the risks requiring mitigation. We are jointly head quartered in London and San Francisco.


All areas of the system are expanding in capability and complexity as the company grows and our development team is involved in the full software development lifecycle, from concept and design to implementation and testing. Our agile development sprints produce substantial new functionality every four weeks. We have regular hack days which allow our developers to explore innovative ideas and technologies.


We are looking for a Senior Java Developer with experience in building high-performance, scalable commercial applications. You will be a key member of a talented software development team and be primarily responsible for Java application development though the role will involve all aspects of product development and engineering and have scope to influence the product roadmap, technology choices, architecture and much more.

Responsibilities



  • Collaborate across teams to define, design, and ship new features

  • Architect and design robust, scalable and secure software

  • Write well structured, testable, efficient code

  • Work with and integrate external tools, libraries, data sources and API’s

  • Discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies

  • Continually increase the quality of the application through bug fixing and other improvements

  • Contribute in all phases of the software development lifecycle

  • Contribute ideas and innovations to the product roadmap
title: Java Developer at Digital Shadows (London, UK)

  • die unsere weltweit eingesetzten IT-Lösungen zum Planen und Optimieren von Flotten, Fahrern oder Touren mitgestalten wollen,

We build and maintain the analytic data pipeline for Twitch that collects data about viewers and makes it accessible to the rest of the company. You would help us make our pipeline real-time, while remaining reliable enough that other systems can depend on us. We will make the data more usable and available, with streaming data enrichment, cross-database querying, and full replay ability. Our platform is open source, and we work in the open -- check out our code at github.com/twitchscience/



Responsibilities




    • Architect, prioritize and develop new capabilities for our data pipeline through new APIs and services.

    • Find unmet data needs throughout the company and design general services to meet them.

    • Harden and improve our existing pipeline.
