You will be working closely with our Mobile (Android, iOS and Unity) and Infrastructure teams. Besides your proven history of success, you also have passion for technology and like us you value hard work and fun in equal measure.

description:
DO YOU WANT TO BE A CHALLENGER?
Do you want to be part of a team that changes a whole industry and where individual initiatives and ideas are not only welcome but vital? If you wish to work in an international team with co-workers, customers, and projects all over the world - this might be the job for you!


ARCCORE is a leading provider of cutting-edge products and services for the automotive systems market. We base our trade on a solid knowledge in automotive platforms and software craftsmanship. Our focus is to provide superior solutions for the development and configuration of embedded systems to the automotive market. We are a company with our own product portfolio, but our customers also often require our expertise on site. We can offer our employees to pursue their preferred way of working - as in-house developers or as experts operating at customers.


Main duties
We offer you a position in our development department as a solution architect in an agile working environment. You will:



  • Participate in planning, defining and designing solutions on a high-level and explore alternative solutions

  • Work in all project phases, from research to market launch

  • Lead projects in requirement, design, coding, test and validation phases

  • Be in close contact with our international customers

  • Mix small local projects with large multi-site global programs

  • Work close to the leading major international automotive players in a global arena

  • Meet our users and other professionals in global conferences and workgroups

  • Interact with universities and research institutes over the world

  • Become a seasoned project manager in a truly international environment

description:
The Twitch Core Platform team is looking for an Engineering Manager that can scale and mentor a world-class engineering team, and help guide the transition to a Microservices architecture, while delivering on key product goals. The team will be responsible for a set of identity and authorization products that power hundreds of millions of users using Twitch. The products also extend outward to other social networks such as Facebook, Steam and Battle.net.

You will work closely with both technical and product teams at Twitch, and be responsible for gathering requirements and executing on the technical direction.

You will also be expected to work closely with external engineers from partner companies.

Most of our software is written in Go or Rails, and we make extensive use of AWS. Other technologies we use include Postgres, Redis, Cassandra, Dynamo, Kafka, and Docker.

You won’t typically be expected to code, but you shouldn’t be afraid of diving in when necessary.

Responsibilities:


  • Lead, manage and grow a team of software engineers

  • Work across other technical and product teams to help define and prioritize requirements

  • Mentor and guide the professional and technical development of the members of the team

  • Grow the team through both recruiting and development of internal talent

  • Improve the engineering process to ensure successful delivery of products
title: Engineering Manager: Identity at Twitch (San Francisco, CA)

description:
Lloyds Banking Group is the largest provider of digital banking products in the UK. Day after day, more and more customers are accessing their accounts using web and mobile with over a billion logons to our digital banking services last year. There couldn’t be a better time to join us, as we work to become the best bank for customers and to build an exciting future for our people.


Role Summary


Joining our Digital & Transformation team as a Lead Java Developer in one of our feature delivery teams you’ll be at the heart of creating digital experiences for our customers across our web, mobile and tablet applications.


You’ll be part of our wider Digital Technology Practice team working with a range of technical disciplines and embedding and generating best practice in your product area.


Day to day you’ll be working in feature teams delivering world class software. As a senior member of our technology community we’ll expect you to demonstrate and apply exemplary engineering practices and skills as well as mentor our more junior team members.


We want to see placement of these skills in context – why they matter, what value they bring, how to get the most from them, how to evolve them and spread them further within the organisation. Examples include test driven development, test automation, pair programming, use of automated builds and continuous integration, adoption and customisation of core code quality tools.


A track record of the required experience demonstrated on a real production platform or system is a must, as are a “can-do” attitude, capability of bootstrapping projects, and ability to effectively work with multi-disciplinary, internal and external distributed teams across the project lifecycle.
title: Lead Java Developer at Lloyds Banking Group (London, UK)

Net Health's Integration Engineers operate on the cutting-edge of the Healthcare IT industry, providing flexible interoperability solutions to healthcare providers by interfacing with numerous software platforms.


The Net Health Integration Specialist is responsible for designing, developing, implementing and deploying interoperability components, with a focus on interfacing with HIS, PMS, Billing and EMR systems.

Software development in an agile environment. We work with startup software in cross-functional teams in which your role as an expert in one or more areas are combined with the opportunity to develop within other technologies that you are interested in.


We work creatively, agile and always with the latest technology.

description:
Voxy is changing people's lives for the better every single day. That’s not an overstatement, it’s the truth. Learning a new language is the single hardest things that you can ask an adult to do. We make it happen. Every. Single. Day.


Voxy provides a cloud-based English language learning platform that’s based on 20 years of cutting edge scientific research into language learning. It’s proven effective, in the lab and in the wild. It’s a tough problem, but that’s okay, we like tough problems and you should too.


Come join a growing start-up as we tackle the old-school entrenched players in a $60B/year industry that hasn’t seen any real innovation in decades. If it’s a kick-ass culture, paying customers and top-tier investors that you’re looking for, well, we have that.


These things are important to us, and they should be important to you too:



  • Communication - we firmly believe that communication is the key to success and the way we work relies heavily on great communication skills. You should be an outstanding communicator, both verbally and written.

  • Organization - our engineers practice, and love, eXtreme Programming. While you might not have actually practiced XP you should have experience in running an Agile product process, and understand why it’s the better way of doing things.

  • Management - we have a team of 12 highly functioning engineers in New York and Sao Paolo.  You will have 2 plus years experience managing a team of at least 5 engineers - bonus for managing or working with a remote team.

  • Vision - we believe the director should also be on the ground coding with the team. You will have 5 plus years engineering experience including at least 2 years experience at the "architect" level, or higher and experience with larger scale, customer focused, web-based applications.

  • Flexibility - we’re fast paced and sometimes things change. We all need to be able to shift gears quickly and deal with the unexpected. Embrace chaos.

  • Respect - we love new ideas and discussion, and while we don’t always agree with each other our strong opinions are loosely held.
title: Director of Engineering at Voxy (New York, NY)

description:
On the 19th of May, ASML will host its first Software Recruitment event for Metrology. The event is an exciting full day program for skilled (young) professional engineers who are interested in solving complex software challenges. The day consists of (guest) speakers, job interviews and talent exploration, with the intention to offer a contract after the event.
If you are selected, you will have two interview rounds in which your technical skills, personal ambitions, and match with ASML will be discussed. Furthermore, you will gain personalized insight and guidelines for your future career through the Talent Exploration Report (TER), which is sent out to all participants.


-- Context & Role Description --


ASML’s lithography systems deliver nanometer accuracy at high productivity. The required accuracy level cannot be achieved by hardware and mechatronics solutions only. At system level, imperfections of the subsystems need to be measured and corrected. The Metrology Functional Group creates mathematical models describing the lithography machine and its imperfections. The parameters of these models are calibrated using several sensors present in the machine. The calibrations of the machine can be done offline in a dedicated calibration test, or inline while running production. Afterwards, the calibrated parameters are used to control the machine in such a manner that the inaccuracies are corrected.


Your role is to design, realize and integrate high-quality software engineering solutions, allowing fast and efficient delivery of complex metrology functions. Within the Metrology Software Department, we are reshaping our software architecture to facilitate seamless implementation of the metrology functions in our software. By introducing engineering practices such as Model Driven Engineering, we increase our engineering efficiency.


We offer:



  • A highly competitive salary based on your skill and experience level

  • A 40-hour workweek, you (largely) determine when you start and finish (between 7:00 AM and 7:00 PM);

  • A minimum of 27 vacation days and 13 ADV days (reduction of working hours);

  • Travel allowance;

  • Above-average opportunities for training and study;

  • 13th month and holiday allowance;

  • Excellent pension scheme;

  • Attractive profit-sharing scheme (2015: 18%);

  • Employers contribution of 50% of the optional health insurance premium
title: Get a new job in a day! May 19th Software Metrology Event 0-5 years experience at ASML (Veldhoven, Netherlands)

description:
WHAT WE OFFER:


1)  The opportunity to help change an enormous industry from the ground up.


2)  A team ­oriented startup culture, with the resources and stability of an established player.


3) The ability to work on the latest technology stacks (mongoDB, node.js, etc.)


ABOUT US:


We are an innovative in-­house startup at one of the largest life insurance companies globally, that is on a mission to redefine life insurance, making it simple, convenient, and online. 


For the right person this is a unique opportunity that brings the culture of a startup to the stability and backing of a large company. 


You will be part of a small and growing team of experienced technology and customer experience ­focused professionals that values smarts, moving fast, and iterating quickly. You will have the opportunity to work on the latest technology stacks (Node.js, MongoDB) in real production environments and with the backing and resources of a large company.


Our office is based in a WeWork space in New York City and we are looking for like­minded developers, with an interest in financial services innovation, to join our team today.


THE ROLE:


You will be joining a small, experienced technology team as the lead architect for the evolving technology platform, shaping its future expansion both in terms of functional coverage as well as support for a broader array of products and channels. Considerations as we expand will include performance, scale, extensibility, infrastructure, data analytics, and integration points with larger enterprise ecosystem as well as external providers. In addition, you will have direct development responsibility for key framework components such as workflow and interfaces out to internal and external platforms. Experience with a wide breadth of technology paradigms and concepts is expected with a focus on data­ driven, web based applications a must. The job will be varied and challenging.


These are essential to success in this role:


      5+ years experience as a developer/lead


      3+ years experience in a systems design/architecture role


      Experience and familiarity with financial services or other mathematically oriented applications


      Experience with enterprise environments and related complexities, dynamics, and processes      


      Experience with data modeling (logical and physical) and object modeling


      Extensive experience with traditional object oriented languages (e.g. Java, .net, Ruby, Python)


      A demonstrable interest in building modern, complex, customer ­facing web applications


      Experience with modern MVC (Model­view­controller) frameworks


      Experience with event­d riven programming and frameworks


      Experience with a variety of database systems, both relational and NoSQL


      Experience with information security paradigms and implementations


      Experience on performance optimization and tuning of web applications required, databases a plus


      Excellent clarity of thought process and communication ability


      Comfortable expressing and defending points of view while respecting those of others.


      Must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.


These skills are not required but are a plus:


      Experience with data analytics ­ both tools as well as impact to data structures and implementation


      Experience design multi­channel platforms and web­sites (desktop, mobile).


      Working in a startup or agile development environments


      BA/BS/MS in computer science or related subject area


COMPENSATION:


We pay competitive base salaries and we reward performance. Our salary structure is commensurate with experience. In


addition, you will be eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits program including medical insurance and 401(K).


We are an Affirmative Action/Equal Employment Opportunity Employer (M/F/V/D).

Our client, The Worlds Largest Travel Site is looking for motivated and talented Technical Managers to join their team as they build their next big product.


If you're looking to build something new, are eager to join a team working with trusted payments, social, and mobile, and love being part of a great team that thrives in a fast paced environment - then we'd love to hear from you!


The Technical Manager will be responsible for building and leading a team within Vacation Rentals. You will be leading a wide range of project work, from integrating with vacation rental management platforms, building APIs for third party suppliers to integrate their inventory into our website, working on a PCI compliant payment platform, to delivering rich content and user experience to our travelers researching vacation rentals for their next vacation. In short, your work will encompass the key areas of execution for the Vacation Rentals business.


Can you enable highly iterative agile development by breaking down complex projects into discrete tasks? Are you a leader that can mold bright young developers into seasoned veterans? Are you capable of hands-on development and digging into reports and logs when problems arise along with delegating and prioritizing the work needed across the team? Are you, above all else, passionate about success?


Qualifications:



  • You have a BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent

  • You have at least 6 years of software development experience, with at least 1 year managing a team

  • You show a sense of ownership and pride in your role as a leader, and you can make us believe you'll excel

  • You have consistently exceeded expectations throughout your career, and you can describe specific activities and projects that demonstrate this behavior

  • You can manage a team towards long-term goals while delivering new capability daily

  • You have the ability to work with everyone from engineers to product owners to C-level executives to help communicate, prioritize, influence and inform key product decisions

  • You have successfully hired and built teams including interviewing, on-boarding, and mentoring

  • You find the live operations of your team's code fulfilling and worth getting right

  • It would be great if you had in-depth and hands-on knowledge of Linux, Java, JavaScript and related open source technologies such as Apache, Tomcat, PostgreSQL, and Hadoop
title: Senior Development Manager, Vacation Rentals at TripAdvisor (via Andiamo) (Needham, MA)

description:
The Ops team at our client is a dynamic group, answering calls for operational advice across the entire organization. We work tightly with all of the development groups to bring a "full-stack" perspective on how the application and infrastructure are working together, helping to provide availability and performance while still allowing for rapid deploys and agile engineering. 

The team strives for situational awareness; we know that failure happens, and our goal isn’t to prevent it, but rather to be as nimble and thoughtful as possible in addressing it. Being nice is a requirement, yet so is speaking your mind.


About the Job



  • Build and maintain infrastructure, from bare metal to production

  • Take part in a 24x7 on-call rotation

  • Support various engineering teams as a “designated ops” person, attending team meetings and advising in an operational capacity

  • Triage and address requests for ops assistance via the general ops ticket queue

  • Collaborate with the senior operations staff and assist with their project-based work

  • Tightly cooperate with development, product, community and customer care organizations


About You



  • Proficiency in building Linux systems, especially RHEL, CentOS, or Fedora

  • Good understanding of Linux commands

  • Ability to write shell scripts, basic ruby or python

  • Experience with configuration management systems and concepts (Chef, Puppet, CFEngine, etc.)

  • Familiarity with revision control software, especially Git

  • Experience with basic management of core operations systems such as, but not limited to, DNS, LDAP, and NTP

  • A solid understanding of web application architecture, including TCP/IP and HTTP

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal


Nice to Have



  • Online payments experience

  • Professional experience in a web application shop, especially in a "continuous deployment" environment

  • Proficiency in one or more programming languages, particularly interpreted languages such as Ruby, Python, or PHP

  • Ability to customize and manage monitoring and graphing systems, such as Nagios, Ganglia, and Graphite

  • Familiarity with automated host provisioning tools

  • Experience with mission-critical databases such as MySQL or PostgreSQL

  • Experience working with virtual machines and/or containers such as KVM/QEMU, LXC, or VMware

  • An understanding of caching strategies at all layers

  • Experience with CDNs
title: Web Operations Engineer - Global Peer-to-Peer E-Commerce for Craft Goods at Etsy (via Andiamo) (Brooklyn, NY)

description:
About Audible:

Audible, Inc. is the world’s largest seller and producer of spoken audio entertainment, information and educational programming. Since inventing and commercializing the first portable digital audio player in 1997, our focus on technological innovation and superior programming has earned us millions of subscribers around the world. We’re an Amazon subsidiary with a presence on three different continents, yet we maintain a startup vibe and small company feel. We offer more than 250,000 downloadable audiobooks, audio editions of periodicals, and other programs, and an escalating array of listening products that enrich daily life for a growing population of people who want to be more productive, well-informed, and thoughtfully entertained.



About the Role:

Within Audible we have built a Platform group that owns tools, frameworks and services. The Platform group enables other development teams within the organization to build and ship software quickly and with a high bar of engineering excellence. This team builds awesome frameworks that development teams use to rapidly develop new experiences. We provide processes that keep our teams unblocked and highly productive but we do so in a way that's much more exciting than this sentence. We listen to our customers and the tech industry and it's our responsibility to push Audible into new places; wherever our customers are listening. That's really an excuse to experiment with things like adaptive streaming, home automation, wearables or even the Raspberry Pi.



This opportunity specifically is building out the HTML components, design patterns, CSS and Javascript components that make up our Human Interface on Desktop and Mobile web. We're building a UX that will roll out across our web properties globally. Accessibility and cross-browser compatibility is of utmost importance as well as a pixel-perfect realization of our Design team's vision. Your work will have a huge impact and be used by all web developers across Audible. Success means we lay the foundation for continued expansion of our company without disrupting an already tremendously successful and much loved product.



As a member on our team you'll be expected to write great code, execute on your ideas, challenge the status quo and generally make things better. You'll need the soft-skills too; Communication, influence and passion are key to the success of the team and ultimately the company. You'll experience all the challenges, ambiguity and opportunities of a new team with a new mission but for the right candidate that's part of the fun.



How does Amazon fit in?

We're a part of Amazon, they are our parent company and it's a great partnership. You'll get to play with all of Amazon's technologies like EC2, SQS and S3 but it doesn't stop there. Audible's built on Amazon technology and you'll have insight into the inner workings of the world's leading ecommerce experience. There's a LOT to learn!



If you want to own and solve problems, work with a creative dynamic team, fail fast in a supportive environment whilst growing your career and working on high volume (2000+ tps) services that support millions of customers worldwide we want to hear from you.



As engineers we like specifics so here's some of the standard info:

  • Own key components within our platform. Owning means envisioning, designing, creating, building and supporting. These services need to operate with a high degree of operational excellence (we measure EVERYTHING).

  • Support our developers. Support means be the go-to-person for questions but never be a bottle-neck, see around the corner and anticipate developers' needs, host brown bags, knowledge-transfer sessions and generally evangelize the platform.

  • Partner with product management to imagine, design, develop, test, and launch software that wows our community and inspires our peers.

  • Be willing to explore and learn un-prompted. Bring problems AND solutions to the table.

  • Lead the way - Lead means staying up to date with tools, trends, technologies and best practices both industry-wide and within Amazon and then sharing that knowledge in a meaningful way with the community.





Qualifications: 




  • Great HTML and Javascript development skills.

  • Solid CSS knowledge.

  • The right candidate will be a JS Ninja - JQuery, React, Angular

  • Experience working with software engineers. If you've built something in your spare time send us the link, we'd love to hear about it.

  • Strong problem solving skills; adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership.

  • A high-quality bar; just-enough documentation, unit testing, code reviews, test automation, continuous integration & deployment and a preference for agile methods.

  • Great communication skills - ability to think creatively and adapt the message to the audience





Preferred Qualifications: 



Don't worry, we'll ramp you up but experience in any of these areas will help you hit the ground running:




  • Full stack development experience a huge plus.

  • Digital-media delivery, HTTP Adaptive Streaming, HLS, HDS, Smooth Streaming, MPEG, AAC & MP3 processing.

  • Progressive rendering, Responsive Design and modern browser techniques (HTML5, CSS3)




Benefits:

We have a comprehensive benefits package but here are some of the fun perks:

  • Free catered lunch daily, breakfast on Mondays, all the snacks you can eat and Happy Hour on a Friday

  • Free onsite gym and 25% fitness reimbursement

  • Ruthless ping-pong tournaments and seasonal sports clubs - volleyball, basketball, soccer, etc.

  • Endless company sponsored events

  • Transit reimbursement, paid parking and shuttle service

  • Tuition assistance

  • Annual Amazon discount

  • Access to Amazon Web Services and much more...


Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer-Minority/ Female/ Disability/ Vet
title: Frontend Web Development Engineer at Audible (Newark, NJ)

title: Software Development Engineer, Web Framework at Amazon (Newark, NJ)

description:
About J.P. Morgan Glasgow


Glasgow has been home to JP Morgan’s award winning Technology Centre since 1999. With more than 1400 Technologists designing, building and supporting global systems, our centre is one of the largest IT employers in Scotland. Our firm lives and breathes technology, with over 40,000 tech employees, centred in 13 strategic hubs around the world.


Business Overview


The Rates business serves the investment and risk management needs of institutional clients across the world (such as pension funds, insurance companies and banks) as a dealer in government bonds and interest rate derivatives. It also supports most governments need to raise money for public services and investment by acting as a primary dealer and market maker in government debt.


Team Description


Athena is J.P. Morgan's cross-market risk management and trading system. It is used in our foreign exchange, fixed income and commodities businesses. Athena includes a globally replicated object-oriented database, a powerful dependency graph and a fully integrated stack across pricing, risk and trading tools. Python is used for flexibility and rapid but controlled releases. Athena is designed to pull developers close to the business to help increase revenues while improving operational processes and controls to reduce costs.


The Rates Athena team is extending the firm’s strategic Athena platform for Fixed Income businesses globally - from New York, London and Tokyo to Sydney and Lima - to provide intraday real time risk & position management, transaction management, and back office integration. The team follows agile practices, adapted to intra-day Continuous Deployment, and supported by regular retrospectives.


The components built by this team range from front end trading GUIs to server side components written in reactive programming paradigm, with responsibilities include pricing, trade capture, sales workflows, position & risk management, profit and loss calculation, trade lifecycle management and integration with internal systems responsible for settlement, financing, risk aggregation and regulatory reporting.
title: Python Analyst/Developer to join global financial institution at JP Morgan (Glasgow, UK)

In this role you will collaborate with our product management and software development teams to turn ideas, use cases, and user stories into mockups, wireframes, and working software. You’ll own the style-guide for IDS’s product suite to ensure a consistent look and feel across all of our applications and help our developers create great user interfaces. A good intuition for design is essential in this role, though you will also be asked to ensure the quality of our interfaces by gathering feedback from real users, reviewing analytics, and conducting usability studies.


If you have a passion for UI/UX and enjoy collaborating with a highly skilled team of product development engineers then please contact us today
title: Sr. UI/UX Designer at InComm (Portland, OR)

description:
Running a game with thousands of players play in the same world and updating the clients in real-time presents some challenges. As the amount of players grows, so does the demand for stability, predictable performance and most of all, scaling. We are looking for someone to join the team that takes care of this codebase.


Can you handle 7 million soldiers? Can your code?


The game is built around a group of servers that processes thousands of incoming requests per second and keeps thousands of clients up to date with the game state in real time. Some requests are simple and can be processed in microseconds, while the more complex ones can take several seconds.

You will be responsible for maintaining and improving the in-house developed framework that forms the backbone of this system. The focus in this work should be reliability and scalability. We are a small team, however, so you should expect to do some work in other areas as well.

The ideal candidate has a strong interest in distributed systems, and has several years experience in working with both design, implementation and maybe testing of such. We expect you to be able to analyze, predict and optimize the performance of the system.

The majority of the work will be in C#/.NET and we prefer candidates with a solid experience in that. Experience with PostgreSQL and Python is a plus, and you should be able to find your way in both Windows and Linux environments.

You will be working in close connection with the rest of the development team at our office and should be able to work well in a group of people with different skills and backgrounds and it is required that you speak and write English well.

In return you will be part of a highly motivated and highly skilled team of professionals having fun doing what they love.

Evidente i Stockholm växer och vi söker nu riktigt duktiga programmerare och systemerare som vill jobba med utveckling av inbyggda system.

Som programvaruingenjör på Evidente arbetar du brett med programvara, vilket förutom implementering kan innebära metodutveckling, arkitektur och uppdragsledning.


 Fokus för verksamheten är att erbjuda våra kunder en komplett produktutvecklingsförmåga och vi har lika delar uppdrag inne på kontoret och ute på plats hos våra kunder. Vårt dagliga arbete är präglat av struktur och leveransorientering för att kunna erbjuda högsta kvalitet till såväl kunder, leverantörer som kollegor. Kvalificerade medarbetare är vår största tillgång och de flesta av oss är civilingenjörer med lång yrkeserfarenhet.


 Vårt strukturerade arbetssätt i kombination med våra erfarna och duktiga kollegor ger dig utmärkta verktyg att nå resultat och utveckla dig själv. Vi erbjuder dig intressanta arbetsuppgifter och mycket god gemenskap.

description:
WARNING


I am just a one-man startup (with a few part timers), pre-product with no outside funding (yet). So you can stop reading here. But if you're interested, read on to see the big problem I am trying to solve.


This isn’t a job posting for someone who likes the 9-5 life and the safety of a regular paycheck.


This is a posting for someone who wants to make a fundamental improvement in the life of millions of people. There are approximately 1.5 billion language learners in the world, but only 7-15% can claim fluency. That means there are more than 1 billion people who started a language but never got there.


If you’re still reading and excited about the opportunity to promote foreign language literacy, you’re probably who I am looking for. 


--


The problem


I speak Vietnamese, English and Japanese. My language ability has opened many doors and allowed me to travel the world. But learning a language IS HARD. And now I want to give back by making it easier to master a language. A. LOT. EASIER.


Studying Japanese was probably one of the hardest things I have ever done. I have been studying for 7 years and at this point I still can’t say I’m fluent. I’m stuck at the intermediate hump, where real-world content is too difficult and time-consuming to master and most edtech tools like Duolingo are too basic. After a long day at work, I can’t be bothered to pick up a dense book full of characters that I don’t even know how to put in a dictionary in the first place. Studying a language requires persistence, time and motivation, which come in rare quantity for people with work and personal responsibilities.


35% of all language learners are at the intermediate level, meaning that there are more than 500 million people who are likely facing the same issue I have. The most motivated ones make it over the hump, but most don’t.


--


The solution


I always wish I had a personal learning assistant, someone who would know my level and give me content that matches my current ability. Someone who would answer questions on the spot when I run into words or phrases I don’t know. Someone who would give me daily quizzes to make sure that I retain what I’m studying. That way, most of the time I spend studying is actually for studying, not fumbling around with a dictionary or flashcards.


That is the product I want to make. Using machine learning and natural language processing, as well as some good old spaced repetition system, I want to create a product that serves as your personal learning assistant. Showing is better than telling, so here is what it looks like: www.helium-app.com/?utm_source=stackoverflow. I don’t want to make a cookie-cutter language app, I want to make a pedagogically-informed, intelligent and personalized learning app. This is the future of edtech.


--


The feedback


In about five days we’ve had 500 completely organic signups and tons of positive feedback. The average conversion rate is 20% (having excluded the first day which was mainly friends and family signups). People need this!


Here is one:


“My name is James and I'm more interested in Helium than the average person. I've been learning Chinese for years, and this is something I've always thought needed to be made. But on top of that, I'm a developer as well, and really appreciate the work you must be putting into this app. Right now I'm living in China still trying to improve my Chinese, and this app is basically exactly what I need. I have plenty of friends here studying for the HSK test that would absolutely love it as well.”


--


What’s in it for you


If you’ve gotten this far, chances are the opportunity to create something from scratch with massive potential impact together with smart and passionate colleagues is what gets you going. In addition to that, I will give you equity, and a lot of it, to make this thing happen. I’m committing my foreseeable future to this and just quit a very well-paid PM gig, and I want to make sure you do too.


We can talk about a minimal salary to support your expenses, but there is nothing that says I’m in like sipping ramen for months in exchange for a chunk of nothing that would be something when we make Helium a reality.


Join Helium, and rise!
title: Technical co-founder for a game-changing adaptive foreign language startup at Helium (Stanford, CA) (allows remote)

description:
We are looking for an experienced Full-Stack Developer to join our company made of 400 highly skilled modern craftsmen and -women. We co-create modern web and mobile services for our customers together with them. As a Full-Stack Developer in Siili you'll have a chance to work in interesting and varying customer projects together with senior level colleagues. We have exceptionally experienced and skilled professionals who share strong craftsmanship and passion for continuous development. We are not working in own boxes isolated from each others but instead we work together regardless of the stack or competence.


Our developers are not tied up in angular or java or others, instead they work with any stack. In our every day work we believe in clean code and test automation, and we show great interest also towards functional programming. We are eager to learn new skills and we offer you great opportunities to constantly develop yourself further. Currently our main focus is in AngularJS, ReactJS, Java, Scala, automated testing and continuous delivery but we are not limited only to these.


Requirements


We are looking for:



  • several years of experience in software development, preferably from customer projects

  • eagerness to learn new things

  • agile / lean way of working

  • fluent Finnish (=native or equivalent) and English skills


In technical side we expect you to have skills in:



  • Java / JVM languages

  • Integrations

  • SQL or NoSQL

  • Browser UIs


We are offering


In addition to the interesting projects, good development opportunities and awesome people, we offer you an attractive compensation package including e.g. private medical care, up-to-date tools for work and a wide variety of different free-time activities.


If you have some questions about the position or Siili, please feel free to ask our Talent Specialist Kira (kira.anttila(at)siili.com). We are growing fast, making good profit and getting new customer projects all the time, and we are willing to start the discussions with you immediately so apply sooner rather than later.


You can apply via our webpages www.siili.com/careers
title: Full-Stack Developer at Siili Solutions Oyj (Helsinki, Finland)

description:
User experience, mobile first, progressive enhancement, designing in the browser, prototyping, Node.js, React, ES6, web components, Gulp, Git - are you familiar with these terms? Are these technologies close to your heart?


Do you have a craftsmanship attitude towards design and implementation, passion to hand-crafted user interfaces and experiences on latest browser technologies? Are you able to set yourself in the end user's role and are you willing to share that experience with our customers? Are you ready to challenge the status quo and to share your passion and curiosity to create something new?


If you share this passion and fill the below mentioned criteria, this job is for you!  


What are we looking for?



  • You have at least 5 years of experience in designing and developing outstanding front end applications, also some experience in UX/UI design

  • Your mother tongue is CSS / HTML / JavaScript and you are also willing to develop new skills for example REACT or Angular

  • You have done automation and fine tuning with Gulp, Grunt, Vagrant or Docker

  • You are familiar with front end architecture standards and follow industry best practises

  • You are able to work with agile methods, in Finnish and in English

  • If you have experience with TDD, user research and analytics, it’s considered as an advantage


Who are we?


Siili is a company made of more than 400 highly skilled modern craftsmen and -women. We build global, lasting and comprehensive digital services together with our clients and we want to be the best at what we do. We know that we are just as successful as our people and that’s why we work hard in being the best work place for our employees a.k.a Siilis. For You we want to be a workplace where you and your know-how is appreciated, where you can develop yourself every day and where you can bring even your wildest ideas into reality.


We work together with our customers in order to improve their business. Hence we hope also you get excited about working with people, understanding our client’s business needs and creating something new and beneficial for the end-user. At Siili you get to work with different teams, yet be the master of your own work – we trust you and your expertise!


How to apply?


In order to apply, please visit our webpages www.siili.com/careers. We are growing fast and able to start working with you soon, so don’t wait! With any questions, please send e-mail to our Talent Specialist Kira to kira.anttila(a)siili.com.


Good luck!

description:
You should consider working at Jayway if you value good software craftsmanship, creating digital services that a lot of people love to use and working at a company that truly cares about their staff.


We only hire a couple of candidates each year. Not "only the best" but people with a great potential and drive to learn new technology.


We invest 10-12 days every year in their competence development - at international conferences and our own Øredev as well as internal knowledge sharing days with about 180 experienced colleagues. After 2 years we then invite them to become co-owners.


This year we are looking for 3 top motivated developers to join us in Copenhagen. 



Many of our mobile projects develop digital services that completes a hardware product for example a mobile fitness solution based on a Jabra headset that measures your heart rate. Other build self service solutions that simplify the everyday life of users such as mobile banking or making sense of your phone bill at 3. We always work agile and do not believe in planning for overtime work.


Our corporate culture is based on sharing knowledge, helping each other grow and learn. We arrange the Øredev conference, as well as numerous internal mini-conferences throughout the year.


You will join our office in central Copenhagen adjacent to Kongens Have.
title: Web Developer, Android Developer, iOS Developer at Jayway (København, Denmark)

description:
Whilst a small team, we have big ambitions. Our market is significant, being high value, enterprise-wide and global. We have great reference customers and partnerships, with plans to grow aggressively and scale internationally over the next couple of years. We are part of Microsoft Ventures accelerator programme and are backed by Passion Capital. Eileen Burbidge serves as Non-Executive Director on our Board.



By joining the Pinipa team, you will have the opportunity to play an active role in shaping the company, the product and the customer experience. We are looking for people who want to make a difference, help make our ambitions reality, and have fun while doing it.


Purpose of role


The Lead Developer provides technical expertise to ensure a robust, quality and secure enterprise grade product is delivered to our customers at all times. The product has the latest technology stack, currently including Node JS, React, API first, Mongo DB, all hosted with AWS. Following a pivot, we have an exciting roadmap ahead which includes a strong focus on integrations and analytics/ reporting.



The right person will appreciate the need to deliver business value through the product, has a deep understanding of the full technology stack and has experience managing delivery using Agile.



They must also be willing to work effectively across the team, including providing support to other developers, and work with the UX designer, sales and customer support, as well as a non-technical CEO.


This role reports to the CTO.


Responsibilities


This role will be responsible for the following activities:



• Supports effective communication across the entire team, to understand business needs and customer expectations, and present a balanced perspective of technical requirements


• Provide technical direction for the product, including advising on latest techniques to continually improve the product performance, stability, security and scalability


• Play an active role in managing and continually improving the agile development process


• Able to write quality, clean, efficient and reusable code, write robust tests, make reliable estimates, and fulfil requirements in idiomatic code that meets standards for correctness and elegance


• Possess cross functional skills and understand how to investigate, troubleshoot, maintain and monitor application deployments


• Support the team to work in a DevOps team manner where the entire team is involved in the delivery of our products


• Provide technical leadership and support to the development team


Characteristics


As a small team, who you are and what you stand for is as important (or more important) to us as what you can do.


We are looking for people who:


• Has deep technical expertise and able to work across every aspect of the stack


• Willing to take on leadership or management responsibilities as needed to ensure delivery of a quality product


• Proactively raises risks, explaining the impact they can have on creating business value, to enable the CEO/ product owner to make appropriate decisions for mitigating actions


• Desire to understand our customers and deliver a product that delights them


• Are not afraid to challenge us, if you think we could be doing things better


• Enjoy the daily sharing of ideas and sparring in an active, outgoing development team, as well as sharing your knowledge and experience with other team members


• Willing to have fun, encourage the team and celebrate successes
title: Lead full stack developer at Pinipa (London, UK)

description:
This role will be responsible for growing Organic Traffic (including SEO / Natural Search, Mobile App and Social) to the market leading Marktplaats.nl and 2dehands.be businesses in Netherlands and Belgium respectively. As the most senior member of the NL growth team you will have deep digital traffic experience, a solid grounding in technical areas and an excellent ability to get the most out of those around you - in country development teams, QA resources and other Growth team members. We are looking for someone who can turn complex and difficult concepts into technical reality by writing clear, crisp and uncomplicated requirements and then drive them through to flawless execution.


This role will be responsible for growing Organic Traffic (including SEO / Natural Search, Mobile App and Social) to the market leading Marktplaats.nl and 2dehands.be businesses in Netherlands and Belgium respectively. As the most senior member of the NL growth team you will have deep digital traffic experience, a solid grounding in technical areas and an excellent ability to get the most out of those around you - in country development teams, QA resources and other Growth team members. We are looking for someone who can turn complex and difficult concepts into technical reality by writing clear, crisp and uncomplicated requirements and then drive them through to flawless execution.



  • Growing Organic traffic from all sources to Marktplaats.nl and 2dehands.be. Responsible for setting and achieving all traffic and visibility targets

  • Acting as the catalyst between the Growth team and the in country development teams. It is your job to ensure that all organic traffic projects are implemented at the highest possible standard and in the expected timeframes

  • Gathering and writing Requirements and User Stories for the development teams and then steering the projects through to conclusion. Your projects may be generated from ideas within your team or your own strong domain knowledge\

  • Discussing and working through complex development problems with development team.

  • Writing technical requirements with developers and following through with them on implementation and troubleshooting

  • Influence without authority by preparing business cases detailing opportunities, scope, dependencies and risks of Growth team projects to help business partners prioritize development investments and ensure these projects make it on the product roadmap

  • Analysis of all traffic trends relating to using large sets of data. Deep diving anomalies and issues to discover the root cause.

  • Acting as the Organic traffic subject matter expert on all related topics and being world class at the optimization of large, user generated Classifieds eCommerce websites. This could include, but is not limited to tasks such as all technical aspects of SEO (e.g. site structure, internal linking, content, meta tags, crawlability, redirects, sitemap feeds, code quality etc.), App Indexation (iOS and Adnroid, API and HTTP) or External Intelligence Reporting (tools for website analysis, linking projects, competitor analysis, ranking tools and analysis, managing agencies)

  • Quality assurance of all new growth team projects in both a pre production environment and the live site. Owning and lodging all Growth team bugs / tickets and ensuring they are resolved

  • Troubleshooting - as we know new code can often break.. Your role is to help solve problems that may be introduced with product releases

  • Monitoring all Organic traffic trends and staying current with latest technologies

  • Explaining Traffic Patterns and understanding all search algorithm changes in both Web Search /engines and App Stores

  • Working with other Global Growth team members such as Paid Traffic managers Content managers, Analysts and Link building/Social Media specialists

description:
Are you an experienced full-stack software developer? And are you up for the challenge to work with an advanced standardized web application? TOPdesk offers you an open and fun work environment, and an international team of talented product developers.


Job description: Full-Stack Java Developer


To build great software you need mad skills and a clear overview of the complete product. This is what we expect from a full-stack software developer in our teams. With your knowledge of back end, front end and user interface you’ll be able to build the best products together with the team. You recommend best practices, and discuss the 'why’s in the team: why should we use this technology, why is this important in the back end, en what are the consequences for the front end if we do this and that. You know why you want to ask these questions.


What will your work day look like?


As a full-stack software developer you work in a multidisciplinary team. At TOPdesk we use all facets of the scrum method to create solid and cool functionalities and new modules. This works both in a relaxed and a target driven way. Target driven because, as a market leader, we’re on an innovative path and have a high priority for quality and user friendliness. And relaxed, as there is room to make mistakes and learn from them, we openly discuss the quality of code, and we appreciate a good work-life balance.


What can you expect from TOPdesk?



  • An agile work environment with a great focus on learning and craftsmanship.

  • A team culture in where free and open discussions are encouraged.

  • 10% time, to encourage your inquisitive nature: explore new techniques, or broaden your knowledge.

  • Fun.

  • An informal team of international colleagues in the Netherlands, Germany and Hungary who work together and for example actively share their knowledge during our International Development Meeting.

  • A steady and financially healthy employer.
title: Full-Stack Java Developer who values code quality and a good laugh at TOPdesk (Delft, Netherlands)

description:
In der Software-Entwicklung setzen wir seit 2007 erfolgreich auf agile Management-Methoden wie Scrum und Kanban. Wir sind weiter auf Wachstumskurs und suchen ab sofort für die Unterstützung unserer Teams am Standort Berlin-Charlottenburg einen weiteren


Junior / Senior Software Entwickler (m/w) Java / C#



Als Software-Entwickler (m/w) bei arxes-tolina hilfst du unseren Kunden ihre Prozesse effizienter zu gestalten und die bekannte Qualität zu erhalten und zu steigern. Du arbeitest bei uns in einem agilen Team und ihr gestaltet eigen­ständig eure Prozesse und Arbeitsabläufe. Dabei stehen unsere kompetenten Scrum Master mit Rat und Tat zur Seite.



Woran wirst du arbeiten?


Wir haben drei Software-Bereiche die verschiedene Produkte und Projekte bearbeiten:



  • Finance — unsere Lösungen werden bei Finanzinstituten in bestehende IT-Infrastrukturen nahtlos integriert. Mit Fachkompetenz und einer breiten Produktpalette aus Desktop- und Web-Anwendungen helfen wir den Instituten ihre Prozesse zu automatisieren und Kosten zu sparen.

  • Public Sector — hier werden neue Lösungen entwickelt die unter anderem die Verteilung von Kita-Plätzen veranschaulicht und allen Beteiligten einen Blick auf ihren Teil vom Prozess ermöglicht. Mit Hilfe neuester Web-Technologien können wir hier moderne Lösungen schaffen und Nutzer besser miteinander vernetzen.

  • Projekte — entwickelt mit dem Fokus auf Web-Lösungen im Kundenauftrag. Dabei entsteht eine Vielfalt an fachlichen Lösungen und neuen technischen Herausforderungen. Wir greifen dabei auf unseren Technologie-Baukasten zurück wodurch wir auch unsere Arbeit stetig effizienter gestalten können.


Was erwartet dich?



  • Software-Entwicklung / -Implementierung

  • Das Leben eines agilen Prozesses

  • Abwechslung bei Themen und Technologien durch die Vielfalt unserer Aufgaben

  • spannende und technisch herausfordernde Kundenprojekte

  • Sicherstellung der Qualität unserer Releases sowie die Unterstützung unserer Kunden bei eventuellen Fragestellungen

  • Regelmäßiger Kundenkontakt

  • Fullstack von A(PI) bis User X-perience
title: Junior Software Entwickler (m/w) / Senior Software Entwickler (m/w) Java / C# at arxes-tolina GmbH (Berlin, Germany)

description:
Just joking about the monkey, but we are looking for an experienced software developer with a great passion for high quality code and great software architecture. Being a software developer, you know that developing software is not just a simple(monkey) trick, but a craftsmanship which requires talent and the constant honing of skills.


              Your vision on software development has been formed
              by your inquisitive nature and passion for programming


Job description: Experienced Java Developer


Right from your first day you work on a product that is used by more than a hundred thousand people on a daily basis. In (and outside) your scrum team you analyze problems and search for technical solutions for the complex challenges of a large software tool. As an Experienced Java Developer you comprehend the impact of technical choices. You involve junior developers in these choices and challenge them to grow with pair programming and code reviews.


Creating software is a challenging job. Especially when you are writing code that you still want to use in ten years. This requires vision. An Experienced Java Developer actively thinks along on improvements and how future-proof our product is. This helps our department do what we do best: deliver a high-quality product.


Like all TOPdesk developers, you receive the chance to direct your attention to matters that you find important. You can do this through 10%-time or Communities of Practice, for example. We improve quality through regular collaborations and insight sharing with international teams. This helps our department to what we do best: deliver a high-quality software product.


What can you expect from TOPdesk?



  • An agile work environment with a great focus on learning and craftsmanship.

  • A team culture in where free and open discussions are encouraged.

  • 10% time, to encourage your inquisitive nature: explore new techniques, or broaden your knowledge.

  • An informal team of international colleagues in the Netherlands, Germany and Hungary that for example actively share their knowledge during our International Development Meeting.

  • A steady and financially healthy employer.

description:
Elsevier is the world's leading provider of scientific, technical and medical (STM) information, tools and resources.Technology is the key to our business. We need you to bring us both technology domain expertise, coupled with business acumen and to share our passion and commitment to making a positive difference to the world.



In return we offer the opportunity to make a significant and tangible difference.  We promise you’ll be challenged and rewarded by the work you do in equal measure.  You’ll work in an exciting and evolving workplace, collaborating with an international team of like-minded professionals.  In addition, you’ll benefit from all the career opportunities expected of a prestigious, global company.


What you will be doing


Reporting to the Development Director, Product Enrichment in the Business Technology Solutions division, you will be responsible for:




  • Leading solution investigation, options evaluation and architectural recommendation of across multiple projects.

  • Delivering high quality, strategically aligned architectures, in accordance with established governance processes.

  • Provide consultancy, leadership, and promotion of engineering best practices. 

  • Engagement of senior management stakeholders, across IT and business groups, explaining architectures using appropriate language.

  • Advising and mentoring delivery teams as required, sharing the architectural vision and demonstrating solution leadership.

  • Providing technical expertise for the Content Enrichment and Analytics domain, collaborating with peers across Business Technology Solutions division and the (enterprise) Architecture & Labs group as a whole.

  • Proactively monitor the Business Unit system health and design and write proposals to remedy the cause of negative trends. 

  • Problem-solve, involving leading teams in identifying, researching, and coordinating the resources necessary to effectively troubleshoot/diagnose complex project issues.

  • Extract/translate findings into alternatives/solutions, identifying risks/impacts and schedule adjustments to facilitate management decision-making. 

  • Review and approve changes to infrastructure subsystems and components. 

  • Drive the architectural direction for a team of approx 20 developers on a business critical system.


Data and the systems which drive it are critical to Elsevier’s current and future strategic direction.  At Elsevier we have a strong technical architectural community, which you will be part of, and you will help us to move seamlessly into new technologies which with drive Elsevier’s business growth in the foreseeable future.
title: Application Architect at Elsevier (Kidlington, UK)

title: Senior Lead Software Engineer at Nordic Semiconductor (Portland, OR)

description:
We are looking for, first and foremost, a software engineer, with plenty of experience building TDD, clean, maintainable JavaScript single page applications. It's a great opportunity to pick up skills across the full platform stack of GoLang, Node.js, PHP, Docker and influence the way we build out the platform.


What we do


At VouchedFor, we are transforming the way people find a professional advisor. To do this we are building out a suite of consumer and advisor facing products that can match the perfect advisor to a consumer's need. It’s an ambitious goal; to be the leading destination for professional advice the products need to be engaging, scalable, self-service and honest. That requires us to be, first and foremost, a technology company, data-informed and agile in the way we deliver.


About the team


We like to keep the teams small, empowered and autonomous. Teams have all the skills they need to complete their mission and typically consist of 3-4 developers, a product owner and maybe a specialist like a product designer, researcher or data scientist.


The current stack consists of a LAMP API developed in PHP Symfony and some Go microservices supporting multiple AngularJS single page applications. We use Jenkins for build and deployment and ship at least once a day.


We are migrating our stack to AWS with Docker, introducing further Go micro-services and building the most awesome pipeline to ship continuously.
title: Front-end Software Engineer at VouchedFor (Teddington, UK)

description:
We are currently seeking a Senior Software Architect to support our existing platform development team. In this position, you will be responsible for the enhancement and the improvement of our system architecture and support projects technically and conceptually.



Your responsibilities



  •  As Senior Software Architect you will be responsible for the development strategy of our in-house gaming platforms across all projects

  • You will be the interface between requirements engineering and technical implementation: capturing of requirements and coordination of the implementation in our development teams;

  • Finding technical solutions for requirements, which don`t match our development strategy

  • You will work on our core system, which connects our clients and suppliers

  • As part of our project development you will identify solutions together with our technical project leaders and clients

  • For the operation of the platform you will design tools, which enable our clients and suppliers to work independently

  • You will automate integration tests and will continuously improve the documentation of our systems
title: Senior Software Architect at Greentube Internet Entertainment Solutions GmbH (Wien, Österreich)

description:
Hexagon has over 16‘000 employees and is a worldwide provider of information technologies. Our solutions improve the quality, efficiency and productivity of spatial and industrial measurement applications. We capture, model and visualize the reality in 3D. Leica Geosystems as part of the Hexagon Group is known for its first class products and the development of innovative solutions to record, analyze and present spatial information.


Our software engineers are key to the successful development of our high precision systems and software solutions . More than 200 highly motivated software engineers work closely with product managers in international and interdisciplinary teams developing projects to our future success .


To further strengthen our software engineering teams in our different departments we are looking for several talented Software Engineers whose main tasks are:



  • Software development for high-end precision systems (e.g., Theodolites, 3D Point Cloud Scanners, Controller Units, Coordinate Measurement Machines, Airborne Sensors) to series production and market launch of systems

  • Shaping the software architecture and design of our innovative products

  • Implementation of sophisticated and advanced algorithms

  • Ensure product quality by implementing high-quality software
title: Software Engineers C++ (m/f) - GEO-200 at Leica Geosystems AG (Balgach, Schweiz)

description:
You’ll be joining a small agile team of developers and testers, working on the on-going development of modern, full-stack web based applications. The focus is on good communication and coordination, to build quality code that is well structured and highly maintainable.
We’re looking for a senior developer whose skillset would complement those of the other team members, so you could be front-end, back-end or full-stack. However, you are extremely good at what you do. Your code not only works but it’s elegant.

  • Creating public facing client portals

  • Building visually appealing real-time dashboards

  • Managing dependencies and build tasks

description:
Devaajatiimeissämme piilee pinnan alla jos jonkinlaista kotidevaajaa ja kissarobottien rakentelijaa. Nyt etsimme lisää moderneista ohjelmistotekniikoista innostuvia koodinpyörittelijöitä Helsinkiin, Ouluun ja Tampereelle.


If the previous is like gibberish to you, there's a reason and we are not trying to tease you without reason. We work with Finland's public sector and large companies in Finland. Our working language is Finnish. You can still always take a peek at our developer's blog (in English) at http://dev.solita.fi/.


-------------------------


Viihdytkö vaativien ja laajojen ohjelmistoprojektien parissa? Etsimme nyt pelottomia, vaativasta ongelmanratkaisusta ja pitkäjänteisestä tekemisestä syttyviä ohjelmistokehittäjä vahvistamaan tiimejämme Helsingissä, Tampereella ja Oulussa!


Luomme jatkuvasti uusia digitaalisia palveluita helpottamaan ihmisten arkea. Maailmasta löytyy kuitenkin nyt jo valtava määrä kypsään ikään ehtineitä ohjelmistohankkeita, jotka palvelevat miljoonia suomalaisia. Nämä olemassaolostaan täysillä nauttivat ohjelmistot tarvitsevat hellää huolenpitoa ja uudistamista myös nyt elämänsä ehtoopuolella.


Liityt meillä jo tuotannossa olevien projektien ylläpito- tai jatkokehitystiimeihin, joissa erittäin tärkeässä roolissa on luottamuksellinen ja hyvä asiakassuhde. Arjessa nopeatempoiseen, moderniin kehittämiseen verrattuna korostuu aiemmin kirjoitetun koodin lukeminen ja ymmärtäminen. Pystyt tutustumaan läheisemmin sekä domainiin että asiakkaaseen. Käytännön teknologioita ovat mm. Java (versiot 5-8), Spring ja JavaScript. Myös perinteiselle SQL-osaamiselle on tarvetta. Teknologiapuolella korostuu aito full stack –tekeminen.


Solita Developer Manifesto


Parasta on, kun tietää, että järjestelmä on hallussa sen verran hyvin, että asiakkaan saa pelastettua pulasta kuin pulasta, eivätkä esimerkiksi äkilliset tuotannon ongelmat juurikaan stressaa. Pääset haastamaan itseäsi luovan ongelmanratkaisun myötä ja samalla kehittymään työssäsi. Tutustu Solita Developer Manifestoonymmärtääksesi miksi epämukavuusalueelle meno, asiakasarvon luominen, ammattimainen ohjelmistokehitys ja kollegan auttaminen ovat meille tärkeitä asioita.


Kolme rekrytointikriteeriämme



  • Kova tekkiosaaminen. Osaat kirjoittaa kaunista koodia Javalla. Viihdyt suurissa ympyröissä ja hahmotat nopeasti kokonaisuuksia.

  • Halu kehittyä. Rekrytoimme Solitaan ainoastaan kehittymishaluisia ja -kykyisiä osaajia. Aiomme olla huomenna parempia kuin mitä olimme tänään. Sinulta tarvitsemme asenteen ja toteutuksen, me tarjoamme fasiliteetit (mm. 15 työpäivää vuodessa sinun valitsemiisi osaamisyhteisötoimintaan, mentorointiin tai koulutuksiin sekä kovatasoisen teknologiayhteisön tuen).

  • Jaettu arvomaailma. Etsimme yrityskulttuuriimme sulavasti solahtavia ihmisiä, jotka jakavat arvomme (intohimo, rentous, rohkeus ja välittäminen) niin asenteessaan kuin käyttäytymisessään.


Kysy lisätietoja rekrytoivilta esimiehiltämme



  • Helsingissä valtteri.valovirta(a)solita.fi / 040 539 9982

  • Tampereella tero.hakkarainen(a)solita.fi / 040 749 9711

  • Oulussa teemu.sevon(a)solita.fi / 045 891 1077


Avoimen lähdekoodin puolesta


Solitalla pääset osaksi porukkaa, joka suhtautuu työhönsä intohimolla ja rohkeudella, rentoutta unohtamatta. Arkeasi ilahduttavat ihmistemme lisäksi modernit työkalut ja teknologiat, toimivat tukipalvelut ja ergonomiset työskentelytilat. Vaalimme kokeilukulttuuria, autonomiaa ja taistelemme kaikenlaista korporaatiopönötystä vastaan. Myös sinä vaikutat siihen, minkälainen työpaikka Solita on tulevaisuudessa.


Solitalla pääset rakentamaan merkityksellisiä palveluita tunnetuille yrityksille ja julkishallinnon toimijoille eli miljoonien suomalaisten käyttöön. Kannustamme asiakkaitamme avoimen lähdekoodin hyödyntämiseen. Voit katselmoida open source -koodiamme GitHubissa ja tutustua koosteeseen julkishallinnon avoimen lähdekoodin projekteista.


Uskallatko tarttua haasteeseen?


Lähetä meille vapaamuotoinen hakemuksesi osoitteeseen rekry(a)solita.fi. Aloitamme haastattelut jo hakuajalla. Hakemuksen käsittelyä nopeuttaaksesi liitäthän mukaan mahdolliset linkkaukset koodinäytteisiisi. Haku päättyy sunnuntaina 22.5.


Rekrytointiprosessimme on kaksivaiheinen ja pääset tapaamaan useita solitalaisia ennen tärkeää päätöstäsi. Ensimmäisessä vaiheessa pääset tutustumaan Solitaan työpaikkana ja toisessa vaiheessa etsimme yhdessä projektitiimin jäsenten kanssa osaamisesi rajat. Tämän jälkeen olemme valmiita päätöksentekoon.


Voit kysyä lisätietoja rekrytoinnin etenemisestä Katilta puh. 044-0673613 tai kati.kitti(a)solita.fi.

description:
We are looking for an Senior iOS developer (full-time) to start immediately in our office in Berlin, Germany.


Who we are:
With millions of regular users and more than 9000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms.


How we work:
Our agile delivery teams are working in full-stack and feature teams involving disciplines from product management, user interface design, user experience research, analytics and engineering. Due to the growth our multi-team environment is scaling fast while we are adopting agile values, management and engineering practices.


Who we are looking for:
You are a passionate, experienced and pragmatic iOS engineer who has proven skills in creating innovative apps with modern and elegant user interfaces. You have a strong knack for problem solving and want to change the future of language learning while working in a challenging environment. Working together with ambitious colleagues you are eager to collaborate and dive into different disciplines to broaden your knowledge in other fields of expertise as well as share your own. Contributing to a great architecture and building the base of an easily extendable and well maintainable application is something you enjoy and take pride in.


Responsibilities:



  • Work in a cross-functional team

  • Deliver high-quality work from design to production

  • Implement great functionality and stunning user experience

  • Take ownership of features, working with the team and stakeholders

  • Work closely with other engineering disciplines

  • Focus on long-term stability and maintainability
title: Senior iOS Engineer (Swift) at Babbel (Berlin, Germany)

stratton is on the lookout for a Web Project Manager with a background in enterprise and high-profile customer-facing websites. We are chomping at the bit to start on a wide range of innovative and exciting projects, and we need a passionate and high performing person to take the reins.


As part of the Software Development department, your job will be to steer major projects through to completion, coordinating software developers, along with marketing, compliance, sales and our partners at carsales.com.au. No interminable bureaucracy, just you and the team and a mandate to succeed.


You will be prepared to take the role of product manager, learning the industry of finance broking, and will ensure that technical requirements are met to the highest standard. Our project include customer facing web projects that will reach thousands of users every day, complex financial systems in the backend, and innovative new product concepts.

Uskotko funktionaalisen ohjelmoinnin tulevaisuuteen? Haluaisitko osaksi Suomen kovinta Clojure-yhteisöä? Vahvan asiakaskysynnän vuoksi rekrytoimme nyt lisää intohimoisia clojuristeja Helsinkiin, Tampereelle ja Ouluun!


Clojure tekee ohjelmoinnista jälleen hauskaa. Useiden asiakkaillemme rakennettujen ja tuotantoon vietyjen Clojure-projektien perustella uskomme, että funktionaalisen ohjelmoinnin osuus tulee edelleen kasvamaan tulevaisuudessa. Tunnetuin ja pitkäikäisin Clojure-hankkeemme on oma tuotteemme Lupapiste.


Projektitiimeillämme on 100% autonomia. Tiimit valitsevat itsenäisesti asiakkaan ympäristöihin soveltuvan teknologiastackin parhaan näkemyksensä mukaisesti, johon asiakkaamme luottavat. title: Clojure Developers at Solita Oy (Helsinki, Finland)

description:
Job Description



From barbers and massage therapists to plumbers and limo drivers, service professionals are a massive and diverse industry of sellers. The Services Team is building an intelligent software suite, centered around the needs of the millions of merchants in the Services industry, empowering them to run their entire business on Square. We build mobile-first functionality to help them manage their schedules, estimates, quotes, projects, and invoices.


We are a small, focused team with great growth and impact opportunities. As a software engineer on the Services Team, you will be responsible for designing, building, and owning the services and infrastructure required to make our merchants succeed. We encourage engineers to lead and influence roadmaps, driving large features across multiple platforms. We have positions available for product and infrastructure oriented engineers, so you can be involved in building back-end services, front-end clients, or anything in between.
title: Software Engineer, Services at Square (San Francisco, CA)

description:
We are currently seeking a Web Developer with a focus on the front end area, who wants to be part of an extremely motivated and experienced team. You will support our team to develop the architecture of the website (both technical as well as conceptual aspects) and will take a central role within this process. You`ll create new features, which will influence the user experience of our site, significantly.


Your responsibilities



  • In this position you are actively involved in the whole design process of our gaming platforms. You will be responsible for conception, development, operation and optimization of our Casino sites. The main focus is always on a target-group specific design.

  • Depending on your expertise and your interest, you are free to define your area of responsibility within this position yourself!


  • Our emphases

      • HTML 5
