title: Web Developer Frontend (f/m) at Greentube Internet Entertainment Solutions GmbH (Wien, Österreich)

description:
Have a reputation for creating software so advanced that it is indistinguishable from magic? Fascinated by the user experience as much as optimising a slow running query? Love to patch and recompile third-party code if it doesn't have the features you need? If this sounds like you, then you want to work for us.


We need an experienced Developer who loves, lives and breathes all things .NET to take ownership of some major new projects in 2016.
In this role you will be responsible for planning and implementing features across their full lifecycle - writing code for the UI, services and SQL backend.
You will be actively involved in the needs analysis, development and deployment of software projects.


We are business that defines itself through the smart and efficient use of technology. We may be a finance company, but we're nothing like other finance companies; no stuffy old bankers,
no bean-counters, and no corporate bureaucracy - just a dynamic, fast-growing business with a suite of bespoke software running the show.


With a recent sizeable investment by CarSales, one of Australia's most popular websites, we have a huge range of projects to get off the ground. These include customer facing web projects that will reach thousands of users every day, complex financial systems in the backend, and upgrading our DevOps capabilities to take advantage of bleeding edge technology.
title: Senior .NET Developer at stratton (Port Melbourne, Australia)

description:
We’re OK GROW!, a full-stack JavaScript consultancy working for clients both big and small. We’re a team of developers and designers and we’re looking for someone with a passion for the web, mobile, JavaScript, and great products. We have an office in Toronto but we have a remote work culture.


The position


You're organized and ambitious and pay attention to details. You have experience developing full-stack JavaScript applications or deep front-end expertise, plus a solid foundation in computer science principles. You're a top React, Node, or Meteor expert or are confident that with a few months' hard work you will be. And your working hours need to be able to overlap with both the east and west coast of North America.


You'll work with a small but growing team and an experienced founder who are known in the Meteor community internationally and the startup community in Toronto.


You'll lead development of client projects and our own internal projects (which we work on one day per week).


You'll work with the best tools, manage projects, launch successful web and mobile apps, and become recognized as a leader in the JavaScript community.


How to apply


For extra consideration run the `contact()` function on our site and email us at the address that it returns. Please tell us about yourself, which time zone you’re in, and why you'd be a great choice for this position. Please include your GitHub account and links to things you've made or written online. We’re looking forward to meeting you.


(No recruiters or agencies please.)
title: Senior JavaScript Engineer at OK GROW! at OK GROW! (Toronto, ON, Canada) (allows remote)

description:
STRATA is an advertising technology leader headquartered in Chicago. A wholly owned subsidiary of a Fortune 100 company, with over 30 years of experience building innovative software products that have set the standard in the media industry. As we continue to develop new systems and technologies that benefit our clients, we are actively seeking talented professionals in the following area(s):




Summary The Software Developer is responsible for developing .NET, web-based software solutions. This development will occur in an Agile environment, typically in fixed-length sprints (Scrum methodology), with regular interactions with Product Owners and other team members. The Software Developer is expected to produce high-quality software, to function effectively as a member of a team, to interact with management and other members of the development group, and to continually seek to improve themselves and the company.



Essential Functions The Software Developer must be able to write quality software based on the provided designs and specifications, within reasonable timeframes, and to be effective members of their department and company. The Software Developer must be able to work on multiple projects simultaneously when asked. The Software Developer needs to be able to work with a range of technologies (e.g., Windows applications and services, websites and web services, XML schemas, relational databases), languages (e.g., C#, VB.NET, T-SQL, JavaScript, HTML, XML), and applications (Visual Studio, SQL Server, etc.). The Software Developer must demonstrate good analytical abilities, attention to detail, and strong verbal and written communication skills in English.



Job Knowledge, skills and abilities (KSA's)



Proficiency in the following programming languages and applications:




  • C# and/or VB.NET for web applications and servers

  • JavaScript, HTML, and CSS for web applications

  • SQL Server 2008 or greater, relational database design and programming



Familiarity with:




  • Modern JavaScript-powered web applications (Angular, React, Backbone, Ember, etc.) and the "Single Page Application" (SPA) architecture

  • REST/RESTful web service design and programming (Web API, Nancy, ServiceStack, etc.)

  • Unit testing frameworks (NUnit, xUnit, Jasmine, etc.)

  • Package management (npm, Bower, NuGet, etc.)

  • Excellent debugging and troubleshooting abilities

  • Excellent communication skills



Strongly Desired:



Experience with:




  • Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)

  • Message queues or event bus technologies (MSMQ, RabbitMQ, NServiceBus, etc.)

  • Automated builds/Continuous Integration/Deployment (Jenkins, CruiseControl, TFS, etc.)

  • Cloud-based services (SaaS/IaaS/PaaS)

  • Data warehouses, reporting, and analysis

  • Very large database (VLDB) design and tuning

  • XML, XML Schemas, XPath queries, etc.

  • Familiarity with the Media/Cable industry



Supervisory responsibilities The Software Developer will have no supervisory responsibilities, but must function well within project teams, working with Product Managers, tech leads, and other team members.



Working conditions The Software Developer will work within the company's offices, based on hours agreed upon by their manager. The Software Developer will be expected to dress and behave professionally.



Minimum qualifications and requirements Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field plus 1 year of experience in a Software Developer position.



Success factors Successful employees will have demonstrable ability with one or more key programming languages and technologies (C#, VB.NET, JavaScript, SQL Server), will consistently meet deadlines, and will do their part to help to deliver high-quality, functional software to the client in accordance with business needs. Successful employees must understand the entire product life-cycle and provide appropriate feedback through implementation, documentation and testing wherever appropriate.




Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer
title: .NET Engineer - STRATA - Ad Technology Platforms at Comcast (Chicago, IL)

description:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




Job Summary:



Responsible for planning and designing new streaming video software and web applications. Analyzes, tests, and assists with the integration of new applications. Oversees the documentation of all development activity. Trains non-technical personnel. Assists with tracking performance metrics. Provides guidance and support to other Engineers. Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and shares expertise.





Core Responsibilities:



- Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.

description:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




Software Engineer- RMP-Denver





thePlatform is hiring a Software Engineer for our core engineering team that will be working onsite at our parent company Comcast's Denver office.





The team is working on the next gen RMP (Remote Media Processor), which is a key component of the mpx video management system and manages the transfer, encoding, and encryption of files used in the workflows of large content providers and aggregators. It includes a plug-in architecture and a development kit that customers and third parties can use to develop new functionality.





thePlatform helps content providers, broadband media sites, and mobile businesses solve their unique media publishing requirements. Our products provide content providers, broadband media sites and mobile businesses the versatility to easily build a unique broadband video channel for any medium including their site, affiliate sites, mobile phones and even off-line playback from PCs.





We build highly available REST-based services and web applications using Java technologies. This position offers a tremendous opportunity to learn a broad range of new skills, technology, and processes in a company with one of the healthiest development organizations you'll find anywhere. We practice Agile methodologies, plan rational schedules, and our cross-functional teams build strong, collaborative relationships as partners in the delivery of quality solutions.





Responsibilities:




  • Design and build new features from product owner specifications.

  • Provide estimates for new product features.

  • Follow a test-driven development process.

  • Work closely with stakeholders to ensure timely product delivery.

  • Respond quickly to customer issues in production environments.

  • Influence the direction of thePlatform's solutions and architecture by contributing ideas regularly.





Requirements:




  • Solid Java programming experience including common design patterns, data structures and object-oriented principles.

  • At least 3 years of experience in the design, implementation and testing of distributed services and large-scale systems.

  • Experience with service-oriented architectures, performance, and scalability.

  • Software testing skills, including experience with JUnit or TestNG.

  • Excellent communication, organization and time management skills.

  • Keen attention to detail and a high level of commitment.

  • BS Computer Science or related discipline.





Additional Desired Qualities:




  • Solid experience with server-side Java development, and understanding of SOA and enterprise integration patterns.

  • Experience with Dependency Injection (Spring), ORM (JPA, Hibernate), Java NIO (and Jetty or Tomcat support), multithreading (java.util.concurrent), OSGI, XML/JSON processing and Apache Maven.

  • Experience with RESTful services and knowledge of common messaging technologies (XML, JSON, SOAP, REST, etc.).

  • SQL and data modeling experience with some exposure to MySQL.





About thePlatform





thePlatform helps some of the world's largest media companies manage and publish their video content online. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, the Travel Channel, Oxygen and more.





We are a team of incredibly bright and driven people, who also believe in having fun. We enjoy a dynamic and flexible work environment, and hope you will consider joining us.





As a subsidiary of Comcast, thePlatform offers competitive compensation and spectacular benefits typically seen only at very large organizations. The following are a few of the many benefits we provide:

  • You are collaborative, have a strong work ethic, are reliable and a self-starter

  • You have a Bachelor’s or advanced degree in computer science or related discipline 


What you’re looking for:



  • A chance to work in a dynamic environment, learn new technologies and hone skills

  • Solve complex problems to develop software which delivers time, frustration, and money saving value to our customers

  • Be part of a team where fun, smart, passionate, ambitious engineers work together to build great systems

  • A fast–growing, global company where you’ll be challenged to think about things that no one has thought of yet

  • A position where you’re an important voice in development


Are you ready to join a different kind of company?  Exciting things are happening all the time.  Come join us!
title: Platform Engineer (JavaScript) at INRIX (Seattle, WA)

description:
The Tanga Network is Arizona's largest and fastest growing true Ecommerce marketplace.  Located in Downtown Chandler, stepping into the brand new office is like taking a trip to Silicon Valley. The amazing design, million dollar views, and incredibly fun and exciting team of talented people is a breath of fresh air.

At Tanga you'll not only help us build and maintain a competitive advantage in one of the hottest industries, but you'll also create standalone applications that can be used internally and integrated into our burgeoning vendor ecosystem.

No siloed work here; you'll help build everything from mobile apps to personalization/consumer taste engines and hybrid consumer marketplaces like no one has ever seen.  


Come join our team of disruptors to shake up the E-commerce world.
title: Senior Software Engineer at Tanga (Chandler, AZ)

description: SURGE is looking for smart, self-motivated, experienced, senior-level software engineers who enjoy the freedom of telecommuting and flexible schedules, to work as long-term, consistent (40 hrs/week) independent contractors (no W2) on a variety of software development projects.
title: Hiring Senior Software Engineers at Surge (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)

description:
ThoughtWorks isn’t your average company, so we don’t hire average people.

From a technology perspective, ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We’ve been at the forefront of innovation on the Java platform, and have pioneered the use of techniques such as Inversion of Control and Domain Specific Languages. We’ve made significant contributions to the Java Open Source community via projects such as CruiseControl, XStream and Selenium.

ThoughtWorks is also a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner and our people provide thought leadership to key Microsoft initiatives such as the Patterns and Practices effort. Most recently we’re becoming famous for the work we’re doing with alternative .net languages like IronRuby, Iron Python, F# and Ioke. We champion Ruby on Rails and ThoughtWorks is already the natural home for some of the world’s leading Ruby developers.


By joining ThoughtWorks, you become part of a community. ThoughtWorkers are a passionate, diverse bunch. Typical ThoughtWorker traits include enjoying arguing about tiny details of language implementation; complaining about Maven and discussing how close to 1K they are. People join because they get to talk to the people who wrote the books that influenced them (and often get invited to help review or contribute to the author’s next one) and work with the people who wrote the tools they couldn’t get their previous company to use.


Add to this our focus on Agile delivery and you’ll start to see why working here is refreshingly different.


We hire only the most talented, passionate people. We're seeking a creative approach to problem-solving and a track record of technical innovation. We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so you’ll be flexible about travel, and willing to travel extensively as part of your role. You want to go the extra mile, and relish the idea of being part of a community that extends beyond the work we do for our customers.


We’re looking for developers who have broad technology experience in Java, C#/.Net or Ruby; polyglot programmers are especially welcome.
title: Senior Software Engineer at ThoughtWorks (Beijing, China)

description:
The National Football League is looking for Senior iOS Engineer to join our mobile team.


The apps we build are used by millions of fans every week. This means progressive development practices and a culture built around rapid releases. You'll work closely with both designers and platform engineers to bring new features to life. Every member of the team possesses a strong level of ownership over what they build and is a part of the entire process, from ideation to final delivery. We ship every week, enabled by continuous integration and automated testing. Our beta release process quickly puts new ideas into the hands of our fans and a combination of analytics, feature flagging, and in-person testing allows us to iterate rapidly. We value close attention to detail and code designed to face constant iteration and collaboration. Each line of code is reviewed by other developers, every pixel inspected by designers, and every feature put to the test with manual and automated QA.


Our entire codebase is written in Swift using modern design patterns and coding standards. We rely on open source libraries—like Reactive Cocoa for our MVVM data model and AsyncDisplayKit for declaratively laying out our UX—and contribute back to the community. We're serious about building an innovative engineering culture, crafting apps our fans love.


Responsibilities


•Build new, exciting features and release to millions of football fans on iOS


•Collaborate with our product and design teams to iterate based on user feedback


•Architect large parts of the codebase to support rapid iteration and collaboration


•Collaborate with platform engineers on API design, serialization, and optimization


•Write and maintain unit tests for the iOS codebase


•Keep up to date with the state-of-the-art of iOS development
title: Senior iOS Engineer at NFL (Culver City, CA)

description:
The Cadasta Foundation is building a global platform to help marginalized communities and individuals document their rights and interests in land, property, and resources. We are seeking a DevOps Engineer  to help scale and deploy our open source platform built on a variety of open source technologies, including Python, JavaScript, OpenDataKit and PostgreSQL.


As a member of a small team, the DevOps Engineer has the opportunity to influence and affect the development process beyond the code and systems. Not only will you be supporting the developers building the platform and deploying it to our users, you'll be able to contribute to organizational direction and have first hand access & influence at all levels of the organization. Flexibility and a willingness to chip in, collaborate, and learn are key in this role, but that doesn't mean long hours or work outside your scope. Cadasta prides itself on being a welcoming, people-first environment that's dedicated to healthy work-life balance.


Our ideal candidate for the DevOps position is not necessarily someone that ticks a box on every technology; rather, we'd like to hire an experienced technologist with the ability to tackle a variety of technical tasks, and that enjoys learning new technologies in a collaborative environment. We encourage diverse applicants with non-traditional development career paths to apply - in other words, we're looking for the right person, not the right combination of buzz words. Traditionally underrepresented populations in tech such as women, People of Color, People with Disabilities, and LGBTQ+ people, etc, we strongly encourage you to apply! We primarily work remotely, so almost anyone, anywhere in the world is eligible.


Responsibilities




  • Automating software deployment and configuration management




  • Configure and maintain system monitoring tools




  • Developing and supporting deployment and rollback tools and processes




  • Participate in capacity planning, provisioning and scaling of the application infrastructure




  • Helping to ensure information security best practices




  • Create reliable and high availability designs for our platform, in partnership with the development team.




  • Assist in supporting rest of organization technical issues including ensuring adequate backups and adequate tech security practices.




Benefits


Cadasta is committed not only to a people-first approach as a social good endeavour, but as an invigorating place to work. We support our staff by using a flexible work structure that caters to your strengths, and a collaborative, learning-focused environment that helps you reach your full potential while making a positive impact on the world. We empower our staff by giving them ownership over their work and license to take risks. When those efforts pay off, Cadasta celebrates those accomplishments in ways that are meaningful to you. As part of our team, your success is our success. In addition to a competitive salary, we offer:




  • 20 days paid vacation annually plus 10 sick/personal leave days




  • 11 National holidays




  • Reimbursement for health, dental and vision insurance




  • Necessary IT tools




  • Conference attendance and training opportunities




  • Additional, evolving benefits that take individual circumstances into consideration, and give further meaningful recognition of the value that our staff bring the organization.
title: DevOps Engineer for small globally distributed team making a difference at Cadasta Foundation (Washington, DC) (allows remote)

description:
Red Ant is looking for an experienced Javascript developer to help us create incredible digital experiences. Front end technology has changed in amazing and incredible ways. New stuff comes out each week. How it fits in has become more and more critical. We need you to help us build these awesome things.


What we're looking for is someone that will really dig working with us. Fit in well. You'll love coming to work, and we'll love working with you. What we're really interested in is you and your passion for developing and refining code. Please don't take that in a creepy or stalker kind of way.


A little bit about us:



  1. We're not consultants. We don't take on projects for a few weeks and then hand over (all the while knowing that this elegant yet fragile code will explode in Production). We get down and dirty, because we think that is where stuff gets really interesting. We value long term projects, because we know that by refining and iterating we can continually improve an idea. We have been working on some sites for over 10 years - but the job is never done.

  2. We all work together. To work together as a high performing team, we think meaningful conversations and interactions are important. To make great digital things, so many different parts need to come together perfectly - from UX to DevOps. We are a team of about 30 people. Not too big, not too small. It’s a collaborative, non-hierarchical ego-free workplace. You’ll get to know everyone and have enough room to grow and never be pigeon holed.

  3. We're not an ad agency & we don't outsource. We build. We're pretty geeky, and while we have content, UX & design people, we're undeniably technical. And to be technically good you need excellent processes along with a strong tech culture. People that care. We're not that company that seems to build things but actually gets all the work done in Nepal or Poland or wherever. Sure those teams could be great, but there are better things you could be doing with your career than babysitting an offshore team. Personally I'd rather clean my ears with a Dremel.

  4. We work with nice people as our clients. Life is too short to work with d*ckheads.
title: Javascript Front Endgineer at Red Ant (Sydney, Australia)

description: As a Software Mobile Engineer with Concur you will contribute to the design and development of new applications and new features for Concur’s mobile solutions. We are looking for bright and creative engineers to enhance and maintain Concur’s flagship mobile application as well as help drive the creation of future mobile products. You will work with new and existing mobile technologies to deliver the best mobile experience to our users. If you believe you have what it takes to get the job done, we would like to talk to you.

Our small, high-performance team is responsible for the UI for the fastest-growing segment of Hulu traffic, on all the best devices, the very day those devices ship. We are building the best Video on Demand (VOD) experience the living room has ever seen, and we work with a plethora of different technologies and partners to do so. We are reinventing television. If you’re looking for a challenge you’ve come to the right place!
title: Senior Software Developer - Living Room Experiences at Hulu (Seattle, WA)

description:
Join us


As a member of Concur's Performance and Load team, you will lead and collaborate with other smart Engineers in the evolution of our SAS platform. Your work will benefit tens of millions of customers and gives you the opportunity to be in the driving seat as we move towards highly-efficient systems coupled to high-quality automation, and new performance and load strategies. 

What you bring with you…

At this stage of your career, you are not looking for a simple set of tasks or well-defined problems with a clear solution. You are looking for a new technical and organizational challenge – assessing the environment, and creating your own path – working with others to solve key challenges you have identified. At heart, you are a strong, technical Engineer who continues to learn and grow - and grow those around you. If this sounds like you we’d love to start a conversation.
title: Performance Engineer at Concur (Bellevue, WA)

description:
Gem is leading the charge in building highly scalable blockchain solutions for large enterprises. Gem’s Senior Software Engineer will join a team of dedicated, innovative, and enthusiastic engineers with diverse backgrounds. They’ll have a passion for innovation, a deep enjoyment of fault tolerant distributed systems, and a habit of geeking out on crypto and garbage collection.


Technologies we use: Java, Ruby, Javascript (front end), Kafka, PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, RethinkDB, BigchainDB, Ethereum.


Frameworks we use: Ruby on Rails, Spark Java, ReactJS.


What you’ll do 



  • Develop and maintain our microservices - build and improve our platform’s internal distributed systems architecture

  • Build blockchain data ingestion pipelines

  • Design core blockchain technology - work on new and upcoming innovations in the blockchain space

  • Construct beautiful user experience (front end only) - work with product and design to craft engaging user experiences

  • Architect our core systems - you won’t be a code monkey, you will be integral to designing the Gem Platform
title: Senior Software Engineer at Gem (Los Angeles, CA)

description:
Come be a part of mobilizing the Perfect Trip!


Be a part of the team that delivers innovative solutions enabling enterprise users to seamlessly manage business travel and expenses using their mobile phone/devices. We are looking for experienced SDETs to join the Mobile Expense Team as we work to extend the functionality of our mobile applications to provide a high quality, intuitive workflow that increases adoption and customer satisfaction.
Concur’s Mobile Expense team develops new features that enable Mobile users to create, upload, and approve expense reports. This is a growing team and we’re looking for SDETs to join our agile development teams to contribute to all activities of the development process, but with a specialty in testing and quality. The team builds web services and user interfaces that are tested through continuous integration, resulting in monthly client and services releases across platforms (iOS, Android, etc…).


In the First 12 Months You Will:



  • Work in a fast-paced Agile environment to deliver a smoother customer workflow for Expense management; managing project priorities and mitigating risks to deliver on release commitments

  • Provide expertise in driving quality-oriented design and development practices as it applies to both product code and test code

  • Participate in driving decisions in planning across teams

  • Work with other SDETs on Test Automation strategies across platforms and form factors. Identify new automation tools/approaches that will decrease testing cost and increase quality

  • Analyze bug trends/patterns and customer feedback to drive for better customer experiences

  • Work with other Agile team members (including PM and Dev) to drive feature planning to increase customer adoption
title: Mobile Software Engineer in Test at Concur (Bellevue, WA)

description:
Be a core part of our configuration management & operations team. Help us build fully automated systems for building, testing and delivering services that will be used by more than 27 million customers. The team is part of a larger group that seeks and encourages innovation and drives for automation, resiliency, and simplicity. Learn and utilize a wide variety of applications, frameworks, and tools across multiple disciplines in a fulfilling and high performing environment.


What you will do:



  • Support our configuration management team building and maintaining the products and services that make up the build and deployment processes for our Concur products.

  • Support and improve our tools for continuous build, automated testing and release management.

  • Continuously train on evolving best practices and patterns driven by the technical leadership.

  • Contribute to documentation on design and implementation for use by both development and configuration management teams.

  • Be passionate about driving automation to replace manual processes.
title: Configuration Management Engineer at Concur (Bellevue, WA)

description:
Gem is leading the charge in building highly scalable blockchain solutions for large enterprises. Gem’s Quality Assurance Software Engineer will join a team of dedicated, innovative, and enthusiastic engineers with diverse backgrounds. The Quality Assurance Engineer will work on agile software projects to ensure delivered systems will meet business needs and satisfy quality expectations.  Responsibilities include designing, scripting, and executing tests, analyzing results, reporting issues accurately, and verifying the completeness and appropriateness of defect resolution.


What you'll do:



  • Ensure functionality, usability, scalability, security, and other quality attributes of the enterprise software systems and underlying infrastructure delivered to business stakeholders by our engineering team

  • Configure test environments and generate custom data sets or test harnesses necessary to support testing activities

  • Develop test plans, cases, and scripts; have primary responsibility for a comprehensive QA strategy on one or more projects, including user story refinement, code walk-throughs, and various types of testing such as functional, integration, regression, and end-to-end

  • Provide clear feedback and input to product owners, stakeholders, and engineers; help achieve shared understanding of project requirements and solution decisions

  • Schedule and execute manual testing cycles; produce and present results and metrics as requested by project team members and management

  • Utilize automated testing tools to create and execute software tests and analyze results

  • Report defects accurately and track them to successful resolution

  • Attain sufficient knowledge of our business goals/operations/constraints as well as our technology tiers/solutions to properly assess the risk and value contained in each release candidate

  • Identify test acceptance criteria and coordinate occasional UAT/deployment/training activities
title: Quality Assurance Software Engineer at Gem (Los Angeles, CA)

description:
We’re on a quest for an extraordinary product engineer who will join us to build clean, modern applications from scratch.


You are a self-starter with a bias for action, and you can take projects from start to finish. You want to work as part of a small, tightly-knit team that moves quickly and pushes changes to production many times a day. You always admired your friends in science, but your knack for computers led you to programming.


Every day, thousands of scientists improve the efficiency of their research by using Quartzy. Our team is passionate about accelerating scientific research through well-designed, meaningful tools for labs. We recently raised a new round of funding and are gearing up for rapid product development.



What you'll do



  • Design and implement new functionality from the ground up

  • Work closely with your team to design and develop a robust REST API

  • Measure and improve site performance and scalability

  • Write well tested code that is resilient to heavy iteration


What we're looking for



  • Demonstrable experience writing clean, thoughtfully crafted PHP that scales

  • Experience with other parts of our technology stack: MySQL, Redis, Beanstalkd, NGINX, Git

  • An entrepreneurial attitude that gets high-quality projects done quickly

  • Ability to work efficiently and communicate clearly


What we'd love



  • Experience implementing the JSON API specification

  • Familiarity with SOLID practices and/or domain driven design

  • Working knowledge of front-end technology: Javascript, HTML, SASS

  • Occasionally, you end the day with more lines of code removed than added; and that feels great


Does that sound like you? We'd love to hear from you.
title: PHP Engineer at Quartzy (Palo Alto, CA)

description:
We build software to help people, and we’re growing a team dedicated to the idea that software engineering skills should be well-maintained and put to positive use in the world, confident that well-built software, applied where it’s needed, can be a powerful force for good.


Help us build our web application, in Ruby on Rails, working with all product stakeholders to define direction in a lean environment. Mentor junior staff and assist in growing our team through hiring.
title: Senior Developer - Healthcare at Wellist (Boston, MA)

description:
2K Security is looking for a high value individual contributor to own the Anti-Cheat and Anti-Piracy program


You will need to be an expert and the go to person for several of the following topics:



  • Anti-Tamper Technologies like Denuvo and Arxan

  • Reverse engineering of game code for the purpose of stealing secrets and modifying game behavior

Job Responsibilities Will Include:



  • Own our anti-cheat and anti-piracy program

  • Conduct cheating and piracy assessments for our games

  • Enhance / build a lab and test infrastructure for cheating and piracy testing

  • Make recommendations to developers and studios on enhancing defense against cheating and piracy

  • Implement Denuvo and Arxan like Anti-Tamper technologies for various games to prevent and detect piracy and cheating

  • Monitor the underground for cheating and piracy activities
title: Senior Game Security Engineer - 2K Security at 2K (Novato, CA)

description:
Great candidates will...



  • Get to work with a world-class team;

  • Deliver real products in cardboard boxes; 

  • Gain experience with embedded Linux software in a state-of-the-art network appliances;

  • Build commercially successfully products used around the world in mission critical environments;

  • Deliver to customers and get customer feedback;

  • Be technically challenged, with exposure right across hardware, chip and software design; 

  • Work for a global Australian business;

title: Software Engineer at Metamako (Sydney, Australia)

description:
Want a work culture where you are challenged every single day?  Want to work on new exciting, back-end applications and collaborate with a small team of elite developers who will expand your knowledge every single day?  Want to become the very best developer you can be by working in a very relaxed, but extremely high-throughput environment?


We are not an agency....and we don't work for anyone else.  We develop our cutting edge software solutions from scratch and offer these world class Software As A Service to thousands of customers all over the world.


We are TurnCommerce – a small group of elite developers working on next generation applications, such as building our own DNS platform handling more than 300 requests per second, building tools to mitigate from extremely large scale DDOS attacks, etc.  Our mantra is to develop almost everything from scratch and by doing this we are always learning.  If we are not all collectively learning together, what is the point??


Our core business is a domain name registrar housing more than 2.5 million domains.  We continue to push the boundaries and are actively building many other tools and services and achieving a very high rate of growth.


If you are looking for a developer-centric culture where you will be rewarded for your efforts and want to be part of an elite group, please contact us.
title: Senior .Net (C#) Developer - Backend Software Engineer at a FUN company! at TurnCommerce Inc. (Denver, CO)

description:
In this role, you’ll lead our Data & Analytics Insights engineering team. You'll hire/grow the team, architect solutions, and actively contribute code to Fusion's data warehouse, data-focused products and predictive tools that are integrated into the daily workflows of Fusion’s editorial, video, and social teams.


Fusion has a multiplatform cable TV station, an immersive digital news site, and distributes content across every major social and video platform. Our engineers are systematic problem solvers who take pride in writing reusable code and enjoy collaborating to build new and innovative experiences that increase Fusion’s content relevance and enagement.


What will you do here? 
* You'll build leading-edge analytics and insight tools that expand the reach of Fusion’s content across the social, mobile web. 
* You get to identify, interview, and build a team around these data and analytics tools. 
* You'll be an internal expert with respect to complex statistical data analysis, data mining, and machine learning. 
* You will use third-party APIs for analytics platforms and drive strategies on how to integrate them with internal tools and products. 
* You ensure products drive valuable, actionable insights by working closely with product, UX, and business teams.
title: Technical Lead, Data & Analytics at Fusion Media Network (New York, NY)

description:
In this role you’ll work closely with Fusion's audience development team to help grow Fusion’s following and brand awareness across online channels. You will be responsible for executing key pieces of Fusion’s user acquisition and engagement strategy. Your contributions will help connect Fusion with our audience and ensure continued growth of voice in the digital community. 


Fusion is dedicated to distributing compelling and high impact stories across all major social and video platforms. Our front-end engineers are systematic problem solvers who take pride in writing reusable code and enjoy collaborating to build new and innovative experiences together.


What will you do here? 
- Setup and execute CRO (conversion rate optimization) strategies to improve user engagement. 
- Use third-party A/B testing tools to setup and evaluate on-site updates and changes. 
- Support the design leads to develop solutions for visual and interaction problems. 
- Work closely with product, design and audience development to ensure projects are successfully executed. 
- Improve site performance through site speed and UX enhancements. 
- Collaborate and contribute ideas to help grow Fusion’s portfolio of digital products
title: Front-end Engineer at Fusion Media Network (New York, NY)

description:
Job Title: Digital Content Associate


Location: New Rochelle, NY


Reports To: Digital Content Manager



JOB FUNCTION:


As a Digital Content Associate you work alongside the Digital Content Manager maintaining focus on distributing, scheduling, recording, converting, archiving, sorting, and finalizing all video required for company deliverables, and/or customers on both internal and external operator supported video systems.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Schedule client and benchmark recordings; maintain a comprehensive list of all shows scheduled on various recording systems in-house and as well as operator supported.

  • Convert video files as required for day-to-day tasks, projects and as requested or need arises.

  • Perform web-video/digital/streaming capture and file conversions for internal reporting use.

  • Perform video restoration, editing and quality assurance testing.

  • Enter and verify video timestamps and other pertinent video file data for utilized videos into administrative interface after report generation.

  • Update Digital Content logs, documents and reports on an ongoing basis and as needed/required.

  • Assists in setting up video equipment for special sessions, meetings and trainings.

  • Generate daily, weekly and monthly reports (as needed and/or required) pertaining to video status, failure/success rates, storage capacity, and hardware errors.

  • Adhere to all operational and video standards and practices and policies.

  • Process incoming video requests and inquiries, assisting in deliverable preparation for internal and external customers.

  • Perform video quality control work, including monitoring feedback on picture quality, sound, equipment operation, data and overall system performance.

  • Perform video recording and verification playback on all in-house and operator supported video systems.

  • Perform video application installation(s) and updates on workstations.

  • Maintain archived video assets in accordance with policies and standards and practices.

  • Assist in supporting legacy video recording systems ensuring they are functioning and operational at all times.

  • Supports operations, client services, sales and other departments when/as required/needed on tasks/issues/questions pertaining to video content; internal and external assets.

  • Performs other related tasks as assigned and needed.
title: Digital Content Associate at comScore, Inc (New Rochelle, NY)

description:
Ever thought of combining your passion of frontend engineering with your love of great lifestyle brands such as HGTV, DIY Network, Travel Channel and more? Do you consider yourself a technical leader who keeps tabs on the  latest technologies yet can be pragmatic about ones that are currently used? Now's your chance to work with such award winning websites that attract more than 13 MILLION unique visitors a month at headquarters in Knoxville, Tennessee.


Not familiar with Knoxville, Tennessee?


It's also been called Vol Country, Top 100 Best Places to Live, Forbes’ Best Places for Careers, Forbes’ Most Affordable Cities, Huffington Post’s Top 10 Places to Relocate to in the US, and the list goes on and on.
title: Front End Engineer for HGTV.com and TravelChannel.com at Scripps Networks Interactive (Knoxville, TN)

description:
Build and lead a team at Sentient that is creating a disruptive AI-driven product in our Visual Intelligence business!


Sentient has built the world’s most powerful distributed artificial intelligence system, which powers innovative products that solve some of the world’s toughest problems.


Combining evolutionary computation, deep learning and other AI techniques, running on one of the world’s largest computing grids, the Sentient platform enables us to understand truly massive data sets in a profound way, enabling cutting-edge products in the financial and e-commerce markets, along with scientific research in health and other domains.


The Sentient R&D team includes world-renowned experts in evolutionary computation, deep learning, artificial life, and distributed computing. The quality of Sentient’s team and technology has attracted some of the world’s most influential investors, making Sentient the best-funded independent artificial intelligence company.


We are seeking an exceptional technical leader to lead our Conversion Rate Optimization product team. This product uses artificial intelligence to optimize ecommerce websites to maximize revenue. We are building a new team to produce future versions of this product. Over the next year, your primary goal will be to build this team, and lead the team to deliver product releases on time and on scope. This is a hands-on technical role, and one that will have a direct impact on the success of the product and our company.
title: Engineering Manager, AI-driven Conversion Optimization at Sentient Technologies (San Francisco, CA)

description:
ProntoPro.it e' una lean startup, fully funded. Abbiamo un pool di investitori invidiabile (angel da Facebook, Google, eBay, McKinsey + investitori istituzionali); siamo ancora piccoli, ma gia' diventati il marketplace di riferimento per i servizi. Stiamo crescendo *molto* bene e l'anno prossimo avviamo espansione all'estero.


Cerchiamoun senior PHP developer che abbia voglia di spaccare e far la differenza. Tecnologia di riferimento e' Symfony. 


Non e' il lavoro da grande azienda: hai pochi paletti, molta liberta' e molta autonomia. Non ti diamo gli orari fissi d'ufficio - diamo liberta' e ci aspettiamo responsabilizzazione. 


TEAM e STACK TECNOLOGICO



  • Stack: Symfony, React, ReactNative, Mongo, RabbitMQ, MariaDB, Bootstrap

  • Team: 5 senior devs, 8 entro fine 2016, 20 entro fine 2017. Lavoro con metodologia agile. 

  • Progetti in corso: roll-out React, e altre cose top-secret :)

  • Progetti prossimi: migrazione a struttura a micro-servizi; mobile app; internazionalizzazione



PERCHE' PRONTOPRO


Sarai uno dei primi dev a unirsi a noi. Quindi: 



  • avrai una crescita rapidissima a livello di responsabilita'

  • avrai liberta' completa nel decidere cosa fare e come. Sara' veramente il tuo prodotto

  • sarai parte del founding team di ProntoPro, e costruirai qualcosa di enorme quasi da zero

  • avrai un forte impatto sociale (davvero)


Tradotto, cerchiamo:



  • Una rockstar

  • Una persona indipendente che sappia arrangiarsi senza bisogno di qualcuno che ti dica come fare.

  • Uno che non ne possa piu' di lavorare in una grande azienda strutturata e burocratizzata.

  • Una persona ambiziosa

  • Uno che cerchi soluzioni nuove e che ogni tanto, nella ricerca di soluzioni sempre piu' eleganti, rompa qualcosa. E che poi passi la notte a riparare quello che ha rotto :) 

  • Uno che creda fermamente nei valori dello sviluppo agile


PRINCIPALI RESPONSABILITA' 



  • Avrai controllo diretto su tutto cio' che e' ProntoPro. Non lavorerai mai su cose a basso impatto

  • Avrai il dovere di interpretare i requisiti di business, dialogare con il richiedente, capirlo e proporgli una soluzione migliore. Non dovrai mai accettare una richiesta di sviluppo senza capirla e senza aver valutato soluzioni migliori.

Crediamo fermamente nella formazione continua del nostro team. Leggi: incentiviamo fortemente la partecipazione ai piu' importanti eventi di settore (hackathon, conferenze, meeting - o proponi tu qualsiasi altra cosa!)

description:
Primary tasks and responsibilities will include:



  • Monitoring and reporting test results, and tracking performance metrics for binary-analysis tools

  • Performing initial diagnostic and impact assessment of test failures

  • Design and development of new tests

  • Preparing and validating release packages

  • Maintaining and extending infrastructure for automated testing

  • Working with the IT staff to ensure that the test organization is well provisioned and that testing machines are running smoothly


Additional tasks will reflect your strengths and evolve over time.


You will primarily work as an integral part of the binary-analysis product development team, helping the team to track development progress and product quality. You will also interact with the corresponding testing and development teams for the source-analysis product. And you will provide testing support to binary-analysis research teams. Your role will provide critical data in setting near-term goals and shaping long-term vision in order to produce a high-quality product.

description:
It's an exciting time to work at UpGuard. Our customers are digitally transforming their businesses and they need our help. UpGuard is at the front lines of solving enterprise-scale IT operations and development problems. Our product scans and tracks reams of server and device configurations within any enterprise. Their administrators can then do powerful things with that data—visualize and pinpoint inconsistencies and vulnerabilities, create policies to standardize a configuration, or even create automation scripts based on running machines to replicate and scale their infrastructure. Demand is going through the roof, and we're in search of Forward Deployed Engineers to bolster our ranks.


As a FDE, you understand our customers better than anyone. You work with them directly every day and feel their greatest pain point. You design robust solutions to address them. Projects often start with a nebulous question like "How can I integrate UpGuard with my custom app?" or "How can we identify configuration drift across 1,800 servers on 3 continents?"


You're a fast mover and thorough thinker. You develop solutions and see them through the entire process, from high-level design and prototyping to application development and data integration. You solicit constant feedback from both customers and colleagues, improving our products over time in rapid iteration cycles. You deploy cutting-edge code to solve difficult problems. You work with customers around the world both onsite and offsite, from first contact to successful deployment, and you gain unique insight into the world's most important industries and institutions.


We have three FDE positions open. One in Portland, OR, another in Mountain View, CA, and another field / remote US East.
title: Forward Deployed Engineer at UpGuard, Inc. (New York, NY) (allows remote)

description:
INNOVIM , LLC, is seeking a Software Engineer to work in a fast-paced Agile development environment performing software development, testing, and support for the NASA Sentinel Gateway (NSG) system.

The NSG is designed to ingest Sentinel mission data from the European Space Agency (ESA) and make them available to a selected set of EOSDIS Distributed Active Archive Centers (DAACs) for distribution to the earth science user community. As a member of the agile development team the candidate will contribute to the NSG development effort including design, development, functional testing, performance testing, system deployment, and sustaining engineering activities.

Job Responsibilities:
• Develop/enhance custom code for Sentinel data ingest, data distribution, and inventory management capabilities using agile development approach.
• Perform external interface testing with ESA’s Scientific Data Hub and the DAACs to ensure that the NSG system meets the functional and performance requirements.
• Perform custom software and database design, generate design documentation, and conduct design review.
• Provide technical support to the NSG performance testing activities including developing a test plan, analyzing test results and evaluating design alternatives.
• Provide technical support in diagnosing NSG software related issues encountered during daily NSG operation and provide bug fixes as required.
title: Software Engineer for NASA Data at INNOVIM, LLC (Riverdale Park, MD)

description:
Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)


The Gogo Platform and Services group is building a team of talented Software Quality Engineers to help us on our mission towards continuous integration and then deployment. If you are a test engineer with strong development skills, ideally Java, who loves to build test automation then this is the role for you.


You are an expert in cross-platform web application testing creating and using highly automated test frameworks. You've successfully built automation frameworks for desktop and mobile applications using open source technologies like Selenium Webdriver, TestNG, and programming skills in Java, Python, Ruby etc. In addition to systems analysis to support quality engineering you will get to work alongside the developers and bring best in class automation to the company. You will also work alongside our platform tooling team who will be building our cloud platform and support them with our deployment automation tooling. Roles and Responsibilities:



  • Perform systems analysis and collaborate with engineers across teams to build best in class testing approach and automation frameworks to support continuous integration and help improve testing and the quality of our code.

  • Continuously help raise the bar – finding new paths and technologies

  • Help design and implement load and performance testing

  • Verify that database data match an expected set of values

  • Support Root Cause Analyses

  • Training and mentoring of other team members as we adopt more automation.

  • Build test automation framework to develop, maintain and continuously evolve efficient test automation approach for full coverage.

  • Collaborate with development engineers to improve testing and the quality of our code.

  • Continuously help raise the bar – help us find new paths and technologies to be best in class.

  • Coordinate testing efforts with extended teams within the enterprise.

  • Help with the training and mentoring of other team members as needed.

description:
Software Architect



HERE is a leader in navigation, mapping and location experiences. We combine highly accurate and fresh maps with cloud technology to enable rich, real-time location experiences in a broad range of connected devices – from smartphones and tablets to wearables and vehicles. Built on 30 years of experience in cartography and drawing on more than 80,000 sources of data, HERE offers "Maps for Life" for more than 190 countries, voice guided navigation in 95 countries in more than 50 languages and live traffic information for 34 countries. To learn more about HERE, including our work in the areas of connected and autonomous driving, visit http://360.here.com or https://company.here.com/here/

HERE is seeking a Software Architect to join our Core Map Engineering department. The ideal candidate will be involved in the architect, design, and contribute to the development of software systems to support transition of HERE’s Core Map operations to a layered, tiled infrastructure using Service Oriented techniques. This individual will also support Agile teams across multiple components to ensure consistency and pattern re-use. 



Responsibilities



  • Designs and specifies key system interfaces and data models

  • Monitors and communicates architectural decisions and intent with project team and leadership

  • Enforces architectural compliance within the context of the system architecture and best practices

  • Prototype solutions as needed

  • Actively seeks new opportunities and contributes key ideas to projects and programs

  • Proposes technical and process solutions for business problems

description:
Our mission is to make datacenter scalability as simple for IT organizations as using their mobile devices. We believe in order to be the best you have to work with the best. Your code stands the test of time. You enjoy working in a rapidly changing environment. You are a team player and believe in delivering results over textbook topologies.


You want to be the first full-time engineer to make a huge impact at Evolute as we together rock the world of enterprise scale containers.

  • To develop the most robust and performant infrastructure capabilities for massively, scalable multi-tenancy.

  • To build new services and implement protocols for Evolute’s infrastructure architecture and cloud management server, as well as developing innovative features for our 2016 patented container distribution software.


Your Perks


We know that the culture at Evolute is something to brag about, but here are more reasons that make you excited to get out of bed and come to work:


Evolution Planning - Equal to scaling the cloud is our passion for scaling people. We walk with you through methodologies to help you code better, pair you with industry leading coaches to improve your ability to communicate, and design opportunities that will help bring you to your next level.


Poly-glot over Poli-tic - Your technology will be heard. From our developers down through our customers, we strive to enable a culture that has a bias toward innovation.


Stock options - In under 6 months, Evolute received a pre-money valuation shy of 8 figures. A modern day Marilyn Monroe, your code will keep earning money even after you’re done developing it.


Life Balance - You work hard to create great code and as a result, you know when it’s the right time to take a break. Enjoy flexible hours and the ability to take a vacation when you need it!

description:
Systems Development Manager AWS Database Services

Job Description



This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon’s world class technical teams in Dublin, working with some of the best and brightest engineers and technical managers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies anywhere. .



Amazon is building some of the largest distributed systems in the world, and we need smart people to help make these successful. Amazon's NoSQL services like DynamoDB, SimpleDB and Elasticache are massively scaled database services that are a critical piece of the internet today.



A successful Manager joining the team will do much more than manage infrastructure, tools, and people. They will be leading a team that builds automation and services that make operating a massive large scale distributed system simple and easy. The ideal candidate will look like this….



Be great fun to work with. Our company credo is “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. The right candidate will love what they do and instinctively know how to make work fun.



Enjoy being a really great people manager. Building, motivating and mentoring a world-class systems & software engineering team is the most important part of this role. You should have a proven track record in recruiting and retaining top talent and excel in day-to-day people and performance management tasks.



Have a strong understanding of Software Development, Linux & Networking Technologies. The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a software development engineer. You will also have a strong level of knowledge in Linux. You will enjoy keeping your technical skills reasonably current, to the point that you can still contribute to architecture discussions. You regularly take part in deep-dive troubleshooting exercises and drive technical post-mortem discussions to identify the root cause of complex issues.



Have strong project & product management experience. The successful candidate will create product roadmaps for the team. This will include helping innovate and invent new value-add services layered on top of our existing services. You will need excellent technical project management skills to deliver product roadmap items as well as other cross-team projects. Experience with Agile methodologies is an advantage.



Know how to run a tight, lean, efficient operation. The right candidate will want to measure everything and be very data driven. He/she will excel at using metrics, monitoring and alarming to measure and improve the operational processes and performance of their team.

· Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field

· 5+ years of relevant, engineering experience, and at least 2 years of people management experience

· Minimum of five years experience operating mission critical online services

· Strong verbal and written communication skills and demonstrated technical leadership



· Strong business and technical vision

· Have experience in an internet operational environment, including multiple data centers and thousands of servers

· Know how to run a scrum for a high performing team and get things done

· Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment

· Strong knowledge of *NIX systems and one or more of Java, Python, Ruby.

· Track record of hiring and retaining great Engineers

· Have been successful working across organizational boundaries, bringing together people with diverse perspectives and experience to find solutions
title: DevOps Manager AWS Database Services at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)

UNI-09: $84,552.00 – $  99,470.00 per year


UNI-10: $95,137.00 – $111,927.00 per year

Its All Gravy is reinventing the way businesses send gifts to employees, clients, prospects, and partners. Our technology platform and fulfillment operations combine the convenience of e-commerce with the elegance of a Tiffanys box. We are seeking a senior-level Ruby application engineer with Ruby on Rails experience to join or growing team.  The candidate should have a passion for clean, well-tested code, as well as a desire to learn and try new tools and technologies.

Our current technology stack and systems include:

   Ruby on Rails

   Github

   AWS

   Heroku

   Mandrill and Mailchimp

   Shipstation

   Spree e-commerce storefront

   Stripe

Experience

We are looking for a full-stack Ruby engineer.  The candidate should have experience with a range of development and conceptual skillsets, from CSS and HTML to database design.  For example, you do not need to be a JavaScript expert, but you should be comfortable with jQuery and know the principals of good database design.

Required Qualifications:

   At least 5 years of hands on work experience with Ruby-on-Rails as a developer or software engineer

Our office is housed inside a sparkling new, 10,000 square foot, super green (LEED Certified) office in Charlotte. Pretty cool, right? You won't be the first to think so.

We pride ourselves on helping our clients make deeper connections with employees and clients. We strive to give our employees the opportunity to grow and thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment. We want every person on our team to feel ownership over our vision and direction as a company. We'll do all we can to get you there.

Cockroach Labs is the team behind CockroachDB, an open source database whose mission is Make Data Easy. CockroachDB - so named for its survivability and scalability - will survive data center-scale outages, maintain strong consistency through ACID transactions, and enable developers to build scalable applications. Our Backend Engineers act as both architect and programmer, designing, coding, and testing the core of this distributed, open source database. Their focus is on building a scalable, reliable, robust, usable, secure, performant database.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Designing, building and testing features directly from the CockroachDB design document.

  • Being an enthusiastic and personable teammate, open to code reviewing and otherwise partnering with other engineers.

description:
Solium needs developers who want to write great programs.


Do you want to work with a system that gets a half million logins from one hundred thousand users per month? Do you want to write code for an industry-leading financial services platform that transacts more than ten billion dollars a year? Do you think it would be cool to be a part of the team that expands this platform to transact one trillion dollars for ten million users?


You aren't dogmatic; you're pragmatic. You know that "agile" doesn't mean scrum but adapting to deliver value to customers. You care about automated tests and code reviews, and when the build breaks, you don't run git blame. You find the root cause and fix it. You embrace the hard problems like localization, security, and timezones.


It doesn't matter if it's Ant or Gradle, Struts or Spring, jQuery or GWT - you know it or you can pick it up. You care about building commercial products that people use - technology is just a means to an end. We are looking for developers of all experience levels to help us build a fast, reliable, secure, and resilient enterprise platform on a global scale.


Things we believe:



  • Results matter, not the clock.

  • Code and technology are what we use to solve problems, not the whole of our job.

  • Free tools are great unless they aren't the best. We use high-end Linux workstations with big monitors and tools like IDEA, JRebel and the Atlassian suite to keep us in the zone.


Things we like:



  • Prior experience with production large-scale distributed systems

  • Prior experience with technologies we use (Java, Spring, GWT, Struts, JPA, EJB, REST)

  • A hunger for tracking down root causes - no matter how deep the rabbit hole

  • A BS in CS is appreciated but not necessary with the right background


What you'll do:



  • Be customer focused - learn about the business to help bring value to our customers

  • Act technology driven - design, implement, and test new functionality

  • Work closely with QA - we fix our own bugs

  • Work with Product Management to deliver material value to our clients

  • Do full stack dev from the DB to the UI

  • Leverage your experience to help the whole team get better


What you'll get:



  • Market rate salary based on experience

  • Participation in annual bonus plan and stock incentives

  • Share Purchase Plan with company contributions (we are public and profitable!)

  • Casual Environment - we aren’t a bank, they just happen to be clients

  • 20 Paid Days off + 11 stat holidays (and 4 week sabbatical after five years)

  • The occasional spontaneous Nerf War


If you've read this far and you're thinking "I want to be a part of this", we agree! Just send an email to dev-careers@solium.com and we'll talk about how your career is about to get better.
title: Software Developer at Solium (Calgary, AB, Canada)

description:
Solutions Architect/Lead

Job Description
 


The Lead / Architect is responsible for leading the specifications, design, and development of large-scale, Internet-based applications, frameworks and platforms. The Solutions Architect will work as a leading member of the Product Development team and, more specifically, the Central Technology Group to support and enhance the application architecture and the framework. The Lead / Architect will frequently be tasked with researching new tools and technologies and asked to come up with recommendations on how they can be used in Cvent applications. The Lead / Architect will also be expected to actively participate in design and implementation of projects featuring a high degree of technical complexity and/or scalability and performance implications.

What You Will Be Doing



  • Spec, design, develop, and debug scalable and high-performance, service-based web applications

  • Play a leading role in supporting and enhancing the architecture and the framework of Cvent applications

  • Help define technical solutions and a unified framework from the design and architecture through development, testing and release

  • Help guide the technology directions by recommending specific technologies to pursue, suggesting training and staff development activities

  • Identify and address technical debt as our applications evolve

  • Conduct performance-testing by using application profiler and load-testing tools

  • Define and implement automated build, deployment, and testing procedures

  • Identify and resolve potential application security vulnerabilities

  • Improve system scalability and application isolation

description:
Greenhouse's Tech Leads are both technical and managerial, so you'll use both sides of your brain each day: writing code, helping to grow your team, or running systems architecture and design planning sessions. Some weeks you'll code more, while other weeks you'll spend more time mentoring, reviewing code, and pair programming. 


Greenhouse's fast growth, plus our focus on continuous improvement, means that every week you'll see something new. We're at an interesting stage in our growth: we're big enough to have stability, great development practices, and tons of interesting technical challenges, but we're small enough so that every engineer has a big impact on our code and product. Over the next year, Tech Leads will be heavily involved in tackling: 



  • Scaling from 100M requests per month to 500M requests per month

  • Building and deploying a globally distributed system with sharding, read/write splitting, and HA

  • Parallelizing large transactions with Spark/MapReduce

  • Improving page load time by 30%

  • Building Greenhouse's mobile app


We use Ruby on Rails and Javascript with Angular & React. We take testing seriously, and have over 8k tests covering our system, maintain a green CI build, and run our shop with a mix of Kanban/Kaizen and XP practices. We also give Tech Leads autonomy to run their teams and to be iterative in their approach to working together. Our technical leaders are a group of hard-working, humble, curious, and people-centric folks who enable engineers on their teams to do the best work of their careers- and they do pretty awesome work themselves!

description:
Job Title: Director, Planning and Communications


Job ID: 5412


Full/Part Time: Full-Time Regular/Temporary: Regular


Job Code: 3312 Administrator II


Job Grade: Range A


Department: IT VP & CIO-8280


Responsibilities


Information Technology (IT) seeks a leader to promote the effective use of technical communications and planning to support the information needs of our students, faculty and staff. Under the general direction of the Vice President for Information Technology and as a member of the IT Leadership Team, the Director for Planning and Communications is responsible for providing leadership for IT communications, IT strategic planning, provides leadership for IT portfolio management, and management of significant projects and initiatives within the Information Technology division. The Director develops and manages the internal and external communication strategy for Information Technology. A key component of the external communication strategy includes the development and management of the IT web presence, including the IT website and social media accounts (e.g. Twitter). Responsibilities of the Director also includes IT Training, participation in productivity improvement initiatives, business continuity, and service on various university and hiring committees. The Director is responsible for establishing and implementing policies, procedures and projects that reflect the mission and goals of the entire IT division and the University; provides broad IT leadership to continually extend and improve the service levels for CSUN students, faculty and staff in support of the University's mission; assists the University community in leveraging technology in their pursuit of student education and University business; provides strategic and tactical technical leadership to the University with regards to current and future technology solutions; cultivates professional development within IT by providing opportunities for training in technical skills, leadership, project management and creative problem solving; closely monitors technology trends in the higher education industry as well as the world at large, and participates in meaningful exchange of ideas and information with other institutions to improve and expand the use of technology at CSUN. Undertakes special projects as directed.


Qualifications


Minimum of five years progressively increasing experience coordinating projects and communications, or related experience. Experience in higher education is desirable. Prior experience with project management strongly preferred. Prior experience coordinating multiple forms of communications including web, print, and social media communications strongly preferred.


Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule


Salary is commensurate with knowledge, skills, and experience. The university offers an excellent benefit package.


How To Apply


Candidates must submit a cover letter, current resume including the names of three professional references, and salary history for the last five years. Please complete the CSUN on-line application/resume upload submission process in order to be considered for any open position within the university and its auxiliaries. The hiring department will contact the best qualified candidates and invite them to participate in the interview process.


Application Screening begins on May 11, 2016, and will continue until position is filled.


In order to be considered in the initial review, applications must be submitted prior to the date listed above. Application submissions received after the application screening date will be reviewed at the discretion of the University.


For more detailed information on the application and hiring process, please view the link below: http://www.csun.edu/careers/


California State University, Northridge is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.


PI93676785
title: Director, Planning and Communications at California State University - Northridge - CSUN (Los Angeles, CA)

description:
Prime Now is one of Amazon's benefits for Prime members, which offers one-hour delivery on tens of thousands of daily essentials through a new mobile app. With Amazon Flex, individuals can now be their own boss while earning up to $25 or more delivering ultra-fast Prime Now and Restaurant orders. Both Amazon Flex and delivery experience of Prime Now are powered by the Flex App, which is available on iOS and Android. The Flex App works in concert with our advanced logistics systems and technology in the Flex Platform. The Flex App and Platform will allow the delivery partner to onboard, schedule delivery times in advance or on demand, guide them through their deliveries with in-app mapping and navigation, and more. You can find out more about Amazon Flex, our newest delivery innovation, at flex.amazon.com. Come join the team and help us make history!



As part of this new org, we are building new development teams in Amazon's Austin office. This is a great opportunity to help establish Amazon Flex's presence in this dev centre and set the technical direction from day one while working on a V1 product.


  • Bachelor's degree and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

  • 3+ years of software development experience in Objective C, and Cocoa Touch Frameworks.

  • Shipped applications on the iOS App Store.

  • Knowledge of UIKit, GCD, Auto Layout, iOS memory management.

  • Knowledge of Xcode and associated tools like Instruments.

  • Experience building mobile apps that access RESTful services.




  • 5+ years of software development experience.

  • Experience in building high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems.

  • Experience with databases and Core Data.
