description:
We are looking for a passionate mobile web developer, who has great experiences with Javascript, HTML5 and CSS (SASS/LESS). You should have 5 years work experience and at least 3 year of web development. If so, we have a great job to offer you!


As web developer at Globalmouth you will be developing responsive, adaptive and mobile websites as well as web apps with different Javascript frameworks, HTML5/CSS3 for some of our clients.


Our clients are both Enterprise companies (such as TeliaSonera, Svenska Spel, Bingolotto TV4 and The Boston Consulting Group) as well as some Joint Ventures and small startups that need support from a great tech team as Globalmouth.


You could develop in any environment you prefer as long as you discuss it with your team mates and then plan and report what you are doing in our Atlassian stack (Jira, Tempo, Confluence) and check in and out your code in our Git repositories. We supply you with hardware that you need to get the job done, and you can work where and whenever you like as long as you do what you should do and hopefully a bit more. But if you prefer to come to the office, we´ve got a great desk with 2 widescreens and some amazing coffee and multitalented colleges that can make you even more productive.


If you are fluent in speaking English and have or are about to move to Sweden then you are extra interesting for us, since most of our existing team members and clients have international ambitions!


Today we have team members from more than 10 nationalities in our downtown Stockholm office at Birger Jarlsgatan 18.


No recruiters. Recruiting new talents is way to important for us.
title: Mobile Web Developer at Globalmouth AB (Stockholm, Sweden)

description:
TES is looking for senior software engineers to build and scale our quickly-growing education technology platform.


What you'll do

There's lots to do: You'll work on our San Francisco team designing and building new microservices to help teachers in their classrooms. You'll collaborate with our London teams building REST APIs and writing front-end javascript. You'll write code that powers simple and beautiful UI and makes teachers excited to use the platform. You'll work with our AWS data pipeline to make sure that the work you're doing is having a meaningful impact.
title: Senior Software Engineer at TES USA (Wikispaces, Blendspace) (San Francisco, CA)

description:
Summary of Position – Software Engineer


This position on the News Team is responsible for designing, implementing, testing and supporting Business Wire’s internal web sites, client/server applications and software infrastructure.


Work on a small development team with other engineers, architects, and project managers in an Agile Development/QA/Production environment to create and support software applications which include, but are not limited to, editorial workflow, document editing, client billing, interfaces to supporting systems and more.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities


Duties include the following (other duties may be assigned):



  • Design software applications based on specific or general business requirements

  • Write, debug, test, and document high-availability software

  • Work closely with business analysts, users and architects to jointly develop top quality applications

  • Work with ever increasing independence on enhancements to familiar applications as experience grows

  • Provide accurate estimates of development time to implement business requirements for a project and offer suggestions for changes that could reduce development time
title: Software Engineer - News Team at Business Wire (San Francisco, CA)

description:
Frontend Developer Angular JS 


We are looking for an experienced front-end developer to complete our small innovative Start Up based in Amsterdam. With our crowdfunding platform focused on sustainable projects, we are aiming to create a positive impact on community and environment.


CHANGE THE WORLD, ONE LINE OF CODE AT A TIME


The smart guys in our development team built our system from scratch and they're eager to share all their insights. It is a custom built crowdfunding application, integrated with several advanced off-the-shelve fin-tech solutions. We are reforming the current financial industry by creating a disruptive alternative to conventional bank loans, enabling the way for more innovative dreams to come true. This needs a progressively advancing web application. Are you ready to join us in this challenge?


OUR TEAM


Oneplanetcrowd has a young, motivated, international team that established a new way of financing innovative sustainable projects and thereby creating a positive impact on environment or community. Oneplanetcrowd successfully raised finance for over 100 entrepreneurs such as Snappcar, Mobypark & Peerby. You will work directly with the managing director, platform supervisor and our lead front-end developer.


You will get a lot of responsibility and opportunities to influence the decision making process and roadmap.


WORKING AT ONEPLANETCROWD


Oneplanetcrowd is a young successful company situated in a beautiful building in the heart of Amsterdam (Royal Tropical Institute). As part of our team, you will be challenged and have lots of opportunities to grow. The atmosphere is informal but ambitious and we think personal development is of crucial importance.



  • First of all, a lot of responsibility and room for initiative.

  • Work worth doing: disrupting the traditional financial industry

  • The opportunity to hop onto a fast moving train

  • Financial compensation conform market standards

  • 25 holiday days (based on 40 h work week)

  • Pension scheme

  • Good gear (pick your own tools!)


WHICH COMPETENCIES ARE MISSING TO COMPLETE OUR TEAM?



  • You design new features and translate user-stories into technical requirements

  • You proactively identify possible technical challenges and come up with solutions

  • You implement and code new features, improvements and updates to the platform

  • You build responsive reusable component-based UIs using SASS, HTML & JavaScript

  • You advocate for best practices and standards

  • You work with our senior front-ender, who will help you get familiar with our codebase

  • You find and tackle performance issues

  • You feel at least some affinity with sustainability and/or finance

  • You understand the balance between perfection (things can always be better) and timely delivery

  • You want to work on-site in our team and have a valid permit to work in NL / EU.


IF YOU ARE …



  • Experienced with developing complex web applications

  • You dream of HTML/CSS and Javascript (AngularJS would be even better)

  • You are experienced with GIT and scrum

  • Responsiveness and mobile compatibility are old news for you

  • And Various CI tools, Gulp and Grunt are what you eat for breakfast


AND …


You like to work independently and eventually manage other developers, you advocate for best practices and standards and you are strong in analytical thinking and a problem solver by nature.


FEEL WELCOME TO CONTACT US


By sending your CV and motivation to Nathan@oneplanetcrowd.nl . Please make sure you describe any relevant experience you have and what your ambitions are as a developer. If you have any questions contact Maarten de Jong or Nathan Alder through +31 (0) 20 568 2070.
title: Frontend Developer Angular JS at Oneplanetcrowd (Amsterdam, Netherlands)

description:
We're looking for a strong, client-facing Sitecore development lead who works well leading and participating on 100% distributed teams.


You'll work with our Sitecore Practice Lead, and other developers to architect and build content management and multi-channel marketing solutions for clients and our agency partners.


Experience with Sitecore Experience Database, the enterprise marketing stack, and personalization will go a long way.  We prize our ability to consult clients on the strategic use of Sitecore and other digital experience management technology.


Most of our Sitecore implementations typically involve integration with third party services, so the ability to think creatively to leverage the strengths of the CMS to make seamless integrations possible is a key requirement.


This is a remote position in which you work from your home office, with occasional travel for onsite work with clients and team collaboration.
title: Sitecore Developer, Client Facing Engagement Lead, Remote at Simple [A] (Austin, TX) (allows remote)

description:
DAILY MENU



  • Design mobile and web interaction flow & information architecture in the creation of site maps, hierarchies, categorizations, navigation, and metadata

  • Develop conceptual diagrams, personas, customer journey maps, wireframes, storyboards, low fidelity prototypes that communicate high-level design strategies and detailed interaction behaviors

  • Create and rapidly iterate on ideas and develop them via storyboards, user flows, mock-ups, and prototypes, or other methods

  • Use insights gathered from in-depth interviews, focus groups, analytics, and usability testing, A/B testing to inform deliverables

  • Provide design leadership to technical teams by hosting on-going application reviews and promoting a shared understanding of the customer-centric intersection between design, business and technology

  • Strong practical knowledge of user-centered design methodologies, usability principles, web-based and mobile information architecture and design.

  • Work effectively in an iterative, agile environment and collaborate with product owners, engineers, and designers to define and produce solutions
title: UX Engineer at Pampered Chef (Addison, IL)

description:
Ready for a chance to learn new technologies and work with awesome people while taking ownership of Android development projects? CrossComm is looking for a great candidate to join its agile development team in Durham, NC to serve as its Google authority and Android visionary for projects. This position reports directly to our Chief Software Architect. We want a perfect cultural and technical fit but don't worry we are not expecting a perfect person. Apply if the following excites you in your next job:  



  • Cutting Edge Technology Exposure: we have a track record from 16 years of being in business, but we stay on the forefront of technology from developing one of the first 500 apps on the iTunes App store on Day 1 to becoming an early Android adopter on v1.5.

  • Work/Life Balance: we honor great work and producing great deliverables- not sitting in the office all night 

  • Management Team That Cares: report directly to our Chief Software Architect, who has a Masters in Computer Science, and work with our President/Founder with over 15 years software development experience and also trained with a Computer Science Degree, and work with a CEO who enjoys providing clear goals, treats & trivia each month, and does push-ups every time we start a new project-what's not to love?
title: Sr. Android Developer at CrossComm (Durham, NC)

description:
EYTYS is looking for a full stack web developer to join the team at the Eytys HQ in Stockholm.


Eytys is working towards becoming a next-gen, fully digitalized organization, finding new and innovative ways to communicate with customers as well as conduct operations. While many non-tech companies lag behind the ongoing developments of the internet age - we want to be at the forefront of it. The right candidate should have a keen interest in technology, as well as what can be accomplished with it.


You will work alongside the Technical Director to further develop the Eytys website, as well as the applications and services used for business operations, both in-house and external. With a holistic approach you will tackle a wide array problems ranging from frontend development to backend, including but not limited to: integrations with different APIs, collecting and analyzing data to improving and innovating business processes.


As part of the Eytys team you will:



  • Work with the development of the website, e-commerce, and other externally facing services

  • Develop in-house applications to facilitate business operations and optimize productivity

  • Integrate applications to create seamless and effortless business operations, minimizing unnecessary manual work and creating full data transparency

  • Work with collecting and managing data to use for business intelligence (analytics)

  • Work on improving, and finding new ways, to how the company conducts its business digitally

  • Work with frontend as well as backend development. Technologies we currently use are: Node, Mongo, Webpack, Backbone and LAMP
title: Full Stack Web Developer at EYTYS (Stockholm, Sweden)

description:
Join our fast growing, highly motivated international team as a Senior Software Engineer with our HERE Urban Mobility product group. 



HERE is a leader in mapping and location technology. We enable rich, real-time location applications and experiences for consumers, vehicles, enterprises and cities. Our open location platform is accessible to all customers who seek to leverage the power of location in their businesses.
 
We are looking for experienced server-side developers to develop cutting-edge backend solutions to reach millions of mobile devices. In this role you will be a part of a dynamic, agile, high-achieving team, which is creating the most innovative location-based services for our customers around the globe.



  • You will be especially active in the field of big data analytics, patterns recognition and involved in machine learning or AI activities.



  • Depending on your qualifications and interest, you will also be closely involved in architectural definition, product specification and/or user interface specifications. 



  • Success will demand the ability to learn quickly, adapt and apply knowledge into practice while continuously improving our products and services and growing your skillset.
title: Sr. Software Engineer (Java/Python/Machine Learning) at HERE (Berlin, Germany)

description:
Deine Aufgaben…



  • Du konzipierst, entwickelst und pflegst unsere JavaScript-Webanwendungen sowie Mobile Apps

description:
We are looking for a strong Developer in Test (WEB) to help us to continue to deliver new systems and product enhancements to our clients and to help support, maintain and improve the quality of our existing systems.


This is a new and impactful role focusing on our web based client portal. The person in this role will shape and develop our approach to testing by helping to establish process and practices for automated testing.


Our emerging test function will be staffed by testers who are are creative, technically aware, highly skilled and driven towards continuous improvement.


Testing needs to be an integral part of our development process and a talented Developer in Test (web) is required to set up the frameworks to deliver automated testing for our web based client portal.


We work in a collaborative environment so the lead Developer in Test (web) is expected to contribute to planning, analyse requirements and, working alongside product managers and developers, formulate and execute acceptance tests as part of wider delivery frameworks.


You will be a key part of a Kobalt-wide testing community and will be dedicated to a domain-specific team, offering domain expertise to developers, product managers and the wider business.


In time this team will grow and you will be able to manage and mentor more junior members of the team or dedicate yourself to the evolution of the testing function in other ways.
title: Web Portal Developer In Test at Kobalt Music Group (London, UK)

title: Remote Technical Applications Developer at Industrial Forestry Service Ltd. (Vancouver, BC, Canada)

RESPONSIBILITIES

title: Senior Web Developer - C#/.Net (Work Remote!) at Tastefully Simple (Alexandria, MN)

description:
eBay is one of the world’s largest online marketplaces, connecting people with the things they need and love virtually anytime, anywhere. eBay has 157 million active buyers globally and more than 800 million live individual and merchant listings at any given time, the majority of which is new and fixed-price merchandise. With mobile apps available in 190 countries, eBay delivers a personalized shopping experience and seamless access to inventory from down the street and around the world. Tailored shopping experiences, including eBay Fashion and eBay Motors, customize buying and selling; and eBay provides variety and choice for sellers by enabling them to offer goods through online, mobile and local channels to consumers around the world. eBay is looking to redesign existing CMS solutions.
We are looking for an experienced Senior Drupal Architect with a proven track record demonstrating mastery of Drupal architecture and software engineering and who is passionate in building personalized experiences. As a senior Drupal architect in our Berlin office, you will develop the technical strategy and development plan for multilingual/multi-domain CMS platforms in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
The senior Drupal architect will be part of the Marketing Technology Product Development team, which supports teams through public websites, mobile applications, emails solutions and other extensions of the digital experience.
The ideal candidate will have a strong experience in defining, designing, planning and building business systems using an existing framework or building it from the ground up.

As a member of the team, you will have excellent communications skills, proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional and global teams and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

The successful candidate will also have strong problem solving skills and can quickly adapt to evolving business needs.


Responsibilities



  • Architect personalized scalable global Drupal CMS systems.

  • Hands-on development, incl. contribution to community modules.

  • Design and develop components & strategies in the cloud to support scalability, high availability, performance, monitoring, disaster recovery, etc.

  • Run POCs on relevant cutting edge and open-source experimental technologies.

  • Estimate and scope development tasks, and make recommendations for innovations and improvements relating to software component designs, including reviewing the work of third-parties vendors and team member.

  • Develop and executes Acceptance Test Driven Development (ATDD) approach to ensure software quality.

  • Manage and/or mentor internal and external teams from vendors and ensure all deliverables are well tested and of high quality.

  • Communication to stakeholders worldwide.


Qualifications



  • Expert in both hands-on and architecture of Drupal 7 projects and proficient in related web technologies like PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS3, and JavaScript.

  • Experienced in building adaptive, multiscreen user experiences.

  • Experienced in test automation and ideally Test Driven Development.

  • Strong troubleshooting, debugging & diagnostics skills.

  • Proficient with code repositories including Git specifically.

  • Deep SQL database experience (Oracle, MS SQL, My SQL)

  • Working knowledge of web services (Apache).

  • Cutting-edge grasp of SEO-friendly practices and Google Analytics.

  • Working experience in agile teams.

  • Excellent communication skills.

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience required.

  • Fluency in English required, additional languages preferred


Benefits



  • A chance to interact with other teams across eBay, and influence the future of technology at the company. We work closely with teams in Europe and USA.

  • Opportunities for travel, conference attendance and speaking.

  • A competitive salary, great benefits, and excellent working conditions.

  • Silicon Valley amenities iPhones, MacBook Pro's, crazy high spec developer machines, and great office facilities.

  • An opportunity to build applications to serve millions of eBay users worldwide.
title: Senior Drupal Architect / Developer at eBay (Berlin, Germany)

description:
Bluebeam Software plays a critical behind-the-scenes role in some of the biggest construction projects in the world.  Bluebeam's Revu applications makes it possible for construction professionals to collaborate in a paperless ecosystem — all the way from initial plans through the last day on the job site.


We have HUGE plans for the future of our paperless ecosystem, and we're growing quickly. We're looking for a Software Development Manager to help mature our engineering practices and lead the team that build our mobile and Mac software products.


Bluebeamers are smart, funny, opinionated, friendly (and quirky, but in a lovable way).  We love our customers, and we build products that help them work quickly and accurately.


So, if you'd like to lead our awesome mobile and Mac teams and help them to solve some challenging, real-world problems and build kick-butt systems, read on...


The role



  • Develop and implement hiring plans to align with business goals and priorities

  • Collaborate with architects, directors, product managers, project managers, quality assurance, and operations to align team direction and product delivery

  • Ensure team’s understanding of business goals, priorities, and how they align with customer needs and business direction

  • Coach team members to help them develop their growth path here at Bluebeam

  • Provide hands-on technical team leadership to ensure software development principles are understood and followed

  • Be an advocate of software quality and ensure the team understands the importance of proper testing, automation, and software design

  • Contribute to the architecture design and direction of our products


Your experience



  • 5+ years of managing software development teams

  • BS or higher in computer science or related field, MS preferred

  • Strong experience in recruiting and hiring

  • Coaching/developing bright and talented developers

  • Comfortable interacting directly with executive team - explaining technical concepts to non-technical people

  • Experienced practitioner of Scrum or other Agile variant. (Not just theoretical knowledge)

  • End-to-end understanding and appreciation of a software product's lifecycle


If you think you are good match for the Bluebeam team, please send us the following:



  • Your Resume

  • A Cover Letter reflecting your personality and why you are a fit for Bluebeam and this role


(Psssst…Be sure to proofread.  We pay attention to formatting, grammar, and all that good stuff!)


Learn more about Bluebeam here: http://careers.bluebeam.com/.
title: Software Development Manager  - Mobile and Mac teams at Bluebeam Software, Inc. (Pasadena, CA)

description:
Bluebeam is building a new team and is focused on finding some highly motivated, talented, JavaScript developers with full stack web application development experience. If you are a computer science graduate with OO design experience and a passion for building high-complexity, extensible, JavaScript web client applications, this is the job for you.  You should have extensive knowledge of the JavaScript language including ECMAScript 6 features and JSX syntax extensions.  You should have experience consuming, extending, and designing JavaScript frameworks. Knowledge of frameworks like React / Flux, AngularJS, lodash, jQuery, etc are a plus. You should have experience building and consuming RESTful web services.  In addition, you should be dangerous in ASP.NET 4.5, with general knowledge of MVC and Web API as a huge plus.


Want a peek at what you’ll be doing? You will play an integral role on a new team created to bring more of our core business product functionality to the web.  As part of the Bluebeam web application development team you will be charged with taking our flagship product into the future by participating in JavaScript client and RESTful web service design and development. Starting with laying the groundwork and initial releases, you’ll be a key contributor on our high throughput agile team working alongside other talented developers. You will have opportunities to contribute to our technical roadmap and will have exposure to a wide array of technologies including cutting edge frameworks, large scale image rendering, real-time collaboration services, 3D Image Processing, and Complex Algorithms, just to name a few.  


What we'd like to see in you:



  • 5+ years of experience in a related field

  • 1 year minimum of intensive JavaScript development, more is better

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher - Computer Science or equivalent field

  • Extensive knowledge of the JavaScript language including ECMAScript 6 features and JSX syntax extensions

  • Knowledge of frameworks like React / Flux, AngularJS, lodash, jQuery, etc are a plus

  • Experience with Node.js, Webpack, and npm.

  • Strong understanding of JavaScript performance and optimization

  • Web Development experience in .NET technologies, particularly C# 

  • Extensive use of APIs and understanding of HTTP and REST architecture

  • Experience using OO methodologies in designing software solutions

  • Strong understanding of design patterns and development frameworks such as MVC, MVVM, Flux

  • Proven ability to work in a rapid release production environment

  • Passion for delivering strong dependable code

  • Full understanding of the SDLC 

  • Comfort with working in an Agile/SCRUM environment


If you think you are a good match for Bluebeam, please send the following:



  • Cover Letter (Try to show us who you are.  If you send us the generic one you send to everyone else, we will be bummed.)

  • Resume

  • Web portfolio (Be prepared to discuss)


 Learn more about Bluebeam here. (Be sure to check out the engineering section and our videos!)
title: Sr. Front End Developer at Bluebeam Software, Inc. (Pasadena, CA)

description:
Contentful makes content management developer friendly with an API-driven approach. Ten thousands of web and mobile developers have used Contentful's cloud-based content management backend to deliver their editorial team's content to any device platform. Customers like Nike, Urban Outfitters, Playboy, and Axel Springer leverage Contentful's APIs to power mission critical web apps, mobile apps, and many other smart device experiences. Founded in 2012, Contentful is venture backed, headquartered in Berlin, and experiencing rapid growth.


As a Rails developer, you’ll work on vital core components of our platform that are built using Rails and Ruby with high availability, high security, consistent and reliable performance requirements.

description:
About the Role / Why This Position Rocks


This is a great opportunity to show off your Drupal skills and put the Drupal best practices back into our Drupal experience. We are a passionate team of engineers who are poised to do some really interesting things. The long term goal is to build a highly available and fault tolerant architecture that will allow Drupal to excel at what it does best, build forms for content entry. We’re also looking to build out an API for both content syndication as well as the site rendering. We’ve got big plans to do exciting things. Right now, our biggest goal is to create a seamless experience for all of our different users so we need someone who can come in to help make this happen. We’re looking for someone who knows how to fix things, but won't lose sight of the big picture. A person that has an eye for implementing standards but isn’t afraid to innovate within those standards and also has an eye for what's next in technology and thinking about how we can bring new technology into the work we do.


Responsibilities / What Impact You Can Make

  • Fixing some custom module and theme implementations.

  • Building out some sales and editorial tools to help with content creation and syndication.

description:
As a Senior Software Engineer in DevOps you will work with various engineering teams to design, implement, and maintain an integrated code and asset production build and deployment pipeline consisting of tools and infrastructure. You have a strong passion for enabling development teams to move faster with greater confidence and agility. You are well versed in all things DevOps, and have a passion to help teams embrace Continuous Integration and Delivery.

Chef, Berkshelf, Kitchen and Jenkins are your daily work environment, as well as Docker and private and public cloud infrastructures (AWS, GCP, Azure, OpenStack, etc.). You wear the title of Jenkins Master proudly and have contributed to Jenkins plugins to enable teams to get the most out of Jenkins. Version control systems like GitHub and Perforce have no secrets for you and you understand the pros and cons of the various Git workflows and Streams in Perforce.

This position will be a significant contributor to the DevOps team responsible for building the tools and infrastructure to enable Disney Consumer Products and Interactive Media production teams to ship products with great quality and at a greater pace.


Responsibilities



  • Define and coordinate configuration management and release automation processes.

    • All build environments (dev, integration, stage, test and live) are operating efficiently.



  • Contribute to the implementation of the next generation production pipeline, leveraging best practices and lessons learned.

    • Actively involved in reviewing/committing code, and providing feedback into technical solutions.



  • Actively maintain technical knowledge of build and software systems to be able to troubleshoot problems with assistance from other members of the software/operations engineering groups.

    • Support production teams that leverage the code and asset pipelines.



  • Partner with production stakeholders, identify, assess, improve and create workflow and process for a highly effective content and code production pipeline.

    • Constantly improving production capability and speed by removing accumulated technical debts and shortcuts.



  • Research, evaluate and recommend new technology, software, toolset and best practices for continuous delivery.

    • Identify technical solutions that will support the creative and executive requirements.

We also like to balance the 'cool workin + cool livin' philosophy, so the team blends together nicely, keeps a balance on work & life, communication is open, and it's an overall fun place to work.

A better connected and more open edtech ecosystem. And more effective ways for everyone everywhere to access education, make discoveries, share knowledge, be inspired, and do big things. We accomplish all this by giving smart, creative, passionate people opportunities to create awesome. So here’s your opportunity.

Do you dream in SQL? When someone says CRUD, do you instantly think in terms of data manipulation? If you were given a Mongo book for your birthday, would you immediately trade it in for a book by Michael Stonebraker? If so, then we have a opportunity that you can not refuse. mobile.de, part of the eBay family , is the largest online vehicle trade site in Germany. The company is reinforcing its market leading position by undertaking major initiatives to extend the value we add to our customers.
This role sits within the Analytics Organization and directly partners with the New Car business unit to help driving their strategy and products through high quality analytics and customer immersion. Our goal is to put the customer at the heart of decision-making, harnessing best-in-class analytical methodologies.
We are looking for a highly analytical minded team member, who is passionate on supporting data driven decision making based on insights of customer behavior.


Data Engineer (m/f)


Your Responsibilities



  • Successfully partner with data scientists to support building fancy data products based on big data technology efficiently

  • Successfully partner with software engineers and system operators to design data generation and provisioning architectures.

  • Be responsible for Data Management / Engineering on our Hadoop-based data platform working in the fields: Data ingestion management, Data architecture and Data modelling, Data Quality and Data accessibility

  • Proficiency with more than one programming language (e.g., Java, Scala, Python) and experience with large scale software systems and architectures.



  • Desire to quickly learn new technologies and adopt tools that fit a problem best

What we offer?

description:
Our ideal Database Administrator is not a traditional Database Administrator! We are looking for a new team member who has a heavy background in production support & sql database administration. A SQL DBA with a history of development or production support, superhero-like troubleshooting skills, and a love for puzzles would have a field day in here! We are a small-medium sized tech shop and, often times, our team members are required to wear multiple hats. Through technology and innovative practices, our organization is quickly seperating itself from the competition. With our team growing, this is an ideal opportunity to step right in and really make a name for yourself!



  • Production Support

  • SQL Database Administration

  • Heavy Production Support/Development skills

  • Strong troubleshooting (.NET)

  • Independently diagnose and fix

  • Strong interaction with our organization – must be customer facing! This is not a back office operational role. You will be hands on!


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Strong experience in Database Administration in SQL Server (2008 and higher)

  • Experience in troubleshooting and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, blocking and deadlocking issues, replication issues, log shipping issues, connectivity issues, security issues etc.

  • Experience in Performance Tuning, Query Optimization, using Performance Monitor, SQL Profiler and other related monitoring and troubleshooting tools.

  • Ability to detect and troubleshoot SQL Server related CPU, memory, I/O, disk space and other resource contention.

  • Strong knowledge of backups, restores, recovery models, database shrink operations, DBCC commands, Clustering, Database mirroring, Replication.

  • Knowledge of SQL Server tools (Profiler, DTA, SSMS, SAC, SSCM, PerfMon, DMVs, system sprocs)

  • SQL Development – ability to write and troubleshoot SQL Code and design (stored procs, functions, tables, views, triggers, indexes, constraints)

  • SQL Database Operational support to tech users

  • May release code to production databases

description:
Req ID: 91550

Ericsson Overview

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and services to mobile and fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people and society to help shape a more sustainable world.

We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment where employees enhance their potential every day. Our employees live our vision, core values and guiding principles. They share a passion to win and a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning and growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to reach your career goals.

CoE RM, BUSS R&D Chennai, India.

CoE RM, BUSS R&D Chennai, India is part of the Global Ericsson organization with development centers in Chennai and Gurgaon. We are responsible for product development of Ericsson Next generation charging system and have association with Ericsson Research.

Mandatory Skills

  • Hands on Experience in Java, Multi-Threading, Collection F/W, J2EE.
  • Knowledge of REST/Web services
  • Good knowledge of OOAD principles, Design patterns and Database.
  • Good knowledge of SW Tools.
  • Experience in application development on Linux platform.
  • Experience of developing system/application architecture/framework
  • Must have good analytical Skills and aptitude to learn new technologies and cross-function domain
  • Experience and ability to work in a distributed environment, different time zones and cultural diversity
  • Must be a good team Player

Optional Skills (Added Advantage)

  • Knowledge of Telecom Systems specifically related to CRM, Product Catalog, Billing etc.
  • Worked with OSGi.
  • Worked with Cassandra (or any other no sql db).
  • Java scripting
  • Protocol knowledge (Diameter) and 3GPP specification knowledge
  • Knowledge/Exposure of SW development methodologies like XP, Scrum, Agile.
  • Should have good coaching and mentoring skills.

Responsibility:

  • Write design related documents such as System Architecture Description, Implementation Proposal for a system or subsystem within the project.
  • System design, coding and basic testing (both functional and non-functional) for his/her system/sub system and pertaining to product feature, Product customization and Trouble reports.

  • Should provide inputs to Configuration Manager regarding setup and maintenance, Software build and packaging.

  • Assist perpetration and coordinate Function, Non Function testing and Error resolution.
  • Maintain process compliance. Propagate processes and ways of working (WoW) awareness in the team contributing towards processes and technical innovation.

Preferred Qualification and Experience Requirements

  • Excellent Java knowledge and architecture principles
  • Software craftsmanship: Design Patterns, Design Principles & UML modeling

Minimum Qualification and Experience Requirements

description:
Who We Are:



Through the use of customer-centered design principles and our own customer experience driven development methodology (CXDD), we connect the dots between businesses, their customers and technology to reimagine physical and digital experiences. We combine iterative strategy, lean user experience, agile development and our patented development tools to deliver higher quality products to market faster.



We are a culture of innovators and thought leaders, educators and contributors to the technology community. We are passionate advocates of Agile principles, and adhere to them both in how we deliver our projects as well as how we run our business.

description:
Sr. Java Engineer - Cloud Services


This position is for a Sr. Cloud Services Java Developer who will help us develop our next gen airline services platform and also assist in migrating our legacy J2EE applications to the cloud. We will be leveraging Amazon Web Services with plans to integrate some exciting open source technologies such as NetflixOSS and Spring Cloud.


The ideal candidate for this role would have experience and passion for building horizontally scalable Java based microservices. You will have good experience building microservices using JAX-RS, Spring boot or Dropwizard. You will also have considerable experience in SOAP using Apache Axis or Apache CXF to support the migration of our legacy J2EE applications.


This role requires strong Java 7 or 8 knowledge and excellent understanding of deploying microservices on various application servers/servlet containers.


Key responsibilities:



  • Develop AWS based micro services solutions.

  • Maintain and assist in migration of Gogo's legacy J2EE applications.

  • Ensure unit tests are well written to provide maximum code coverage.

  • Assist with performance tuning of the built services.


Required Skills & Experience



  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or equivalent experience.

  • In-depth development experience with Java/J2EE.

  • Web Services, Web APIs, and microservices: JAX-RS, Spring Boot, DropWizard, JSON, Web-Sockets.

  • Solid experience with SQL and NoSQL based solutions.

  • Must have experience consuming SOAP and producing RESTful services.


Bonus Skills & Experience



  • Reactive programming using tools likes RxJava or Akka.

  • Netflix OSS tools such as Zuul, Eureka, Hysterix, or equivalents.

  • Cloud deployments, containers, and continuous integration – Jenkins, AWS code deploy etc.

  • Experience working in a DevOps environment.


Gogo's worldwide inflight Wi-Fi services have made internet and video entertainment a regular part of flying. We are a diverse group of technologists, marketers, strategists, and any other function you can think of- all working together in extraordinary harmony. And that's just the beginning.


We connect the aviation industry and its travelers with innovative technology and applications, and we do it all in a high-energy environment that welcomes the next challenge. Be prepared for a dynamic ride with people who are passionate about what they're building. Gogo?is an equal opportunity employer and works in compliance with both federal and state laws. We are committed to the concept regarding Equal Employment opportunity. Qualified candidates will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, marital status, medical condition or disability.? The EEO is the law and is available here.Gogo participates in E-Verify. Details in English and Spanish. Right to Work Statement in English and Spanish.

description:
Glasgow has been home to JP Morgan’s award winning Technology Centre since 1999. With more that 1400 Technologists designing, building and supporting global systems, our centre is one of the largest IT employers in Scotland. Our firm lives and breathes technology, with over 40,000 tech employees, centred in 13 strategic hubs around the world.


Due to ongoing investment, we have a newly created role for a Senior Data Developer, to job The Suitability Programme within our Asset Management business. The Suitability Programme delivers a technology solution to support many regulatory directives and requirements globally. The solution covers many different aspects of the client and trade lifecycle:



  • Capturing data from clients, from multiple channels (online and paper)

  • Algorithmically determining, from the captured data, the clients’ appetite for risk and their understanding of different investment products

  • Calculating the risk the different products clients may invest in

  • Pre-trade checks to ensure all trades made for a client are suitable

  • Post-trade checks to evaluate various aspects of each client’s overall portfolio

  • MIS, enabling reporting to internal compliance and external regulatory bodies

  • Developers will have the opportunity to work on all the above areas of the overall system. This role is for a developer with a particular focus on data using a range of technologies

  • The program is global and delivers to all jurisdictions

description:
We are hiring a full-time dev-ops person to join our core team who has significant experience configuring, managing, and monitoring frontend servers and backend services at scale. We have millions of visitors and quickly growing, and you will have the great opportunity on creating the infrastructure to support that.


Our backend tech stack currently includes Linux, Scala, Python, MySQL, Redis, Cassandra, Zookeeper, Kafka, Kubernetes, AWS (EC2, ELB, RDS, ElasticCache, Elastic Search, S3, EB, CloudFormation, VPC, etc).


Infrastructure-wise, we use AWS for almost everything. We use Elastic Beanstalk for our backend and front-end server deployment, S3 for static files and deployment bundles, Route 53 for DNS, RDS & ElastiCache for hosted MySQL and Redis, respectively. Outside of the AWS world, we use Incapsula as our cloud WAF & DDOS protection, Fast.ly as our static file CDN.
title: Devops at Sale Stock (Jakarta, Indonesia) (allows remote)

description:
As a front-end engineer in Sale Stock Indonesia, you write and push user-facing code that gets deployed in the same day to millions of users across Indonesia. We build our front-end codebase with love, tears, and the latest and greatest the open source world have available: Node.JS, React, React Native, Redux, GraphQL, Gulp, WebPack, and others. You’ll also work in the same team with people who have worked for world-class companies in Silicon Valley such as Facebook, Sony and Yahoo! — building products such as the PlayStation 4, Facebook Groups, Yahoo! Messenger and Mail. We’re a team of programmers trying to build a great product worth calling home about.


Front-end wise, we’re basically building a React-based isomorphic SPA. We pretty religiously follow the Flux architecture, with Flummox library as our chosen Flux library implementation. We use WebPack for code bundling and Gulp as task runner. The front-end app, although very much is an SPA, is served by a custom Node.JS-server (express-based) that does a pretty interesting server-rendering mechanism, which helps us achieve things like SEO and low-latency initial client-side rendering.
title: Front End Engineer at Sale Stock (Jakarta, Indonesia) (allows remote)

description:
We are looking for a backend engineer with passion and growth mentality to tackle various challenge in developing performant, resilient and scalable system. Our core system developed in Scala, supported with several microservices written in Node.js and Python with MySQL, Cassandra, and Redis as storage.


As a Software Engineer working on our Back-End development team you'll help us develop services, exposed through clean & thoughtful APIs, that will store and process product cataloging, inventory, membership, and order. We develop most of our services today in aforementioned technologies and languages, but our microservice architecture is language-agnostic and we're open to new tools and ideas.


Back-end wise, we use Scala’s Play as our web framework. We use MySQL as our primary persistence layer and Redis for more transient data. Our codebase is shaped to be a highly microservice-based infrastructure (although we’re still a monolith at current time), so our server code is very much async-driven; we use Future-based abstractions almost everywhere in the stack. We’re also in the process of adding Cassandra into the mix for our preliminary tracking infrastructure persistence layer. We use Docker heavily for both development and production deployment.
title: Back End Engineer at Sale Stock (Jakarta, Indonesia) (allows remote)

description:
We are currently looking for talented and creative mobile app developers to join our growing software team. We are working on a number of high profile projects for some of the world's biggest brands, and we need your help to build first class mobile applications using the latest technologies and development best practices.


You would be joining the company at an exciting time, as we are currently undergoing rapid expansion and you would have a chance to build your career in one the country’s leading suppliers of retail solutions. 


Our team is made up of people with a diverse range of backgrounds, so whatever your experience or skillset, we'd love to hear from you.


We have a reputation for being down-to-earth and great-to-work-with people who deliver nothing less than the best in everything we do and we work hard to create a challenging, supportive and satisfying working environment for all our employees.


As our next mobile app developer, your role would include:



  • Developing innovative, attractive and robust mobile apps.

  • Working as part of a skilled team, following Agile best practices.

  • Creating and building new products which use REPL Digital’s technology stack.

  • Delivering solutions using the latest technology & design patterns.
title: Mobile Software Developers (All Levels) at REPL Digital (Warwickshire, UK)

description:
adjust is a fast-growing mobile marketing analytics company with offices in Berlin, San Francisco, Tokyo, Sydney, Shanghai, Singapore, Sao Paulo, London, Paris and Istanbul. We build business intelligence for mobile apps, placing a high premium on scientific statistics, hand-in-glove UX, and lean, pragmatic product iteration.


We provide a sophisticated, open-source SDK that has been implemented in over 12,000 apps worldwide and almost every second device on earth. The SDKs are responsible for core tracking functions, storing and processing data locally as well as two-way communication with our servers. As a crucial piece of technology implemented in our clients’ apps, we need to ensure that it integrates easily and robustly carries out these key tracking functions on different plattforms.


Therefore, you will continously adjust our SDK to the external updates and testing its performance.You will learn how different mobile platforms work, focusing on the enginnering part in a close collaboration with our backend team.


Responsibilities:


-       Build clean and concise code to run on hundreds of millions of devices


-       Work closely with tech & product teams


-       Planning and realization of product features


-       Significant participation in core product design


-       Contribute ideas for the improvement of the overall solution
title: SDK Developer at adjust (Berlin, Deutschland)

description:
We believe coding is a creative craft which involves brainstorming, figuring out best solutions, and reinventing the web step by step. It involves technical skills, but also soft skills and entrepreneurship. Our team has strong beliefs and a strong focus on culture.


We work with PHP5.6 (looking to switch soon to PHP7), Symfony2 and 3, MySQL, Redis, AWS, Git, following the agile and lean startup methodologies. On frontend we use HTML5, Sass, Jquery, AngularJS, gulp and bower. We highly focus on scalability and high availability. We have designed our own continuous deployment process, using AWS. We introduce and experiment new technologies all the time.


The developer job at LastGear involves a lot of dedication and entrepreneurship. You will be involved in all the steps of software development, from architecture to scaling the projects to millions of users, from doing usability tests with people outside the team, to coming up with ideas for new features and improving existing features.


This is a full time position at our headquarters in Bucharest, Romania.
title: Senior PHP Developer for worldwide cars & food brands at LastGearPublishing (Bucharest, Romania)

description:
The sensor revolution is accelerating and we are in search of full-stack developers to work on revolutionary products that showcase terabytes of crowdsourced data collected from millions of  contributors’ mobile sensors across the globe.


Us:


OpenSignal is a London based start-up with the vision of harnessing the next billion sensors. Our mission is to become the global authority on wireless; our Wifi and mobile signal crowdsourcing apps have been downloaded over 15 million times, our public reports reach a wide audience and our OpenSignal Insights are purchased by key players in the telco industry. We are currently a team of 24 and you’ll be joining our developer team of 4 in a brand new office in the heart of Angel, Islington.You will work within cross-functional teams of 2 to 5 together with data scientists and mobile developers and have the opportunity to own and shape large chunks of the codebase.


Join us in Improving Signal, Together.


You :)


You lose yourself when coding and you'd rather stop eating than not being able to correct one more method and test whether it works as intended ;) (but really, we encourage lunches together, and afternoon walks to refresh your mind).The urge to write more code gets you up in the morning (that, and an alarm), and sometimes makes you stay late (#midnightcoding). In other words, you love the art of programming and we want you to share that passion when working with us (and no, working hours are NOT 6 to 23:59).


Your role:


You love learning and resolving unique and complex technical challenges: on the frontend, you will help in developing our websites (OpenSignal, WifiMapper), coverage maps, data visualization console, and public reports; on the backend, you will help in writing APIs used by our mobile apps and work on the data pipeline that receives and processes terabytes of contributed data. After a day at OpenSignal you’ll go to bed knowing you worked on revolutionary products that empower people with the information and tools to get better mobile connectivity in a hassle free way.


Our Stack & Workflow:



  • Our infrastructure is based on Amazon Web Services such as Elastic Load Balancing, Auto Scaling, EC2 instances and S3.

  • We enforce systematic peer reviews using pull requests and a release-based git branching model.

  • We use Vagrant and Ansible for virtualization and automation, Jenkins for continuous integration and deployment.

  • Our primary language in the backend is Python, we develop our APIs using Django REST Framework or Flask, we use Spark and Pandas in the pipeline.

  • Our main database is PostgreSQL, also using PostGIS for geographical data.

  • Our frontend toolchain includes JavaScript (ES2015), React with Flux, Browserify and Gulp as well as Sass with the Foundation framework.

  • We use D3.js for data visualization.
title: Full Stack Dev - Harness power of next billion sensors! at OpenSignal (London, UK)

description:
• Hands on technical role; contribute to all phases of the software development lifecycle, including the analysis, architecture, design, implementation, and QA

  • Collaboration on requirements; work with the Engineering, Product Management and Client Success teams to define features to help improve results for our customers and ourselves alike

  • Partner with our Data Mining and Analytics team to do analysis, build predictive models & optimization algorithms, and run experiments

  • Work closely with Operations/IT to assist with requirements and design of Hadoop clusters to handle very large scale; help with troubleshooting operations issues

  • Technology Stack: Core Java, Distributed computing System, Database Management System, Multi-threading, Algorithms, SQL, Hadoop, Pig, Hive, HBase, Flume Sqoop, Cassandra, Spark, Kafka, Oozie, Storm, Scala, cloud computing

description:
På Notified utvecklar vi nästa generations omvärldsbevakning. Genom vår egenutvecklade webbtjänst hjälper vi många av nordens ledande företag och organisationer att hålla koll på och förstå vad som skrivs om deras intresseområden online. Vi expanderar och söker därför en grym utvecklare till vårt kontor i Malmö.


Vad kommer du göra?


Första tiden kommer du att lära dig plattformen och ta dig an mindre uppgifter. Efter hand kommer du implementera större funktioner och ta ansvar för vidareutveckling.


Även om du har erfarenhet av både backend och frontend ser vi gärna att du tar ett grepp gällande frontendutvecklingen i form av design, struktur och optimering.


Vem är du?


Vi söker dig som brinner för utveckling och gärna med stort intresse för design och användarvänlighet.


Du bör ha några års erfarenhet med webbutveckling och det faller dig naturligt att hålla dig uppdaterad med det senaste inom utveckling t ex Angular och React. Ett krav är dock att du är bekant med utveckling i Visual Studio och MS SQL Server.


Du ser en positiv utmaning i att finna goda lösningar och kontinuerliga förbättringar som tillför värde till slutanvändarna och kollegorna. Sist men inte minst trivs du i en kreativ miljö, och lockas av tanken att arbeta i ett mindre men snabbt växande företag med stort eget ansvar!


Vad kan vi erbjuda?


Som utvecklare på Notified blir du del av ett tätt sammansvetsat gäng där vi inte gör skillnad på utvecklare och säljare. Dina insatser märks direkt och vi har kort sträcka från idé till implementation. Vi är ett ungt och drivet gäng som älskar det vi gör, och för oss är det viktigt att ha roligt på jobbet! Vi erbjuder en kreativ arbetsmiljö på Media Evolution City i Malmö med bra utvecklings-möjligheter.


Kika gärna in på vår hemsida www.notified.com för att få en bättre bild av vilka vi är!


Om du tycker att detta låter intressant och du tror att du är rätt person för jobbet, så ser vi fram din ansökan. Ansök genom att registrera dig på vår karriärssida på http://notified.teamtailor.com.


Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning, och ser därför extra gärna kvinnliga sökande.


I din ansökan ser vi gärna att du länkar till projekt du har varit involverad i och berättar lite när du trivs som bäst med dina arbetsuppgifter.


Sista ansökningsdatum är måndagen 29/5-2016, men ansök snarast då intervjuer sker löpande. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum.


Vi frågor kontakta gärna Mattias Axelsson: mattias.axelsson@notified.com eller 040-6857400.
title: Full-stack webbutvecklare med känsla för design till spännande SaaS-bolag at Notified (Malmö, Sweden)

description:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Job Summary:



Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests, and assists with the integration of new applications. Documents all development activity. Assists with training non-technical personnel. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.



Core Responsibilities:



-Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.



-Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under development, and customizes current applications. -Assists with the software update process for existing applications, and roll-outs of software releases.



-Participates in training representatives and operations staff on internally developed software applications.



-Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports.



-Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.



-Provides technical leadership throughout the design process and guidance with regards to practices, procedures and techniques. -Serves as a guide and mentor for junior-level Software Development Engineers.



-Works with Quality Assurance team to determine if applications fit specification and technical requirements.



-Displays in-depth knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, skills, and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty.



-Displays in-depth knowledge of, and ability to apply, process design and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design, and technical choices to internal audiences.



-Displays knowledge of, and ability to apply, project management skills.



-Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.



-Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.



-Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Job Specification:



-Requires 4-6 years of experience in software development with 2-3 years of experience in Telecom/Media developing large and critical systems



-4-6 years of experience in developing, deploying and administering Java applications using JAVA, J2EE

-3-6 years of experience in Java/J2EE, with web services technologies

-3-5 years of strong experience with XML(SAX/DOM), XSLT and SOAP

-2-4 Years of experience in developing applications in Oracle PL/SQL,Pentaho, ETL tools

-2-4 years of GUI/web development experience using Java/J2EE technologies and MVC framework will be plus

-2-4 years of experience in SOA

-Familiarity with BEA weblogic



-Bachelors Degree or Equivalent inEngineering or Computer Science



-Generally requires 5-8 years related experience

Our goal is to partner with the business and provide front line users with simple, easy to use capabilities that satisfy our Customers and improve the Employee and Customer experience. We are a DevOps team that uses Agile software development methods to quickly meet the business needs. Our team is known for being innovative and collaborative when providing solutions, and we have excellent relationships with our business partners.



As an OSSi engineer on the Comcast system engineering team, you will design, prototype, and support state of the art network management tools that monitor Comcast's customer premise equipment, HFC plant health/performance metric to ensure the best customer experience for Comcast's high speed data, IP telephony and video services. The OSS Tools team is a small and fast-moving team of world-class experts who are innovating in network management of Comcast's customer premise equipment and HFC plant. title: Senior Development Engineer at Comcast (Englewood, CO)

description:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





The Customer Interaction Systems (CIS) team is part of Comcast Cable's Technology & Product (T&P) organization and serves the larger company with application frameworks that facilitate the customer sales and service experience across multiple lines of business. Our software helps serve current and future Comcast customers.



Comcast is seeking an experienced software engineer responsible for designing, developing and maintaining Comcast's tools and service framework. The ideal candidate will have a strong Java background and web development experience. This individual will work in an agile environment, relying on strong problem solving and communication skills. As an experienced Software Engineer, they will be a technical leader on the team, having a large amount of input on technical design decisions and serving as a liaison to our stakeholders, primarily other development teams.





Core Responsibilities

-Producing technical designs and documentation at varying levels of granularity

-Writing production-quality, tested code

-Performing code reviews

-Collaborating with our technical operations teams to provide outstanding customer service

-Working with business stakeholders to understand their roadmaps and identify critical technical capabilities that need development.

-Partner with collaborating technical teams to ensure our systems are delivered with a focus on quality.

-Resisting the accrual of 'technical debt' in our systems.

-Working with product development teams to assist them in meeting their business goals through judicious application of CIS technologies.

-Mentoring more junior members of the technical staff.

-Building proof-of-concept systems or conducting exploratory experiments with new technology.

-Serving as an ambassador of CIS technologies to the broader technical community, both inside and outside Comcast, via a combination of authorship of technical papers, journal articles, and/or blog posts; and delivering presentations at technical conferences, meetups, user groups, etc.

-Keeps current with technological developments within the industry.

-Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews

literature, patents, and current practices relevant to the solution of

assigned projects.

-Other relevant duties as assigned.





Preferred Qualifications:

-7 years of relevant work experience, including extensive programming experience and strong object-oriented skills.

-BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field.

-Experience with Java and associated frameworks (Spring or Spring Boot)

Position Summary: The Commercial Network Engineer 2 position will be responsible for infrastructure and routing design, network strategy and implementation of the Comcast Commercial Network which combines the following services data, voice, and video-onto a single converged infrastructure for the Commercial service offerings. The Commercial Network Engineer will also provide expertise in real time analysis and diagnosis of network problems, and configuration and operation of Commercial service offerings, networks and devices.





Job Responsibilities:

- Create and document high-level and detailed network designs for Converged Commercial Networks, as well as for the augmentation of existing commercial networks

- Generate network configurations to support market augments and Converged Commercial Networks designs

- Develop and implement routing architectures for the roll-out of Metro Ethernet products

- Assist in the development and implementation planning for the roll out of future hardware and software versions of network devices.

- Participate in assigned interdepartmental technical projects

- Take a lead role on assigned interdepartmental technical projects

- Provide last tier On-Call support, focused on isolating and resolving network outages

- Build relationships with assigned markets through regular communications

- Provide technical training to operational units on Converged Commercial Networks technologies and features that are currently deployed in the network or will be in the future

- Work independently with little supervision while managing assigned projects and ensuring timely delivery of services

- Communicate applicable design guidelines and provide guidance to markets to ensure compliance





Qualifications/Education:

- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.

- The equivalent in related work experience and self-study may be substituted.

- Junos, Cisco and/or Carrier Ethernet certification(s) preferred.

- Generally requires 2-5 years of related experiences





Experience:

- Experience focused on design and routing expertise, forecasting, and implementation of IP router based high-speed technology

- In-depth knowledge and working experience in layer 2 switching technologies, including VLAN tagging (IEEE 802.1Q, IEEE 802.1ad)

- In-depth knowledge and working experience in layer 3 routing protocols RIPv2, OSPF or IS-IS, and BGP

- Specific knowledge of Cisco routers, especially the 7600, CRS-1, ASR9k, 2900, 3600 series is preferred.

- Specific knowledge of Juniper routers and switches, especially the MX and EX series.

- Specific knowledge of Ciena Carrier Ethernet switching gear.

- In-depth knowledge of Carrier Ethernet, its associated technologies (L2VPN, VPLS,VPWS) testing and OAM (IEEE 802.1ag RFC2544, Y.1731)

- Knowledge of database concepts and working knowledge in mysql is required

- Knowledge and practical use of scripting languages. PHP/Perl/Python preferred

- Solid written and verbal communication skills

- Demonstrated initiative to build relationships both internally and externally with minimal supervision/direction from management

- Proven ability to manage multiple tasks/projects as well as to lead small, directed projects.





Core Responsibilities

- Creates and documents all high-level and detailed network designs.

- Performs sustained engineering duties to support data, video, and voice products.

- Communicates applicable design guidelines and provides guidance to ensure compliance.

- Provide on-call support, focused on isolating and resolving network outages.

- Serves as execution resource for adjacent product and engineering teams to ensure smooth introduction of new products.

- Participate in the development and planning for the roll-out of future hardware and software versions of network devices.

As an online marketplace, technology underpins our entire business and we’re now beginning to build out a team of A-grade performers who have a desire to build a world-class technology platform. This position is for a Senior Scala Developer, or an experienced Java developer with an interest to learn Scala. We apply technological solutions to all areas of our business, so you’ll be building solutions that automate our supplier marketplace, enhance our user experience, power our supply chain and logistics, and build data and analytics tools to inform our operational decisions.


You’ll be reporting directly to the CTO and founders. If you’re a highly motivated top performer, this role offers you exciting long-term prospects with one of Australia’s fastest growing and innovative companies. We’re creating a powerful platform that’s truly unique and we need brains and passion to bring it to life.


In this role you’ll:



  • Enhance our platform and build a range of innovative features

  • Get to work with Scala and Java on the server side, HTML (+Bootstrap), Angular, and raw JS on the front-end, AWS, Slick, Spring and a custom built CMS

  • Help advise on the direction of our overall software stack and product roadmap

  • Work directly with the founders and CTO to help drive strategy and shape the direction of the business

  • Enjoy keeping up to date with the latest technologies and implement new ideas, as appropriate.

description:
Company Overview


Viral Launch is an industry leader in providing tools and services to help Amazon merchants build and grow their businesses. We work with nearly 2,000 merchants with some of our clients in the $100m/year echelon. 


Viral Launch's first tools and its primary SaaS platform was built by the CEO. With a small team of 8, we are now looking to bring on a lead developer to help us accelerate the rate which we are able to disrupt the market by building new tools and services.


Job Description


As lead developer you would be working with the Viral Launch team to build a variety of new software tools. Each new project/tool we build is unique and would offer you the opportunity to leverage your skills and ability to develop new products utilizing different technologies. This will keep the job interesting and break the monotony many software positions typically consist of.


As lead engineer, you are the boss! The world will be your oyster in the planning and execution of each project. 


Company Culture

description:
Why this role?



If you are passionate about our mission and would like to impact the broader scope of the industry - using a grass-roots effort to drive collaboration and change in a stagnant and inefficient marketplace - this is an unique opportunity for you.




Are you right for this job?



We are looking for someone with:




  • 3+ years in a systems administration and/or DevOps role supporting a software development team

  • Proven experience with Amazon Web Services administration and configuration

  • Demonstrated skill writing and managing Chef deployment scripts

  • Knowledgeable in Linux system administration and shell scripting

  • Experience automating tasks using Jenkins or similar tool

  • Basic understanding of git and source control standards

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and ability to interact with others in a professional manner

  • Ability to work in fast paced, dynamic environment

  • Detail-oriented





What will you do?




  • Support pre-production environments for Engineering

  • Develop and maintain automated deployment scripts

  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues with software deployments

  • Manage databases in pre-production environment

  • Manage pre-production cloud infrastructure



Why Remedy Partners?



Remedy Partners is an innovative healthcare services and technology company specializing in “bundled payment” programs. Bundled payments are an innovative new payment model that includes financial and performance accountability in episodes of care. Episode payment programs represent an important advance in the organization and financing of health care services in both the public and private sectors.



The company’s mission is to dramatically improve the quality and efficiency of healthcare delivery by developing and managing episodic payment programs in partnership with leading healthcare organizations.



We take our role seriously and constantly remind each other that every patient in Remedy’s program is someone’s mother, brother, father, sister, friend or other relative. Empathy for the challenges patients face after a hospitalization keeps us focused on the important role we can play.




To learn more about our company, mission and history:



Please visit our website, www.remedypartners.com



Remedy Partners is an equal opportunity employer and Remedy Partners considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. In addition, Remedy Partners provides reasonable accommodation to individuals with a disability in accordance with applicable laws.

description:
Position: Quality Assurance Analyst


Division: Information Technology















Information Technology team is looking for a Quality Assurance Analyst to work on enterprise and web applications. You will be working with a team of developers and network engineers, and also be involved in client meetings, scheduling and project management tasks.


We value creativity, quality of work, technical leadership, intelligence and an interest to learn. Our ideal candidate is flexible and must be skilled in testing, multi-tasking, time management, organization, creating documentation, and communication skills. Product life-cycle experience is a must, including requirements gathering, architecture, design, data modeling, product development, QA testing processes and procedures, deployment and post-deployment support.


The Quality Assurance Analyst will work with NAR departments and external partners and vendors to determine their application needs and determining the strategy for meeting these needs. Acting as an overall technology consultant, the Quality Assurance Analyst will help guide our business partners in making sound technology decisions. He / she will work and mentor junior staff in all phases of application testing cycle.


Quality Assurance Analyst will define testing types, levels and depth of quality assurance testing, determine acceptance criteria, and estimate duration of testing cycles. He / she will maintain project documentation. Additionally, Quality Assurance Analyst will maintain their technical expertise by keeping up with industry trends and news.


MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (NOT ALL-INCLUSIVE):



  • Analyze applications and business processes, and develop detailed testing plans and scripts.

  • Conduct QA testing of applications, including ongoing bug fix verifications. Analyze and report the test results. Create documentation to support application testing.

  • Build, maintain, document and extend regression and automation suites.

  • Assist developers in quickly investigating problems reported in UAT and production systems, and in reproducing the scenarios.

  • Contribute to the integrity of the test plans, test cases, test data, and test environments.

  • Open issue/defect reports and record problems in defect tracking software.

  • Lead the release management process.

  • Prepare testing estimates for proposed application releases.

  • Provide feedback on both technical and business issues. Research and evaluate solutions.

  • Develop and maintain functional as well as technical design specifications. Meet with users to define project requirements and functions.

  • Troubleshoot application issues in production, research and recommend solutions.

  • Meet project-related deadlines.

  • Attend training on an ongoing basis to keep skill set and technical expertise current.

  • Able to manage multiple projects.

  • Mentor staff and share information to allow for knowledge transfer.

  • Travel domestically, as necessary, to national, state and local association conferences.
