description:
About Q:


Q is building an operating system for physical space, backed by a comprehensive technology and service platform. Today, hundreds of companies in four cities trust Q to make their offices run better. We handle everything from catering to IT, to cleaning, plumbing and office supply management.


We also believe that creating good jobs is fundamental to our success. We treat all of our employees well — from software engineers to office cleaners. We know that 5-star service comes from talented, motivated people.


 Engineering @ Q:


Our software engineers own problems end to end. We iterate quickly and we learn from setbacks. We hire people we can trust and we get out of their way. We find the best ideas from across the industry and apply them here. We work closely with our colleagues in design, in product management, and in other parts of the company.


Our stack is currently Python, Django, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Docker, React, Flux, and Swift. We frequently experiment with other tools. We welcome excellent people of all backgrounds regardless of whether they have experience with the technologies we use. We value both those who want to specialize in a particular area and those who like to work across the stack.


It’s early and there are lots of big decisions to make. If you’re interested in playing a formative role on a fast growing team, we’d love to talk.


A sample of what you might work on:



  • Designing and building the APIs that power Q — across ordering, scheduling, fulfillment, customer service, and other areas

  • Building the web and mobile control panels to help office managers run their offices

  • Developing usable React components that help us iterate quickly across our tool set

  • Building the mobile app that our employees use to manage their work at customer sites

  • Working closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs and to build tools that give them superpowers

description:
Job Summary
Performs entry-level work within a research and development, science and engineering environment working in conjunction with Sandia staff on projects that involve applying integrated technical judgment--which requires using the scientific method to recognize and formulate problems, to collect data through observation and experimentation, and to formulate and test hypotheses.  Supports work in the fundamentals of science and engineering while applying an understanding of engineering and scientific principles. Assist in the creation and application of scientific theories and laws and engineering methods used within scientific and engineering disciplines to develop or demonstrate new designs, concepts, materials, machines, products, processes, or systems.









Primary Job Duties







Job assignments are focused in the area of Research and Development (R&D), and will vary based upon organization, discipline preference, and specific job requirements as defined in the job specification.

Duties may include assisting R&D staff with developmental research, analysis of technology and engineering options, project design, testing, formulating conclusions, data collection, and analyzing experimental data.

Job Specifications:


An opening exists for an exceptional undergraduate student candidate to conduct leading edge research in the area of advanced memristive/resistive memory (ReRAM). This research will support Sandia’s recently established effort in Brain Inspired Computing (BIC). In particular, this research aims to advance the suitability of oxide-based ReRAM devices for use in a Neural Processing Unit. The candidate’s primary responsibility will be to electrically characterize and model ReRAM devices. He or she will work closely with researchers at Sandia and our partners to investigate novel methods of fabricating, operating, and implementing these devices in BIC systems and to publish the results.
title: Student Intern - Brain Inspired Computing R&D Undergrad Summer at Sandia National Laboratories (Albuquerque, NM)

Assist in the creation and application of scientific theories and laws and engineering methods used within scientific and engineering disciplines to develop or demonstrate new designs, concepts, materials, machines, products, processes, or systems.









Primary Job Duties







Job assignments are focused in the area of Research and Development (R&D), and will vary based upon organization, discipline preference, and specific job requirements as defined in the job specification.

Duties may include working collaboratively with R&D staff with developmental research, analysis of technology and engineering options, project design, testing, formulating conclusions, data collection, and analyzing experimental data.

Job Specifications:


An opening exists for an exceptional graduate student candidate to conduct leading edge research in the area of advanced memristive/resistive memory (ReRAM). This research will support Sandia’s recently established effort in Brain Inspired Computing (BIC). In particular, this research aims to advance the suitability of oxide-based ReRAM devices for use in a Neural Processing Unit. The candidate’s primary responsibility will be to electrically characterize, model, and physically understand the behavior of novel ReRAM structures, and apply this knowledge to improve device characteristics in neural circuits. He or she will work closely with researchers at Sandia and our partners to investigate novel methods of fabricating, operating, and implementing these devices in BIC systems. Results will be published in journal articles and conference presentations.

description:
We are a flat, distributed, rapidly growing organization, with hundreds of Startup Weekend events, Startup Next pre-accelerators, Startup Digests and Reading Lists, and over twenty accelerators running throughout the year. As a Full-Stack Software Engineer, your day to day work will require a mix of supporting program operations, as well as building new software infrastructure to help our organization and community. You have experience in Agile, sustainable software development and deployment. Techstars utilizes a variety of technologies, and keeps an eye on products and tech that our portfolio companies create, for potentially incorporation into our platform. This is a full-time role for the Seattle, WA office.



As a full-stack developer, your day to day work could include any of the following:



  • Spec'ing out a new Ruby on Rails app to support Startup Weekend operations

  • Creating a Ruby script to run custom queries against a NoSQL database

  • Building an integration with a third-party JSON API

  • Working with a web designer to launch a new PHP microsite for Techstars.com

  • Creating D3 visualizations to feature in an upcoming blog post

  • Monitoring backend systems for performance and availability on New Relic

  • Fixing bugs at various layers of a Ruby on Rails application

  • Implementing a new RESTful JSON API endpoint


Our systems are built primarily in Ruby on Rails and JavaScript, but we aim to use the best tools for the job. We use several database technologies, including NoSQL solutions (MongoDB, Redis), as well as relational databases (MySQL, Postgres). We heavily utilize Open Source libraries, 3rd party APIs, and cloud infrastructure (DigitalOcean, AWS). We use GitHub for version control, and continuously test and deploy code to production. Some of our past projects were built using Python, Neo4J, and Google App Engine.

Assist in the creation and application of scientific theories and laws and engineering methods used within scientific and engineering disciplines to develop or demonstrate new designs, concepts, materials, machines, products, processes, or systems.

Primary Job Duties Job assignments are focused in the area of Research and Development (R&D), and will vary based upon organization, discipline preference, and specific job requirements as defined in the job specification.

Duties may include working collaboratively with R&D staff with developmental research, analysis of technology and engineering options, project design, testing, formulating conclusions, data collection, and analyzing experimental data.


Job Specifications:


An opening exists for an exceptional graduate student candidate to conduct leading edge research in the area of neuromorphic computing. In particular, this research aims to design and simulate an ultra-efficient resistive memory (ReRAM) crossbar based neural algorithm accelerator chip. This research will support Sandia’s recently established effort in Brain Inspired Computing (BIC). The candidate’s primary responsibility will be to simulate the execution of algorithms on the accelerator using both numerical and circuit simulation approaches and extract module-level performance and power characteristics. He or she will work with device researchers at Sandia and our partners to understand the effect of ReRAM properties on neural algorithm accelerator systems. Results will be published in journal articles and conference presentations.

description:
Snapshot


We’re looking for a games programmer with a passion for software creation and problem solving with a proactive, can­do attitude to overcoming technical challenges. To succeed in this role you will need to have a strong foundation in software engineering and enjoy working on a wide range of diverse and challenging problems within a results focused mission driven team.


The Team


As part of the Research Group, the Evaluation Team is tasked with measuring the performance of AI agents created by researchers. This is done by providing challenges and tasks for agents to solve. These range from classic arcade games to first­ person games using modern 3D engines to bespoke mini­ games tailored to answer specific research questions. The output from the Evaluation Team is used by the entire organisation to track progress and is crucial in helping steer DeepMind’s research forward.


Projects we’ve worked on include AlphaGo and DQN on Atari as well as contributions to countless publications. The team consists of several developers from high profile games and VFX companies including: EA, Sony, Elixir Studios, Criterion Games, Animal Logic and The Foundry.


The Role


You’ll add new game features to existing game environments, and make brand new environments available. All games are wrapped with a common environment API so agents can switch between them without interface changes. You’ll work collaboratively to develop and integrate environments and carry out performance optimisation to ensure that our games run fast in our data centres. We take time to design and implement our software carefully as it’s likely we’ll live with it for many years to come so we welcome new ideas and apply thoughtfulness to everything we do. We take code reviews, unit and integration testing seriously to ensure high code quality and robustness. You’ll join a close knit team of talented individuals who openly share ideas with one another.
title: Games Programmer, Google DeepMind at DeepMind (London, UK)

So you’re a happy, dedicated quality engineer, but what if you could be even happier? Imagine if your dedication helped ensure that non-profit organizations were able to continuously deliver their vital services to the groups they serve. As a Software Quality Engineer, you’ll play a key role in building quality strategies that enable thousands of non-profits to carry out their missions worldwide.


What you’ll be doing:


You’ll be creating and executing test strategies against Blackbaud software and cloud-based frameworks using automated and manual tests. You will run security, performance and functionality tests against cloud-based web applications and establish testing goals, write test plans and identify critical scenarios based on design requirements and client usage.


The job:


You’ll be building automated regression suites using a VB.NET, C#, JavaScript, PowerShell, SQL, Team Foundation Server and Fidldler. You’ll be working in an agile environment to implement best testing practices and ensure high quality releases. If you have a natural passion for high quality, please apply!


About us
Purpose: At Blackbaud, we believe the world would be a better place if good took over. If everyone on a mission to do good had the power to do even more. That’s why we come to work every day—to equip and connect the world’s philanthropic community so that good can take over.


People: We are Heart + Smart. Our employees are passionate about doing good and helping others with their philanthropic missions. They love museums, arts and culture, wildlife, feeding the hungry and helping to save lives. Philanthropy is in our DNA. If you support a non-profit, chances are you’ll find someone here who supports that mission too. In other words, you’ll find a friend here (and we hope you bring your friends too).


Place: Blackbaud’s Charleston headquarters, located on Daniel Island, provides an environment that helps our employees achieve balance, with convenient opportunities to step away from the office for a little personal time. Parks, a fishing dock and miles of trails surround the office. Onsite amenities include a full-service cafeteria, a complete gym facility and access to recreational space for gaming or social gatherings.


Other things you might care about: Competitive salary, four weeks of PTO, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k, Flex spending accounts, tuition reimbursement, volunteer for vacation, onsite fitness facility, and community involvement.


Curious? Come in and check it out. Worst-case scenario- you learn a little more about us, we learn a little more about you and keep us in mind for the future. Best case, you get to help empower organizations that are actively making the world a better place.

title: Senior Software Quality Engineer at Blackbaud (Charleston, SC)

description:
Front End Javascript is the Wild West, full of visionaries, trolls, and rival gangs trying to off each other one subtweet and Hacker News flame war at a time.  You've flipped the table in disgust and switched to Typescript.  You've thrown your lot in with Google and figure even though Angular 2 is still in Beta, that it's the safest bet out there.  We agree with you.


You also love pizza and yearn to know everything about it.  How it's priced, how it's ordered, and how that touch screen thingy the cashier is looking at works.  You're in luck.  We make those touch screen thingies and the next generation of them will run Angular 2.


Pizza delivery has turned into a technology arms race and you'll join a real David and Goliath struggle against the major national pizza chains.  We're building a technology arsenal that independent pizza restaurants and mom and pop operations can use to compete toe to toe with the big three.


We're looking for you, a solid front end web developer looking for an excuse to use Typescript and Angular 2 on a real project, maybe even in a full time job situation with features like paychecks and health benefits.  You'll work from home with a remote team full of smart people who aren't jerks about it.  We have high technical standards and we expect a lot, but we'll treat you like a human and you'll work with cool stuff like fingerprint readers, cash drawers, chip card readers, LED pole displays, digital signage, and thermal receipt printers.  You'll get a shiny new Macbook Pro and an O'Reilly Safari subscription.  Your team includes nice people with names like Danny, Gillian, and Muhit.  You'll meet them in person every so often at a tech conference or a client site.  If you hurry, you might even go to Angular Summit in Chicago this May where a person called Jeff will try to make everyone play Settlers of Catan every night.
title: Angular 2 Developer Wanted For Pizza Arms Race at Granbury Solutions (Grapevine, TX) (allows remote)

description:

Nu vill vi lära oss ännu mer nya saker för att ha ännu roligare. Och bästa sättet att lära sig nya sker är att prata med nya människor. Vi vill anställa människor med nya ideér och infallsvinklar. Engagerade människor som tar med sig sin vilja att utveckla, bygga och förändra med sin kompetens.


Är du Java eller .Net-utvecklare med arbetslivserfarenhet, gärna som konsult, så vill vi gärna träffa dig. Vi vill att du kommer hit och berättar något för oss.

description:

Our beautiful campuses are centrally located in Irvine & Newport Beach, CA. Glidewell strives to provide a family-friendly and employee-friendly work environment with frequent employee appreciation events, friendly corporate culture, competitive salary, and achievable growth opportunities.


In addition are the following generous employee benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with company match, company-paid life insurance, additional onsite dental services, vacation, holiday, and sick time, employee gym (with fitness classes and meditation room), employee medical/wellness center (with massage therapy and acupuncture), two company subsidized cafes, Internet cafes, employee lounges with big screen TVs, game tables, fun company sponsored events, a diverse work environment with over forty nationalities represented, and much more!


If you have the following qualifications (listed below), we want to hear from you! We are always looking to bring onboard the brightest and most qualified candidates to our Glidewell Family.

Create web applications for the predictive modeling team to help Glidewell's internal and external customers to better asses their needs.

description:
A fantastic opportunity for a talented developer looking to progress to a leadership position. You'll be working to improve young people's life chances, on a platform already used by more than 10% of schools in the UK.


What you will be working on


At the heart of the service Future First provides to schools is an online platform which allows former students to sign up to support their old school, and school staff to mobilise these volunteers to support current students.


This is a great time to join the team as we develop our system to be able to best innovate and iterate to meet the needs of our users. Practically, this means moving to full-stack JavaScript. Our current front end is built in AngularJS, and we are moving to the Meteor framework with Node.js and MongoDB.


This transfer to full stack JavaScript is being led by our outsource partners. You will join the project team to build the minimum viable product for summer 2016. We will then bring the majority of development in house, and your role will be to lead the development and maintenance of this system.


Duties & responsibilities



  • Develop and maintain the Future First platform to ensure it is high performing

  • Develop new features and services within the platform to meet evolving user needs

  • Work with the Product Owner and other team members to turn user requirements into technical specifications

  • Develop out our mobile and cross platform strategy 

  • Work with the Director of Operations to manage the development priorities and timetable

  • Work with the Director of Operations and other team members to achieve and build upon our vision for the platform

  • Line management of one in-house developer

  • Management of outsourced staff including developers and designers


Any questions?


We’d be delighted to have an informal conversation about this role if you are considering applying. Please contact Melanie Robinson on 020 7239 8933 or by email melanie@futurefirst.org.uk. We are also happy to share login details to a demonstration version of the platform – get in touch if you would like to take a look.

description:
You would provide support in the form of application development, scripting, debugging, and software development expertise to a digital forensic lab and malware reverse engineering section. You would maintain existing software and develop new software to customer specifications.


At Cipher Tech Solutions, Inc. (Cipher Tech), we take great pride in supporting some of the most mission critical work in the Department of Defense and the Intelligence Community. The majority of our company is comprised of extremely talented software developers who write production tools which directly support one of two missions: Digital Forensics and Malware Reverse Engineering.

Digital forensics is the practice of extracting and processing evidence from computers, phones, tablets, cameras, flash-drives, and just about any other form of digital media. The results of our work are then used to support federal and military law enforcement, counter intelligence, and counter terrorist activities.

Malware reverse engineering is the practice of analyzing extremely advanced malicious code. The goal of a reverse engineer is to understand how the malicious code works and determine facts such as:



  • How did it infect the victim's computer

  • What kind of information it is seeking to steal

  • How is it communicating with the author (actor)

  • Who that actor might be


If you would enjoy waking up every morning, using your keyboard to help protect National Security, this is the job for you!
title: Forensic Software Developer - Entry Level at Cipher Tech Solutions (Elkridge, MD)

After a stint in YCombinator, the world’s most prestigious startup incubator, and a successful crowdfunding campaign, we’re growing and we’re growing fast. We’re building out our engineering team and laying the groundwork for our next generation of products.


You’ll be working with an incredibly talented team of engineers who’ve built some amazing things. You’ll also be working with some pretty savvy business folks who’ve founded successful companies. description:
A leading financial organisation seeking a Test Analyst offering up to £30,000 in Greater Manchester

Your new company
You'll be working with a well-established and innovative provider of financial services. This company are committed to providing customers with useful assistance and advice in financial management. As an organisation they offer outstanding products and provide exceptional customer services to leading businesses across the globe

Your new role
As a Test Analyst you'll be involved in the creation and execution of test scripts, recording outcome of tests and escalation of defects. You also be identifying opportunities for product improvement.
You'll be testing all functional modules using structured and exploratory test techniques and be working in a cross functional team and attend Scrum.
Use of Selenium for Automation is also part of this role although not essential.

What you'll need to succeed
As a Test Analyst you be able to work within an existing team and balance speed of delivery with a quality customer journey. You will operate within an agile team within the Scrum framework, working to deliver high-quality solutions in an iterative manner with continuous integration and automated testing. You will be required to analyse systems to determine what tests are required in order to achieve the objectives within each testing stage. Experienced in using Selenium would be advantageous.

What you'll get in return
You will be paid up to £30,000 (plus benefits). You will be joining a great team working within an exciting organisation who can offer realistic progression opportunities and whilst gaining some excellent experience.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

Software Engineer, Analytics


What you will do:


In this role you will design, implement, and scale the systems that process and analyze data as it flows. These systems will generate real-time insights, and also deliver data that has been cleaned, transformed, augmented, or enhanced prior to storage. You will work with gigabytes of clickstream data, as well as an incredibly robust real estate data set. description:
We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer (C++) to build and enhance our core low-latency, quantitative electronic trading applications. Working with small agile teams and directly with traders and scientists, you will be exposed to some of the brightest minds and some of the hardest problems in the industry.


If you are an experienced C++ developer with a Linux background and you share our values, please contact us. Bonus points will be awarded for experience building low-latency components and/or experience in the financial or trading industry. 


Our values



  • SOLID design principles

  • Test Driven (TDD) implementation process

  • Teamwork

  • Simplicity

  • Intellectual agility

  • Continuous learning

  • Experimentation



What are you going to be doing?


As Quantlab software engineers, we do work that impacts the bottom line.  The applications we build and the code we write are directly tied to how much money our trading systems make.  On any given day we find ourselves doing any or all of the following (and then some):



  • Writing fast C++; writing code in several languages; optimizing code; pair programming

  • Building trading system applications; analyzing system performance/trading data;building applications that parse and stream data; debugging CPU cold-path problems; increasing system resiliency

  • Working with our research scientists to deliver their algorithms and models

  • Learning how exchanges work; learning how trading works; learning how the company operates; teaching and mentoring others

  • Helping build talent on the team; mentoring summer interns; managing summer intern projects; interviewing candidates; giving and receiving feedback


Who should you be? (Who’s successful here?)


In our tech-driven, team-focused firm, you will work on teams whose top priority is to get it done.  You will work with people whose goal it is to bring out the best in each other and to build things that can’t be built by one person alone.  Our developers love what they do.  We have more nerd-geek per square inch here than on most development teams. If you work here your hobby is software too; you love this stuff and keep thinking about it on your drive home.
title: Senior Software Engineer at Quantlab Financial (Houston, TX)

B.responsible

description:
We are looking for generalist programmers who want to take charge of large feature areas and drive them to completion. We hire people with strong technical backgrounds, but who also possess the soft skills to manage non-technical parts of problems. We like to prototype and deploy quickly to test ideas. For us, determining what to build is at least as important as the data structures and algorithms we use to build it.


The Work


Sortable’s Ad Engine helps web publishers monetize their website with minimal effort so they can focus on doing what they do best: creating great content. We work on crawling and rendering pages on the web at scale, analyzing large volumes of data to set efficient inventory prices, and building intuitive self-serve user interfaces for our publishers.


Sortable Products covers our product recommendation sites (e.g., Snapsort.com), which help consumers quickly make informed decisions on which product to purchase. Challenges in this area include developing algorithms and UI to boil many data points down to simple conclusions, crawling the web to collect data, and building automated quality control systems.

description:

across Europe and Asia. In a fast-changing omni-channel environment, the mobile app is an important customer
touchpoint for Telenor. As a result, we are now looking for an iOS Engineer to join our team!

overview of all self-care apps in our business units.

description:
EVO Payments International GmbH (EVO) ist die europäische Tochter der Unternehmensgruppe EVO Payments International mit Hauptsitz in New York, USA. Als Principal Member von Visa und MasterCard bietet EVO internationale Lösungen für die Akzeptanz und Transaktionsverarbeitung von Debit- und Kreditkarten im stationären Handel, im E-Commerce und im Versandhandel sowie an Geldausgabeautomaten. Weitere bargeldlose Zahlungsarten, Risikominimierungssysteme und zusätzliche Dienstleistungen vervollständigen das Full-Service-Angebot. Ein Team erfahrener Fachleute und eine herausragende technische Plattform sorgen für exzellente Lösungen und die einfache, schnelle und sichere Abwicklung der Zahlungsvorgänge. Nicht umsonst ist der Acquirer und Payment Service Provider der exklusive Anbieter für Kartenakzeptanzlösungen des Geschäftsbereichs Global Transaction Banking (GTB) der Deutschen Bank in Europa und wurde wiederholt als bester Anbieter für international agierende Händler ausgezeichnet.


Ihre Aufgaben



  • Übernahme der Systemverantwortung im Bereich der Backoffice-Verarbeitung von Kreditkartentransaktionen

  • Aufnahme und Analyse von Anforderungen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachabteilungen

  • Ausarbeiten technischer Spezifikationen und Pflichtenhefte

  • Analyse, Entwurf und Implementierung von Datenbankmodellen

  • Umsetzen der Anforderungen, Erproben und Übergabe der vorgenommenen Entwicklungen

  • Erstellung von Systemdokumentationen

  • Durchführung von Schulungen

  • Betriebsunterstützung und 3rd-Level-Support

  • Erstellen von Ad-hoc-Auswertungen

  • Projektleitung

  • Definition der strategischen Weiterentwicklung für die verantworteten Systeme


Ihre Qualifikation



  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Informatik bzw. vergleichbare Ausbildung

  • Langjährige Praxis in der Softwareentwicklung und der Leitung von Projekten

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse der Oracle Datenbank, insbesondere der Entwicklung mit SQL und PL/SQL

  • Vertiefte Einblicke in ddie Optimierung von Datenbankzugriffen

  • Idealerweise vertraut mit HTML, JavaScript, PHP und Java

  • Erfahrung in der Verwendung von Unix-Shell

  • Fachwissen über die Abläufe von Kreditkartentransaktionen und die regulatorischen Rahmenbedingungen ist wünschenswert

  • Ausgeprägtes analytisches Verständnis

  • Eigenverantwortliche, strukturierte und effiziente Arbeitsweise mit starker Zielorientierung

  • Einsatzfreude und Teamfähigkeit

  • Souveränes Auftreten und gutes Kommunikationsvermögen

  • Erzielen genauer Ergebnisse auch unter Termindruck

  • Sehr gutes Deutsch in Wort und Schrift

  • Gutes Englisch in Wort und Schrift

description:
Darauf kannst Du Dich freuen:

Als Teil unserer agilen Projektteams lieferst Du unseren Kunden Software-Lösungen. Dabei wird bei uns eng zusammengearbeitet, d.h. Du wirst an einem Tisch mit Projektmanagern, Testern und Analysten sitzen, um Ideen kreativ und iterativ in praktische und maßgeschneiderte Lösungen umzusetzen.


Im Rahmen unserer Projekte wirst Du die gesamte Breite aktueller Praktiken und Methoden erleben und anwenden, angefangen bei User Experience Design über Pair Programming und Test-Driven Development bis hin zu Continuous Delivery. Du nutzt verschiedene Technologiestacks wie Ruby, Python, C#, Java, Scala, Clojure, JS oder GO und schreibst in kollaborativen Teams komplexe Anwendungen mit Code von hoher Qualität - und immer mit Fokus auf den Mehrwert für den Endnutzer des Systems. Dabei lernst Du unterschiedlichste Domänen kennen: ein Projekt kann mit einer gemeinnützigen Organisation durchgeführt werden, ein anderes mit einem großen Finanzdienstleister. Da wir fast ausschließlich bei unseren Kunden arbeiten und dort eine Kombination aus Entwicklungs- und Beratungsleistungen anbieten, bist Du flexibel und verfügst über eine hohe Bereitschaft zu reisen.


Darüber hinaus wirst Du als Senior Software Developer bei ThoughtWorks



  • Jeden Tag etwas Neues lernen und mit den Autoren von Werkzeugen, Büchern und Blogs, die dich inspiriert haben, zusammenarbeiten

  • Dich auf das konzentrieren, was Dich begeistert, anstatt festgelegten Strukturen zu folgen

  • Die gesamte Breite aktueller Best Practices der Softwareentwicklung anwenden

  • Dich in einer internationalen Community zu aktuellen Technologien und Trends austauschen

  • In einer dynamischen, kooperativen, transparenten, nicht-hierarchischen und ego-freien Kultur arbeiten, in der Dein Talent zählt


Das bringst Du mit:



  • Erfahrung mit der Entwicklung großer Applikationen und Softwarelösungen

  • Beste Kenntnisse einer der üblichen Programmiersprachen wie Java, C# und Ruby; idealerweise zusätzliche Erfahrung mit aktuellen Sprachen wie Clojure, Scala oder Go

  • Nach Möglichkeit Erfahrung mit Test-Driven-Development und Continuous Delivery

  • Starke Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und Kundenorientierung und damit die Fähigkeit in einem Beratungsumfeld zu arbeiten


Du findest Dich in unserer Beschreibung wieder und möchtest uns bei unseren großen Plänen unterstützen? Dann sende uns Deinen Lebenslauf und sag uns, warum Du ein ThoughtWorker werden möchtest. Wir freuen uns auf Dich!


Stop careering. Start contributing.


Wir fördern Vielfalt und stellen uns gegen Diskriminierung und Ungleichbehandlung. Wir sind stolz darauf, aktiv und leidenschaftlich unser Unternehmen und unsere ganze Branche sensibler für gesellschaftliche Belange zu machen.

description:
GfK Business Applications Netherlands is looking for a developer for the dashboard framework team.


The team's focus is to develop a dashboard framework with which, in the end, GfK clients can get insight in their data. With the framework we provide tools for other GfK developers to continue building upon our framework. These tools might include a new chart type to visualize data, a package manager to decouple functionality and improve maintainability or support for web analytics; your work will be very diverse and will have a high impact on a lot of users. Everything we do is in JavaScript; focused on the end user, fast, interactive.


Our current challenges are related to:


·         enabling our users to get insights from their data;


·         developing easy to use tools for tough market research challenges


·         setting the standards by developing a high quality dashboard framework;


·         supporting the developers that build upon our framework;


·         decoupling functionality by developing a package management system;


·         extending our test suite to verify if our features are (still) working properly;


·         improving our development process to ramp up our velocity and quality;


The dashboard framework is used for several GfK products, used by clients and GfK colleagues worldwide.

description:
SAP (www.sap.com) is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. As part of the Products & Innovation organization within SAP, the Innovation Center Network (icn.sap.com) combines the best of both worlds: the creativity and agility of a startup with the backbone of a world market leader in business software. The goal of the Machine Learning Incubation unit within the SAP Innovation Center Network is to develop new products and discover new markets for SAP. We focus on disruptive products which can be built using machine learning to shape the long-term growth opportunities for SAP.


As a Senior Developer for (deep) machine learning you will work in a startup-like team of experienced researchers and data scientists taking on challenges posed by the SAP customers. You will have the chance to work with the richest data sets available in the world with the goal of building new cloud-based products for SAP. To that end you will implement state of the art algorithms and develop new approaches and technologies for deriving value from our customers’ data. You will have the chance to work across all data verticals including: image, text, structured and time series.


You will work against fixed timelines and your success will be measured by the ability to deliver scalable and sustainable cloud-based products. Additionally your tasks will include:



  • pushing the frontiers of what is currently possible in the area of (deep) machine learning

  • exploring, understanding, and implementing most recent algorithms and approaches

  • assessing the fitness of machine learning approaches in terms of their precision, performance, and scalability

  • ensuring high quality of your solutions through continuous deployment, evaluation, and refinement

  • communication of the solution quality and fitness in a visual and consistent way
title: Senior Developer - (Deep) Machine Learning at SAP SE (Berlin, Deutschland)

description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 80 million users per month!

JavaScript is a central piece of the trivago Hotel Search. Faced with high performance requirements, our JavaScript engineers work relentlessly on speeding up the application while keeping the code modular and maintainable.

We are currently looking for a JavaScript Software Engineer to apply their analytical and methodical way of working to our codebase. Are you an innovative thinker? Do you create solid architectures that are well-structured and extensible? Can you keep our applications snappy and responsive despite the growing amount of features? Then we should definitely talk!


Your responsibilities:



  • Work cross-functionally in an agile development environment with Product, Design and UI/UX Developers.

  • Participate in architecture decisions and innovative feature development tasks.

  • Write clean, single-purpose, composable, and testable software modules.

  • Be up to date with current frameworks, tools, and libraries, and decide which ones to follow and adopt.

  • Optimize our code for various browsers and connection speeds.

  • Keep our JS codebase future-proof by integrating new language features (ES6, ES7).


Your profile:



  • You speak English (our company language) fluently.

  • You have a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related technical field.

  • You have worked for 3-4 years in Web Development as a JavaScript Engineer.

  • You are fluent in JavaScript and can write code using ES3 & ES5.

  • You are familiar with at least one modern JavaScript framework (React/Flux, Ember, Angular, Backbone,etc).

  • JavaScript framework development and Node.js experience would be beneficial.

  • You are a master of Git and can read and understand PHP 5.6.

  • You possess solid knowledge of HTML and CSS.

  • You crave the freedom to experiment with, test and implement new technologies and approaches.


What we offer:



  • A large-scale, complex, and rapidly evolving IT landscape.

  • The opportunity to make a difference for millions of users.

  • A free choice of PC or Mac and equipment.

  • External trainings by key influencers of the IT scene.

  • Regular code workshops, conference visits, hackathons and time for innovation.

  • Flat hierarchies and short decision paths.

  • Relocation and on boarding support.

  • Possibility to work from our office in Palma de Mallorca up to 4 weeks a year.

  • Regular team events, a wide range of sport activities, a fridge full of beer and non-alcoholic beverages as well as fresh fruit every day.

  • Our fellow developers Lars and Timmo bake awesome cake for us.


Start date: As soon as possible

title: Produktmanager (w/m) Softwareprodukte at Schüco International KG (Bielefeld, Deutschland)

description:
Want to join a young and dynamic engineering team, build amazing online products, push your Javascript skills to the limit and learn all about beating the stock market while you're at it ?


Stockopedia.com is Europe's fastest growing stock market SaaS service currently extending coverage all over the globe. Founded by Oxford graduates and headquartered in the heart of the Oxford city centre, we're looking for an innovative and experienced front end engineer to join our team and accelerate the development of our online platform. 


The role


If you like to build features end to end, love working with new technologies and are genuinely passionate about the web you'll fit right in.  This is an exciting opportunity for a front end engineer with ambition and ability to take on a key responsibility within the development of our rapidly growing financial brand.  


The role has a core focus on using AngularJS to build out our new UI, interfacing with our financial and user generated databases through Restful APIs.  AngularJS expertise is a huge plus, but we're happy to hire candidates with strong core Javascript skills and train them up in Angular.  Competent PHP or Node skills may come in quite handy.   If you do have stock market knowledge that's a big plus, but if not, just bring some fresh eyes and a sense of curiosity and you'll pick it up fast.  


Your work will be integral in building social & investing tools for our highly active subscriber community. Your work will help find winning stocks from our 50,000 strong stock market database through the development of stock reports, technical charts, stock screeners and portfolio analytics modules. Ultimately it's a role that will deliver stock market success to tens of thousands of individual investors in over 95 countries worldwide.


The culture


We're a dynamic, international team at Stockopedia hailing from the UK, New Zealand, Poland and India. Our cross border focus drives our ambition to be the first fully global stock and portfolio analysis platform for individual investors.  As a small company everyone gets responsibility for a key part of the stack and we're free from the kind of ineffectiveness and petty politics that so often come at big companies.   


We work in relaxed and open plan city centre offices and all make our own coffee.  We offer five weeks holiday and the opportunity to work from home on Fridays.  Other perks of the job include pension, expensing of work related lunches and books and travel to our offices abroad at least once per year. We'll also spare no expense in training and certification to ensure you develop the skills you need for the job.


Don't miss the chance to come and learn more.  We're extremely friendly, and as a profitable, fast-growing company in fin-tech we've got lots to talk about...   so please do get in touch.


£££ Highly competitive salary + benefits geared to experience, talent and skill.
title: Front End Engineer - learn AngularJS in Fintech, Oxford at Stockopedia.com (Oxford, UK)

description:
Are you interested in joining a team of motivated IT professionals?  Would you like to work in a casual and collaborative environment on one of the nation’s most beautiful Big 10 College campuses?  Would you like to work for an organization that has a strong focus and commitment to all of our employees, including professional and personal development; robust benefits; and a flexible work schedule?  Would you like to work and live in a city ranked 9th by Business Insider for “People are most satisfied with life in these 10 US cities”?  Would you enjoy a leadership role in the on-going improvement efforts around enterprise grouping, enterprise identity and access management (IAM), and future service offerings?



If so, you may be the innovative, energetic, and driven professional that the Division of Information Technology at the University of Wisconsin-Madison seeks.  The division is in search of an Identity and Access Management Engineer – Web Services Developer, in the Middleware Technology Group, who is responsible for engineering and managing the framework for electronic identity and access management solutions for a population of nearly 375,000 active users and over a 1000 applications.  These solutions allow the right people access to the right services and enables secure access to campus and system services and resources for faculty, students, and staff.


As an IAM Engineer – Web Services Developer, you will:



  • Work closely with top management, peers, and customers to design, develop, and maintain the UW Madison and UW System Person Registries, lead development of identity and access control services for applications, services and resources for faculty, students, and design, develop, and maintain solutions using a mix of commercial, open source and locally developed tools. 

  • Play a lead role in the development and deployment of identity and access management solutions that help collaboration happen, enable shared management between institutional processes and resource owners, and help increase efficiencies through automated processes for functional users. 

  • Work across the organization and with peers on campus and nationally to provide recommendations on how UW Madison and UW System can improve Identity and Access Management (IAM) services.



You are a great fit if:



  • You’re collaborative, versatile, innovative, motivated, intellectually curious, and an excellent communicator.

  • You are looking to grow or further your career in a supportive and ever-evolving environment.

description:
Sense is building hardware and mobile apps to help people analyze their home energy consumption, see what is going on in their homes, and ultimately reduce their energy footprint -- all powered by cutting-edge machine learning technology that can tell which appliances are on in your house and how much power they're using, in real time.


We are looking for Machine Learning Engineers/Data Scientists to join our team.  The ideal Engineer/Scientist will mine energy data, design algorithms, and develop models which improve Sense's automated disaggregation platform. The right person for this role will enjoy diving into messy time-series, designing high-performance models, and developing robust code that scales on live data.


What you will do:



  • Design and implement unsupervised dynamic algorithms that learn home-appliance models from wattage time-series and other signal representations

  • Design and develop models and algorithms to improve Sense's disaggregation platform

  • Dive into data, clean it up, and pull out insights that can be used to improve system performance

  • Drive successful algorithms to production

McKinsey’s North American Knowledge Center (NAKC), located in Waltham, MA (20 minutes west of Boston), provides research and analytic support to McKinsey consultants. The Center hosts several industry and functional research teams as well as a few specialized teams, including the Geospatial Analytics unit. Geospatial Analytics is a cutting-edge capability that supports consulting teams on a wide range of business issues that are geographic in nature and often cut across several industries and functions.


The Geospatial Analytics team has distinct capabilities that leverage spatial analytics such as spatial statistics, optimization, visualization and modeling. The team developed several tools and applications that bundle these analytics into user friendly interfaces and standardized workflows for greater impact and efficiency.


We are looking for creative web developers focused on spatial-centered development to join our team and drive new, full-stack web application development using open source libraries. You will work in a highly collaborative environment within an entire ecosystem of analytics practitioners, including geospatial and non-geospatial data scientists, platform architects and engineers, and analytics consultants, as well as Firm clients. You will have the opportunity and responsibility for developing full-stack geospatial applications, including backend and frontend web development, in order to bring business and geospatial insights to clients.

description:

We are young! (3 Years young) But we have achieved explosive growth, with 600 million monthly views globally across 4 platforms.

The successful candidate will be involved in the design, the implementation, the deployment and the full­lifecycle maintenance of a full range of innovative products that will pose the team some serious programming challenges. BuzzMyVideos helps Video Creators to optimise, scale and monetise their content. If you like the idea of joining a fast growing Series­A VC backed startup with a global mindset founded by two former YouTube employees, this is the spot for you!


Where do you come in and what you will do?


Our team structure is very flat, all our engineers are part of the same group, some are more senior than others but  that is down to the role they play and the impact they have, we don't dwell on job titles!


 Design, implement, test and deploy scalable and robust software applications. Enhance existing applications and integrate external solutions. Perform code reviews and adopt agile methodologies. 


About you and your skills


We are a diverse organisation headquartered in London with 17 different nationalities and pride ourselves on our differences. If you have the following, we would love to hear from you

WHAT WE OFFER


We offer you the chance of working as a human within a group of other humans who will never be referred to as “resources” and have a real interest in having some good time together. Our headquarters are located in London and we keep a constant exchange with all our sites located all over the world, including Cagliari. BuzzMyVideos is on a quest for a new paradigm in managing and promoting video content and your contribution will play an essential part in that journey. Salary DOE.


Contract type: Permanent


Location: Cagliari – Sardinia, Italy

description:
Extraordinarily gifted computational scientists and engineers are sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the field of biochemistry and fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.  

Candidates should have a demonstrated track record of academic, industrial, and/or open-source accomplishments.  Relevant areas of expertise might include parallel computing on high performance computing systems employing multi-core, GPU, or special-purpose architectures, numerical analysis, C/C++, or Python programming, data-intensive computing, compilers, operating systems, or distributed systems, but specific knowledge of and level of experience in any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability.  We are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation.  

Among the group’s current research activities is the development of new algorithms and software for molecular dynamics simulation and data analysis both on commodity clusters and on Anton, a massively parallel special-purpose supercomputer of our group’s design.  Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work closely with a number of the world’s leading computational chemists and biologists, and to make fundamental contributions within the fields of biology, chemistry, and medicine.

description:
Alchemy+Aim is a website development company, specializing in helping thought leaders, entrepreneurs and creative businesses. The business has grown from a solopreneurship to company that currently has a team of 12 people.


We're doing things differently at Alchemy+Aim, focusing on building lateral structures in the company rather than traditional hierarchical ones. Team members have all the perks that contractors have, while also being able to really contribute to the growth of the company and the direction it's moving in. We're instituting several things over the next two years, including profit sharing for full-time employees, team development opportunities, and team retreats.


The Basics of the Job:


+ You’d be developing custom Wordpress sites. We believe in coding custom sites from scratch and we hope you do too.


+ You’d be communicating with the team regularly. We use Slack for regular communication and Trello for project management. There are occasionally some video chats we'll need to do either via Skype or Google Hangout. 


Job benefits:


+ You can work from anywhere. No moving for a job involved. If you’re happy where you are, stay there. If you’re unhappy, move somewhere new. This job will go with you. (If you want to spend a month working from the Italian countryside or in a Scottish pub, more power to you.)


+ You decide what you want your hours to be. You just need to communicate with the team regularly.


+ You get paid on a per project basis. We'll discuss the scope of the project and come up with a feel-good price for the work you'll be doing. (For some team members, this has evolved into full-time payment structures, but we start everyone off as contractors to ensure it's the right fit.)


Open Positions:


+ Wordpress Developer (part-time to full-time) - multiple positions open

Successful hires will be dedicated to the improvement of our in-house software tools and user experience.  They will be the first line of user support for our computational chemists and biologists, and will work with members of our software team to resolve open questions about our software.  Responsibilities could include performing simulation diagnostics, troubleshooting, maintaining and improving documentation, and distributing software to third parties.  This is a unique opportunity to contribute to the development of transformative technology within a dynamic, interdisciplinary environment.

description:
What we do: We develop a software platform that allow scientists to leverage the power of physics-based simulations throughout all stages of the pharmaceutical and biotech drug discovery process. We make software that improves the lives of millions of people.


Who we are: We are passionate engineers, entrepreneurs, and thinkers. Our team consists of alumni of great engineering companies (e.g., Google and Microsoft) and startups, but have made the decision to work on something with significant human impact. Our clients include many large pharmaceutical companies and our investors are fellow technology visionaries, including Bill Gates.


You are: An engineer, developer, and/or scientist that loves solving practical problems. You are comfortable being on the front lines and squashing problems as they surface. You keep your cool when problems get tough. You enjoy learning about business and organization details as much as the science/engineering details. You are an incredibly fast learner and can wear many hats. You enjoy teaching and sharing ideas.


Responsibilities



  • Develop code to customize the Schrödinger platform to clients’ needs

  • Work in small teams to deploy platform instances at customer sites

  • Scope, plan and complete complicated deployments (including novel/unusual configurations), for a range of operationally relevant clients

  • Be responsible for the success of deployments in various domestic and international locations (travel is optional)

  • Guide the direction of product releases to ensure that features are relevant to individual clients

  • Work with clients as their primary technical contact and become familiar with their day-to-day operations

  • Assist in product development and product management

  • Be a source of knowledge both internally and externally by gaining a thorough knowledge of the entire software platform

  • Interface with Engineers, Product Managers and Account Managers frequently to solve business and technical problems

  • Support business development efforts as a platform evangelist for our scientific and computational partners


Requirements



  • BA/BS from a top university in Engineering, Computer Science, Sciences or Mathematics

  • 2+ years experience with scripting or programming languages (python, perl, java, etc)

  • Strong Experience with Databases and Database schema design

  • Data management in the Life Sciences

  • Familiarity with Unix and Windows

  • Go-getter attitude: requires a desire to not just identify problems, but also develop solutions that fix the source of the problem

  • Excellent verbal and presentation skills

  • Self-motivated and reliable

  • Ability to collaborate and communicate with technical and non-technical personnel from everyday analysts up through the leadership ranks

  • Extremely detail-oriented and hands on


Pluses



  • Science major/minor or independent interest (chemistry, physics, biology, or related fields)

  • Demonstrated success in technical project management


Schrödinger is an equal opportunity employer


Please apply directly via our website at: http://www.schrodinger.com/careers/description/238

description:
Clue is the world’s fastest growing period tracking and fertility app, the second biggest category in mobile health. It’s a growing 22-person, VC-­backed startup based in Berlin. Every month, millions of users track data about their bodies in Clue’s iOS and Android apps. With every data point, Clue users gain knowledge about their own health, impact the entire community of Clue users, and advance reproductive health care globally.


Shape Clue’s data ethics and make us a leader in mHealth privacy


Clue’s users trust us to handle their data responsibly. You will work for their privacy and empower our teams with your knowledge and passion to develop services with privacy and security built in to the maximum.


Empower the user with data


The potential of Clue’s data is infinite. Help us build a transparent, scalable and user-centered data management system that will make Clue users feel safe and keep them in full control of their personal data.


Keep us safe


You will build defense systems to keep our systems, storage, and organization safe from intruders. Clue’s system holds sensitive (and sexy) data en masse.


Legal work


Together with our lawyers you will work on both our privacy policy and our terms of use contract. Both must comply with legislation in different countries while being as short and as easy to understand as possible.


What now?


Introduce yourself! We look forward to your application.

description:
Sky is Europe's leading entertainment company serving 21 million customers across five countries. We offer the best and broadest range of content, deliver market-leading customer service and use innovative technology to give customers the best viewing experience across a wide range of platforms.

Summary of role:

To build, execute and support all aspects of non-functional testing against our Identity Platform. Working closely within a scrum (CI) environment the successful candidate will join the performance engineering team and oversee the set-up and management of large-scale testing programmes including strong focus on resilience and high availability.

The successful candidate will be responsible for implementing all manors of performance and resilience tests in accordance with the standards of the OTT Reliability Engineering team.

Help drive the adoption of frameworks for Continuous Delivery, Resiliency and availability measurement, tracking of actions and the adoption of best practices targeting 100% resilience and 100% availability.

We are seeking highly skill individuals in this field who relish a challenge and who are passionate about building world-class systems architectures and delivery mechanisms.

Core Functions
  • Performing non-functional testing against back-end / service layer implementations within an agile software development environment utilising continuous delivery pipeline
  • Comfortable with taking full ownership of the non-functional test process that includes ownership of the sign-off of each release.
  • Building and designing real world test scenarios that are integrated into the continuous delivery pipeline.
  • Work with the business owner and developers to identify and ensure non-functional requirements are defined and are satisfied through testing
  • Working within an agile environment, working the closely with the developers, QAs, Analysts and reliability engineering team to uphold excellent standards of quality.
  • Able to take ownership of test environments to include the scheduling and deployment of production-ready software in every iteration
  • Producing NFT reports that are visible to all in the company for total transparency of testing effort
  • Participate in daily stand-up meetings, planning games, showcases, and retrospectives
  • Conducting tests to prove high availability systems (circuit breakers, kill switches)


Necessary Experience
  • Minimum of five years Non- Functional testing experience of web technology high transactional business critical systems, high availability back-end systems (backend focus)

description:
Love programming? Want to build great software, using leading edge technologies, with smart, passionate people?


The energy industry is changing, and technology is at the forefront of innovations that will transform it forever.


At OVO, technology and digital products are at the heart of our customer experience and they are key to our commercial success.


We were the first energy company to offer our Pay As You Go customers the opportunity to top up using their phone, the first company to offer real time electricity and gas usage data, and the first to release an apple watch App. We’ve been featured in Wired magazine for our ability to develop software to shatter the status quo.


But we’re just getting started.


We need to develop, test, and release software that scales, quickly and reliably. Over the last few years, we’ve built a highly skilled team of software engineers that is making a real impact to our business, and shaking up our industry.


We care about code quality, test automation and continuous delivery. Our developers drive our technology choices and own the software they create from their laptop all the way through to production.



We’re building a better energy company, and we’re doing it one Git commit at a time.


What will your day look like?


You’ll turn up in the morning, grab a coffee and have a chat with some of your team mates.
You’ll do your daily stand up and be super clear on what you’re doing that day.
You’ll grab a partner and do some pair programming in the morning
When you’ve had enough of each other you’ll test your skills at Rocket League or FIFA
Try to not forget to order your free lunch on Friday
You’ll get back to pairing and finish off that small feature.
You’ll grab lunch with your team mates and talk about the latest and greatest tech
You might have a tribe meeting with all the other front end people from other teams to share ideas
You’re about to get back to coding, but realise you should really have a whiteboard session first
You’ll be thinking about how you can implement some of those great ideas from the tribe
You’ll get back to coding
Time for tea?
More coding, chatting, Rocket League.
Rest.

Sky is Europe's leading entertainment company serving 21 million customers across five countries. We offer the best and broadest range of content, deliver market-leading customer service and use innovative technology to give customers the best viewing experience across a wide range of platforms.

·You'll have strong experience with at least two of the following; Java, JavaScript (Node.JS, React, Angular or Ember), Ruby, PHP, Scala, .Net, C#.

Technology helps people to do more and be more. It changes our world every day. At Telefónica, we’re leading a digital revolution. We’re transforming technology and the way people use it. The future is full of exciting possibilities. So, we’re looking for talented explorers and adventures to help us deliver the next big thing.




Position objective



As a global wide leading telecommunication company, our missing is to constantly innovate our core network infrastructure to deliver the best connectivity to our customers.


 The goal of this new project that we are launching now is to create a new intelligent layer for our core network where end-users (our customers) can interact and customize. The new layer will put end-users in control of the data that is currently sent to different online players. Our end-users will be able to decide with who they want to share the personal information and in which form.


 If you are always seeking new challenges and strongly expect to impact, in a good way, the life of million of people with your daily hard work, then join us.

We want you to bring your keen eye for detail to our very technical and data driven world, to make the most seamless experience for our thousands of users. description:
Visible World is the leading provider of targeted TV advertising solutions. Our technology makes television advertising inventory more valuable for inventory holders, advertisers, and viewers. Visible World's HighYield tech stack is an end-to-end programmatic TV ad sell-side platform. Whether through programmatic sales infrastructure, household addressability, automated versioning, or Smart TV insights, Visible World offers the most complete automated solution for targeting, selling, and managing impression-based television ad campaigns.





Since 2000, we have been developing technology that makes TV advertising more efficient and effectivewe've been awarded 24 U.S. patents to date for technology we developed in house, and more are on the way. However, we're not just doing R&D. Today, Visible World empowers more than 300 advertisers to deliver more targeted, effective and accountable local TV ad campaigns to consumers in approximately 80% of U.S. cable homes in 210 DMAs and our household addressable footprint includes 3 million homes. Smart TV DNA is used by over a dozen leading networks to track their program promotion campaigns. Our AudienceXpress group is using the HighYield platform to lead the programmatic TV ad buying industry. Visible World employees operate at the cutting edge of TV technology. In June 2015, Visible World became a subsidiary of Comcast, joining one of the most innovative media and technology companies in the country. Come help us craft the future of TV.

- Build simulated full production environments for complex testing scenarios

- Build and deploy custom testing frameworks for REST-based API's using JSON data formats

- Fluent in at least one scripting language such as Python or Node.js

- Experience with relational databases (SQL)

- Excellent written and oral communication skills

- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Preferred qualifications

- Experience working in an agile environment

As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.







Job Summary:





Responsible for providing system architectures and solutions to bring to market new innovative products which span web service offerings. Leads engineering functions as they relate to the planning, design,integration, test, deployment and support of products. Assists with testing and operational activities. Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and shares expertise.Individual will be a contributor on a team focused on Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). They will have responsibilities in helping to provide uninterrupted service to our millions of Video subscribers who consume our products through a wide variety of devices. We see this SRE team assisting in the scalable, supportable and resilient deployments executed by our existing component and platform team owners.



To best align the SRE efforts with the objectives and obligations already supported by Component and Platform teams, the SRE group will be developing, deploying and tuning instrumentation and tooling to create higher level reliability and service delivery metrics. We will use this additional level of visibility to further refine existing practices and address risks.

prevent future occurrences.

description:
Kongregate's Data Engineering team is responsible for creating and maintaining an analytics pipeline which services data from both our game publishing and web platform businesses. This critical and emerging team is in need of engineers to help expand our data processing capabilities as Kongregate continues to grow.


As a Data Engineer at Kongregate, you will work with Ruby, MySQL, and Puppet in addition to various AWS products including RedShift, S3, EMR, Lambda, and Kinesis. Our data pipeline extracts data from S3, transform it in Ruby jobs and loads it into RedShift. Part of your job will also be to assist our data analysts and game producers to assist with identifying and resolving data pipeline concerns.


Candidates should be smart, eager to learn, excellent communicators, and extremely tenacious. We are looking for someone who is able to both help define and implement best practices regarding data pipeline development. In practice, this can lead to working through unusual and unexpected situations as data sources can introduce unique exception cases requiring candidates to be able to track down obscure root causes.

description:
Are you one of top Software Architects in the world? Do you enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 10x more productive than the typical developer? Are you interested in earning $120,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.

The Role:

You will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architecture problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.

You will own a key piece of a cloud based java stack. Youll have end-to-end responsibility for the delivery and quality of this component, including its development, testing quality, deployment and production reliability. This is a role where you have access to the big picture and truly sharpen the broad set of skills required to own a software component in todays cloud based world. You should only apply for this role if you truly want to build and own great technology.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Developing expertise in one or more of our proprietary enterprise software products.

  • Leveraging your broad technology capability set and maintain a level of excitement in using various technologies to architect, develop, and iteratively deploy real enterprise class software

  • Achieving an expert level understanding of our customers environments and their use of our products.

  • Architecting and leading weekly technical delivery of one or more products in a way that maintains an unyielding focus on quality while matching the needs of the target customer base.

  • Creating solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs for solutions that scale to the customer's enterprise/global requirements

  • Leading a small team of Software Engineers to apply software engineering practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery

  • Manage accountability of team members, with pinpoint focus on quality; Personally accountable for resolution of the most technically challenging issues

  • Ensuring our customers are supremely confident in the advantages and quality of our product and solution, and the technical services you lead to deliver them.

  • Development - write JDK 1.8 code (writing new code and creating test cases)

  • Support - Every developer rotates into a support role for 1 week every two months

  • Methodology - Youll be expected to use jira to track active work, close tickets and create new tickets as necessary

description:
Bluebeam is looking for talented sr. web developers with a passion for building robust, performant, scalable, high availability web applications. You should have extensive web development experience including designing RESTful services utilizing relational and no-sql databases in a testable framework. 



Want a peek at who you would be working with?



Our software developers are friendly, fun, intelligent, hard-working team members devoted to developing software right.  They have an ability to see the big picture throughout the design and development process.  We are highly-collaborative so you should have a capacity to contribute to and learn from the team in constructive debates in order to coalesce multiple points of view into effective unified solutions.  We work in small fast-paced scrum-agile teams. You would be working alongside software engineers, and product and project managers who are self-starters passionate about delivering clean, dependable software solutions.  To work well with the team you should have an ability to clearly articulate solutions to complex problems both to technical and non-technical people. 




What we'd need to see:



  • 5+ years of experience in a related field (Candidates will be considered for engineer or senior engineer based on experience)

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in a computer science or equivalent field

  • Extensive use of APIs and understanding of HTTP and REST architecture

  • Experience using OO methodologies in designing software solutions

  • Strong understanding of design patterns

  • Proven ability to work in a rapid release production environment

  • Full understanding of the SDLC 

  • Experience with developing scalable software systems

  • Ability to clearly articulate solutions to complex problems; when developing solutions, ability to see the big picture



What we’d love to see



  • Comfort with working in an Agile/SCRUM environment

  • Proven Web Development experience in .NET technologies, particularly C# and Web API

  • Understanding of machine learning algorithms

  • Experience with cloud technologies such as Azure or AWS

  • Experience developing microservice-based architectures

  • Ability and propensity to generate and share extremely delicious baked goods




If you think you are a good match for Bluebeam, please send the following:



  • Cover Letter (Try to show us who you are.  If you send us the generic one you send to everyone else, we will be bummed.)

  • Resume

  • Samples of your web development work (Be prepared to discuss)



Learn more about Bluebeam here: http://careers.bluebeam.com/.

Bluebeam is looking for talented sr. web developers with a passion for building robust, performant, scalable, high availability web applications. You should have extensive web development experience including designing RESTful services utilizing relational and no-sql databases in a testable framework. 



Want a peek at who you would be working with?



Our software developers are friendly, fun, intelligent, hard-working team members devoted to developing software right.  They have an ability to see the big picture throughout the design and development process.  We are highly-collaborative so you should have a capacity to contribute to and learn from the team in constructive debates in order to coalesce multiple points of view into effective unified solutions.  We work in small fast-paced scrum-agile teams. You would be working alongside software engineers, and product and project managers who are self-starters passionate about delivering clean, dependable software solutions.  To work well with the team you should have an ability to clearly articulate solutions to complex problems both to technical and non-technical people. 




What we'd need to see:



  • 5+ years of experience in a related field (Candidates will be considered for engineer or senior engineer based on experience)

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in a computer science or equivalent field

  • Extensive use of APIs and understanding of HTTP and REST architecture

  • Experience using OO methodologies in designing software solutions

  • Strong understanding of design patterns

  • Proven ability to work in a rapid release production environment

  • Full understanding of the SDLC 

  • Experience with developing scalable software systems

  • Ability to clearly articulate solutions to complex problems; when developing solutions, ability to see the big picture



What we’d love to see



  • Comfort with working in an Agile/SCRUM environment

  • Proven Web Development experience in .NET technologies, particularly C# and Web API

  • Understanding of machine learning algorithms

  • Experience with cloud technologies such as Azure or AWS

  • Experience developing microservice-based architectures

  • Ability and propensity to generate and share extremely delicious baked goods




If you think you are a good match for Bluebeam, please send the following:



  • Cover Letter (Try to show us who you are.  If you send us the generic one you send to everyone else, we will be bummed.)

  • Resume

  • Samples of your web development work (Be prepared to discuss)



Learn more about Bluebeam here: http://careers.bluebeam.com/.
