description:
Animoto is looking for a solid Software Design Engineer in Test to round out our 7-person Test Team. Testers at Animoto are strongly embedded within product teams and partner with developers to increase confidence in our software. We are not trying to break systems that developers hand us, we’re working with developers to deeply understand and improve systems. Want to become an indispensable member of the engineering team? Read on...


Test, as an engineering discipline, seems unusually vulnerable to existential crises. Every organization has a different perspective on test function, goals and deliverables. So we feel that a job posting needs to be fairly opinionated in terms of how we view “Test” at Animoto.


Fundamentally, we believe TESTING IS ABOUT GETTING FEEDBACK FROM A SYSTEM. This is true whatever size of system we’re talking about, and whether we’re talking about a developer feeding inputs to a single function in console or a suite of automated UI tests running in the cloud. Testing is obviously not something that only testers do, but members of the Test Team are mostly focused on providing feedback and working on systems that can provide feedback.


We try to avoid talking about ‘Quality Assurance’. This might just sound like semantics, but all teams need to care about quality and no one team can truly assure it. We value Automated testing and Exploratory testing. We do not write or run manual test scripts.


Our SDETs are capable developers who recognize that Test provides some of the most interesting and challenging engineering opportunities.



WHY YOU WANT TO WORK AT ANIMOTO?



  • You resonate with our Test philosophy and don't want to work anywhere that doesn't think about Test in that way.



  • You want a chance to learn and grow as a Test Engineer. We encourage our testers towards deep understanding of the technologies and systems that they are testing.



  • A powerful and cool product. We are a New York based tech company that strives to enable anyone to produce powerful, professional video. Our patented cinematic artificial intelligence takes photos, video clips and music, analyzes them and outputs videos with high-end production value that tell a compelling story. We have over 14 million users, both consumers and businesses, a web-based video editor, mobile apps for iOS and Android, and integrations with various partners including Shutterfly. Animoto has been featured in the Apple store more than once, have contributed significant pieces to the Open Source community, and is a hub for the tech community workshops and meetups.




WHY ANIMOTO WANTS YOU?



  • You have a solid background in testing, automation and computer science fundamentals. You are often found talking to buddies about system design and architecture or/and unit testing.

  • Want to find better ways to test at all stages and improve our process.

  • Code in the same languages as our devs do: we’d love to see any work in Swift but will also appreciate Obj-C, Ruby, javascript ….

  • Know which tests work better with human interaction and which are a better fit for full automation. Work with the rest of the team to plan and implement those tests.

  • Determine how test results should be reported for your area to give everyone the fastest, most useful feedback about the state of the project.

  • Know and can explain common classes of bugs to the engineering team. Finding a way to prevent those bugs is a big plus.

  • Help our developers make their code more testable.
title: Software Design Engineer in Test at Animoto (Where Testing is Important) (New York, NY)

description:
The Trade Support Engineering and Operations team at HRT supports and maintains the production trading platform. It is the job of Trade Support and Operations to oversee our internal systems, all connections with external markets, and develop tools to keep our trading efficient and processes as automated as possible. We are the nucleus of all other teams at HRT -- from research to systems administration, and from accounting to core development -- we have our hands in everything that HRT does and combine our efforts to create and maintain the most robust and efficient trading platform in the world.


The Role


In a high performance environment, immediate awareness of and reaction to systems and trading issues is essential. That’s where the Ops Analyst comes in. You’ll be in charge of managing new initiatives and responsible for ensuring a smooth trading day. You are the first line of defense when the inevitable happens and the person most knowledgeable about recent changes to the production trading platform.


The Profile



  • You attained a Bachelor’s in a quantitative disciple (CS, Physics, Math, Finance, Chemistry, etc)

  • You possess a strong working knowledge of Unix systems and the Bash shell

  • You are an automation geek. You do not do the same task twice, manually

  • You have excellent communication skills and a willingness to admit mistakes

  • You can debug and analyze problems quickly and under pressure

  • You really like to work with people who challenge you and make you better at what you do

  • You are skeptical by nature and have a high attention to detail


Beneficial



  • Understanding of Market Data/Order Entry systems. Interest in how modern electronic markets work. Industry experience and/or Series 7 certification is a strong plus.

  • Experience with a scripting language (Python, Perl, Bash)

  • No problem with an early start and the occasional off-hours support.

description:
About you:
Are you a highly talented Python developer with the breadth, depth and experience with Python to be an effective architect for a ground-up build of a complex test and performance analytics infrastructure?

About where you hang your hat today:
Do you feel like good ideas go unheard and unimplemented because of repressive bureaucracy?
Do you tire of silly beancounter questions and wish you could focus on solving problems?
When you contemplate the legacy codebase that you inherited and which now would "cost too much to re-architect", do you find yourself quoting Ellen Ripley?
When it comes to solving problems, are you all out of bubblegum?

If you are a Python rockstar and would like to exercise your creativity without suffering the pitfalls mentioned above, we want to talk to you about a unique opportunity with Shipwire, an Ingram Micro company. We need to build out systems to help us scale our testing and our success. As we drive toward our goals we need to be more efficient in our testing as we improve and harden our technology.

This is where you come in. We need to build a Python test infrastructure that can scale with our technology and our business, not only by validating functionality but by predicting bottlenecks before our regular and peak workloads are impacted by them. This is to be a ground-up build.

Note that this is NOT a "Tester" or "QA" position. The Architect who fills this position will have to understand testing needs and the direct "customers" will be QA Automation engineers.

We have a great culture that is not just about flextime, telecommuting, free lunch every day and regular opportunities to have a drink and socialize or go on team outings(though we have those). It's about working with people who enjoy working and having fun together with people they respect, while having all of the tools needed to excel and make a difference.

If you are looking for more of the typical verbiage about our company, benefits, and culture, details may be found on our careers page, on our Stack Overflow company page, or in the job posting on our website.

description:
Job Description


Originally founded in York and Headquartered in San Francisco, Anaplan has offices all over the world. In fact we may be the most successful company you’ve never heard of. We are a slice of Silicon Valley in the heart of Yorkshire on a mission to revolutionise how companies analyse and plan their businesses. And it’s working; we are already trusted by hundreds of Fortune 5000 companies and we’ve only just begun. 


Our core product engineering centre in York is expanding rapidly, and we are looking for experienced and passionate product managers to lead our product into new realms.



Skills & Requirements


YOU HAVE…



  • A true passion for technology and innovation.

  • Solid experience as a product manager in the technology space. Extra points if you've worked with financial / multi-dimensional modeling or spreadsheet-related products, or with B2B SaaS platforms.

  • A constant balance of big picture perspective and careful attention to detail.

  • Excellent communication skills! You can explain anything to anyone at any level of detail. Importantly, you convey ideas in a way that inspires and motivates others to go above and beyond to solve problems and deliver products. You also know when to communicate what to whom.

  • Ownership - You will define and evangelize a vision for your product which supports the continual onslaught of feature requests, strategic initiatives, and market pressures and opportunities, and you will be making constant decisions based on that.

  • Proficiency in diagnosing, prioritizing, and conveying the problems to be solved.

  • A true spirit of collaboration – you enjoy working closely with others, learning and teaching; you seek out feedback, and you challenge assumptions of others when needed. You facilitate collaboration so that it improves the final out come without slowing down the process.

  • Positive energy and enthusiasm - Cultural fit is a big deal for us - we're looking for smart people who are excited about solving big problems and are self-motivated to get things done.

  • A highly organised and professional attitude - you'rean exceptional communicator, you are pragmatic and you know how to build trust.



WE OFFER…



  • The opportunity to work for one of the coolest hyper-growth companies on a product that is disrupting the way that businesses operate.

  • A rewarding career with a company that values diversity and invests in you - you’ll be working with super-smart developers, amazing UX designers, and many of our Fortune 500 customers to solve problems that affect an enormous market.

  • An award winning working environment here in the centre of York.

  • A long list of incredible benefits worthy of a leading Silicon Valley tech firm - we offer highly competitive packages: we’re serious about attracting the best technologists in the industry.

  • Friday is cake day in the York office....yes, we give you free cake (and beer if you like!)



About Anaplan


Originally founded in York and Headquartered in San Francisco, Anaplan has offices all over the world. In fact we may be the most successful company you’ve never heard of. We are a slice of Silicon Valley in the heart of Yorkshire on a mission to revolutionise how companies analyse and plan their businesses. And it’s working; we are already trusted by hundreds of Fortune 5000 companies and we’ve only just begun.
title: Core Platform Product Owner, York at Anaplan (York, UK)

description:
Your Role



  • To help us continuously improve our user experience, creating an intuitive, brand-consistent and engaging web interface. Yoiu will be expected to be up to date with industry best practice in web development/design; but also to analyse user data and use creative thinking to deliver tangible results

  • To help improve the reliability, usability and resilience of our platform by analysing user data and being conscious of code maintainability. You will also help resolve and prevent cross-browser layout issues and bugs

  • With a strong focus on usability and responsiveness, develop our customer facing UI and help to develop, prototype and implement new features

  • You will work within a small team collaborating with our backend developers, designers and product managers. You will be expected to contribute and trial new ideas; gathering data from a/b tests, user data and other sources to facilitate decision making

  • Working in a small team and collaborate with our backend developers, designers and product managers to create a great product



What's our Offer



  • A small team of experienced developers and a complex, distributed platform to work on

  • A modern technology stack using ES6, React and alt.js in the frontend.

  • Individual responsibility and the opportunity to grow professionally

  • Work directly with our founders and gain experience of an international, venture backed, startup

  • Access to a global network of successful entrepreneurs

  • Become part of a multinational, talented team of 30 working in Berlin

  • Prime office location - overlooking the Spree - in the heart of Berlin’s Mediaspree

  • Free breakfast, drinks and fruit to keep energy levels high
title: Frontend UI Developer (m/f) at OptioPay GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

description:
@Permission Data we have been rewriting our tech stack. We've chosen go as our primary implementation language, and are creating a scale-able microservice architecture.


Have you heard all about go but not had a chance to try it out? Have you played around with it on side projects but not been able to use it at your work?

This is your opportunity. We are a small team who is using go for our next generation platform and we are looking for interested, talented developers from mid to lead level.


Work will encompass the full stack. For the front end we are using aurelia.io and react.js. On the database side we use what is most appropriate for the service. Currently that means we have postgres, mysql, influxDB, and redis.

We've implemented our pipeline with saltstack, DCOS, Marathon, and Drone, but are always looking to enhance it.


The team is small (9 people), so you have the ability to make a big impact. We do a lunch and learn every other Wednesday, but are constantly pushing each other to learn more in our slack channels. 

We believe in a healthy work-life balance, and use agile practices to facilitate that.


We believe in contributing to open source.


We are unable to sponsor any visas at this time.
title: Software Engineer (using go) at Permission Data (New York, NY)

description:
Our innovation team is building a new web app that has a lot of growth potential, and solves a huge pain in the market in a brand new way. Additional details about this exciting opportunity will be shared during the interview process.  Here is some of what you can expect if you join our team:



  • Lean Start-up.  We are discovering as we go what delights our users and leads to sustained growth.  Lean start-up principles allow us to quickly and iteratively validate/invalidate assumptions about users.

  • Product Ownership.  As engineer #2 on the team, you will build the product from scratch, including MVP’s along the way.

  • Cross-functional Collaboration.  Product Management, Design, and Development all happen from the same small team, so there is no space for decisions made in silos.

  • Autonomy. We all have a lot of control over how they collaborate, communicate, and generally work.

  • Agility. We practice scrum, work in sprints, calculate velocity, do code reviews and rely on Continuous Integration.

  • Location Independence. Remote work is built into our company and team DNA.

  • Craftsmanship. We are committed to becoming better at our craft.

  • Stewardship. We are big proponents of open source, use it a lot, and give back to the community wherever we can.


Our fledgling codebase is being built in Ruby on Rails and React, with a high standard of code quality and excellent test coverage. We take a detailed approach to system architecture and documentation and work to make the code base something you enjoy working with and are proud of. We avoid overly complex methods and classes, and prefer an OO approach to using conditionals. We follow Ruby-community best practices, encourage code consistency with Rubocop, and encourage/elicit improvements to standards and processes. You have a voice, experience, and passion and we want to hear it.


What’s in it for you



  • Competitive Pay. We hire excellent people and reward them accordingly.

  • Flexible Work Hours. If you work better evenings than mornings, that’s fine by us!

  • Work remotely within the U.S.

  • Great benefits. Health, dental, vision, 401(k), FSA, HSA, life and disability insurance

  • Parties! We can fly you out for our company-wide summer BBQ and holiday parties.

title: Software Architect .NET at Infoman AG (Stuttgart, Deutschland)

description:
Engineers needed to help lead the medical software revolution!


The medical software industry is experiencing a revolution, and pMD is looking for a Senior Software Design Engineer who has the talent and drive to change it forever. You’ll have a huge impact on health care in America by using cutting edge technology to change the way that physicians practice medicine.


A developer’s career at pMD is nothing like the stereotype of a programmer. In addition to brilliant engineering, it involves high-level decision making; interaction with customers who love using our product; involvement in sales, recruiting and other aspects of the business; and rapid career growth through real mentorship.


It’s like a startup in that you’ll wear many hats, have a lot of responsibility and be part of a small, highly motivated team. It’s not like a startup in that we make our own business decisions. We have a proven and profitable product, extremely happy customers and a team of people as talented as you are. We love what we do. We strive to work like a beautifully engineered German car: fast, efficient and fun.


As a Senior Software Design Engineer at pMD, you’re a technical leader in training. You've not only demonstrated engineering excellence, you’ve also been informally building management skills since you were in school by balancing multiple high-priority projects simultaneously. Your past accomplishments suggest that as the company continues to grow, you’re ready to start mentoring others and eventually build and lead a team of developers.


Your programming work will focus on extending our Java/JSP Web application, with an emphasis on open source technologies like Linux, Apache, Tomcat, Struts, AJAX/Web Services and MySQL. You’ll have opportunities to work on sophisticated native apps for Android, iPhone, iPad, and possibly others.


You:



  • bring at least three years of focused, impactful experience as a Web and/or mobile developer… plus a lifetime of curiosity

  • want to grow your career quickly and start learning management skills

  • lead multiple high-priority projects simultaneously

  • design applications that are intuitive and fun to use

  • communicate fluidly in a team environment

  • find elegant solutions to complex business issues that don’t always involve writing code

  • aren’t agoraphobic – travel is fun!


We:



  • never set foot in a cubicle farm

  • like to play with sleek machines named after fruits and robots

  • inhabit a beautiful building in the Letterman Digital Arts Center in San Francisco

  • love our work

  • prefer Mac and Linux to… other operating systems

  • prefer to work in person with a small, fast-paced team

  • always search for the next hot thing


At pMD you can grow as quickly as you want to. Where else would you have a chance to program a thrilling new feature in the morning, meet with clients for lunch, run an impromptu design meeting in the afternoon, and drink home-brewed beers with the team after work? Plus, you’ll be able to see the impact of your work immediately and you’ll hear from our users how your efforts have improved their lives.
title: Senior Software Design Engineer at pMD (San Francisco, CA)

description:
The 18-person engineering team at Help Scout is full of people dedicated to a wonderful experience for our 6,000+ customers in more than 60 countries. We work remotely and autonomously for the most part, which is why this position requires senior-level skill and experience.


The ideal engineer for this position loves building RESTful APIs and other web services at scale. You relish the opportunity to take on a challenging problem, choose the right tool for the job and build an elegant, scalable solution. We leverage Solr for several tools at Help Scout and are looking for someone that can improve and maintain our implementation as we grow.



Tools We Use



  • Java 8

  • Apache Solr, MySQL, MongoDB

  • Spring, Play frameworks

  • RabbitMQ

  • Git


About the Role



  • You first project involves working with another Java/Solr engineer to build and own our Search and Reporting services. Solr runs all search functions, reporting, folder views and other areas of the product. On a daily basis, you'll work on improving existing code, adding new functionality and API endpoints all with a focus on testing and documentation.

  • Your team will be responsible for handling large amounts of data within Solr and ensuring it can be searched/delivered with optimal performance.

  • You'll be working with product people. Your leaders are technical and committed to creating a magical experience for customers. You'll deploy excellent work that moves the needle for businesses around the world.

description:
What we do:
Support video streaming services like HBO GO, HBO NOW, HBO on Demand and EST across a broad range of consumer platforms including mobile devices, televisions, desktop computers, and more. We also write and support all server side APIs, data workflows, and video delivery services. In addition, we are creating technologies for a new generation of digital media entertainment that builds upon HBO's rich portfolio of content.


What you’ll do:
You are responsible for the design and implementation of software solutions related to our Media Service Platform and Workflows for the Media Software Engineering group. Additionally this role will support other technical initiatives across the Technology group, such as video encoding and live video streaming via the Cloud.

What we’re looking for:
A highly skilled individual who has a proven track record and takes pride in bringing high-quality product quickly to market, enjoys learning and applying new technologies, and thrives in a dynamic engineering-oriented work environment. 
 



  • You will be focusing on enhancing our media service platform and file-based workflows – integrating multiple systems in a complex, multi-channel broadcast environment

  • You will work with business units to understand needs and develop project requirements: designing and implementing new metadata and video file-based workflows that address media management pain-points and core system issues

  • You will serve as a department software-development expert and technical lead, working with the team members to choose appropriate technologies for each project and formalize a long-term tech stack

  • You will lead projects related to File Based Workflows and integration with other systems that require HBO’s media – both internal and third party affiliates (domestic as well as international)

  • You will create software solutions to enable long-term growth and productivity of the team

  • You will learn about industry standards for media supply chain workflows and help implement APIs both internally and with external partners

  • You will identify automation opportunities within the media management space and develop maintainable software-based solutions

  • You will delegate responsibilities to other developers as appropriate and ensure deliverable timelines are met

  • You will create and maintain documentation related to software development projects, working with team members to establish standards for all developers to follow

  • You will mentor and enhance the skillset of other team members

description:
We are looking for a passionate and highly motivated generalist full-stack software developer to join our young and dynamic technical team in Montreal. CLX is one of the top players in the field of global SMS messaging, voice and mobile data (IoT), and we want world-class people in our team. Our services are useful to thousands of people daily and we serve many highly visible clients.


Our development stack is based on Java and Python, we store data in whatever makes the most sense (currently MongoDB, MySQL and Redis) and automating everything is a top priority.


We work according to Agile values of continuous improvement, highest quality standards, openness and sustainability. We understand that to go fast, you first need to go well. TDD, pair programming, code reviews and technical debt are part of our daily vocabulary. One of our core values is collaboration and people who display humility, a constant attention to detail and an innate desire to improve things around them will be highly considered.


A lot of autonomy is given to team members in the daily organization of the work, each person is asked to participate in all parts of the development flow according to their skills and interests: front-end, back-end, tests, quality assurance, infrastructure (dev-ops). Joining our team is a tremendous opportunity to grow, learn new tools and explore new practices.


We like to have a great deal of fun on a daily basis, but are also very serious about the work being accomplished. Working with us is hard and intensive but extremely rewarding.


CLX offers many great perks such as flexible work hours, generous group insurance plan, regular lunch & learns, constant stock of fruits, candies and coffee. Our office is located in the heart of downtown Montreal near the Quartier des Spectacles (Sainte-Catherine/Saint-Alexandre).


Read more:  www.clxnetworks.com

The QA Engineer performs the total scope of engineering responsibilities including participation in the software and documentation design process using an Agile development lifecycle model.


In more detail QA Engineers will:



  • Develop test cases according to the specifications for all testing phases and conduct reviews.

  • Execute test cases and record results.

description:
About Global Citizen


Developed by the Global Poverty Project, Global Citizen (www.globalcitizen.org) is the online home for the movement to end extreme poverty and is one of the largest social good platforms in the world.  The Global Citizen software connects NGOs and corporate partners to the international community of citizens that want to take meaningful actions that change the policies impacting the world’s poor.  Events like the annual Global Citizen Festival in NYC’s Central Park bring together people from around the world to give voice to the movement and celebrate its progress.


Overview of the Position


GPP is looking for a Senior Agile Project Manager who can help drive the future development of the Global Citizen platform.  The person will be the scrum master for at least 1 scrum team and will work closely with other members of the technology team to release new versions of the software.  The Senior Scrum Master/Project Manager role will be a highly visible position across the organization, responsible for coordinating and communicating development progress within the company and with the company’s various stakeholders and partners.


Key Responsibilities




  • Work closely with the Lead Developer and Product Manager to orchestrate the day-to-day operations of the Global Citizen platform




  • Manage budgets and resource plans for the Technology department




  • Serve as a liaison to other teams within the Global Poverty Project




  • Ensure that all departments are aware of platform roadmap and how it enables or impacts their work and leads in any necessary problem solving and prioritization




  • Coordinate internal and external development teams executing new features from definition, to planning, to release




  • Lead negotiations with 3rd party vendors and reconcile spending against budget




  • Report out on development progress to executives and key external stakeholders such as foundations and corporate funders




  • Coordinate roadmaps with industry partners and track progress against shared milestones




Qualifications and Attributes




  • BA or BS degree from a 4 year college




  • Previous experience as a Scrum Master




  • Previous experience as a Project Manager working on software projects




  • Excellent written and oral language skills and a proactive approach to communication




  • Comfortable facilitating decision-making in a cross-functional, matrixed organization




  • A passion for group dynamics and for building high-performing teams




  • Understanding of Agile frameworks, the spirit of continuous improvement, and a desire to coach development teams




  • Experience with project management and software development tools; in particular, GitHub and Pivotal Tracker




  • A desire to learn and contribute in an fast-growing, dynamic environment




  • Energetic, flexible, funny, humble, smart, and kind
title: Senior Agile Project Manager at Global Poverty Project (New York, NY)

description:
At Metron, we are seeking talented, experienced programmers to design and develop code, algorithms and visualization tools that will be tested on real world hardware in real world environments. As a Software Developer you will work on both small (2-3 people) and large (12 people) teams where each person on the team is involved in the entire software development process, from concept, through design and implementation to demonstration. The ideal candidate will have experience writing well-documented, maintainable, usable, and extensible software and APIs and will thrive in an environment working with motivated, engaged, intelligent people.



Metron Culture:



Metron is a 30 year old company with a long history of applying mathematical models to the solution of real world problems, particularly those related to national security. At Metron we value innovation, inquisitiveness and insight and our no-nonsense management structure gives you the freedom to create products you can be proud of. Metron produces everything from innovative ideas and algorithms to applications running on deployed Navy platforms. Software engineers and scientists working at Metron have private offices, but their doors are almost always open. Project managers have technical degrees – not MBAs.
title: Software Developer at Metron, Incorporated (Reston, VA)

description:
How does it feel to be a valued contributor in a highly collaborative team of elite technical talent?


Join us and find out!


At OutMatch culture is not something we “create”, it’s something that we attract by finding people that want similar things in life. It’s the character of each individual that defines us. It’s our values and motivations that bring us together. It’s something that each member of our team has the privilege and the responsibility to help define and nurture.  Collaboration is a foundation of our company, and we’re looking for smart individuals who are self-motivated and passionate to join us.  When you work with us you will join a fast-paced team that has maintained a highly effective startup culture.  We value passion, delivery of high quality software and the drive to continuously learn and improve.


If you think you have what it takes WE WANT YOU!!!


At OutMatch you will participate in design, development, testing, debugging and configuration of web based and Mobile friendly software products/applications. You will have the opportunity to be part of a world-class development team which is chartered with designing and building our next generation talent assessment system, by maintaining high standards of code quality, following best practices and leading by example.


Things you will do as part of our team...



  • Design, develop, enhance and support web-based and Mobile web-based SaaS applications using Microsoft technologies, ASP.NET, ASP.NET MVC/WebApi, JS libraries and MS SQL Server Databases.

  • Engage as part of an agile team, in software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including adhering to coding standards, setting up and maintaining builds for continuous integration; designing and coding enterprise framework components; and performing code reviews

  • Solve complex technical problems and debug/troubleshoot systems while following best practice guidelines

  • Assist with configuration of solutions to meet unique customer requirements

  • Generate data files and reports from SQL Server


…And most important, you will immerse into a culture of collaboration, contribution, and fun!
title: .Net Developer  Full Stack at OutMatch (Dallas, TX) (allows remote)

description:
Yocale is the perfect way to discover & book appointments with local businesses. We are a team of dedicated and ambitious individuals changing the world for how consumers and users book appointments with businesses nearby. If you would like to leave a legacy and change the world, jump on board!

title: Senior .NET Developer at Yocale (North Vancouver, BC, Canada)

description:
Are you interested in working for a company where your ideas will be taken seriously? Vitamix is built to empower you to affect the change you would like to see. If you are a thought leader, change champion, and view technology as a constantly evolving practice, this is the right place for you. Vitamix wants to push the boundaries of contemporary IT.  We embrace new technology ideas and would like to build a devops culture.  At Vitamix your title will be Web Developer but your role will span multiple traditional IT roles and enable you to help form the IT function. You would have the opportunity to work with a team of highly skilled technologists and business associates and apply your talents in developing for and maintaining our customer facing web applications.


The Web Developer ensures the creation, enhancement, and operations of multiple customer facing systems, working with individuals within both IT and business units to advance the cause of Vitamix and improve its IT function.



  • Understands, develops against, and configures the full stack for owned applications (WAF to storage)

  • Leads day to day operations and project work for all web platforms (including the technology stack serving Vitamix websites and the technology stack serving our Shows department), including collaborating, directing and delegating to external consulting

  • Instills cultural evolution of Vitamix IT towards devops

  • Works as peers with other developers, architects, and engineers to evolve IT application development and operations processes

  • Works as peers with business analysts to assist in defining high level architecture and providing delivery estimates

  • Works with business units to deliver technology solutions for business problems

  • Troubleshoots and debugs application issues related to performance, defects, and application errors

  • Extends packaged software platforms in a way that enables the ability to continuously upgrade

  • Refactors existing code based on new requirements, defects, or elegance

  • Suggests design, implementation and process improvements to the Architect or Manager

  • Assists in the definition, development, and documentation of software’s business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments

  • Assists in defining software development project plans, including scoping, scheduling, and implementation

  • Verifies quality, performance, coding, branding and security standards are being met for internally developed code and any vendor developed code

  • Recommends, schedules, and performs software improvements and upgrades
title: Web Developer at Vitamix (Olmsted Township, OH)

description:
Join our team at Ohlala – the first platform for paid dates! We are looking for front-end engineers who wants to further their knowledge about cutting-edge technologies and who want to have an impact and be involved in the creation of our product!


You are a frontend enthusiast having multiple years of experience? We are looking for a passionate new member of our frontend team.


Our product is a single page webapp that behaves like a native app, relies heavily on React and is powered by Node.js. Since the code is complex we use TypeScript and a powerful IDE to safely handle the code and recognize bugs early. This allows us to conveniently use ES6 features. We organize information transport within the client by means of Flux and Redux.

We heavily rely on Github and use agile processes (Scrum) to manage our projects. We currently work on integrating test driven development principles for all layers of our app.
title: Frontend Engineer (React.js) at Ohlala (Berlin, Germany)

description:

You should have strong hands-on technical skills with at least 3 years of experience working with an Adobe Omniture analytics suite. This individual should have experience developing measurement and data driven strategies across all aspects of a direct to consumer e-commerce environment.

title: Web Analytics Specialist at Bethlehem Shared Services (Bethlehem, PA)

description:
Location: Open/Negotiable within the United States of America.


Overview of the Position


The Alliance is seeking a skilled Web Developer with broad experience in front end and back end development. This position will be responsible for defining, developing and deploying custom code to deliver high quality, high impact solutions. This position will work on the Alliance’s web products that include:



  • Alliance website: https://www.healthiergeneration.org/

  • Schools: https://schools.healthiergeneration.org/

  • Out-of-School Time: https://host.healthiergeneration.org/

  • Let’s Move! Active Schools: https://myactiveschool.letsmoveschools.org/


The Alliance’s custom code is built within Clockwork’s Active Media Manager, on LAMP stack with significant javascript. Data captured online syncs with Microsoft Dynamics CRM. In addition, there are three SSO integrations with third party sites.


The ideal candidate will be an expert developer, comfortable with complexity, detail-oriented, forward-thinking and passionate about children’s health and social change.


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Manage, maintain and update complex custom code in order to increase maintainability, performance and scalability as well as meet our business needs

  • Manage integration of data points between the web systems and Microsoft Dynamics CRM

  • Lead development work for new web projects

  • Implement enhancements in web products and content management system

  • Troubleshoot and fix bugs in the system

  • Test new code deployments

  • Identify areas for improvement

  • Adhere to and ensure compliance with policies, procedures and standards

  • Other duties as assigned to support both internal and external technology
title: Web Developer at Alliance for a Healthier Generation (Portland, OR) (allows remote)

This role requires the candidate to possess, or have a willingness to acquire, skills in large-volume data analysis with Hadoop/NoSQL technologies.


LOCATION - We are currently considering qualified applicants for this role who are based in or relocate to Los Angeles or San Francisco.

description:
New Relic
Senior Software Engineer, Java/JVM
Portland, OR


New Relic is a Software Analytics company that makes sense of billions of metrics across millions of apps. We help the people who build modern software understand the stories their data is trying to tell them. We are looking for talented engineers to join our expanding Java/JVM teams.


We work with some of the smartest, nicest people you'll meet. People who work here say the problems they work on are enormously challenging, and that the team culture is the most supportive they've seen. 


Our customers are our fellow engineers and IT operations professionals, so we have easy access to feedback. We experience the impact our work is having. We take pride in providing services with great availability and ease of use.  We are adding new products to our platform at a steady rate and this means our services need to be accessible and easy to use. We'll be connected to both new and established teams consuming our services.


We would love to connect and learn more about you and tell you about upcoming roles at New Relic!


What working on this team is like:



  • We own everything about our services from concept through to operations

  • We ship incrementally and often. Once we merge code we normally want to ship it straight away

  • We own our process and we're free to improve on it
title: Senior Software Engineer, Java/JVM at New Relic (Portland, OR)

description:
Are you our new  Front-end Developer? (fulltime)

Be part of our journey to make tech feel personal

Ever had a bad experience on a website where content wasn’t personal and relevant? We have. That’s why our founders set out to build a company that’s changing that. We declutter web experiences and make sure customers get personal and relevant content at all times.

Want to help out?
We are looking for a Front-End Developer for our office in Maastricht. It’s a laid back office with people from all over the world. In between writing code, you can work on your German, French, Chinese, Spanish and Dutch!

What you will be doing
Together with a small team of UX/UI designers and other Front End Animals, you will be building cool stuff for our clients. Companies like KLM, Coolblue and FedEx want better and automated ways to talk to customers, and you can help them out with that.

You



  • build interfaces that rock

  • create web apps that have millions of users

  • develop components that make sure our technology stays ahead of the pack

  • occasionally show up for meetings with clients and show off how smart you are

  • are a good communicator that knows how to get things done



You love solving problems. Breathe code. Have crazy ideas that sometimes work. Get obsessed with optimisation. Are UX driven and kick ass at HTML5, CSS3, jQuery and JavaScript.
title: Frond-End Developer at CX Company (Maastricht, Netherlands)

description:
LSI is looking for an experienced (3+ years of demonstrated experience in full software development life cycle) web developer that is highly motivated, talented, able to work independently and looking to be a big fish in a small pond. You will be working on a small team of smart developers creating and supporting complex web-based software applications that are heavy on data and logic.


We are looking for someone to help improve internal web development processes with innovative ideas and implementation, who is interested in wearing several different hats and being a solid team player to help other employees improve their skills. If you are looking to skate by and blend in on a bigger team, this job will not be for you! This is a salaried position that requires occasional evening and weekend work and being on-call for systems you support.


We offer a competitive salary, benefits and bonus plan, ongoing education and travel, a fast-paced work environment and the ability to work with the latest technologies. We offer near-unlimited vacation and you can make your own hours – as long as you get the job done. Want to wear shorts and comfy shoes to work? No problem! We’re looking for the best, brightest and results-driven performers to join our team – not fancy dressers! We reward innovation, creativity and the ability to get the job done.


This position is open to local candidates only. All applicants must be authorized to work in the United States. LSI is an equal opportunity employer.
title: Web Developer at Local Social, Inc. (Cary, NC)

description:
Informz Inc. is a Technology Company that provides digital marketing solutions and software development services.

We are currently seeking a Senior Full Stack Java & AngularJS Developer to be the lead technical resource on a Data as a Service portal that is being developed. The role will oversee overall development and architecture of the product and will work closely with the Product/Project Manager to build a quality software product. At the outset the Architect will work in a hands on capacity and will help extend the functionality of the existing product and will work closely with the vendor’s (custom) development team. We expect to build a small but strong development and support team around this role as the product matures. The role is hands on and the candidate will be required to actively build code and help coordinate development.  Must understand not just how to write code but why you are writing it and how it would impact the systems - a holistic view of design and development.  Critical thinking skills are desired and proven experience working on systems with architectural complexity.

At Informz, you will be part of a company that values your work and gives you the tools you need to succeed. Our headquarters is located in Saratoga Springs, New York, but this position allows flexible to work remote. Informz provides competitive compensation and excellent benefits


Core Responsibilities



  • Partner our vendors to build and customize a software product to the client’s requirements.

  • Build custom applications and extend vendor application using AngularJS, Spring MVC, MySQL, Elastic Search, Java.

  • Build applications that connect to RDBMS (Oracle, Teradata)

  • Work with other open source software platforms such as NoSQL and GraphDB’s

  • Build interfaces between applications using REST/JSON

  • Manage the software stack

  • Help build and grow and internal development team

  • Build product expertise and help expand product scope and footprint

  • Manage the complete software development process including planning, design, implementation, testing, debugging and tuning, as well as iterative post-production enhancements

  • Document all internal code development efforts

  • Coordinate development efforts across teams and products. Work with other internal teams to access, provision and coordinate resources and releases of code.

  • Collaborate with business users, internal and external technology teams in order to deliver a scalable application that exceeds requirements ensuring compliance with enterprise standards

  • Identify new opportunities, tools, and services to enhance the custom software platform;

  • Support and troubleshoot issues (process & system), identify root cause, and proactively recommend sustainable corrective actions.
title: Sr. Full Stack Java & AngularJS Developer (U.S. Remote) at Informz Inc. (New York, NY) (allows remote)

description:
Complexe app-technologie en je team vanuit senioriteit een stap verder helpen

Je functie
Bij Ziggo geldt: never a dull moment. De klantbehoefte in onze markt verandert razendsnel. En wij spelen daar dagelijks op in. Bovendien zijn we sinds kort onderdeel van het beursgenoteerde, internationale Liberty Global. Dat zorgt voor flink wat dynamiek. En geeft veel ruimte voor nieuwe innovatieve diensten en producten. Dat zie je 1-op-1 terug in de manier waarop we 24/7 werken aan unieke apps voor onze klanten. Daarin lopen we voorop. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan onze hooggewaardeerde Horizon GO app. Maar we blijven ambitieus op dit vlak. Als Master Engineer Apps bij Ziggo kun je met jouw kennis en ervaring complexe apps én je team nog steviger op de kaart te zetten.

Developen kent voor jou geen geheimen. Maar je bent al lang een stap verder in je vak. Jij neemt als geen ander het voortouw binnen een team en zorgt dat baanbrekende apps in technisch opzicht subliem werken voor klanten. Bruggen slaan tussen bestaande systemen, de (grote) krenten uit de app-pap en op alle niveaus mensen winnen voor nieuwe ideeën. Dat is helemaal jouw pakkie-an. Heb je nu het gevoel dat we het over jou hebben? Kom dan snel bij Ziggo praten over de functie van Expert Engineer Apps.

In de kern



  • heb je een voortrekkersrol bij het laten ontwikkelen, testen en uitrollen van platformen en netwerken die onze apps bedienen. Niet alleen voor bijvoorbeeld Horizon Go, maar ook voor apps van partners als HBO en Fox Sports. En natuurlijk voor apps die we de komende tijd samen met jou gaan ontwikkelen

  • draag je bij aan het technisch-strategische beleid binnen je eigen vakgebied en deel je jouw vakkennis met collega’s. Ook vertaal je de productvraag naar technologische concepten

  • verzamel, definieer en communiceer je functionele en technische specificaties van nieuwe ideeën voor Ziggo

  • ben je verantwoordelijk voor het up-to-date houden van de technische plannen en voor de volledige borging daarvan binnen de organisatie. Hierin werk je veel samen met andere Ziggo afdelingen, (internationale) collega’s van Liberty Global en leveranciers. Je bent daarin een echte aanjager van samenwerking en een coach voor minder ervaren collega’s

  • ontwerp en implementeer je oplossingen die operations processen ondersteunen. Meten is weten. En we willen precies weten wat klanten van onze apps vinden. Zo kunnen we apps steeds verbeteren en helemaal afstemmen op de wensen van onze klanten. En zijn onze diensten overal, altijd en op de beste manier bereikbaar

  • analyseer je systeem- en klantdata. Mede op basis hiervan bepaal je de prioriteiten op de roadmap
title: Master Engineer Apps Ziggo at Ziggo (Amsterdam, Netherlands)

description:
We’re looking for a seasoned Senior Game Server Engineer who understands what it takes to own and develop a world class live gaming service backend for AAA games.


The successful candidate is highly creative, motivated, collaborative, player-focused, and has a passion for all things gaming.


As a Senior Game Server Engineer, you’ll work on the backend server suite for an up-and-coming title as well as future, unannounced titles.


You will collaborate with the team and external developers to drive projects from inception to live, while always looking to improve the experience for the team and players. 


You adhere to Agile software development best practices and aren’t content to ever consider a project “done”; constantly looking for ways to evolve, streamline, and automate processes.


You are a genuine human being that interaction, and a self-starter that can work independently when needed. You have the ability to distill complex issues for dissemination to a wider audience.
title: Senior Game Server Engineer at Sixfoot (Houston, TX)

description:
Stratagem Technologies is an established sports betting technology startup looking for an innovative Python Developer to maintain and enhance the development of sports odds feeds from various bookmakers as well as our automated trading and execution system and scalable data processing infrastructure.


This position will involve continued development of our trading system, smart execution engine, backtesting system and high frequency bookmaker APIs using various Python libraries. The role will also partially involve spending time enhancing process automation and monitoring of our infrastructure and other operations. Our main trading system infrastructure is written in Python / Cython, and we handle large amounts of data and use databases such as Cassandra, MongoDB, Redis and message queue RabbitMQ. We also run a Spark cluster, and use Ansible to help manage / standardize our servers.


You will ideally have experience processing high rates of throughput of realtime data, working with APIs, and developing rules-based automated systems. Some experience with big data, such as experience with Spark, ideal but not required. Some experience with infrastructure ops using Ansible or other configuration management systems also ideal.


These feeds and capabilities are at the core of what we at Stratagem work with and are integral to our company. We are a growing and innovative technology company at the intersection of finance and sports betting. You will be smart and able to get stuff done, but you'll also want to contribute ideas and expand horizons.


Joining a startup, this is your chance to get in early and make your mark. You'll have autonomy to make decisions and to work how you want to work, allowing you to deliver results as efficiently as possible. Want to explore new technologies? No Problem. Want to learn new skills? Even Better.  We want you to be hungry to push the horizons;  both ours and yours.


Please note position does not allow remote working.
title: Python & Infrastructure Engineer at Stratagem Technologies Limited (London, UK)

description:
Oletko kiinnostunut moderneista web-teknologioista? Löytyykö sinulta innostuneisuutta ja oppismishalua kehittyä alan guruksi? Poplatek etsii Junior Fullstack-kehittäjää tiimiinsä! 


Poplatek: Junior Fullstack-kehittäjä


Tyyppi: Vakituinen, täysipäiväinen (joustoa, jos opinnot loppuvaiheessa)
Toivottu tausta: Valmistunut / opintojen loppuvaihe
Toivottu aloitusajankohta: Sopimuksen mukaan
Työpaikan sijainti: Leppävaara, Espoo
Haku-DL: sunnuntai 1.5.2016, huom! Hae tehtävään heti, sillä hakemuksia käydään läpi jo hakuajalla!


Poplatek on suomalainen maksuratkaisuihin erikoistunut palvelu- ja ohjelmistoyritys. Meidän mielestämme maksamisen pitäisi olla sujuva ja huomaamaton osa palvelua. Kehitämme kitkattomia maksamisen järjestelmiä aina ideatasolta vaativiin teknologiaratkaisuihin asti.

Poplatek etsii innostunutta Junior Fullstack-kehittäjää liittymään joukkoonsa. Emme etsi valmista gurua - tärkeämpää on halu ja kyky oppia. Saat työsi tueksi kokeneen tiimin tuen! Olet innostunut moderneista web-teknologioista ja oletkin kartuttanut jo jonkin verran kokemusta käyttöliittymien toteuttamisesta JavaScriptillä. Työlläsi haluat tuoda loppukäyttäjälle positiivisen fiiliksen ja ehkä saisit ujutettua mukaan jonkun WOW!-äännähdyksen aiheuttavan ratkaisun.


Käytämme työssämme laajasti eri teknologioita ja odotamme, että tässä vaiheessa tunnet ainakin JavaScript-HTML5-CSS- stäkin, React- ja Angular-osaaminen katsotaan eduksi. Koska kyseessä fullstack-positio, odotamme, että tunnet jo jollain tasolla ja/tai olet innostunut oppimaan myös muita käyttämiämme teknologioita (Node.js, Python, Scala, Docker, AWS, Linux). Toivomme, että olet myös kiinnostunut opiskelemaan pilvipuolen koodausta (esim. Javalla), jotta projektit eivät turhaan seiso pallon pyöriessä kehittäjältä toiselle.


Hakijalta odotetaan:
• Innostunutta asennetta ja oppimishalua
• Loppuvaiheen amk-tai yliopisto-opintoja
• Vähintään vuoden verran kokemusta vastaavan tyyppisistä tehtävistä (tai näytöt harrastuneisuuden parista voivat korvata kokemusta)
• Suomen ja englannin kielen osaamista


Tarjoamme:
• Alan huipuista koostuvan kokeneen kehitystiimin täyden tuen
• Avoimen ja keskustelevan yrityskulttuurin sekä mahdollisuuden vaikuttaa yrityksen kehittämiseen
• Viihtyisät tilat sekä valitsemasi työkalut ja mahdollisuuden opiskella työajalla
• Pleikkarin toimistolla sekä haastavampaa viihdettä tarjoaa kevään IoT-Hackathon!


Osuiko kuvaus sinuun ja innostuit tästä mahdollisuudesta? description:
HealthcareSource is the leading provider of talent management software for the healthcare industry. With a comprehensive suite of solutions that includes applicant tracking and onboarding, recruitment optimization, reference checking, behavioral assessments, employee performance, merit planning, compensation analysis, competency and learning management, and eLearning courseware, HealthcareSource addresses the needs that are most critical to healthcare talent management professionals.
  
We are seeking an Associate Software Engineer to provide both internal and external technical support for our healthcare-specific talent management products.

The Associate Software Engineer is responsible for fixing bugs, and contributing to the development of product features.   The Associate Software Engineer will work closely with more experienced engineers, and product owners as part of a small agile development team.
 
This position will be located in our Woburn, MA headquarters and reports to the Software Engineering Manager.

As an Associate Software Engineer, your typical day will look like this:



  • Develop and test new product features

  • Fix bugs
title: Associate Software Engineer at HealthcareSource (Woburn, MA)

description:
The Javascript Developer is responsible for developing moderately complex areas of the product. The position is targeted to a Developer who is able to help take this function to a new level as the company continues its rapid growth.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
» Develop software as part of an agile team with short iterations and frequent releases;
» Work within development/project life-cycle, from analysis to implementation, test and release;
» Contribute to planning and the subsequent development of applications;
» Remain up-to-date in terms of current and future needed upgrades.
title: Javascript Developer: Come join awesome Gambling projects! at Novabase (Porto, Portugal)

description:
This is a contract position of 90 to 120 days, with conversion to full-time employment available to candidates who demonstrate their value during the term of the contract.


During the term of this contract, you will enhance our in-house Analyst Workbench tool. This includes tasks such as:



  • Serializing and synchronizing C++ object instances across a network connection

  • Producing visualizations of threat intelligence


A contractor who successfully completes these tasks can expect an invitation to join our team full time and work on many other exciting projects, including use of A/I heuristics to analyze network traffic and security threats. You will also get to work with our embedded devices team as they deploy Arxceo client technology into vehicles, robots, medical equipment, and all sorts of other exciting toys.


Our shop uses Ubuntu Linux almost exclusively. Windows and OS X are also present, but most day-to-day R&D is done on Linux, either natively or on virtual machines.


Our operation here is still getting started, so we don't yet have a perfect Joel score - but we aspire to. If that's important to you, why don't you join and help us make it happen?


Candidates in the northeast Florida region will get preferred consideration. If you are located elsewhere but you believe you are an ideal candidate, feel free to submit your resume.


No third-party representatives, please.
title: C++ Qt5 Developer - Contract Position at Arxceo Corporation (Ponte Vedra Beach, FL)

description:
You will be part of an agile team, focused on building web sites that are visited by millions of users every day. Each team will work on multiple products, including sports, casino and poker games!


With over 100 frontend developers spread over 2 locations, our client aims at delivering the best experience in the industry.


As a JavaScript Developer you will be responsible for the development of software in a scrum team using agile. You will be contributing to the success of the products by materializing the business teams’ visions into the best user experience.


You will participate in sprint planning, development, testing, bug fixing, deploying software, implementing new features as well as improving the existing functionality.

description:
AndPlus is a custom software firm based just outside of Boston, MA in Framingham, MA. We're looking to add another person to our growing team to help facilitate the development of a large-scale application for one of our customers.


This application has a VB.NET back end with an ExtJS front end, and the right candidate would be able to go in and out of both technologies to implement features on a modular basis. We run a kanban process and you would be working directly with our customer, so strong communication using Skype and HipChat and being a professional while working remotely with this customer is required for this position.


Our firm is pretty awesome. Our office has a gym inside the unit for our employees to use, free snacks and coffee all day, frequent company-paid lunches, and an awesome culture. We spend our days working on complex software for awesome customers, names like ESPN, Bloomberg, and Honeywell to name a few. 


If you feel you are a fit, please apply to this posting. We're looking forward to meeting you!

description: The Shared Platform Services team (which is part of the Visual Studio Team Services) owns delivering core platform services as well as solving complex problems in Identity, Authorization, multi-tenancy, Commerce and Customer acquisition & engagement spaces. Our problem-space is platform-centric and systems-engineering centric with design challenges around scale, performance, and security and API design. We are looking for a seasoned engineer who can think outside of the box, passionate about end user experience and can work across multiple application tiers. This team is chartered with increasing the adoption of Visual Studio Team Services both by end-users as well as partners extending the service with a wide range of functionality. The team owns both the user experiences as well as the backend services needed for each of the technical spaces. The team follows agile methodologies extensively, embraces DevOps model and delivers value to customers through continuous development lifecycle. In this role, you will be contributing to the engineering efforts owning design, implementation, testing deployment and live site support for multiple backend services and user experiences. You will architect backend services and the corresponding user experiences and work with other teams across VS Team Services, Azure, Azure Active Directory and Visual Studio to ensure that the components plug in well with the overall architecture. You are expected to drive the technology strategy and be proficient with the technology stack (Web Services, REST, SQL, JavaScript, Typescript and jQuery) and own the testing strategy for the components. You will be working on ambiguous and open ended problems, drive long-term architecture and partner with team members to deliver innovative and exciting customer experiences.
title: Software Engineer II at Microsoft - Visual Studio Online (Redmond, WA)

description:
Working remotely is an option after trial period has been completed. Preference will be given to those who would consider relocating and working here in Teamwork HQ.

---

Teamwork.com is a company founded by developers, built to give our outstanding crew of programmers the best possible environment to write great code and build the world class products that our customers love. Developing great software is our DNA - it's what drives us, excites us and it's what’s built us an incredible business.


That excellence has been rewarded with hundreds of thousands of amazing customers all across the globe and millions of users who sign in every day to trust us with getting their businesses organised and running productively. We’re a profitable, entirely self-funded business with no investors or outside influences beyond one - our customers and what is best for them.  


It’s a responsibility that we take very seriously. We’re a company of action, full of try’ers and do’ers - we try stuff - new software, new languages, new techniques, we make mistakes and we learn from them. We work hard, together as a team and individually when it suits better.


We are looking for developers with real passion for their work, who love learning and who would thrive in a "come-see-what-I-did" environment.


Talented developers will get to grips quickly with our code as long as they are masters of jQuery and any server-side language (like PHP, ASP, Ruby or ColdFusion). Send us on details of your projects, let us see what you've done in the past. Then checkout the TeamworkPM apps, tell us what you'd change or how you'd improve them.


So that’s us, now let’s talk about you!
title: Senior Software Engineer at Teamwork.com (Cork, Ireland) (allows remote)

description:
Charles River Analytics is looking for a Senior Scientist to join our Decision Management Systems division. We are looking for a world-class artificial intelligence researcher who shares our enthusiasm for innovative research, cutting-edge technology, and solving real-world challenges.


The ideal candidate will have a broad range of research skills and interests that cover a variety of AI technologies, including machine learning, planning & optimization, automated reasoning, probabilistic modeling, natural language processing, data mining, data/information fusion, and applied mathematics and will have demonstrable depth in at least one such area. We are currently most interested in candidates with depth in big data analytics, information fusion, and applied mathematics.


In this key position in our Decision Management Systems division, you will develop and foster relationships with customers, design innovative software solutions to our customers’ problems, and manage groups of scientists and software engineers to make those designs real. You will also connect with other researchers in the field by publishing papers, articles, and reports as a lead and contributing author and by attending relevant conferences. You will help develop new AI concepts and prototypes for domains such as cyber security, big data analysis, military command and control systems, space-based systems, unmanned vehicles, modeling and simulation, missile defense, intelligence analysis, and human behavior modeling.



Major Responsibilities/Activities:




  • Maintain deep awareness of the state of the art in current pure and applied research in relevant disciplines

  • Identify and analyze domain challenges and user needs

  • Pursue novel research to address user needs, including establishing new areas of research

  • Manage engineering teams to develop technology solutions

  • Conduct technical discussions with customers guided by or acting as a Principal Investigator

  • Be primarily responsible for writing proposals, research reports, and scientific papers, and presenting work at briefings and conferences when appropriate

  • Identify and analyze business development opportunities, generate a marketing plan combining technical and business objectives, and present and sell innovative and robust technical solutions to current and new customers
title: Sr. Scientist at Charles River Analytics (Cambridge, MA)

description:
What We're Looking For



  • We're looking for a Senior Full-Stack Developer to support our engineering team and take our product to the next level.

  • You should be comfortable in our "all hands on deck" environment and should be able to thrive in a startup culture.


Who are you?



  • Resourceful. You've taught yourself things the hard way, and you're a troubleshooter to the extreme.

  • Self-driven. You have superior organizational skills, integrity and great follow through on tasks. You don't get overwhelmed easily... mobile app in a month? No prob.

  • Motivated. You understand the impact of a highly-satisfied, excited crew of users; you are slightly obsessive-compulsive about grinding away at issues.

  • Team Player. You'll be working closely with our CTO and other members of our team. You should excel at working with others and functioning as a tight unit.


You will be responsible for:



  • Working with a cross-functional team to continuously ship code

  • Leading design and architecture for major technical features

  • Implementing features, improvements, and bug fixes

  • Managing and scaling our infrastructure

  • You should have experience

description:
StatMuse is changing the way sports (and eSports) fans interact with each other and with the games they love. We're a small, well-funded team with great investors all carefully crafting a product we love and that our users rave about.


As a polyglot shop we strive to pick the best tools for the job. Our application is a universal ("isomorphic") app using React/Redux, a thin Node.js layer and an Elixir/Phoenix backend, all of which centers around a powerful, F# NLP engine.


We're looking for talented web developers. Ideally you're deeply familiar with our tech stack, but we know a great developer can learn on the job. Bonus points for React Native, native mobile development, D3 and/or data visualization experience.


As a company we all value work/life balance, continual learning, and a friendly and productive environment. If you're looking to be a ground-floor engineer at a venture-backed (Series A) startup using sharp tech to build a next generation sports media platform, we'd love to hear from you!


Come work with us full-time in our San Francisco workspace or remotely from your current location. Candidates must legally be eligible to work in the United States.

description:
A day at Snappet as a Developer


“Good morning!” It’s around nine or ten in the morning when you enter the Snappet premises and you greet your colleagues cheerfully. The early birds – perhaps even you – have already turned on the coffee machine, allowing you to get your daily fix to start the day. Your office outfit merely consists of the required good mood and persistent drive.


You’re ready to start coding for a few hours. Together with that hot cup of coffee you sit yourself down at your desk until you join our daily stand-up meeting at noon with our Russian colleagues to discuss all updates and statuses on items you’re working on and need to be handled. Fast forward to demo Thursday, three weeks ahead: you and your colleagues proudly present your work to one another.


After working the entire morning and finishing that daily meeting you feel your stomach yearning for fuel. It’s lunchtime at 12.30 pm. Whether you get your favourite sandwich at Utrecht Central Station, or use our company restaurant is completely up to you.


After recharging your inner battery you’re good to go for another work session. Your aim is to finish coding on time in order for you colleague to perform a code review on your work. This helps you to tackle possible mistakes.


Before you know it time’s up. Whereas one may go home immediately, the other may join their colleagues for some after-work drinks or other activities. Needless to say you’re completely free to make up your own mind about joining or not.


When you get back home you feel that today was a productive day that gave you another energy boost. See you tomorrow!



Does this fit your profile?
This typical Snappet day suits you perfectly. Snappet may very well be your perfect match. Not just because it’s close to your home in the Utrecht area, but also because you can be yourself. Just like all of your colleagues. Basically there’s no typical Snappet employee; the versatility amongst our team is what grabs you the most. It allows everybody to inspire one another with their qualities and therefore help each other grow.


That last element is what you value greatly in a working environment. Growing is essential for you to stay challenged and you don’t fear taking your own responsibility to achieve this growth. Your results and teamwork prove this to a large extend.


After all, teamwork is exactly what leads to even better results. You appreciate that social vibe at work; it keeps you motivated to do what you’re good at. It basically contributes to the overall goal of drastically improving children’s learning results. You support this mission in every way.


What does our front-end look like?



  • JavaScript, jQuery, jQueryUI, KnockoutJS en RequireJS;

  • HTML and CSS/LESS.


What does our back-end look like?



  • Amazon Web Services: Snappet fully opperates in the cloud and we use a broad spectrum of Amazon services;

  • ASP.NET, MVC5, C#;

  • LINQ to SQL and Entity Framework;

  • SQL Server and MongoDB.
title: Full Stack and Front-end Developers at Snappet Connected Learning at Snappet (Utrecht, Netherlands)

description:
Kortfattat om din roll


Din primära uppgift blir att vara med och bygga det bakomliggande system som ligger till grund för vår
kapitalförvaltning och återrapportering. Vi är ett mindre team som jobbar agilt med de senaste
teknikerna, där du kan vara med och forma morgondagens lösning.


Tekniker som för stunden används är exempelvis MVC.NET, MongoDB, Python och en hel del Javascript på klienten. Därför är det en fördel om du briljerar inom de teknikerna!

description:
Bugatti Veyron, Concorde, Apollo 10, high velocity bullet, light - and you! Your whole life, you’ve learned fast and adapted to new challenges in double quick time. Now’s your chance to step on the gas and move your career forward at warp speed.


The internet is growing at a phenomenal pace. App development is advancing even faster. So we’re looking for mobile engineers who are one jump ahead of that rapidly accelerating curve.


Like you, Skyscanner is also on a high-speed growth journey. Over 30 million people a month trust us to turn their travel nightmares into sweet dreams. Increasingly, they’re doing this on mobile devices, resulting in 35 million app downloads to date, and counting – which is where you come in. We’re currently expanding our app development capability and we’re looking for world-class mobile developers with mentoring or management experience to work within a small team of innovative engineers, in an ultra fast paced environment. We can offer you the flexibility and fast pace of a startup combined with the opportunity to develop products that are used by multiple millions of people every day. Products that people actually want and find useful, built by a company that still has massive potential ahead of it.


If you are flexible, eager to learn and can’t move forward fast enough, don’t waste any more time, apply today.


You can offer us:


A hunger to learn, and learn fast. A desire to meet challenges. A passion for developing apps that work in a global and scalable environment. A commitment to applying engineering best practice to produce top quality solutions.


We can offer you:


An excellent career move. The chance to work with great developers, in fact, great people across the board. The space to be trusted to do what you do best. And to make decisions that matter. The potential to tackle big stuff, not small stuff.
title: Senior Mobile Engineers - Objective-C, Java, Xcode, Android, REST API at Skyscanner (London, UK)

description:
Who we are


Origami Risk is a wildly successful Enterprise Software as a Service growing at an exceptional rate. Origami has been consistently ranked the #1 Risk Management Information System (RMIS) in the industry’s most comprehensive study for the past 3 years. Founded by industry veterans committed to bringing new ideas and advanced features to the RMIS market, Origami Risk’s innovative software is designed with the latest technology and a focus on performance and ease-of-use. It features powerful workflow, advanced reporting and analysis tools, and intuitive features to improve productivity and better manage Total Cost of Risk—saving our clients time and money and enabling them to be more successful.


Making a Difference


We have an immediate opening for a Senior Developer to join our growing development team. The position will be based in our Chicago or Atlanta office.


Job Function:



  • Provide feedback on existing product and contribute to the design of new product features.

  • Have experience with building intuitive and highly scalable web applications using the Microsoft stack. Technology expertise must include ASP.NET, MVC, SQL Server, C#, HTML/CSS, and Javascript.

  • Be responsible for building entire features across all layers (database, services, and Web UI).

  • Have experience with building responsive web applications that work across different screen sizes.

  • Experience with building mobile applications using Xamarin and C# is also a plus.
