description:
MRI Software offers enterprise software applications and hosted solutions that support real estate property owners, investors, and managers in operating their real estate property management businesses and maximizing the returns on their diverse global business portfolios.  An Information Assurance Analyst will work with business and Information Assurance Engineers to document and distribute policy based information to the business and client, own processes for addressing security related requests from prospects and clients, and prepare and document standard operating procedures. A detail-oriented, thorough individual will be suited for this role to document, work cross-functionally, and contribute estimates of capital requirements for project objectives. This role will work within our SaaS Engineering team, as well as other departments across the organization, as a crucial addition to the success of MRI’s SaaS organization.


Essential functions include:



  • Develop corporate-level information security awareness and training programs in concert with the training department.

  • Prepare and document standard operating procedures and protocols in coordination with the Information Assurance Engineers. 

  • Assist in the execution of annual audit(s) with vendor and internal personnel (e.g. SSAE16)
title: Information Assurance Analyst at MRI Software LLC (Solon, OH)

description:
We have offices in Ithaca, NY and Madison, WI — but will consider remote employees when there is a strong match of skills and experience. Please reference job #RR11-01


Innovation is at the heart of GrammaTech. We are constantly pushing the boundaries of software research and development – from software assurance and software integrity to cyber-security threat mitigation and autonomic computing. 


GrammaTech was founded 26 years ago, with a firmly-grounded purpose to help organizations develop tomorrow’s software.  Given the ever-increasing dependence of software in today’s connected world, our staff is able to focus on the most challenging software issues through a constant stream of highly innovative research and commercial development programs – focused on the evolving cyber security landscape, software hardening and intelligent systems.  Within these projects, GrammaTech employees have the opportunity to work with industry, academic, and government experts, significantly advancing their skills in engineering, research, marketing, or sales.


So, do you want to have an opportunity to work with software assurance experts?  Have the ability to publish and further your software engineering skills in cyber security?  Work alongside some of the most cutting edge research and engineering teams?


GrammaTech's engineering teams work on the software challenges of the future within a culturally rich environment and great career growth opportunities.


Responsibilities:


The primary responsibility is to design and implement research prototypes based on ideas drawn from academic literature and original research. Team size varies from project to project. On small projects, a scientist may implement a significant portion of the prototype, while on larger projects they will lead a team of engineers. Our scientists are expected to:



  • Generate ideas for innovative solutions (original or drawn from the literature) that address needs identified by research sponsors. Write proposals for research contracts.

  • Translate research ideas into working prototypes.

  • Manage engineers implementing research prototypes: identify risks, plan work, monitor progress, review designs and code used in prototypes. Adapt your plan as you learn more about the sponsor’s needs and the benefits/deficiencies of the prototype.

  • Document research results in written reports. Present results in person at meetings with research sponsors.

  • Work with research sponsors to ensure success of any demonstrations or evaluations of the research prototype.

  • Collaborate with product and marketing team to identify a strategy to turn the research prototype into a marketable product.
title: Senior Software Scientist at GrammaTech, Inc. (Madison, WI) (allows remote)

The CRM System Administrator is responsible for providing day-to-day end-user support and training including system configuration, report generation, training aides, complex formulas and system maintenance. This position will work with end-users to establish and implement best practices with regards to system usage, release management, system maintenance, configuration, development, testing, data integrity, etc.

Repair and recover from workflow and or data integration issues. Coordinate and communicate with impacted constituencies.


Develop complex reports and dashboards that enhance end-users CRM experience.


Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all software resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as ETL flows.


Maintain security profiles and access rights and roles for users within the application.


Work closely with business partners to realize the full capabilities of the CRM .


Maintain high customer satisfaction through the delivery of high quality, timely, and thorough solutions to customer problems.


Systems Integration & Management Proactive identification of process improvement and enablement opportunities that may include selection, configuring and installation of plugin applications that enhance the functionality of base CRM software.


Review, map, and analyze business processes and translate to system requirements.


Proactive identification of process improvement and enablement opportunities.


Work with all levels of the organization to determine needs and establish priorities.


Develop, document and maintain installation and configuration procedures, initial and regression test procedures. Contribute to and maintain system standards. Research/recommend innovative, and where possible automated, approaches for end-user workflows and integration tasks.


Assist other Admins and Delegated Admins, including training and knowledge transfer.


Gather system requirements, conduct analysis, coordinate the design of solutions and establish metrics for success.


With the oversight of Management, create and maintain development and integration plans.


Manage the development and deployment of new applications, and/or enhancements to existing applications.

description:
The AWS Network enables the global operation of tens of thousands of applications across hundreds of thousands of servers around the world. The AWS Networking organization develops and operates the network platform for all of Amazon, including its e-commerce products and Cloud Computing solutions. This platform is industry-leading for its efficiency, throughput, scalability, reliability and intelligence. The network is fundamental to the success of Amazon.com and hundreds of thousands of AWS Customers.



As Manager of the EC2 Edge Services Network Engineering team in AWS Networking, you will own the design, scalability, security, performance and operations of the networks that interconnect AWS and our data centers to our backbone network and to the Internet. From whitebox networking to enabling new AWS services and customer use cases, the opportunities are rich and varied. Your job is to lead a team of 8+ highly skilled Network Engineers and deliver solutions that are always available, never constrain customers, continually reduce cost and provide low and consistent latency. You will leverage your skills in strategy, network design, project management, recruiting and team development to build a high performing team that delivers an exceptional customer experience.



Your work will delight our customers and disrupt the networking industry.

· A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or equivalent experience is mandatory.

· 8+ years of industry experience in a similar environment.

· 3+ years of managing and developing a team.

· Hands-on engineering experience in networking, large-scale distributed systems or a related field.

· Prior ownership of the design and operation of a mission-critical system.



· Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

· Excellent analytical skills.

· Substantial background building and operating large-scale networks.

· In-depth experience in the application of network design, including knowledge of major protocols, topology design, network hardware, device configuration and traffic engineering.

· Proven track record of success conceptualizing and delivering engineering solutions to customers.

· Hands-on experience with project management, preferably using Agile methodologies.

· Experience building production software applications or solid understanding of software development, distributed systems and systems architecture.

description:
Job Description



Be a part of an energetic and fast moving team that delivers incredible, innovative improvements to our products. We create a rich, interactive and engaging user experience. Our engineers write and test code that binds the front and back ends of our products together and makes the customer experience and product usability as good as it gets (and it gets pretty darn exciting). This role will be constantly working on and delivering new features and functionality through software improvements in small, high performing teams and continually optimise the performance of our products. You’ll collaborate often with other developers to write the best code for the project and deliver amazing results that our users love.


You will be joining a brand new, kick-arse team to start an Android development practice right here in Sydney, with modern development tools. Your team will build high-quality, design-centric mobile applications to delight knowledge workers around the world. 


More about our team


We are always growing, learning, and adapting, in and out of the office. You’ll be joining a team that is crazy smart and very direct. We ask hard questions and challenge each other to constantly improve our work. We are self-driven but team oriented. We're dedicated to agile methodology and big believers in 'lean' (which means we don’t do documentation for documentation's sake). We know the importance of validating our assumptions about users and implement various types of testing to prove ourselves right (or wrong). Our bottom line is improving our user’s experience- no matter what.


More about the perks


Our offices are open, highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some killer perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, five paid volunteer days a year for your favorite cause, plenty of food and drinks (including our famous 'Charlie's bar'), ergonomic workstations with Aeron chairs, 20% work time for your passion projects, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and more.

This is an opportunity to work in a real-time environment where you can make immediate contributions.  You will be part of a small team building real-time data feed handlers for the largest financial exchanges such as the NYSE, LSE, TSE, CME, BATS, ICE and NASDAQ.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Develop and implement infrastructure to support market data and trading.

  • Develop and maintain market data feeds.

  • Build and design large scale applications, with a focus on reducing latency and improving the performance of the system.


Requirements:



  • High proficiency in C++ development in a Linux environment.

  • A Computer Science degree.

  • Outstanding problem solving skills.

  • Familiarity with multi-threading and networking protocols (TCP/IP, Multicast preferred).

  • Experience in a real-time environment in the Financial industry.

description:
Amazon Game Services is looking for an experienced software engineer to design and build services and APIs for game developers to help them better monetize their games. We offer a series of stimulating problems, an environment that's exciting, motivating, fun, and new, and colleagues who will challenge you to achieve more than you thought possible, as well as great camaraderie.



Joining our team will give you endless opportunities to use your passion, ingenuity, experience, and pragmatism to build very cool services that will help game developers solve problems around game discoveribility, monetization, retention, and playability. We're serious about service-oriented and object-oriented design, code quality, easy maintenance, reliability and software stability.



To be successful you'll need to have lots of experience with C++ or Java, GUI development, customer focus, knowledge of SOA, experience working with databases, and excellent communication skills. You need a strong grasp of architecture and advanced engineering principles and design patterns. You must be a fast, efficient coder and make coding and design decision with multiple simultaneous dimensions in mind. If you are the kind of person who naturally creates new opportunities and drives projects to completion, sometimes across several functions and groups, you should apply now.

• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field

• 6+ years relevant work experience

• Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis

• Proficiency in, at least, one modern programming language such as C++, C# or Java



• Master's Degree in Computer Science or related field

• Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

• Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

• Experience with distributed computing and enterprise-wide systems

• Experience building APIs and services for game developers

• Strong ability to communicate with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy

• Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills, and make them more effective, product software engineers

• Ability to influence software engineers best practices within your team

• Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between

description:
You will be joining the Interest Rate Derivatives (IRD) trading systems team. This is a front-office development group with over 120 members spread over three continents. The team is responsible for trade capture, trade life-cycle management, market data management, curve calibration and systems that calculate valuations, risk, profit & loss and feed this data to downstream systems. The candidates will occasionally have interaction with the IT and BU partners, financial controllers, market risk and operations departments.


We’re currently looking for committed developers into a smaller team that is responsible for reporting these risk measures further downstream to other systems and various business units. The core of our system is implemented as a distributed Java system (Java SE, Spring, Hazelcast), with grid based infrastructure that supports computing. Our team’s responsibility is to implement new features and enhancements from design to integration to the wider universe of systems within Morgan Stanley.


We work closely with the companies risk management who drive our projects, based on regulatory demands for newer risk measures. The other key area of collaborations is with peer systems up/downstream, as we sit in the middle of the data flow. Joining our team is a good opportunity to be part of capable team and have an insight of business requirements, to work with people in different teams and locations including desk strategists and financial modeling teams.


What we can offer is strong technical mentorship, various internal trainings, exposure to new, cutting edge technologies (distributed caching and computing, large scale service oriented architectures) as well as opportunity to learn about financial products and the banking industry.


Primary Responsibilities
- Gathering and clarifying requirements; collaborating with managers and lead engineers of the IRD team, broader technology partners in the Technology Division and BU partners in order to understand technical and business requirements that will drive solutions
- Delivering new features/components from design to integration to the wider system and enhancement and necessary re-factor of existing one.
- Perform testing of the new features, supporting production deployment and post production activities
- Building strong relationships with BU partners and the global IRD team
title: Java/Scala Developer - Enterprise wide financial trading system at Morgan Stanley (Budapest, Hungary)

We're based in beautiful Edinburgh and we're growing from strength to strength with over 45,000 paying customers and continued strong growth. Customers love what we do!


We operate in small, cross-functional teams with a great degree of autonomy. We like to help each other, learn from our mistakes, invest in self-improvement and have fun doing it. description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 80 million users per month!

Join our dynamic Software Engineering department as a PHP Developer and help shape the future of the world’s largest hotel search. With around 3 billion requests per month we are operating on a large-scale, complex, and rapidly evolving IT landscape. We encourage all team members to question established processes and give them the freedom to experiment with new technologies in order to drive trivago to the next level.


Your responsibilities:



  • Develop our high traffic web applications (e.g. price comparison, hotel booking or B2B applications).

  • Implement new website features.

  • Set-up efficient and high performing database queries in MySQL.

  • Use JavaScript to breathe new life into our front-end development.


The ideal candidate:



  • Has extensive PHP knowledge and experience.

  • Is experienced in Software Engineering, ideally in a high performance environment.

  • Has JavaScript experience.

  • Is familiar with the term Dependency injection.

  • Enjoys technical challenges and is eager to explore new technologies.

  • Holds an academic degree in the field of IT or has completed a comparable apprenticeship successfully.

  • Speaks English (our company language) fluently.


Life at trivago:


trivago is an exciting hub of multicultural activity where nationalities from all around the world come to share their knowledge and work together on redefining the traveling experience for millions of people. We nurture all our talents and provide them with the support they need to develop professionally as well as personally. We encourage fanatic learning through regular code workshops, Hackathons and constant feedback as well as promoting quick decision making by our trial and error philosophy. Flexible working hours are in place to create a trusting environment where productivity is measured through goals rather than how many hours spent in the office. For our internationals, we help with relocation and provide German classes for those wanting to learn and practice their German.

Join us at trivago - a place where talented minds meet, crazy ideas are shared and innovation is born.

description:
Hello, we are SolarWinds and we appreciate you clicked on our job offer – this was the first step to become part of a multinational software development company which creates great IT management software our customers love.


What would you do?
Do you really believe in “changing the world” or just jumping from one to another company and cashing out? If the first answer is correct, you have an opportunity to work on new functionality for Virtualization management.


Virtualization management product is one of the top products in SolarWinds. Virtualization is mainly about Agility which is able to respond to changing requirements as quickly and flexibly as possible. Virtualization brings new opportunities to data center administration, allowing users to enjoy reconfiguration of running computing environments without impacting the users.


Currently in Brno we are developing a new functionality you will definitely hear about in the future.


You will be the key member of top Virtualization engineering team. Your colleagues will be talented engineers working according to agile (SCRUM) principles who like to code, create smart and simple solutions, and explore new technologies. You will be responsible for product development.


Your contributions will have an immediate positive impact on our current and future customers.  Above all, our R&D department has several respected virtualization management geeks like Kong Yang where you’ll have direct access to some of the brightest minds in the industry every day in our highly collaborative office space.


What will you use?
The main technologies you will use are: C#, ASP.NET, SQL, HTML5, AngularJS, jQuery, TypeScript, CSS, Selenium, Nunit, nodeJS, xui



The tools we use on daily basis are: Visual Studio 2015, Resharper, TeamCity, Jira, and Confluence


In addition we will be examining the cutting edge technologies that will push our products’ excellence even further. If you have the same passion for technology as we do, you have just found the right place!

description:
We are a dynamic and innovative company that is building a platform to help educators all around the world improve school performance. As winners of UK 2015 Education Investor Awards for school improvement service, we are proud of being the fastest growing education platform in Europe. Our belief is that, if used in the right way, technology can make a positive and lasting impact to education and in turn improve the world around us.

Our system improves school information entry, analysis and communication, fostering a data-driven school culture while increasing transparency with parents and pupils. This cloud-based system is designed for deployment on all types of devices- smartphones, standard mobiles and traditional laptop/desktop systems- and can be used in schools across the world.

We are looking for an experienced JavaScript Engineer to develop novel applications and user interfaces. We need your help and experience to scale our enterprise system which already has an international user-base of around 10,000 schools.

You will be part of an elite team of JavaScript experts and creative UX designers tasked with delivering innovation and keeping us up to date with cutting-edge advances in browser and mobile technologies.

If successful, you will work with some very interesting people and become part of an amazing workspace experience and culture which rewards initiative and collaboration.


Benefits


We believe culture is key to a happy and productive work life. Our offices in Belgrade are located in a purpose-built section of a modern coworking space in the vibrant Savamala district. We like our working atmosphere casual and cooperative and we value people over process. We let good arguments and not hierarchy shape our discussions and inform our decisions. We want to learn from the best in the business at workshops and conferences. We are motivated to make a difference to education, and take pride in working for a business thats trying to make a lasting, positive impact on the world.

We value our team more than anything and will provide you with everything you need to move your career to the next level. This includes:

  1. The opportunity to work with some seriously interesting people
  2. A very competitive salary
  3. Opportunity for leadership and continuous development
  4. Amazing work environment
  5. Maintaining great work/life balance
  6. Top of the range equipment
  7. Award-winning catering service serving healthy and delicious meals
  8. Working on products that make a positive impact in the world

description:
We need to strengthen our Development Team in Bangkok, Thailand and are now looking for a System Developer to be part of our team to further develop our international internal and external web system.


The work tasks include further development of existing systems as well as managing your own development projects. Although the focus will be on back-end, some work will include front-end development as well. You will also be included in the service desk as a 2nd line support and you will report to our IT & System Development Manager.


To fit into this role, you need to have a genuine interest and experience in working with back-end PHP-development. You enjoy working with team work in an international environment and get challenged by developing the impossible. You are used to work against tight deadlines, can manage several projects in different phases simultaneously, as well as acting as 2nd line support at our service desk.


You have a logical mindset and you see possibilities and solutions where other see problems. You are used to take own initiatives and work to improve things all the times. You will be part of a team of 5 employees as well as part of the entire IT/R&D department of approximately 20.
title: System Developer (PHP+MySQL) at DIAKRIT (Bangkok, Thailand)

description:
Our team achieves more every day. So can you.


We have been making navigation apps since 2004 and have been the market leader ever since.
And, we are not slowing down.  



  • Do you always think about making better user interfaces and menu-navigation flows?

  • Do you think of yourself as a Master of Java and/or C++?

  • Do you like the challenge of displaying real time info in a very easy way for users to understand at a glance?

Sound interesting?


Want to code the future?
We like to think we make that happen. Therefore we are looking for product-aware user interface engineers, who have a passion for building the user interface and who drive the future of navigation and beyond.  Designing and developing the best possible products is what we're famous for!

Here’s a little taste of your challenge

Position Summary:

The National Security Operations' Security Response Center Engineer 2 position is responsible for monitoring security system events in a 24 X 7 Security Response Center facility. Responsibility includes managing performance, fault and security incident events and performing the appropriate response to adequately close or escalate the events until closure. In addition, will perform the more advance security systems configurations, upgrades and troubleshooting changes per approved change requests and/or Operations tickets for security tools (i.e., firewalls, routers, Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems, etc.). During a critical security event, this position will be authorized to make customized changes to the various security tools or system configurations to minimize the immediate impact to the business. PLEASE NOTE: Must be willing to work weekends and/or nights.





Major Duties:




  • Monitor all Security Response Center, National NOCs and Local Management Centers events to identify security issues or respond to automated event identification.

  • Develop, execute and maintain security system fault management support procedures for assigned systems.

  • Develop, execute, and maintain security incident management procedures for large ISP network and systems.

  • Investigate opportunities to update security system capabilities or perform policy updates based upon system performance reports and observed incidents or threats.

  • Perform configuration updates, such as modifying configurations, signature definitions or implementing new policies on various security tools, as directed.

  • Assist with daily OS and application level administration for assigned security elements.

  • Respond to security incidents and report on incident handling and resolution.

  • Be able to leverage other network management tools used by the National Operations Centers or Local Management Centers in the identification and response to security incidents and faults.

  • Ensure timely proactive identification and reporting of security gaps and vulnerabilities to the critical business information, systems and network infrastructure.

  • Assist with daily virus, vulnerability and exploit assessment review

  • Assist with security compliance audits to verify completeness of security required configurations and verify system hardening.

  • Participate in the post-mortem investigation of catastrophic network security incidents and prepare security incident reports documenting the findings.

  • Other duties as assigned.





Minimum Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor degree or equivalent years of experience, in Network Security, Computer Science, MIS, or related field.

Preferred: SANS GIAC Program certifications in Intrusion Analyst, Incident Handler and Forensics Analysts, CCNA

Desired: CISSP, CISA





Experience:




  • Three years of experience working in a security response center or security operations center.

  • Bachelor degree in Network Security, Computer Science, MIS or related fields.

  • Minimum 3 to 5 years of experience in monitoring security events and security incident handling.

  • Minimum 3 to 5 years of experience in administering network gear (i.e., Cisco routers and switches) and at least one year of CMTS experience is desired

  • Minimum 3 to 5 years of experience administering Unix or Linux based applications (or) at least one year of experience administering Unix or Linux systems in secure environments.

  • Must be able to work on round-the-clock shifts, rotating or fixed.

  • Minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience with TCP/IP and UDP/IP protocols and networking

  • Experience with firewall policy creation and rule updates, configuration and troubleshooting; firewall administration experience preferred.

  • Experience with Radius system administration, creating and modifying user and group access rights, TFA configurations, reporting and troubleshooting.

  • Strong working knowledge of network Intrusion Detection and Intrusion Prevention Systems.

  • Must be familiar with trouble ticketing procedures and have strong written and verbal communication skills.

  • Experience with best practice incident response procedures.

  • Knowledge or experience with network based security mitigation systems or tools.

  • Proven analytical and problem solving ability.

  • Comfortable with interfacing with other internal or external organizations regarding failure and incident response situations.

Position Description:



The Senior Engineer in Data Scienceand Analytics is an enticing role, which will contribute significantly to the team's ability to support advertising sales and marketing within Comcast. In this role, the individual will leverage advanced skills and experience in mining structured, unstructured and transactional data, and develop analytics that will drive advertising insights and strategy across linear and video-on-demand (VOD) platforms. Given the ever-changing industry, the majority of analytical projects provide new and innovative opportunities to use big data in ways that support leading edge initiatives. Projects may include predictive analytics in determining effective and efficient advertising, targeting select segments, as well as analytics providing ROI on new advertising strategies. Additionally, there will be key projects involving the development of segmentation and propensity modeling, utilizing internal, external and third party enhanced data.





With every project will come opportunities to work with other engineering, research, marketing and BI teams across multiple areas within the company. The role requires significant expertise in mining, joining, and analyzing data from multiple environments. Therefore, a strong background and level of experience is needed with Hadoop, Hive, Python, R, Linux, Java, SQL, and related skills/tools. In addition, excellent analytical skills required including advanced statistical and data mining techniques.





The Senior Engineer will be a significant member of the team, working closely with his/her manager to collaborate on current and upcoming projects, discuss data requirements and resource needs, and designing effective approaches to working with all necessary data. In addition, he/she will participate in meetings with the business to discuss, define, design and deliver analytics that will significantly impact both the company and its clients in the advertising industry.

title: AngularJS Developer at Attend Anywhere Pty Ltd (Melbourne, Australia)

description:
We are looking for a talented Front-End Developer to join us in Melbourne. The team is full of great developers to collaborate with, thriving on autonomy and a love for building great products. We use exciting technology and solid principles, bringing design and programming together.


As a Senior Developer you will lead one of two sub-teams. Your mentoring will help our developers grow, and your technical leadership will help to drive the direction of our platform. You will help your team operate smoothly and highlight any roadblocks. Senior Developers interview new candidates and help us hire great people. We are looking for candidates that are from a leadership role, or have strong technical skills and love to work with and help other developers.


We want someone with a strong attetion to detail, who loves to learn and iterate. If the spelling mistake in the last line made you cringe, then you’d be a perfect fit! If you love programming and user focused design thinking, apply now and help us transform advertising technology.


Within the Melbourne development team you will develop products for publishers and media agencies. Our products ease transactions between the two, providing automation and transparency through visualised data. Every day we work to drive meaningful industry-wide change and innovation.


Having a sibling team and product in Sydney means collaboration and communication are core values. We have built a fantastic API that is consumed by the Sydney product and by the Melbourne front-end.


We primarily use AngularJS and CoffeeScript in our front-end and have a rapidly growing open-source ES2016 React component library (github.com/Adslot/adslot-ui) used here in Melbourne and soon in Sydney.

title: Full Stack Engineer at Roost (San Francisco, CA)

description:
Extraordinary careers for extraordinary people



  • Do you have flair for technology and a desire to make a contribution to the security of New Zealand?

  • Are you passionate about problem-solving and enjoy mastering difficult technological challenges?

  • Can you assess and reorganise complex data to identify its true intelligence value?

  • Are you looking for a career where no two days are the same?


If any one of the above sounds like you, then read on….


We are seeking enthusiastic and motivated graduates to join our team of talented specialists in Wellington.  Our graduate programme will provide you with a broad awareness of the GCSB mission and an opportunity to develop the skills and on-the-job knowledge required to launch your career within the New Zealand Intelligence Community.


This is a unique opportunity where you’ll get to work with some of New Zealand’s smartest people and use exciting technologies to solve challenging technical problems. Above all, your work will ensure that New Zealand remains one of the best places in the world to live. No day will be the same – ever.


Up front, we are seeking candidates who are inspired and excited by intellectual challenges. You will also have an excellent academic record and a strong desire to learn and to build a career in the context of national security.  In addition you’ll have:



  • completed, or be in the process of completing, an undergraduate or postgraduate qualification in Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering,

  • strong critical and analytic skills and penchant for problem-solving,

  • excellent verbal and written communication skills, and

  • a commitment to excellence and integrity.


We offer some fantastic benefits, including:



  • training and career development opportunities, including opportunities for overseas travel,

  • flexible working hours with a commitment to work-life balance,

  • subsidised health insurance,

  • on-site gym, and

  • an active social club.


How to apply


Applications must include a completed application form [DOCX, 69 KB], a current CV, a cover letter and a copy of your latest academic transcripts.   These should be sent to careers@nzic.govt.nz quoting C2/16/26 in the subject line.


Please direct any enquiries regarding this role to careers@nzic.govt.nz


Please Note:  Employment in the NZIC requires candidates to have been a NZ citizen, or a citizen of UK, Canada, USA or Australia, for at least 10 years and be able to obtain and maintain a Top Secret Special (TSS) security clearance. 


Ordinarily to obtain this level of clearance candidates must have a 15 year checkable background in countries where meaningful and reliable checks can be undertaken.  Where requisite checks are unable to be made, the candidate application may not be able to progress. 


Applications close Monday 30th May 2016


The GCSB treats all applications for employment in the strictest confidence and we ask that you maintain a similar level of confidentiality. You are expected to exercise discretion during the recruitment process and throughout your career.
title: IT Graduate Opportunities - Wellington at Government Communications Security Bureau (Wellington, New Zealand)

description:
New Relic
Engineering Manager, Growth Engineering
San Francisco, CA


The New Relic Growth team is tasked with driving acquisition, onboarding, monetization, and retention across the New Relic product suite for the full lifecycle of our customer base.   We are looking for an experienced manager with a passion for supporting engineers and nurturing an environment where they can do their best work.


The team focuses on the four core areas for Growth:



  • Data & Analytics: We ask the right questions about what drives growth, collect relevant data, automate the analysis, and define tests that improve conversion.

  • Acquisition: We lead the digital acquisition strategy for newrelic.com and focus on optimizing the conversion rate of different aspects of our digital marketing strategy.

  • Engagement & Retention: We own key experiences across the customer lifecycle that help drive engagement and growth such as setup, signup, and product adoption.

  • Monetization: We are responsible for self-service checkout in product, which allows interested customers to enter their credit card and get billed for New Relic.


In this role:



  • You will be building and maintaining a great team of great engineers who enthusiastically work with their larger cross-functional team, sharing in successes of our Growth initiatives

  • You will be supporting rapid iteration and continuous delivery, with monitoring and metrics around all features and experiments so we can use data to drive our direction

  • You will deeply understand the New Relic customer throughout their lifecycle -- and continuously improve their experience!

description:
At Cloud Academy, were builders. Learning new technology is just as exciting for us as building it. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and empowering students, developers, engineers and companies to build and grow products with robust and constantly updated cloud skills. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled educational content to developers worldwide.

Were looking for a Full-stack developer to help us take our product to the next level. We move seamlessly from full-stack web development, to mobile, to deployment/scaling. This position will take ownership of how features are implemented from user experience to backend, involving our web app, mobile app, APIs and backend infrastructure.

Youll have an opportunity to make a large impact on the culture of our development team. Our ideal candidate is a humble leader, equally capable of teaching and learning. You will work in our Switzerland office (Mendrisio, CH), together with our international engineering and design team and were happy to facilitate your relocation to this area if needed. Expect to travel at least once a year to our US headquarters in California for a short period of time (usually 2 to 3 weeks maximum).

Responsibilities:

  • Able to write well-structured, maintainable, idiomatic code with good documentation; unit tests for every feature, bug fixing and code reviews.
  • Communicate with the rest of the company (e.g. sales, marketing, UX, etc) to ensure the functionality you're implementing is what was intended.
  • Collaborate in a cross-functional team, including mobile developers, designers and product managers in order to quickly deliver new features.
  • Work side by side with DevOps. Every piece of software should provide useful error messages and logging capabilities. DevOps will see the messages before you will, so make them count!

Benefits


  • Competitive compensation
  • Yearly bonus based on your achievements
  • Stock options
  • Full benefits, including medical, dental and vision
  • Yearly budget for conferences/courses for your personal development
  • A very exciting environment with unlimited snacks and drinks
  • Regular travels to our US offices (San Francisco)
  • Your personal workstation (up to $2000)

We value diversity and are an equal opportunity employer at Cloud Academy. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description:
Requisition ID: 12064


Based in Chicago and operating in major regions globally, we are a local e-commerce marketplace where people discover and save on amazing things to do, see, eat and buy in their neighborhoods. We're enabling real-time commerce across local businesses, travel destinations, consumer products and live events. At the same time, we provide merchants with the resources and tools to grow and manage their businesses. Culturally, we believe that great people make great companies and that starting with the customer and working backward moves us forward.


Senior Site Reliability Engineer 


The Senior Site Reliability Engineer, and a master of the Groupon web site.  A strong candidate should have an expert knowledge of the technologies and best practices used in a high-traffic, customer-facing website.  We need people who enjoy solving complex problems, who can act independently, and who can stay calm in high stress situations - while driving a path to restoration.  Groupon is growing rapidly, and we need leaders who can help beat a path forward.


Requirements


- 10+ years large scale environment experience


- Appropriate technical background (Bachelor in computer science or equivalent)


- Strong knowledge of Linux operating systems and environment


- Strong knowledge of Networking, Load balancers, DNS, and TCP/IP


- Experience with databases (MySQL, Postgres)


- Ultimate self-starter


- Experience in handling production outages and root cause analysis


- Strong crisis management leadership ability


- Effective communication skills, whether talking to individual contributors or to executive management


- Experience with Virtualization a plus


- Skill with Ruby, Python, or Java a plus


- Experience creating tools for infrastructure (IaaS and PaaS) management and automation a plus


Responsibilities


- Part of a Global TDO team, working US business hours five days a week.  No on-call!


- Prioritize the focus of the Global SOC during normal times and during crises


- During a crisis, lead the effort to triage and mitigate


- Manage real-time communications during outages with both technical and non-technical audiences


- Evangelize Best Practices to the rest of the company


- Develop policies and procedures that improve overall product stability


- Design and create tools to manage the site


- Participate in reviews of outages in order to improve overall product stability


- Build relationships with development teams and technology leaders across the company
title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer at Groupon Inc (Palo Alto, CA)

Skyport Systems is developing groundbreaking, security-focused solutions for the enterprise.  We are an early-stage startup looking for skilled, passionate individuals that want to make a direct impact on product.

At Skyport, you will be part of the team responsible for developing our data analytics/warehousing engine.  We securely collect data from our server platforms in the field, perform ETL with stream processors, and feed the UI through RESTful API endpoints.  Help us enable new user-facing, data-driven features that will become part of our value proposition.

  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science with 3-5 years of experience

  • Experience in any of these: Spark, Druid, Hadoop, Kafka, Samza, or Storm

  • Familiarity with data mining techniques

  • Backend development in production environments

  • Understanding of application end-to-end (browser to cloud to backend data store)

  • Experience and understanding of multiple programming languages, including Java

  • Inquisitive, enjoy learning


Bonus

  • Experience in RESTful API development

  • Working knowledge of basic cryptography and cryptographic best practices

  • Knowledge of defense in depth and secure coding in a challenging environment


We offer:

description:
Job Description


WalletHub is a high-growth start-up based in Washington, D.C. that is looking for talented, hard-working individuals to help us disrupt personal finance.


More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:



  1. Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.

  2. Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.

  3. Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.


In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.


Responsibilities include:



  • Ensure proper security, monitoring, alerting and reporting for the infrastructure and be the on-call for production servers

  • Develop security monitoring and other tools to ensure the integrity and availability of our applications, server resources, reviewing system and application logs

  • Work with the incident team to diagnose and recover from hardware or software failures working with or as the Incident Commander to coordinate and communicate with our internal customers

  • Assist project teams with technical issues during development efforts

  • Gather system requirements and support several project teams in evolving, testing and rolling-out new products and services, then transitioning the site or product to post launch operations activities throughout life of the product or service

  • Work with the application development team and other systems engineers to make improvements to current isfrastructure

  • Document processes and procedures and follow a formal change management procedure


Note: This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed either remotely or from WalletHub’s offices in downtown Washington, D.C. (preferred). Can be either part-time or full-time, but let us know what you prefer when you apply.
title: UNIX/Linux Systems Administrator at WalletHub (Washington, DC) (allows remote)

description:
We are looking for a Python Web Developer who has strong web API and application design skills to join our team. This full-time developer will work on our Web Development team which builds real-time data visualization and parameter configuration tools to directly aid traders in assessing risk and strategy.


The Web Development team creates and maintains a suite of web applications. All of these web applications are based on Tornado, the asynchronous web framework for Python. We take full advantage of Tornado's coroutine feature to create elegant asynchronous servers that scale efficiently. We use websockets to create live-updating displays to ensure traders have access to the most up-to-date information as quickly as possible. We also work with other teams at Akuna Capital to design infrastructure and tools that help monitor the health of our systems. 


At Akuna Capital, your participation means creating the tools which developers, traders and support personnel will be using every day to compete on the market.


The ideal candidate is adept with Python but also knows their way around front-end (JavaScript) code in a pinch and wouldn't get lost in Chrome's DevTools. Any additional JavaScript experience is not required but is very welcome!

description:
Twitch is building the future of interactive entertainment. We have over 2 million broadcasters and over 100 million monthly active users. The services we create for our broadcasters have deep, lasting effects on their lives. For many of our partnered broadcasters, streaming on Twitch is a career, and our subscription system is central to making that possible.
We're looking for a technical engineering manager who can run a team of software engineers who gets why the story, "I bought a sub using my favorite streamer's sub button so I can talk in sub-only chat" starts off looking simple, but isn't. You like wrangling existing technologies together to solve business problems. Maybe you've built an e-commerce site or two. You will work with your team and specialize in subscriptions, payments, and related products like emotes and Turbo.

Most importantly you are a leader that can recruit and rally people to transform the gaming world, $4.99 at a time.

  • Continue to recruit and build out the subscription commerce team

description:
Chez Gameloft Montréal, vous travaillerez avec les meilleurs développeurs de jeux au monde. Notre studio a développé et développe toujours plusieurs titres à succès tels que les séries Dungeon Hunter, Modern Combat et Gangstar.


Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un programmeur engin pour développer un moteur de jeu, incluant un éditeur qui intégrera des modules génériques de 3D, de gameplay, de physique, de son, etc.


Dès le début de votre aventure avec nous, vous serez appelé(e) à:



  • Travailler sur un moteur de jeu, un éditeur ou tout autre module utilisé dans le studio;

  • Développer des modules qui seront utilisés par les programmeurs de production;

  • Identifier et corriger les bugs.


****


At Gameloft Montreal, you’ll be working with the world’s best game developers. Our studio has developed, and continues to develop, hit titles that include the Dungeon Hunter, Modern Combat and Gangstar series.


We are currently looking for an Engine Programmer to develop a game engine, including an editor that will integrate generic modules for 3D, gameplay, physics, sound, etc.


From the beginning of your adventure with us, you will be tasked with:



  • Working on a game engine, an editor or any other module used within the studio

  • Developing modules that will be used by production programmers

  • Identifying and fixing bugs
title: Engine programmer at Gameloft (Montréal, QC, Canada)

description:
DESCRIPTION


Help Scout is hiring a quality assistance engineer to help ensure our products provide an excellent customer experience. We build our products with engineer-led unit tests and functional tests, as well as extensive dogfooding and internal testing throughout the company.


As our first full-time quality engineer on our flagship Help Desk application, you are responsible for test plan development, execution and analysis across several major new initiatives. For this project you’ll be joining the Help Scout Web team of five engineers and working on an application used by over 6,000 (and growing!) companies around the world.


About the Role



  • The engineering team now has about twenty people, with five of them working full-time on our web application. You will be working hard with them to perform exploratory testing, build effective test plans, execute them efficiently, and deliver a great product to our customers.

  • A separate group of engineers works on several APIs consumed by both the web and mobile apps. Your test plans will need to cover the complete end-to-end application behavior exposed to the user.


About You



  • You love breaking things and running down what exactly failed. When you find a bug that’s hard to reproduce, you continue to test around the area to get to the root of a reproducible failure.

  • You are technical. You are comfortable using SSH, gathering logs, performing SQL queries, and automating the mundane.

  • You are an excellent writer and can effortlessly summarize an issue, steps to reproduce, and indicate all relevant details. You enjoy decomposing a large product into carefully considered test plans that maximize coverage vs time to test.

  • You are the go-to person for any applications you test and thrive gaining a deep understanding of the application. You seek out the major cow paths and important edge cases through research and close team collaboration.

  • You know the in’s and out’s of testing both iOS and web applications. You are familiar with tools that assist in bug capture, diagnosis, simulation and the limits of these tools.

  • You stay up-to-date on the latest quality techniques and can provide insightful advice about what does and doesn’t work to ensure quality over the long term.

  • You believe remote teams are the future of work, or are at least excited about the idea. You have experience working with remote teams or can adjust your work/management style to be remote-friendly.
title: Quality Engineer, PDT - CET timezones at Help Scout (Boston, MA) (allows remote)

Defines, develops and maintains code for software applications using established project methodology and guidelines. Implements design and testing processes for successful implementation of new or changed software applications. Focuses on innovation and quality.

Develops innovative technical designs and collaborates with team members to develop and maintain code quality and standards.

description:
Welcome to 21st century healthcare. In the 20th century, we built hospitals to address communicable disease.  Today, Omada Health is on a mission to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease. As a key member of our engineering team,  you will help design, build and maintain systems necessary for rapid growth. Our team practices pair programming (at least 50% of the week) so you will have the opportunity to learn new techniques and share your skills.


How you can make a difference:



  • Impact the health outcomes and happiness of our participants

  • Collaborate with other developers to write maintainable code and solve problems effectively

  • Build new products and applications using Ruby on Rails

  • Enhance customer experience by improving our analytics platform

  • Solve big problems including improving customized interventions, making data actionable for users

  • Collaborate across the whole company to create life-changing experiences via web and mobile applications

  • Work in an Agile, test driven, pair programming environment

  • Scale a high-performance system using Redis and PostgreSQL

  • Research and adapt new technologies quickly in a dynamic work environment


What you need for this role:



  • 2+ years experience building consumer web applications or B2B services

  • Solid web skills, ideally in Ruby on Rails

  • JavaScript (MVC and the fancy shiny stuff)

  • Extensive understanding of HTML5, CSS, Ajax, jQuery, JSON

  • Good OO design skills and an understanding of design patterns

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Intellectual curiosity, positive attitude, and a desire to influence the products being built

  • Other technologies we use: Coffeescript, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Git, Ansible, Backbone.js, Node, Unicorn


What you’ll get from us:



  • Competitive salary

  • Stock options

  • Unlimited vacation

  • Parental leave

  • Health, dental, and vision

  • Healthy snacks and lunch

  • Wellness events (e.g. running club)

  • Community volunteering


About Omada Health: We’ve pioneered digital behavioral medicine: an innovative approach to tackling the growing epidemic of type 2 diabetes, heart disease, and obesity. Our online programs combine world-class science, technology, and design to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease. Named one of Fast Company’s “50 Most Innovative Companies in the World,” our team includes passionate and talented individuals. Our approach has been embraced by major employers across the country, including Costco and Iron Mountain, as well as leading health plans, such as Kaiser Permanente and BlueCross Blue Shield of Louisiana.


We carefully hire the best talent we can find, which means actively seeking diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and ways of thinking. We strive to build an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated and leveraged to inform better design and business decisions. Omada is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer.
title: Software Engineer at Omada Health (San Francisco, CA)

description:
Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Senior Programmer to join our winning team, located in our Global Services Office in Los Angeles. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.

The Senior Programmer will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.

As a Senior Programmer at Latham, you will lead and assist with the design and development of Latham production applications including programming, coding, and debugging applications. You will lead such functions as time estimates, task planning, and project follow-up and status reporting. The Senior Programmer works with the user community and/or reviews existing specs and assists with providing appropriate Information Technology solutions to business needs while accomplishing these and other critical functions:



  • Working with and making recommendations to the Development Supervisors and Managers regarding the maintenance and enhancement of existing Latham production applications

  • Working independently to develop and implement comprehensive computing solutions that solve user business requirements; develops solutions in a professional manner and in accordance with established deliverable schedules and firm procedures

  • Developing and implementing new applications for Latham and maintains the existing production applications. Utilizing firm system software to generate and customize applications and recommends solutions for the firm

  • Participating in consultations with development staff, project analysts and end-users regarding system requirements and functionality; designing recommended solutions

  • Coding, testing, and debugging application systems per developed specifications; developing prototypes of various stages of development

  • Leading small, medium and large size projects from design through deployment

  • Maintaining applications after implementation, including user support and software upgrades

  • Working with the project analysts and user community to assist with gathering requirements, analyzing business problems, acceptance testing, etc.

  • Performing and/or assisting peer code-reviews for other developers

  • Assisting with the training and knowledge transfer to other developers

  • Preparing appropriate system and user documentation, as required

  • Performing other related projects and assignments as required.

  • Promoting effective work practices and working as a team member.


Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.

For information regarding family care and medical leave (CFRA), click here.
title: Senior Programmer (2145) at Latham & Watkins (Los Angeles, CA)

description:
Twitch is rapidly expanding engineering to deal with challenging scaling problem of being the 4th biggest consumer of bandwidth and one of the largest social gaming experiences in the world.  We have over 100 million monthly users and over 2 million broadcasters.  At peak we serve over 2 million requests per second at the edge. We have thousands of community developers building apps against our API today at https://github.com/justintv/Twitch-API, and are working closely with many AAA game studios to integrate their games with the the Twitch experience. We are looking for a deeply technical leader that has the wherewithal to get things done while maintaining excellent people relationships. You can discuss the finer points of API design one moment, and at the next, work closely with product teams to discuss product nuances. You will be growing and developing teams that own the core platform APIs that support the myriad of new product ventures. You will be building an org responsible for driving Twitch application and data architecture across the entire engineering organization to support stability at scale and rapid parallel development as we move further into an SOA world. Your teams will own multiple aspects of the Twitch platform: API, Identity, Core Data Services, core AWS infrastructure.



  • Recruit and hire to rapidly scale the engineering org while maintaining a high bar

  • Level-up engineering managers on your team and your peers

  • Drive the move to a service oriented architecture and help define best practices for all the product engineering teams at Twitch

  • Define what the the Twitch “edge” means including rate-limiting, QOS and SLAs with our community and partners

  • Extend our Twitch Identity story with internal teams and high profile external partners

  • Ensure the core data teams that drive our real-time consumer apps (chat, video, web) maintain reliability and can continue to scale beyond billions of transactions per day

  • Define the “service-success” framework on how Twitch builds micro-services in AWS

  • Participate in production on-call as needed
title: Director of Engineering: Core Platform at Twitch (San Francisco, CA)

description:
Rockstar Games is seeking a Linux Systems Engineer to join our platform team in San Diego. The successful candidate will be responsible for architecting and troubleshooting public facing Linux web architectures in various hosting environments with an emphasis on database technologies (traditional and emerging).


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Along with the Online Engineering team, work closely with development teams to develop, deploy, and support applications.

  • Work with development groups to architect solutions for new and existing projects.

  • Utilize configuration management and custom scripts to deploy and manage systems.

  • Ensure all critical systems and services are properly monitored with relevant alerts enabled.

  • Manage backups including ongoing policy refinement.

  • Migrate applications off of legacy environments with minimal downtime.

  • Be able to respond to critical requests during off-hours.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Mastery of Linux (RHEL/Centos preferred) support experience in large scale environments.

  • Advanced knowledge (maintaining, troubleshooting, tuning) of web architecture and related applications such as the following: Apache 2.x; Memcached; PHP, Python; MySQL; Mongo, Postfix, DNS; CDN; SVN, and GIT.

  • Experience managing data warehouse platforms & tooling: ex. Hadoop, Vertica, Pentaho.

  • Advanced knowledge and experience creating and executing shell scripts.

  • Advanced knowledge of load balancing administration and tuning – BigIP LTM, Squid, Nginx, and Varnish.

  • The ideal candidate will be comfortable in “non-silo’d” environments and have an appetite to research, test, and implement new technologies.

  • Configuration management experience with puppet, chef, or cfengine.

  • Experience configuring and maintaining AD/Linux integration (desired).

  • A sense of ownership, initiative and drive.

  • Passion for Rockstar Games.
title: Linux Systems Engineer at Rockstar Games (Carlsbad, CA)

description:
Our global expansion is creating job opportunities for creative thinkers who are wired for action and delivering big results. We’re also stacked with industry rock stars who are just as comfortable keynoting a conference or delivering a podcast as they are mentoring up-and-coming colleagues. But what our employees are most excited about is our products. Our market-defining technology provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.


Tenable now has over 600 employees globally and over 20,000 customers in 150 countries. Tenable Network Security is recognized as one of the fastest growing security product companies by SC Magazine, Red Herring, Info Securities, Deloitte, E&Y and as a Best Places to Work by Glassdoor, The Washington Post, The Baltimore Sun, The Washingtonian, The Baltimore Business Journal and Expert Marketplace.


The scoop:


Working from the comfort of your own home, or from our cozy Columbia, MD HQ, you can help shape Tenable’s next great product offering. That’s right, we’re cookin’ up something new and looking for several software engineers to build it from the ground up. So, if you’re looking for a new gig that allows you to do what you do best, then this is the role for you.


We need you to be a bad ass in all flavors of Javascript, particularly Node.js, traditional web dev skills and have some experience with breaking down monolithic applications into microservices. Beyond that, we want you to be excited about bringing skills from your past experience, as well as the desire to learn new technology from your new team members. You'll focus more on the backend, but you can consider this a full-stack engineer. We can’t say much about the new product, just know that it’s something we’re excited about and hope you are too.

description:
Sauce Labs provides the world's largest automation cloud for testing web and native/hybrid mobile applications. Founded by the original creator of Selenium, Sauce Labs helps companies accelerate software development cycles, improve application quality and deploy with confidence across 500+ browser / OS platforms. Join us in making the world a better place for continuous integration and software development. We’re building a next generation infrastructure as a service platform.


We’re looking for Senior Systems Engineer to join our Ops Team. This role will be responsible for the successful operations and scaling of the infrastructure and software that powers Sauce Labs and launches over 10 million VMs a month.


Responsibilities:




  • Write tools and scripts to provide automation and self service solutions for ourselves and other teams




  • Design new systems to support production services




  • Install, configure and debug hardware and systems in our data center;




  • Creatively solve scale challenges regarding a rapidly expanding cloud environment;




  • Work with real hardware - high density Cisco UCS B-series blades and C-series rack-mount servers, Nexus networking (10Gb+ core network), storage (NAS and SAN), Mac-in-a-datacenter, custom appliances for mobile devices, load balancers, and beyond;




  • Help improve monitoring and identify key performance metrics;




  • Proactive R&D - discovering and implementing new tools, emerging technology, etc.;




  • Disaster recovery design, implementation, and maintenance;




  • Create NOC runbooks, procedures, documentation, and diagrams of the environments you manage;




  • Troubleshooting and resolution of server/network issues;




  • Help maintain hardware in Sauce’s colocation facilities;




  • Help build out new data centers around the globe;




  • Participation in 24x7 on-call rotation.




Here are a couple of examples of the kind of projects you might work on:




  • Optimize hardware and configuration for improving hypervisor performance.




  • Automating and migrating a system configuration to our UCS platform for faster production scaling.




  • Building and optimizing a logstash cluster for our development team to monitor and analyze production system usage.
title: Senior Systems Engineer at Sauce Labs Inc (San Francisco, CA)

description:
This is what you have been looking for—an exciting, relaxed atmosphere to harness your coding talents and rise to the top of the world’s best career: Front-End Development. It’s a dream job for anyone who’s ever thought about front-end development for a living—with great pay, unlimited upside potential, and a chance to show the world how good you are (your work will be experienced by MILLIONS!). Plus, you’ll be working with self-driven, intelligent people who are all committed to creating the world’s biggest and baddest websites in the country music, rock and roll, world war, automotive and DIY niches among others. No boring working professional websites or vanilla organizations. 


We are Blue Rose Media and we publish the raddest music videos, news stories, live performances and viral content you will ever find on the web. Right now we are looking for a talented person to develop into an elite developer as our sites continues to thrive. Experience helps, but what we are most interested in is intelligence, a strong work ethic, genuine character and a talent for coding and development. Great jobs like this come along once in a lifetime… Don’t let this one slip by.


Key ways to becoming an essential team player:


-Code: Write clean, bulletproof HTML, CSS, PHP, Javascript, jQuery, and Wordpress code adhering to modern best practices.


-UI/UX: Create simple, efficient site layout/user interface by using standard HTML/CSS practices


-Architect: Integrate data from various back-end services and databases via API


-Communicate: Create and maintain easy-to-understand software documentation for end-users. 


-Scale: Be responsible for maintaining, expanding, and scaling successful website concepts.


-Grow: Stay ahead-of-the-curve on emerging technologies/industry trends


You should be pro-active in everything you do and you will have the freedom to be able to suggest ideas with an open door policy that will reward you for contributing to the growth and vision of the company.


You will be working closely with the owners of a company that has been crushing the competition for several years. We are a relatively small team, but we are a FAMILY giving 110% each day, with a “cup-half-full” mentality. Culture and character are extremely important to us in creating a work environment that everyone can thrive in. Your communication, work ethic and personal drive must be excellent or the position will not work out for you. The hours of operation are 9 am - 6 pm PST and it is a full-time position Monday thru Friday in the heart of downtown San Diego (and yes we do pay for your parking!)


COMPENSATION:


-$70,000 - $90,000 per year DOE


-Bonuses at project milestones


-Long-term partnership potential


-Parking included.


-Medical benefits not currently offered but may be offered in the near future.



HOW TO APPLY:

If interested please do not send a generic cover letter.

Please list 3 reasons why you are qualified with your application with one of the reasons being what your favorite genre of music is and why. We love when our team shares the same passion! Also, please note your most recent projects and what you contributed to each.


As long as you are hard working team player well versed in coding and you absolutely LOVE music and web development, this position is ideal for you!


Thank you for your interest. We look forward to connecting with you!!!


Here are some of our core sites for your review:


-Country Rebel Clothing Co. (www.countryrebel.com)


-Society of Rock (www.societyofrock.com)


-DIYjoy.com (www.diyjoy.com)

description:
We are looking for developers who enjoy solving problems, find coding fun, like being part of an agile team, are not afraid to try new approaches, yet easily abandon 'false-starts', like clean code, have strongly developed common sense, and take pride in things they build.


You would be working on Electio - our newly built and constantly evolving SaaS fulfillment management platform (more about Electio). Electio already does some great things which won us major clients, but that's just a start. We're excited to see what else we can make it do, how we can innovate in a challenging market, and delight our customers. 


Electio has to comply with very strict response SLAs and at the same time handle large, 'spiky' volumes of data, therefore designing for performance, reviewing and optimising your code would be essential.


We believe you should test your own code. We're not particular if you cover it with meaningful tests before or after you've written it - as long as you do.


You should also be ok with deploying your own code in a controlled manner. 


We use relatively new technology stack (.Net 4.6.1, C#, MVC 4.5, Nancy, SQL Server 2014, Redis, Dapper, ELK, and Azure Service Bus).


We keep our code in BitBucket, for continuous integration we use TeamCity, we adopted Gitflow as our branching strategy, and we manage our deployments via Octopus. All our environments are deployed in Azure.
