description:
Position Summary:

Delta Defense is searching for a Web/Application Developer who will be responsible for working on the back-end and server-side code required to build highly scalable, interactive websites and applications. This individual will be the technology lead for development initiatives across our domains, but will also be comfortable working with and supporting off-site teams. This person will produce common components that can be leveraged across multiple web properties, and will implement "responsive web design" in mind at all times.
 

Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Architecture design - Come up with appropriate architecture and technical solutions for a wide range of web projects. The candidate may, at times, be required to research new technologies, methodologies, architecture patterns, develop a proof-of-concept and then create a full implementation plan based on best design pattern applicable to solving the problem. This individual will also be required to look at areas of re-use and architect solutions that can be easily integrated across products. He/She will also ensure that solutions are architected and implemented to scale with responsive web design for mobile devices.
  • Developing Solutions - Have a working knowledge of different front-end and server-side programming languages and design patterns. He/She will be able to work closely with 3rd party agencies, project managers, and implement the right solution. Responsibility will include writing logic in the appropriate programming language to meet the functional requirements, as well as ensuring the appropriate test cases are implemented. This resource is also expected to ensure proper documentation of code before the code is deployed to production systems.
  • Application or Website Support - Provide all required development or operational support to ensure the website is performing to availability, load time and stability standards. Some of these tasks may require providing support outside of core business hours.

Skills/Abilities and Education Requirements:

Intangibles:

  • Demonstrates the Core Values of Delta Defense, LLC
  • Demonstrate analytical and problem solving skills using knowledge, experience and understanding of basic Internet concepts along with necessary software, databases and programming languages
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Strong time management and project development skills, with ability to deliver on time and to specifications
  • Proven ability to work with cross-functional stakeholders including Editorial, Product and Design
  • Cool under pressure
  • Time management and reliability (able to accurately predict turnaround time on projects and deliver on those timelines)
  • Provide feedback on technical issues, as well as recommend solutions

Tangibles:

  • Advanced knowledge of Internet protocols and applications in addition to a solid understanding of business and marketing strategies
  • Familiarity with CMS-assisted development
  • Ability to work both independently and collaboratively to meet deadlines
  • Intermediate/Advanced knowledge of version control (we use Git)
  • Intermediate/Advanced knowledge of development and workflow tools: npm, Grunt/Gulp, Yeoman, comfortable on the command line, browser dev tools (e.g. Chrome inspector)
  • College degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • 2 - 4 years developing web applications and architectures to support high-traffic, scaleable sites
  • Software development in language pertinent to project (PHP, .NET, HTML5, CSS3, Sass, JavaScript (& jQuery). Strong front-end and server-side development skills
  • Previous experience in building websites responsive web design
  • Track record of leading by example in the areas of code design, source code control, software life-cycle management, documentation, implementation, testing and production release of all software projects related to the environment.
  • Experience with web development lifecycle including design, development, testing, and deployment
  • Experience with web application architecture & design
  • Experience with web development design patterns and best practices
  • Demonstrable knowledge of best practice software development, QA, Source control

description:
Penetration Tester - Sr. Information Security Analyst


Are you looking to advance your Information Technology career?  If so, then UPS is the place for you!


Once known as a trucking company, UPS is now recognized as a technology company with trucks and is poised for success.  Spending more than $1 billion a year on information technology, UPS provides its customers unparalleled capability in tracking and distribution intelligence.  This technological infrastructure also enables UPS to provide fully integrated Web-enabled, business-to-business solutions.


UPS Information Services, a leader in information technology, is currently seeking career-minded individuals to join our team.  If you are highly motivated with a degree in Computer Science or related discipline, then UPS is a great place for you to advance your career.


Job Description:


The Penetration Tester - Sr. Information Security Analyst identifies, investigates, analyzes, and remediates information security events to ensure enterprise integrity against technical and physical risks.  He/She conducts quality management reviews to evaluate the effectiveness of security controls.  This position reports on the controls effectiveness for mitigating exposure to identified risks.  He/She communicates security issues and control gaps through security governance processes.  This position implements and integrates risk management procedures across the enterprise.  He/She participates in the development and maintenance of business continuity planning, data, systems, and network security for systems & controls related to their job duties.


The Penetration Tester- Sr. Information Security Analyst will:



  • Perform Security Penetration Assessments exploiting and compromising defined targets in a global enterprise environments ranging from web applications to handheld systems.

  • Identify and exploit vulnerabilities in web and mobile applications, OS, hardware, databases, wired and wireless networks, etc.

  • Represent Information Security as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) supporting the enterprise’s security efforts globally, performing penetration assessments based on “Statements of Work” defining the engagement parameters.

  • Document technical and logical security findings identified during the security assessments and providing security recommendations for enterprise executives, developers, web/system and database administrators.


Responsibilities:


Conducts Security Administration and Service Operations



  • Act as SME in security review meetings with developers, project managers and business executives. Compares security findings to enterprise defined security standard and business requirements. Implicate risk levels found and suggested mitigation or remediation direction. Examine assessment results, produce consumable actionable reports. Defends all findings, their description, risk, mitigation strategies, and references during reviews.

  • Interacts with customers and vendors in a collaborative consultative manor to accomplish planned results.

  • Investigates security events (e.g., problems, crises, critical situations, unauthorized access, non-compliance with UPS’s policies, fraud, service exploitation, etc.) to determine malfunctions, breaches, and remediation steps and to identify root causes.

  • Investigates unauthorized access and conducts tests to determine Information Services (I.S.) facilities and infrastructure malfunctions and breaches.


Conducts Quality Management



  • Gathers and organizes evidence of compliance with management directives to review and evaluate effectiveness of security functions, processes, products, and services.

  • Examines records and tests strategies to determine compliance with management directives and to identify abnormal occurrences.


Maintains Information Security



  • Researches emerging security topics and new attack vectors, as well as maintaining legacy knowledge

  • Leverages and develops analysis techniques, methodology, for efficient actionable items focused on real business security

  • Conducts local and basic risk assessments to enhance resilience for unauthorized access.

  • Provides immediate remediation response to decrease and limit damages by negatively impacting occurrences.


Education:


The desired Penetration Tester- Sr. Information Security Analyst will possess a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Security or related field or the equivalent in education and work experience.
title: Penetration Tester - Sr. Information Security Analyst (97863) at UPS Information Services (Louisville, KY)

description:
Req ID: 112385

Ericsson Overview

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help shape a more sustainable world.

We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & an innovative & engaging environment where employees enhance their potential everyday. Our employees live our vision & core values. They share a passion to win & a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning & growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge & skills necessary to reach your career goals.

We welcome the opportunity to meet you!

Position Summary

The Ericsson Service-Aware Policy Controller (SAPC) is called to be the central policy node in the operators’ network coordinating the nodes in the transport domain to behave according with the operator's defined policies. The role SAPC takes in the network is compared with an orchestra conductor who is the ultimate responsible for the whole group performance.

As a SAPC Software Developer, you need to：

  • Work with leading edge technology for Ericsson’s Broadband solution over LTE
  • Work with operational product owner to understand customer requirements and come up with solutions
  • Work in Agile software development process to develop new features in an efficient way
  • Handle customer inquiry or perform product maintenance work with strong trouble-shooting skills
  • Participate in all function test and automation test activities including test plan, environment setup, design and execution of test cases and regression test
  • Design documentation like component description and modeling during system design and implementation
  • Co-operate with colleagues in Europe to ensure the software delivery on time with good quality

Position Qualifications

Core Competences:

  • Outstanding C++ and Java programming skills
  • Deep understanding of design pattern and be familiar with frequent used Data structures.
  • Familiar with Linux OS including inter-process communication, multi-threading, semaphore, etc.
  • Rich experience over STL / boost library.
  • Familiar with at least one script languages: Shell, Python, Perl, TTCN

Minimum Qualifications & Experience Requirements:

  • BSc level in a technical discipline or the equivalent level of knowledge
  • English Skills
     

Preferred Qualifications & Experience Requirements:

  • Knowledge on Packet Core network and PCRF, solid network protocol background in Telecom (3GPP, 3GPP2, DIAMETER, etc.)
  • Experience on LDAP, SQL, XML, Radius Diameter, SNMP, Webservices, SOAP
  • Knowledge on Lean & Agile principle and experience on Scrum software development process
  • Good coding style and be familiar with software developing procedures.
  • Knowledge on TCP/IP network
  • Knowledge on software testing, including test process and test methodologies
  • Familiar with test automation practices, tools and framework
  • Knowledge on TSP platform and TTCN script language
  • Experience on ECLIPSE development environment

Additional Requirements, Physical Demands, Region/Local Specifications:

  • Knowledge Sharing & Collaboration Skills
  • Communication Skills
  • Ability to learn new technology quickly and apply to work tasks
  • Innovative and solution thinking
  • Open minded and easy going
  • Strong team work spirit and willing to take challenges

 *LI-JS2

description:
Twilio's customers send millions of communications every day.  These communications become a firehose of micro-transactions, processed at a fraction of a penny at a time.  As a pay-as-you-go service, it's critical to external and internal customers that we bill transactions in a timely and accurate manner.  As a shared platform within Twilio, we have a responsibility to ensure that our systems can quickly and easily scale to support new products and use-cases.


We're seeking engineers with experience in real-time data processing, microtransactions, financial data, and a passion for API design & REST.  We build our services in Scala and Python, and use Spark to process our large-volume data.  Redis also plays a key role as a tool to coordinate processing in a distributed environment.


Responsibilities:


As a member of the Real-Time Billing team, you'll have an opportunity to take on some of the most challenging problems in distributed computing, HTTP, data persistence, and more.  We're looking for someone who writes quality, maintainable code in Scala and Python with thorough test coverage.


As a Principal Engineer on the Real-Time Billing team, you'll have end-to-end ownership of the micro-transaction system that processes customer usage.  You'll work directly with product management to define, architect, build and test new internal and external facing services.  As an owner-operator of our services, you'll also develop evaluation, monitoring, and roll-out plans to minimize operational risk and ensure that systems run smoothly from day one.
title: Principal Engineer - Real-Time Billing at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)

description:
Charles River Analytics is developing software solutions that integrate with wearable devices aimed at sensing neurophysiological and physiological measures and assessing their relationship to human state and performance. The platforms we are developing interface with a variety of different hardware devices such as EEG, EMG, fNIRS, SpO2, and eye trackers and are being used by the U.S. Armed Forces, NASA, and the National Institute of Health. The selected candidate will work closely with neuroscientists who will help them interpret the relationship between the data being collected and what it indicates about cognitive function or neurological state. The candidate will define and implement signal processing and machine learning algorithms to automate this interpretation of sensor data.


In addition to being technically competent, we are looking for engineers who work well with a team, who love to learn, and who have a track record of self-motivated investigation and tinkering. If you have pursued non-work or non-school related projects simply because you like building things and are not afraid of the challenges associated with exploring and learning outside of your comfort zone, we want to hear from you.    


Major Responsibilities/Activities:   



  • Use open source SDKs to develop applications that interact with hardware devices such as MS Kinect, biosignalsplux, FLIR thermal cameras, and EEG devices

  • Develop software implementations of  signal filtering and noise reduction algorithms

  • Develop feature extraction methodologies and implement them in code for real time signal analysis

  • Work with team members to understand project goals and translate those goals into technical requirements

  • Interact with customers, users, and domain experts to analyze and understand challenges
title: Physiological Data Processing Engineer at Charles River Analytics (Cambridge, MA)

description:
Developing is this all you can think of?
If someone asks you about which languages you speak your answer is C#?
You're interested in a young and agile environment using modern and innovative technologies and working in self-organizing SCRUM teams?
You're willing to be part of the whole development lifecycle and you do whatever it takes to push a product to its best?


Then…you're awesome.


…and we're looking for exactly someone like you (what a nice coincidence).

description:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture.  This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net, you will join an innovative eCommerce team as a technical leader responsible for delivering innovative eCommerce solutions built for sustainability and performance. Your passion for architecture optimization will enable you to become a key contributor in the development and enhancement of our core eCommerce architecture. You will be a go-to-person in designing and guiding teams in the delivery of high quality software that scales and performs at a best-in-class level. Collaborating closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers, you will design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment.


Our teams are composed of talented software engineers working in a very dynamic, challenging, fast-paced, sustainable and fun Agile (Scrum) environment.


Job Description:



  • Translate business requirements into architecture designs:

    • Understand the existing software core architecture, interactions and dependencies between its main components.

    • Support product managers to gather and filter key information from stakeholders.

    • Evaluate risk by identifying development complexity, limitations and impacts.

    • Determine development feasibility within identified constraints.



  • Support product managers with drafting functional specifications.

  • Write minimum technical specifications and documents.

  • Participate in detailed development reviews and demos.

  • Write unit tests.

  • Troubleshoot and guide the team to resolve complex problems.

  • Suggest core infrastructure enhancements based on current and future technology trends.

  • Brainstorm and solve very interesting problems that will considerably increase product user experience.

  • Coach and mentor junior team members:

    • Contribute and promote software best practices and processes across the team.

    • Participate actively in code reviews.

    • Provide teammates continuous technical support.

    • Provide guidance for new feature integration and key architectural decisions.



  • Share knowledge through collaboration, training, peer review, presentations, and articles.


Requirements:



  • 7 + years of C# and ASP.NET experience.

  • 4+ years of hands-on technical leadership experience around system engineering.

  • 2 + years of MVC experience.

  • 2 + years experience working under Agile scrum framework.

  • Strong knowledge of SQL Server.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field; Master’s degree preferred.

  • Strong experience with web development (HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, CSS, relational databases and SQL).

  • Experience with MongoDB or NoSQL preferred.

  • Experience implementing REST architecture preferred.

  • Good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).

description:
Die ProSiebenSat.1 Group gehört zu den führenden Medienunternehmen Europas. Mit unseren Sendern SAT.1, ProSieben, kabel eins, sixx, SAT.1 Gold und ProSieben MAXX faszinieren wir täglich Millionen von Menschen. Zudem versorgt unsere globale Produktions- und Vertriebsgruppe, Red Arrow Entertainment Group, Sender in aller Welt mit einem umfangreichen Programmportfolio. Außergewöhnliche TV-Unterhaltung ist aber nur ein Teil unseres Erfolgskonzeptes. Im Vorstandsbereich Digital & Adjacent bündelt die ProSiebenSat.1 Group auf dem Weg zum digitalen "Entertainment and Commerce Powerhouse" all jene Angebote, mit denen sie ihre starke TV-Welt generisch erweitern kann. Dazu gehören vornehmlich die Bereiche Online-Video, Online-Games, Music sowie Ventures & Commerce.

Andere faszinieren können wir nur, wenn wir selbst fasziniert sind. Deshalb sind unsere "Fascinating People" unser wichtigstes Gut. Die ProSiebenSat.1 Group, das ist eine Gemeinschaft außergewöhnlicher Menschen, mit außergewöhnlichen Talenten und überragenden Leistungen in allen Bereichen unseres Unternehmens. Und da wir uns auf der Suche nach neuen Herausforderungen ständig vorwärts bewegen, braucht unser Team Verstärkung!



Deine Aufgaben



  • Einführung von agilen Testings bei maxdome und den damit verbunden Prozessen innerhalb eines cross-funktionalen Teams aus Entwicklern, Designern und Testern

  • Koordination der Integrationstests im Sprintverlauf

  • Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Software-Entwicklern

  • Durchführung automatisierter und manueller Testfälle für Video-on-Demand

  • Konzeption von Testfällen sowie Coding automatischer Tests

  • Weiterentwicklung der Transformation in automatisierte Testings



Die Anforderung



  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium bzw. eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im IT Umfeld

  • Berufserfahrung im Bereich Scrum /Agile Testing oder Software-Entwicklung iOS

  • Mehrjährige praktische Erfahrung mit der Arbeit in agilen Teams

  • Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Continuous-Integration-Systemen

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Testautomatisierung mit den Schwerpunkten Integration- und GUI-Testing

  • Gute Kenntnisse in Swift 2.0 sowie Objective-c

  • Test-Frameworks für iOS (z.B xctest) sind dir bekannt

  • Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung im Test-Driven-Development und der Einführung von agilen Testings

  • Begeisterung für Filme und Serien runden Dein Profil ab



Unser Angebot



  • Trage dazu bei, die Welt des Entertainments zu verändern und Video-on-Demand als Ergänzung zu linearem Fernsehen in Deutschland weiter zu positionieren

  • Bringe Dein Team mit deinem Drive voran und nutze den großen Gestaltungsspielraum in einem technologisch anspruchsvollem Umfeld

  • Arbeite in einem motivierten Team auf Augenhöhe, per Du und ohne Dresscode

  • Werde Teil eines internationalen und agil arbeitenden Teams mit passionierten Kollegen

  • Nutze die Vorteile unseres flexiblen Arbeitszeitmodells und die Work-Life-Balance-Angebote der ProSiebenSat1 Gruppe



Wenn wir Dein Interesse geweckt haben, dann bewirb Dich noch heute – wir freuen uns auf Dich!

description:
Kies jij je volgende opdracht of wordt je gestuurd?


Java specialisten die graag zonder overleg naar hun nieuwe project worden gestuurd zonder na te denken over:



  • uitdaging in de opdracht

  • gebruikte technieken

  • affiniteit met de opdrachtgever

  • reisafstand woon-/werkverkeer

  • Etc.


En die het prima vinden om jarenlang hetzelfde salaris te verdienen...


Die hebben al genoeg keuze, dus die hoeven niet op deze vacature te solliciteren!


Wij geven wel graag een mogelijkheid aan de professional, die:



  • zelf mee wil beslissen over welke opdracht hij gaat oppakken

  • zelf beslist in welke richting hij/zij zich verder gaat ontwikkelen

  • beloond wordt aan de hand van het tarief dat de opdrachtgever betaald

  • mee wil bouwen aan de organisatie

  • kennis- en technieksessies en events wil (mee)organiseren (niet verplicht)

  • op basis van wederzijds respect wil worden behandeld

  • zelfstandig en communicatief is

  • het leuk vindt om onderdeel te zijn van een team

  • met dat team ook leuke dingen te doen, anders dan techniek


Die professionals spreken wij graag!


Onze professionals werken op basis van de midlance constructie. Wat “best of both worlds” betekent tussen een vast salaris en freelancen.


Jij als professional kijkt samen met de business manager naar de beschikbare projecten. Hieruit wordt een selectie gemaakt van projecten die jij leuk vindt, op comfortabele afstand van je woonplaats zijn, etc. Alleen op die projecten wordt je voorgesteld. Zodoende zorgen we er samen voor dat je op redelijke reisafstand een leuke opdracht kunt oppakken, waarbij uitdaging en ontwikkeling van jou als professional centraal staan.


Ook op het gebied van verdiensten zijn we volledig transparant. Als freelancer betekent de periode zonder opdracht, geen inkomen! Bij Superconsult krijg je in de zogenoemde ‘leegloop’ een basissalaris. Zodra je echter op een opdracht bent ingezet ontvang je 70% van het tarief. In de meeste gevallen komt het er ongeveer op neer dat wat je bij de (laten we zeggen) klassieke bedrijven bruto verdient, bij Superconsult je netto salaris is.


Naast het salaris geniet je bij Superconsult ook van een aantal interessante regelingen, zoals:



  • Bonusregeling

  • Onkosten- en reiskostenvergoeding

  • Collectieve ziektekosten en WIA verzekering

  • Flexibele vakantiedagenregeling

  • Flexibele leaseregeling

  • Etc.
title: Java Developer - Kies zelf je project! at Superconsult (Utrecht, Netherlands)

description:
Join our team of software engineers to build an intuitive interface which allows users to get quick answers to hard questions. You are a member of an agile development team and your challenge is to make our innovative and complex software super-easy to use for our clients.


Pinpoint is our solution to easily access (cross) media data and use the data for target analysis and cross-media planning. It queries Big Data hosted in an Azure cluster using Apache Spark.


You develop a fresh and modern interface, with feeling for an intuitive design and user-perspective. You apply a high standard to your code and its maintainability, are used to create reusable code and you are comfortable with a culture of peer reviewing. You are a self-motivated, creative thinker, you are flexible and enjoy working in teams.


We have an international team, with fun and smart people from different disciplines (econometricians and mathematicians, software engineers, account managers) and we work on exciting projects.


Pointlogic accommodates employees that wish to develop their capabilities in relevant areas by means of supporting studies and facilitating R&D projects.


Our offer


We offer a competitive compensation package and ample opportunity for self-development, both in the specialist and personal field. An atmosphere of openness, mutual respect, time for social contact ánd fun are important aspects to us. In addition, working for Pointlogic means flexibility, both in terms of working hours and work location.

description:
Follow Up Boss is a cutting edge CRM for small businesses. Customers love our product, check what people say about us. You'll be solving real problems for our thousands of daily users that run their businesses on FUB. We're bootstrapped, profitable and growing.


Looking for an experienced full stack engineer to join our small friendly team. You will be working on the new version of Follow Up Boss in React.js while extending our REST API to support new features and improvements. On the backend we use PHP, Postgres, MySQL, Redis, Algolia. Everything is hosted on AWS.


We practice simplified version of Scrum with 1-week sprints for faster development and feedback, chat in Slack daily and meet in person on regular company retreats. Our roadmap is packed with new features and improvements based on solid feedback from customers.


This is a full-time job, choose to work remote or in our San Francisco office.


What We Expect


- Experience working in a fast-growing startup building and shipping a SaaS product.


- Great programming skills, ability to produce quality code that is maintainable, efficient, reliable and secure.


- Excellent knowledge of PHP, MySQL and Postgres, ability to write complex queries that run fast.


- Good knowledge of JavaScript and experience with frameworks like React, Backbone, Angular or Ember.


- Linux administration skills, ability to set up and maintain production and dev servers.


- Fluent English and good communication skills.


What You Can Expect


- Solve challenging technical problems and put your skills to the test every day. See direct impact of your work and value you created for customers.


- Work in a small friendly team side-by-side with co-founders. Opportunity to learn all aspects of running a SaaS business.


- Provide direct input on technical (and not so technical) decisions, be heavily involved in the product design process. Your opinion matters, your ideas will be heard and appreciated.


- Flexible work schedule, work when you are the most productive and be with your family when they need you.


- Ability to work 100% remote, enjoy working from the comfort of your own home. We’re hiring the best people regardless of where they live.


- Loose vacation policy, take time off when you need it.


- Competitive compensation, year-end bonuses based on performance, trips to tech conferences and company meetups.


- Your choice of equipment, latest MacBook Pro or anything else you need.


- Monthly perks like Starbucks, WholeFoods, Uber, Movie Tickets, Dashlocker.


- Something else you need? Let us know.
title: Senior Full Stack Engineer at Follow Up Boss (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)

title: Software Developer at Esker Inc. (Madison, WI)

description:
Intercom is a great place to work. We care about people (you, our customers, our team mates). 


Intercom is growing like crazy; we’re one of the 5 fastest growing SaaS companies of our generation, and our product is 100% built in Dublin, Ireland and every single person who works here gets a significant amount of equity in the company. And we're excited to announce that we've just raised $50 million! So, let’s work together. It’ll be the best investment you’ll ever make.


Why join? Take a look at our new engineering careers page to find out!


We're looking for a seasoned Software Engineer with experience building data pipelines to join our product team.


Intercom aspires to be the place where businesses have an authoritative and rich view of customer data. We want to make this data alive, up-to-date and personal. This means our data should be richly queryable and available to our customers for use not only in the right places, but in the right context. We need to do this at our current scale (multiple 10s of terabytes) and at a scale that is in line with our growth ambitions.


As a technical lead you will not only be shipping novel data-centric product features but given our growth trajectory will influence the direction and culture of our engineering team and our company.


You will:



  • Work with our product teams to surface the right data in the right places.

  • Amplify the value of our existing data pipelines by enriching and scaling them. 

  • Drive our roadmaps and be comfortable influencing them in a big way. This is more than a technical role, you’ll be a creative product and technical leader.

  • Work with our data scientists and analytics team to prototype and develop new and interesting product features that leverage data.

  • Collaborate on long and medium term technical direction while regularly adding value near term.

  • As a lead software engineer coach talented engineers to realise their proven potential.

description:
Intercom is a great place to work. We care about people (you, our customers, our team mates). 


Intercom is growing like crazy; we’re one of the 5 fastest growing SaaS companies of our generation, and our product is 100% built in Dublin, Ireland and every single person who works here gets a significant amount of equity in the company. And we're excited to announce that we've just raised $50 million! So, let’s work together. It’ll be the best investment you’ll ever make.


Why join? Take a look at our new engineering careers page to find out!


The Intercom platform comprises of several different and connected products. Each product is designed and developed — through invention and iteration — by a single team. As an engineering manager you’ll partner with a product manager to define a product vision, strategy and roadmap.


You’ll be expected to own your space: work with all disciplines on your team to build, launch and iterate. Talk directly with your customers, take part in usability studies, work with data analysts and researchers to ask the right questions and make good use of the answers.


You will:



  • Collaboratively set a product and technical direction with your team.

  • Support an ambitious group of engineers in their career goals. Work with our people ops team to maintain our high performance and high morale.

  • Be actively involved in hiring and growing our engineering team.

  • Care about agility as much you care for scalability and availability. Continuous deployment keeps us focused on incremental releases. Even our biggest technical achievements roll out piece by piece, feature flagged out of sight. Projects are kept short and tightly scoped. Teamsbuild a weekly cadence of releases.

  • Drive, create and improve operational excellence, quality, security and privacy initiatives within your team and the entire engineering organization.

  • Help us evolve our culture.

description:
Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including many of the world’s largest companies and governments -- we call this a start!

Our global expansion is creating job opportunities for creative thinkers who are wired for action and delivering big results. We’re also stacked with industry rock stars that are just as comfortable keynoting a conference or delivering a podcast as they are mentoring up-and-coming colleagues. But what our employees are most excited about is our products. Our market-defining technology provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.


Tenable now has over 600 employees globally and 24,000 customers in 150 countries. Tenable Network Security is recognized as one of the fastest growing security product companies by SC Magazine, Red Herring, Info Securities, Deloitte, E&Y and as a Best Places to Work by the Washington Post, Baltimore Sun, Baltimore Business Journal and Expert Marketplace.


Tenable is looking for a highly motivated Senior C/C++ Software Engineer to join the Development team for the Log Correlation Engine (LCE) product. The Log Correlation Engine processes, classifies, stores, and correlates log data for customers to identify and eliminate network threats. 


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Plan, design, implement, and test features and improvements to the core of the Log Correlation Engine.

  • Collaborate with the technical lead, Research, and QA teams to produce coherent and comprehensive software solutions.

  • Work with log data, vulnerability data, and security logs to improve and expand existing capabilities.

  • Develop innovative object-oriented, reusable, and stable code, and deliver solutions on schedule in an Agile environment.

description:
Consolidated Court Automation Programs (CCAP) seeks qualified candidates for full-time Business Process Analyst positions.  These unique positions offers a wide range of duties, including: gathering and documenting user requirements, creating and executing test plans, providing direct end user phone support for custom and off-the-shelf software, implementing software at customer locations, and providing  remote and in-person application training.  Analysts may specialize in one or more job function based on abilities, interest, and organizational need.  Join an elite information technology team as we develop, implement and support new software in support of the Wisconsin Court System.  Individuals who enjoy developing and supporting cutting edge software in a team environment, or working directly with end users as they migrate to new software systems are encouraged to apply. Candidates must be self-motivated and have a commitment to providing high-quality systems and services to the Wisconsin Court System.  


LOCATION: Madison, WI with some statewide overnight travel required.


SALARY: Competitive salary with a comprehensive benefits package.


RESPONSIBILITIES: The selected candidates will:



  • Perform software business analysis functions. Define user requirements, perform analysis and design, assist with development and review of system requirements, coordinate usability testing and create and execute test plans.

  • Provide application support for custom and off-the-shelf software applications for all court system users via Help Desk or as a SME.

  • Coordinate and lead the implementation of new software, hardware and system upgrades throughout the court system.

  • Conduct training sessions for internal and court system staff and the public in the use of CCAP-provided software applications.


TO APPLY:  Please go to our website http://www.wicourts.gov/courts/employment/apply.htm and submit a cover letter and resume (please combine your cover letter and resume to one document) clearly indicating your qualifications and the position title Business Process/Systems Analyst (#16-1426).  If you are unable to apply online please send application materials to human.resources@wicourts.gov or send to: Human Resources, 110 East Main Street Suite 430, Madison, WI  53703-3356, (608) 266-3501 or FAX (608) 261-8293.  Failure to follow these procedures may result in your disqualification.


DEADLINE:  Applications will be accepted until the positions are filled. The Wisconsin Court System will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified applicants when requested. For additional information on the court system visit our website at www.wicourts.gov
title: Business Process/Systems Analyst at Wisconsin Court System (Madison, WI)

description:
TRI is seeking a Spotfire Analyst to join its Data Analytics and Bioinformatics Team and participate in building products based on healthcare data. Job responsibilities include:





  • Collecting user requirements and interact with clinicians, researchers, or software developers




  • Loading clinical and health care datasets and performing data clean-up and transformation




  • Managing and sifting through health care and life sciences data sets to extract trends and find patterns




  • Validating the techniques used for data transformation




  • Designing visualizations (table/graphs) that respond to user requirements and are intuitive and user-friendly




  • Creating dashboards to automate report generation using visual analytics tools like Tableau or Spotfire




  • Work in a team mentoring others and collaborating as a group, in a fast-paced environment
title: Spotfire Analyst at Technical Resources International, Inc. (Bethesda, MD)

description:
We are looking for a Junior and Mid-Level Quantitative Developer to work with a strong team of Quant Developers and Quant Traders. The successful candidate will bring enthusiasm for problem solving, financial mathematics, and will assist our team in maintaining existing quantitative infrastructure and the development of new data analysis, visualization and modeling tools. Long term plans for our team include strategy development and trading, so a candidate with interests in the financial markets and a quantitative background is preferred.


What you’ll do as a Junior Quant Developer at Akuna:



  • Design and improve existing python tools that interact with C++ applications, databases, and wire protocols

  • Write and optimize data analysis code and calculation intensive models

  • Work closely with traders/ quants on developing web-based visualization tools for trading strategies

  • A strong interest in finance and learning to develop trading strategies is a plus

  • Provide python mentoring to team members and traders
title: Quant Developer at Akuna Capital (Chicago, IL)

description:
Akuna is currently looking for a motivated developer to join our engineering team and contribute to the build-out of our proprietary options market-making trading platform infrastructure. Your role will focus on analysis, design, implementation, testing and delivery of key trading system technology using the latest technologies. A pragmatic approach to technology solutions, using the latest open source software will be required. The successful candidate will be given a unique level of exposure to an industry-leading team of options traders who participate fully in the design and on-going enhancements to our proprietary trading platform.


What you’ll do as a C++ Developer at Akuna:



  • Plan, design and implement high quality Linux services

  • Engage with traders and developers and articulate ideas clearly

  • Build software using Agile methodologies

  • Participate in design sessions and code reviews

  • Work on cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and solve complex problems

  • Design and implementation of database schemas/data storage
title: C++ Developer at Akuna Capital (Chicago, IL)

description:
EyeVerify is looking for an experienced Software Engineer Manager to lead a small team (3-5 members) to build and support a broad scale authentication platform.  The initial client base for this platform will be located primarily in China.  The work hours will be shifted to allow for some cross over with other US based product teams as well as with key customers in China.  Targeted work hours are from 3PM to 12AM.   There is some flexibility and specific work windows can be negotiated.  Manager will also be involved in quarterly trips to China for planning and support purposes.



The Software Engineer manager will lead and be a contributing architect to a team of software engineers developing mobile software written primarily in C++ with limited Objective-C and Java.  Manager will write product requirement documents, implement and track release timelines, track bugs/issues and own feature sets. This role will also require hands on development along side the team.   The manager will work closely with other product teams in planning and coordinating development efforts.
title: Software Engineer Manager at EyeVerify, Inc. (Kansas City, MO)

description:
Kan du bygga TV4 Play så att tjänsten skalar till den direktsända finalen i Fotbolls-EM i sommar?


Vi bygger morgondagens digitala TV-upplevelse. Vi vill driva utvecklingen och definiera hur den ska se ut, och vi tror att vi har en unik möjlighet att göra det. TV4-gruppens position som den största kommersiella aktören på den svenska TV-marknaden, tillsammans med C Mores utbud av film, serier, och sport, och Nyhetsbolagets journalistik, bildar en innehållsmässig grund för visionen. För att nå dit måste vi leverera solida tjänster med hög tillgänglighet som klarar av både hög genomsnittlig belastning och de koncentrerade toppar som vissa sändningar kan medföra. Samtidigt är ett högt säkerhetsmedvetande viktigt då våra tjänster dagligen utsätts för olika försök till intrång eller belastningsattacker.


TV4 Play är en tv-tjänst i stark tillväxt. Bara under förra året ökade vi vår konsumtion avsevärt – 95% i startade strömstarter och 79% i tittad tid. Det är vi stolta över, men inte i närheten av nöjda. Under de kommande åren vill vi ta stora kliv framåt och skapa en tjänst som blir den självklara starten för en tv-upplevelse.


Vi söker nu en ingenjör som vill hjälpa oss bygga en robust, säker och väl testad bottenplatta av tjänster som får maskineriet att snurra glitch-fritt.


Du kommer att arbeta i ett litet team med kunniga kollegor som ansvarar för utveckling och drift av en microservice-arkitektur, byggd främst med Go och Elixir. Det innebär design, implementation, testning, dokumentation och deploy, ofta flera gånger per dag. “You build it, you run it” är sättet vi arbetar på och samarbete i form av diskussioner, par- och mobbprogrammering är vanligt.
title: Go och/eller Elixir utvecklare till TV4 Play at TV4-Gruppen (Stockholm, Sweden)

description:
Amazon Video is changing the way millions of customers interact with video content. The Amazon Video team delivers high-quality instant video to Amazon customers through subscriptions (Amazon Prime) as well as purchases and rentals. Amazon believes so deeply in the mission of Video that we've launched our own studio to create original and exclusive content. Every day we face the challenges of a fast paced market and expanding technology set. As a member of the Video team, you will spend your time as a hands-on engineer and a technical leader. You will play a key role in building software products and features from the ground up. You will use a wide range of technologies, programming languages and systems. Your responsibilities will include all aspects of software development. You will have the freedom and encouragement to explore your own ideas and the reward of seeing your contributions benefit millions of Amazon.com customers worldwide.



We'd love to have you join us and build the systems, services, and apps that delight our end users. We build apps for the web, mobile phones, tablets, smart TVs, game consoles, and set top boxes. Using advanced machine learning and data mining techniques, we help our customers discover the best movies and TV shows. We measure data in Petabytes and streaming in Exabytes. We obsess over big picture problems like How do we deliver video that’s more reliable than the internet it’s delivered over? to low level details like How do we squeeze maximum picture quality out of every bit delivered? We strive to be on the forefront of new consumer technologies like UHD TV and High Dynamic Range video. We build huge scale distributed systems on the AWS cloud to make sure our service is always reliable for our customers. We use computer vision and machine learning techniques to build rich metadata about videos, and partner closely with teams like IMDb to let customers explore deeper into the TV and movies they love. In short, we have exciting challenges in an industry that’s doubling in size every year, and you can be a part of it.



The AV Website organization is seeking a Senior Software Development Manager to deliver a superlative and immersive web and mobile web experience to Amazon Video customers worldwide. As an Amazon Senior Software Manager, you will be responsible for leading a group of software engineering teams responsible for the design, development and deployment of the customer facing functionality on every Amazon Video website worldwide. A successful candidate will have a background in developing customer facing experiences, strong technical ability, excellent project management and organizational skills, great communication skills, a motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment and, of course, a passion for TV and film.

- Degree in Computer Science or related field

- Experience leading a group of software engineering teams in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

- Experience mentoring or managing software engineering managers and engineers to improve their skills, and make them more effective technical leaders

- Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

- Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy

- Experience influencing software engineering best practices within your team

- Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences



- Significant technical experience as software developer, software development manager, or related role

- Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design

- Computer Science fundamentals in data structures

- Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis

- Experience developing in at least one of Java, C, C++, or Perl

A proven track record of software delivery through all phases of development
title: Senior Software Development Manager - Amazon Video Website Team at Amazon (London, UK)

description:
Assurance Systems, Inc. has been in business since 1986 writing software used by insurance agencies and insurance companies.  We are a development team who works on SaaS apps for the insurance industry and need another experienced person to help us take on new projects while maintaining our existing code base.  Our main product is on the .NET stack written mostly in C#/XAML with data stored in MongoDB and run entirely in AWS. Large portions of that product is currently being re-written and is transitioning to a combination of C#/TypeScript/HTML running on a hybrid stack with some parts on .NET and others on Node.js. Git is our source control of choice and typically we work in the latest version of Visual Studio. We believe in using the best tools for the job and are not afraid to change things up if a particular project requires it.


We are a small development team and you'll get to have a direct impact on our development.  Designing and implementing web applications for the evolving insurance market.  Our team is a mix of local and remote developers and we are happy with either option.  Typical work day hours are flexible with some of us starting early and others later. Generally developers are expected to be available during normal business hours Eastern time. We use an agile based development process that is a mix of Scrum and Kanban.
title: C# .Net Developer - Jr to Mid Level at Assurance Systems, Inc. (Norcross, GA) (allows remote)

description:
Create insights for millions of people


Clue is a mobile app (iOS & Android) used by millions of people to track and understand their reproductive health. It’s beautifully designed and not pink. Our users trust us with their most personal data and we honor this trust by providing them with insights about their body and respect for their privacy.


We collaborate with world leading research institutions as we strive to advance the field of reproductive health. Ultimately we want to be able to predict when a user can get pregnant - or not - and provide scientifically sound interpretations of their data. This is where you come in to level up our Data Science team.
title: Chief Data Scientist at Berlin Health Startup at Clue (Berlin, Germany)

description: World Wildlife Fund (WWF), the world's leading conservation organization, seeks a Director, Program Management Technologies at our Washington, DC office. Manages and oversees the development, support and maintenance of PTS and other budget-related systems. Manages developers and support technicians. Works closely with Program staff to identify new requirements and enhancements to PTS and other technologies.
title: Director, Program Management Technologies - 16077 at WWF Washington, DC (Washington, DC)

description:
MyDrive is going places fast. We are a world leader in using data to build understanding of customer behaviour through telematics. We employ the latest thinking in data analytics and software engineering across a variety of sectors including motor, home and health automation. We are looking for a talented Dev Ops Engineer with three to five years of intensive software engineering experience in a start-up business and/or a commercial environment to join our team. We are a global player and have an truly international team to reflect this.


Your purpose will be to build, maintain and improve the server and service infrastructure on which our projects run and deliver real production services in the cloud being consumed by real consumers.


We are looking for engineers who have experience of dev ops in cloud computing and who are practiced in Amazon Web Services (AWS). You will build, test, maintain and improve the server and service infrastructure on which our projects run and implement the benefits of automated testing.


Our engineers are brilliant at gathering and maintaining lines of communications with different project stakeholders and research and recommend new technologies to develop the MyDrive Telematics offering worldwide.


You will need to work closely with other software developers, operations engineers, and data scientists to design and implement software to interoperate with our web services and systems including coding. Maintaining test coverage and writing automated tests for new production software, including continuous integration is all in a day's work as is evaluating software performance.


Keeping MyDrive up to date with the state of the art in dev ops and site reliability engineering, including new features, functionality, security, and performance is both vital and fun. Each engineer contributes to Hack Days and we take personal development very seriously.


Ideally you will also have superb customer service skills and be able to support the service and undertake remedial fixing if needed.
title: Dev Ops Engineer at MyDrive (London, UK)

description:
The Software Quality Assurance Engineer will serve the interests of our customers by ensuring that our products function as expected, providing the most efficient workflow solutions to accomplish their goals.


RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:



  • Review and analyze product requirements and specification documents providing input on accuracy and clarity of documents as well as product testability.

  • Apply principles of Software Quality Assurance to create test environments and planning documents such as QA test plans, test procedures, test harnesses and automation systems based on customer broadcast infrastructures and use cases, product requirements and specification documents, and on other methods of information gathering.

  • Create automated tests using open source scripting languages.

  • Report test results clearly and accurately, and track to closure, product defects found in testing, using Bug Tracking system (MS Team Foundation Server).

  • Assist customer support team by verifying product issues, finding and documenting workarounds, as well as reporting and tracking the underlying defects to closure.

  • Other duties as assigned.
title: SQA Engineer at ChyronHego (Melville, NY)

description:
Delivery Hero is building the next generation global online food ordering platform. Our awesome international team already operates in 33 countries worldwide. We feature an environment with feedback exchange throughout the company from people who are genuine, ambitious and fun. We are looking for passionate and smart people to join us on our mission. Our ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative, and good at “getting things done“. So, would you like to play an active role in our future? If so, then there is an exciting job and a workplace in the heart of Berlin waiting for you!

Your mission:



  • Identifying and driving our overall technical direction

  • You will analyze and evaluate our existing architecture and design, in cooperation with our CTO and VP of Software Engineering

  • You will be responsible for reviewing our platform designs and determining as to whether they are technically viable and relevant to the goals of our company

  • You will keep up to date with web and infrastructure technologies and be a first mover when it comes to future technical trends and top of the class technologies

  • You will work together with our Development and Engineering team to build our Global Platform

  • You will provide technical leadership and ensure that Engineering best practices are adhered to across our global business.

  • You will ensure our Architecture is built and managed in a highly-scalable manner
title: Head of Architecture (m/f) at Delivery Hero (Berlin, Germany)

description:
Etimo hjälper ledande organisationer inom Telekom, Spel, Media, Finans, E-handel och IT att utveckla affärskritiska system. Därmed ställs höga krav, både på oss som individer och på de lösningar vi utvecklar. Ett typiskt projekt är mellan tre och nio månader långt där vi arbetar tillsammans med klienten från A till Ö för att utveckla en lösning på ett affärskritiskt problem.


Vår filosofi: Människorna är allt


Medarbetarna är vår högsta prioritet och vi satsar för att bli bäst. Utgångspunkten i detta arbete är kompetens. Etimo är ett kompetenscentrum inom IT och systemutveckling. Vi skapar kundvärde med hjälp av teknisk spetskompetens, djup insikt i utvecklingsprocesser och enastående förmåga att lösa problem. Dessa verktyg är fundamentala för oss.


Med tanke på den snabba teknikutvecklingen i världen är vi övertygade om att dagens kompetens inte räcker för att lösa morgondagens problem. Ständig förbättring är därmed ett krav för att förbli relevant och vi lägger betydande kraft på att lära mer, lära nytt och bli bättre, både som individer och som team. Genom en icke-hierarkisk struktur och ett prestigelöst förhållningssätt uppmuntrar vi nya idéer och förbättringsförslag från hela organisationen.


Samarbete möjliggör kompetensdelning och därmed ständig förbättring. En stark grupp som arbetar tillsammans når högre än den bästa individ. Därför är samarbete centralt för oss. Dessutom har vi roligare på vägen!


Slutligen fokuserar vi på affärsproblemet. Etimo strävar alltid efter att leverera bestående kundvärde. För att lyckas krävs god förståelse för kundens affär och utmaningar. Med hjälp av teknik och ett nära samarbete tar vi oss an och löser kundens problem. Baserat på kundens situation och problemets natur skräddarsyr vi lösningen för att skapa förstklassigt kundvärde.
title: .NET utvecklare at Etimo (Stockholm, Sweden)

Med tanke på den snabba teknikutvecklingen i världen är vi övertygade om att dagens kompetens inte räcker för att lösa morgondagens problem. Samarbete möjliggör kompetensdelning och därmed ständig förbättring. En stark grupp som arbetar tillsammans når högre än den bästa individ. Därför är samarbete centralt för oss. Dessutom har vi roligare på vägen!


Sist men inte minst krävs alltid fokus på affärsproblemet. Det är endast genom förståelse för kundens utmaningar och kärnaffär som vi kan leverera bestående kundvärde. description:
At Mailjet, we make sending email easy and have an all-in-one solution to do just that. We're a growing venture-backed startup with teams in Paris, London, Berlin, Toronto, & New York and with customers around the world. Our technology empowers developers to painlessly integrate their apps with our API and begin sending smarter email. Every company needs email and they need it delivered to their contacts inbox!

Were looking for a Developer Evangelist to join our team based in London. As a Developer Evangelist your main mission is to be the voice for making email easy and reliable. As Developer Evangelist for Mailjet, youll travel to hackathons and conferences, give amazing demos, contribute to forums, collaborate on insightful blog posts, and empower developers to solve problems with the Mailjet API. You get excited about helping others build innovative products and are passionate about technology. Oh, and you better like to have a lot of fun!

Responsibilities:



  • Identify and build relationships with the developer community (in various tech stacks) and engage in meaningful conversations around Mailjet, our amazing API and why we do way more than just send e-mails


  • Attend various events - from niche Meetups to large international conferences, and actively contribute across the web wherever developers are to be found


  • Publish content - from blog posts to sample apps to video demos

  • Stay on top of the game by integrating our API with everything and anything, from new frameworks to connected devices, you geek out about this stuff. Be creative and well support you!


Benefits



  • Exceptional environment: international startup (clients in 158 countries), strong growth

  • Multicultural team: interact with our offices in Toronto, Madrid, Brussels, Berlin, Paris, etc.

  • Learn from successful entrepreneurs (fotolia.com, mention.net, etc...) and build your network

  • Highly motivating salary package, long term contract: grow with the company!

To Apply:

Click "Apply" below and email us a copy of your resume, links to social profiles & blogs, and your opinion on the most effective way to reach new developers.
title: Developer Evangelist (London) at Mailjet (London, UK)

description:
We’re looking for excellent software engineers from junior to senior who will be responsible for:

description:

The results of our sprints will be presented back to our key stakeholders such as application specialists and software service teams who globally implement and configure our software at our customer sites.


As part of our team you will apply some of the latest technologies and practice your prioritization skills in an environment that is placing high expectations towards your productivity and on the quality of your software.


In this role you will:



  • Be responsible for defining, developing, and evolving software in a fast paced and agile development environment using the latest software development technologies and infrastructure

  • Work with Product Line Leaders to understand product requirements & vision

  • Translate requirements/vision into prioritized list of user stories and deliver to required timelines and quality standards

  • Support process improvements which guide the development, sustaining & support activities

  • Drive world-class quality in the development and support of products

  • Engage subject matter experts in successful transfer of complex domain knowledge

  • Apply principles of SDLC and methodologies like Lean/Agile/XP, CI, Software and Product Security, Scalability, Documentation Practices, refactoring and Testing Techniques

  • Building awesome stand-alone iOS/Android apps that we can take to market

title: Lead Front-end Developer at Lucid Fusion (Irvine, CA)

description:
We are looking for an outstanding DevOps Engineer to be part of our growing team. The position is full time with location in our office in Berlin. Your skills should include:



  • At least 2+ years DevOps experience

  • Desire to take up responsibility and always be eager to learn

  • Demonstrated experience in implementing best practice methods for setting up and maintaining AWS environments (including, but not limited to EC2, ELB, S3, SQS, DynamoDB, Route53)

  • Strong knowledge of modern web servers infrastructure

  • Experience in challenging and improving existing deployment paths (Chef, Opsworks)

  • Experience working with reverse proxies like Varnish

  • Experience with RDBMS, like MySQL

  • Familiar with Linux (ideally Ubuntu/Debian)

  • Knowledge in PHP, ideally experience in Symfony2

  • Agile team-working experience



What do we offer?



  • A dynamic and highly motivated and experienced team and flat hierarchies

  • Free German, French, English or Spanish language courses

  • The keys to the engine room and the warp core

  • The possibility to actively shape the company with your actions

  • A work environment tailored for you, including a state of the art work computer (SSD, 16GB RAM, Dual Screen) with free choice of the operating system

  • Working closely with the Head of IT, ideal as preparation for a CTO role

  • Time to contribute to open source projects

  • Regular technical exchange with other Berlin-based startups

description:
RTI’s Center for Data Science (CDS) seeks a talented Early Career Front-End Web Developer to be based in Research Triangle Park, NC.  We are seeking individuals with experience building and deploying applications in at least one modern open source web framework, such as React, Angular, or Backbone.  It’s just as important that you be willing to learn, are inquisitive, and flexible.   The successful candidate will be comfortable working with a growing team of RTI data scientists and domain experts to implement web-based analysis and data visualization platforms across a wide variety of fast-moving projects.


The ideal candidate will possess a clear understanding of user interface design, interaction design, information architecture, and user experience design for the Web and mobile devices.  Activities may involve the use of commercial software, open source software or RTI-developed software tools.  Developers with a broad skill set will be ideal candidates to address the technology needs of a diverse project base.


Responsibilities




  • Collaborate with a team of data scientists, statisticians, computer scientists, and subject matter experts to solve problems using data science approaches, techniques, and methods.

  • Implement front-end components of web-based analysis platforms, including interfacing with a variety of different types of databases and APIs.

  • Assist in the development of 2D and 3D web-based data visualizations.

  • Assist in gathering client requirements to help frame projects and design solutions based on client needs and problems to be solved.

  • Possess thorough understanding of contemporary interaction design aesthetics.

  • Support new technology as needed.
title: Early Career Front End Developer at RTI International (Triangle, NC)

description:
MyDrive is a world leader in understanding customer behaviour through data and telematics. We apply the latest thinking in machine learning, data science, analysis and software engineering to motor, smart home, and health automation. We are a global player and have a truly international team which reflects this.


We are growing our engineering team as we expand from our historic work with motor telematics, analysis of GPS data, and driver behavioural analysis, into IoT, smart home, wearables, e-health and other connected devices.


We are looking for a talented, experienced developer who can design and build solutions across a range of technologies. Much of our current codebase is in Ruby, and we have Java, Obj-C, Swift, C++, R, Python, Scala and more in use across the scientific and engineering teams.
title: Senior Software Engineer at MyDrive (London, UK)

description:
We develop key applications that the financial community relies on to interact with one another and to keep abreast of key news and market moving information. Our responsibilities include communication tools such as Bloomberg's proprietary Email and Instant Message products, Notes and Contact Management systems, News, Market Alerts and Monitoring applications. These are delivered across both desktop and mobile platforms. Our products are built to handle high volume, low latency and high availability. In addition, we build the core systems that form the foundation of applications built by other software groups within Bloomberg.

We have a deep understanding of our product areas and work closely with our business counterparts and UX design teams to deliver the experience desired by our customers. As the speed of change is rapid we need people who are agile and eager to learn and develop new skills. The ability to collaborate across multiple teams and learn a depth and breadth of technical and domain knowledge is critical.

We frequently work with open source software and encourage interaction with the wider technology community by contributing changes and taking part in related meet-ups and conferences.

Teams in Communication, News, and Realtime Applications and Services:

Bloomberg Chat

Bloomberg Chat is Bloomberg's instant messaging system. It is used by the entire Bloomberg community for real-time communication to exchange quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. The Bloomberg Chat team in London is responsible for ensuring the fast and efficient distribution of content through our data centers to the client application running on our customers' desktops.

Message and Collaboration

Internet Message - The Bloomberg Message system delivers over 300 million messages every day. The Internet Message system converts messages between email and Bloomberg's proprietary Message format. Software written by the team must be scalable, fault tolerant and secure. Our work also includes evolving and extending our solutions for detecting spam, malware and phishing.

Contact Management - Bloomberg's most popular functions are its communication tools (Message and Chat). Users of these systems need a fast, secure and reliable way to store their contact information. The Bloomberg contact management system contains data on over 50 million contacts, all of which can be queried in under a millisecond. In the last 12 months, we developed a brand new interface, which we continue to evolve. Our focus this year is our backend systems as we work on improving performance and scalability.

Notes - Notes is an exciting new product being developed to further improve the collaboration capabilities of the Bloomberg system. It will enable users to annotate and curate Bloomberg content for quick retrieval and organization, providing insightful ways to analyze user-generated content.

Mobile

The Mobile team has the charge to take Bloomberg's key financial and foundational applications and deliver them to all major mobile platforms. We are a mix of both client side iOS and Android specialists, and other backend developers focused on infrastructure who use their platform native skills mixed with C++ to deliver an immersive mobile experience. Developers are involved in full end to end development of native UI components and the required client and server infrastructure that connects devices to Bloomberg data services. Security and usability concerns are also a major focus for our team.

News Editing & Workflow

The News Editing and Workflow team is responsible for the tools used by the Bloomberg News organization for the timely release of accurate, market moving news. The team also develops the Bloomberg News Automation suite, which generates thousands of news stories per day with minimal latency, which is triggered by realtime Bloomberg market data and events.

News Search

The News Search team owns the search and alerting backend behind the news functionality across Bloomberg. This is one of the most widely used functions on the Bloomberg Terminal. It serves timely, accurate and market moving news to our customers by sifting through hundreds of millions of news stories. Our customers can search, analyze and set alerts for the news that matters to them in milliseconds. Developers work on scalable, low-latency solutions by making use of search and information retrieval technologies, and working with distributed systems running on dedicated farms of machines.

Realtime Applications

Alerts - The Alert product lets market participants monitor the markets. It exposes nearly every tick in the world, along with a broad range of non-pricing data from corporate actions to social media sentiment and even power station outages. The system is available 24/7 and is used by tens of thousands of traders and investors helping them respond quickly to changing market conditions. Alerts are a major strategic focus for the company and we are scaling our infrastructure and extending our feature set significantly.

Monitors - The Monitors team is responsible for providing industry-leading, comprehensive, fully custom cross-asset quote sheet applications. 200,000 of our clients rely on these applications every day. The team deploys Bloomberg's latest proprietary technologies and UI framework by making further UX improvements, while maintaining a strong focus on performance and reliability.

Trade Ideas - The Trade Ideas application allows users to exchange investment research and recommendations in order to demonstrate their skills. The Trade Ideas Platform comprises high-performance distributed multi-threaded services, real-time publishing, both SQL and NoSQL databases, with desktop, web and mobile clients.
title: Communication, News, And Realtime Applications And Services Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)

title: Senior C++ Software Engineer at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)

description:
Want to escape cubicle hell and avoid that nasty commute? We may have something for you...


but first - let's get a few quick notes out: 



  • NO AGENTS PLEASE – we’re looking for direct contact from our candidates.



  • Remote/Virtual Office Work Position is an option but you must be in CANADA...


OK - that's out of the way - let's move on to seeing if you may be ready to join our team.


Looking for a cushy gig where there is no pressure to deliver? Where there are perfect specifications all the time and you have time to be elegant and do everything you could ever dream of to solve a problem?


Keep looking. We’re not for you.


But...


If you’re looking for problems to solve and you take ownership of them, perhaps we should chat.


If you need to be in a position where extreme ownership is the norm and hard tasks assigned to you are owned, executed, and delivered.


Then perhaps we can work together.


Are you that kind of person?


Does that sound like you?


If not - move on .


If you need to be in an environment where you are challenged regularly...


If you like to be in an environment where you are pushed to grow ...


If you like to work with senior talent that will help you solve hard problems ...


We may have something for you.


We’re adding to our small, high-calibre team .


We’re looking for a Junior or Intermediate developer that we can groom to bring to the next level .


Our main efforts at the moment at Continuum Loop relate to a cutting edge cloud-based ecommerce engine.


Our goals are ambitious and your role will be substantial . Being able to manage expectations of the founder (we have a tech savvy founder - but as all entrepreneurs do he pushes hard, expecting the best), and our lead Architect/Developer. We expect you to take on “ownership” and to push our team - to pull out the best ideas in our design discussions. You’ll then carry tasks and projects forward.


We're willing to look at amazing candidates across Canada. Great benefits. Great computing (Macs and we're Amazon AWS based) and great people that push each other to improve and grow.


If you think this gig may be for you, send us your resume and a cover letter.
title: Full Stack (React / Node / Mongo) Developer [Remote Work] at Continuum Loop Inc. (Ottawa, ON, Canada) (allows remote)
