description:
What we want you to do
As a Senior Developer with TV3 Play, you will be part of a team focusing on developing the best advertising funded video on demand services in northern Europe. The team is responsible for the development and maintenance of the platform powering TV3.se, TV3play.se, TV6play.se, TV3play.no and similar destinations across eight markets. You will be a part of the Viaplay Technology Team and work closely with the teams building similar services such as Viaplay and Viasat Sport. We are truly at the forefront of video on demand development and streaming experiences and we are now looking for a new team member to help us grow the different platforms, enhance our user experience and support our constant growth.

What we can do for you
TV3 Play & Viaplay Technologies are part of the Modern Times Group, an international media company with brands such as Viasat, Viaplay, TV3, TV6 and RIX FM. We offer a challenging environment, with very skilled high performing individuals, located at Södermalm in Stockholm. As part of a strong technology team you will be working with the latest technologies in streaming video and building full stack software platforms in a micro-service architecture. We build software in short delivery cycles for enabling you to quickly see the result of your work. Product iterations are data driven, based on consumer feedback and behavior. Our users are expecting great viewing experiences, and as part of the team you will learn about video player development and HTML5 frameworks. Our business is driven by advertising, and we are constantly developing innovative and seamless solutions for creating value, while optimizing user experience.

What we ask of you
You are an experienced back-end developer with 4-5 years of experience. You will be focusing on building strong and high performing back-end components in Node.js. We expect you to have a good understanding of frontend frameworks as you will work closely with these teams. Everyday work will include running development activities, including design, complexity assessment, development, test and deployment. We expect you to take ownership of the design, development and ongoing quality of our platforms as a key part of the team. You will develop engineering solutions aligned with technical- and product long-term visions. This means working closely with our product department.



  • Degree in computer science, computer engineering or an equivalent level of work experience (4-5 years).

  • Solid experience in developing services using Node.js+express, another dynamic language or Java.

  • Solid experience of HTTP/REST services and web development patterns.

  • Experience with metadata providing systems and Amazon services.

  • Dedication to CI, automation and other efficient workflow-oriented practices.

  • Dedication to unit testing, code review and other quality-oriented practices.

  • Experience of, and enthusiasm for working in an agile environment and with agile development methodologies.


You’re a passionate developer with an interest in video streaming and software development. We work in an agile environment and use Jira, Confluence and Stash (with Git) to support our needs.


Our HQ is in Stockholm, but our market is across the Nordics. You will become part of an amazing company with great people, content and culture. If this feels like your kind of challenge, please apply and attach your CV and cover letter. If you have any questions you are very welcome to call our recruiter Johan Wolfhagen at 076-494 09 66.
title: Senior Developer at TV3 Play (Stockholm, Sweden)

description:
As one of the fastest growing technology companies in Europe, we offer a unique opportunity for you, as a Ruby on Rails developer! We are rapidly expanding our IT team to facilitate the tremendous growth of the company. As you can imagine, our website faces numerous complex development challenges as a result of our continually increasing numbers of sellers and buyers. We’ve already implemented localisations for various European countries and will be expanding even further, outside of Europe, in the near future.


That is why we need your help; we want to expand our team by introducing even more expert knowledge. You will work in product driven innovation teams in which front-end developers, back-end developers, a designer, a data analyst, and a product owner all work closely together. We are driven by A/B-testing and automated testing, which allows us to do multiple releases per day on our high-traffic website.


You will work with Ruby on Rails, nginx, MySql, Redis, Solr, jQuery, and Git in an agile development team of 30 developers (and counting). We have headquarters in both Assen and Amsterdam, the Netherlands.
title: Full Stack Ruby Developer - Website & App used by millions at Catawiki (Amsterdam, Netherlands)

description:
What’s the deal?


Web software creation! As a member of our development team, you can get involved at any level and in any area we are working on: brainstorming, architecture, development, testing, integration, delivery, and operations. What you end up doing depends as much on you as on us. We want you to be free to develop your skills precisely where your passions lie.


What are our methods, languages, technologies, etc?


You’re not going to find a lot of dogma at DEEP IMPACT: we use agile and waterfall concepts as needed – no project is the same. We write in statically and dynamically typed as well as compiled and interpreted languages. We run quite a few databases (SQL or No), and don’t limit ourselves to a single framework. We do however strike a balance between the introduction rate of new tech vs. the need to maintain a stable and productive ecosystem. Here’s a couple of keywords to give you an idea of what we currently use: VanillaJS, AngularJS, React / Flux(Alt), SCSS, Less, Apache, nginx, PHP, Pimcore, Zend, Java, Spring, Play Framework, Jetty, Clojure, Yada, MySQL, Cassandra, MongoDB, TitanDB, Datomic, Docker, CQRS, DDD, Design Sprint.
title: LAMP Stack Engineer at DEEP IMPACT AG (Winterthur, Switzerland)

We would like you to have solid knowledge of Javascript, CSS and preprocessors like SASS. Next to these, we appreciate exposure to NodeJS platform, experience in building tools such as Grunt, Gulp and Webpack, knowledge in ReactJS framework and EcmaScript6.


In this role it’s preferable that you have previously worked with mobile and desktop applications, that you are excited by new methods and tools to make great websites and applications faster and better. If you are a fast learner, able to work independently on tasks assigned, creative and curious, you will be a good match for our international tech team.


This position is based at our headquarters in the Netherlands, so fluency in English is a must and fluency in Dutch is a plus. If you are the one we are looking for, send us your CV and cover letter in Dutch or English.

Whether building a house or a bridge, a map or an aircraft, you need reliable measurements. With close to 200 years of pioneering solutions to measure the world, Leica Geosystems products and services are trusted by professionals worldwide to help them capture, analyze, and present spatial information. Leica Geosystems is best known for its broad array of products that capture accurately, model quickly, analyze easily, and visualize and present spatial information. 


Leica Geosystems is searching for an enthusiastic Project Leader to join the dynamic and international SmartNet Team. 


SmartNet is a world-wide GNSS correction service that is reliably serving our customers in Surveying, Machine Control, Agriculture and GIS day after day, 24/7 - www.smartnet-ww.com


Your main tasks are:

  • Close cooperation with the software development and service operation team (DevOps)

  • Service and Business Analytics

description:
Pusher is a communication layer for application developers that routes data at scale and in realtime. We want to improve the lives of other developers by making hard problems simple, freeing them from operating and maintaining their own realtime infrastructure.


We're looking to expand our engineering team so we can solve more problems for developers around the world, and part of that mission means continually improving the way we deploy and maintain our platform.


Some of the things you will be doing:



  • Increasing automation and reducing deployment time on our platform

  • Maintaining Pusher's reputation for maximum reliability

  • Building tools where one doesn't exist already

  • Being part of our on-call rota

  • Contributing to decisions about the team's architectural direction.


What do we think about DevOps?



  • We believe that engineers should deploy applications with the simplest and safest tooling available

  • We are big fans of immutable infrastructure and seek to reduce customisation of individual boxes

  • We prefer open source tools and cloud infrastructure
title: DevOps Engineer on our realtime messaging platform at Pusher (London, UK)

description:
Klicken & durchstarten!
karriere.optadata-gruppe.de


Lösungen, die verbinden – und Leistungen, die begeistern: Mit einem umfangreichen Dienstleistungs-und Produktportfolio ist die opta data Gruppe eines der führenden Abrechnungs- und IT-Dienstleistungszentren im deutschen Gesundheitswesen. Über 22.000 Kunden setzen mit opta data auf Lösungen, die genau auf ihren Berufsalltag abgestimmt sind und ihnen neue zeitliche und finanzielle Freiräume verschaffen. Und auch mit einem ausgezeichneten Service punkten wir: Schon sechsmal in Folge haben uns unsere Kunden zu „Deutschlands Kundenchampions“ gewählt.


Wir sind auf Wachstumskurs und werden unsere Marktstellung künftig noch weiter ausbauen. Unterstützen Sie uns dabei „im Zentrum des Geschehens“, in unserer Zentrale in Essen, als


Webentwickler/in

- Konzeption und Implementierung von Front- und Backend-Systemen
- Analyse und Lösung von Entwicklungsaufgaben
- Implementierung/Programmierung webbasierter Anwendungen in Teamarbeit

- Hochschulstudium oder vergleichbare Berufsausbildung im Bereich Informatik

- intensive Unterstützung und Begleitung in Ihrer fachlichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung

description:
What we want you to do here
As a back-end developer at Viaplay you will have the opportunity to work at the forefront of digital media, helping us grow the platform to meet the challenges of a continuously growing and passionate user base. Your engagement will help shape the future of our service as you’ll be involved in defining the cutting edge for video on demand.

What we can do for you
We offer a challenging environment working with scalable and highly available solutions at the cutting edge of technology within an international media company with strong consumer brands. You’ll be working in a team of 10 developers responsible for delivering content to all Viaplay platform clients, continuously adding functionality to our platform while improving existing features such as search and content recommendations. Docker, microservices, functional programming, continuous integration and daily releases will are all part of the developer experience here at Viaplay.

What we ask of you
You’re a passionate developer with a developer interest in Node.js or Java with an ambition to hone your skills in a fun, challenging and fast paced environment. You have strong communication skills, both in English and in Swedish, written as well as spoken. A successful candidate should meet the following qualifications:



  • Degree in computer science, computer engineering or an equivalent level of work experience (2-3 years)

  • Experience in developing services using Node.js+express, another dynamic language or Java

  • Knowledge of HTTP/REST services and web development patterns

  • Understanding of test- or behavior-driven development (TDD/BDD) including supporting frameworks

  • Knowledge of working with agile development methodologies



Join us today
Our HQ is in Stockholm, but our market is worldwide. You will become part of an amazing company with great people, content and culture. If this feels like your kind of challenge, please apply and attach your CV and cover letter. If you have any questions you are very welcome to call Johan Wolfhagen (Recruiter) at 076-494 09 66.

description:
What we want you to do
As a Senior Front-End Developer you will work within a team with other highly motivated and fun developers to build robust and well-structured services for the Viaplay technical platform. You will build web-based interfaces and applications and contribute to our platforms, APIs and libraries. Your work will be a part of Viaplay’s strategy to grow and continue to bring an innovative first class streaming service to our customers.

What we can do for you
Viaplay is driving next generation of video consumption and you will get the opportunity to influence the TV landscape of tomorrow. You will work within an expanding organisation that strives for excellence by taking responsibility and pitch in where needed as a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional team. The technical teams are prestigeless, problem solving oriented and flexible. Viaplay takes pride in being an inventive company and use forefront technology and test driven development and continuous deployments are central in the deployment process. We feel our culture is modern with a relaxed atmosphere where we want everyone to feel at home and we hope that you will too.

What we ask of you
You are an experienced developer and have had senior roles in the past. You have been involved in the development of services that require a high degree of scalability and fault tolerance. You have strong communication skills, both in English and in Swedish and excellent analytical and problem solving skills.



  • Front-end skills (ie. CSS, HTML, JavaScript) and understanding of or back end skills.

  • Experience creating responsive, device-agnostic interfaces via progressive enhancement.

  • Dedication to unit testing, code review and other quality-oriented practices.

  • Experience working with frameworks, CSS preprocessors, task runners (e.g., React.js, Sass, Grunt)

  • Enthusiasm for Agile software development.


Join us today
Our HQ is in Stockholm, but our market is across the Nordics. You will become part of an amazing company with great people, content and culture. If this feels like your kind of challenge, please apply and attach your CV and cover letter. If you have any questions you are very welcome to call Johan Wolfhagen (Recruiter) at 076-494 09 66.
title: Senior Front-end Developer at Viaplay (Stockholm, Sweden)

description:
Park is looking for a web developer with experience in building beautiful cloud based applications that can scale to reach national audiences. We are a technology company that puts our customers first to create effortless and elegant solutions that really make a difference. Park is a startup so no two days will be the same and you should be ready to be flexible and step up to get things done. Our culture is to build fast and iterate on the right product for today. We are looking for someone who wants to be part of our story as one of the first employees. In return for being part of what makes us a success you will gain a wealth of experience in the startup world working with an experienced startup delivery team with a mission. As well as a competitive package, team lunches and employees stock options we also offer a training budget you can use to boost your skills.


Package



  • Full time position with competitive salary.

  • 25 days holiday as well as bank holidays.

  • Share options so you take a stake in the company's success.

  • Annual bonus scheme based on company and individual performance.

  • Great office environment in a spectacular Fitzrovia space.

  • Regular funded team lunches, office snacks and monthly “Thirsty Thursday”

  • Personal training budget.

  • Casual dress code if you want!
title: Full Stack Web Developer at Park Technology (London, UK)

description:
As a Senior or Mid-Level iOS Engineer at JUST EAT you will work on a product that generated over £1billion worth of orders in 2014, but wait... It's still growing!? 


As an Engineer in UK Product Development what will you be doing?:



  • Our UK site and apps has over 40 orders a second at peak times, it's fast!

  • Working in Continuous Delivery / Deployment and having full stack control to meet your's and your teams objectives.

  • Using OKR's to be aligned with company wide objectives, and create great clarity about what will make the boat go faster!


If you are a Senior Engineer you will:



  • Will become a trusted technical authority and specialist in one or more technical areas of your team. You’ll be someone the rest of the team and your Technology Manager can turn to for engineering advice and guidance.

  • Collaborate with other product development teams and use their feedback as a basis for improvements.

  • Write technically sound, clean, maintainable code – with practical application of established patterns and practices.
title: Senior or Mid-Level iOS Engineer - UK Product Development at JUST EAT (London, UK)

description:
Our customers expect to be dazzled. Whether it’s TV, mobile, home phone or super-fast broadband services across the UK, at Virgin Media we’re focused on making their lives easier, richer and a little bit more fun.


This is an exciting time to join Virgin Media, as we are embarking on the biggest investment in the UK’s digital infrastructure for a decade and challenging our competitors with the best services and fastest speeds.


What will you be doing? In this role you will deliver high quality application solutions for new products and services regarding our customer portal (web portal) and mobile offerings.


Tasks will involve breaking down solution designs as produced by the design team and produce end-to-end detailed designs; investigates and repairs problem applications; identify improvement opportunities where possible; conduct unit testing, assess dependencies and impact on other systems, plan proof of concepts and pilots for new systems; provide day-to-day management/supervision of internal development resources and partners; and work with the development manager to define and maintain software development standards and methodologies.
title: Senior Developer / Team Leader - Great Opportunity to move into Team Leadership at Virgin Media (Hook, UK)

description:
To further develop our next generation ERP system we need expansion of the development team. To create the future we need you and your skills to make the difference in the food industry and beyond. 


The team exists of 15 Dutch developers who will work closely with you and an external team of 5 Romanian developers.  


Based on the functionalities of the current ERP systems and the knowledge of the market of our sales department and implementation consultants you work on the successor of the current Reflex 3000 ERP system. Within the development team there is a lot of freedom in developing our future. 


Do you want to be part of a enthusiastic team, you will be more than welcome to respond. We are looking for a Dutch speaking addition of the Dutch branche.
title: Medior & Senior .Net Developers needed for creating the future at ReflexSystems (Almere, Netherlands)

description:
DESCRIPTION:


Finnish financial technology company TAVIQ Oy (taviqinvesting.com) is looking for a talented software developer to join our work to modernize the investment industry. TAVIQ develops intelligent software solutions that help investment services and wealth managers to modernize and automate their services and serve their clients in more efficient and personal way.


TAVIQ is a place for innovation and modern technologies, a place where finance truly meets the technology. This is a place where pointy haired middle management will not push you to use Java or some other legacy.


We are looking for a software developer with entrepreneurial attitude. You will be working in a small team and you are able to affect straight to your own tools and responsibilities. We are looking for a person who wants to work with agile methods, innovative solutions, and has a drive to success.
title: Software Developer at TAVIQ Oy (Oulu, Finland)

description:
We are looking for talented and creative software developers in two job positions as iOS Developer and ASP.NET programmer. In each of these two positions you will be working closely with a team of talented and experienced analysts and designers. We practice the latest development methods and SCRUM and are dedicated to perfection. Our projects run on an interactive and finely controlled local Git server.


As an iOS developer you will be:



  • Developing iOS applications in either swift or objective-c

  • Participating in design and analysis sessions

  • Implementing UI/UX designs

  • Making use of our modern Mobile Back-End platform through web services

  • Design and develop Unit and automated UI tests


As an ASP.NET Developer and member of our back-end development team you will be:



  • Designing and developing back-end services

  • Creating RESTful and SOAP web services

  • Designing and implementing relational DBs

  • Ensuring the maximum security of back-end structures

  • Creating Automated Unit tests
title: Software Developer (iOS, ASP.NET) at Orchid Pharmed (Tehran, Iran)

description:
Sephora Digital SEA is seeking an experienced Android App Developer. As an Android App Developer, you will be responsible for end-to-end development of Sephora’s new Android Mobile App for SEA markets. This is an exciting opportunity to be involved in a pivotal project since early stage. You will be directly involved in setting the foundations for the Android App in the concept-definition stage and have the chance to drive innovation through close collaboration with other Teams (UX/UI Design, Product, Marketing). The position will be based in Singapore.


Responsibilities:


- Participate in full Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) for the Android Application


- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design and implement new features


- Integrate with backend APIs and external data sources


- Develop with strong testing culture with both unit and integration tests


- Work with project stakeholders to develop automated Acceptance tests


- Optimize for availability, performance and memory management


- Be responsible for delivering project milestones


- Continuously discover, evaluate, propose and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency


- Embrace and add value to a team that practices Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration pipeline, Agile development framework, manual and automated peer reviews.
title: Mobile App Developer - Android at Sephora Digital SEA (Singapore)

description:
The FT is currently working on the next generation of its FT.com website, called Next FT - a Node.js based suite of microservices orchestrated to form the user-interface to our journalism.


Responsibilities ...



  • JavaScript, CSS and HTML development for new product features.

  • Writing and integrating with server-side APIs.

  • Liaising with product owners, UX and designers to help shape the user experience.

  • Managing the lifecycle of a feature - from design to build to deployment.

  • Contributing to the company-wide frameworks.
title: Web Developer - Next Generation FT.com at Financial Times (London, UK)

description:
MANCHESTER’S TECH SCENE JUST GOT EVEN MORE EXCITING


Competitive package based on qualifications and experience


GCHQ is the government’s appointed expert in cyber security. Every hour of every day, we’re working to protect the UK. It's about keeping our society safe, secure and successful. From terrorists to hackers, fraudsters, and organised criminal gangs, the online threats we encounter are many, varied and increasingly sophisticated. So, we've always got to be one step ahead.


Here at our newest site in Greater Manchester, we’re looking for talented, motivated and experienced software specialists – people who like to solve the unsolvable, and develop unbreakable systems. Whether you’ve mastered C++ Java, or another language, we’ll put your valuable skills to work, helping to safeguard the entire UK from cyber threats.


In this unique environment you’ll use technologies you won’t find anywhere else. And due to the nature of what we do, you’ll maintain a healthy work-life balance because, at the end of the day, you simply can’t take your work home. We also offer flexible working hours wherever possible and a comprehensive benefits package which includes paid parental leave, amongst other advantages.
title: Software Developers - Manchesters tech scene just got even more exciting at GCHQ (Manchester, UK)

description:
Imagine what you could do at Apple, where great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. We’re looking for engineers to help us bring exciting new mobile products to the Android platform.


As a senior level Applications Software Engineer, your expertise will be challenged at every step of the process: You will be asked to brainstorm new products and features, collaborate with experts in every field to find the best way to implement them, and take responsibility for coding, debugging, and making your ideas real for millions of customers.
title: Applications SW Engineer - Android at Apple (Santa Clara, CA)

description:
Zimpler (Smart Payments Nordic AB) is a leading start-up within the fintech industry focusing on mobile payments for the iGaming Business. The company was founded in 2012 and launched its first version of the payment solution in 2013. Today, Zimpler is one of the fastest growing IT start-ups in Sweden with a revenue growth of 200% in 2015. They have two offices in Sweden; HQ in Stockholm and R&D in Gothenburg with a total of 20 employees.

The company is well-funded and controlled by the Financial Supervisory Authority (Finansinspektionen). There are currently around 200 gaming operators in Sweden and Finland that use Zimpler and very soon, the solution will be launched in the UK and a few other countries as well. In order to expand globally, Zimpler needs to hire a number of strong developers and further perfectionate Zimpler as a product.

About the Product
Not only does Zimpler offer its users a simple and effective solution to complete their payments through the mobile phone, it also gives them the opportunity to take control over their gaming. By using Zimpler, the user can see the total spending, deposits, and winnings across all different sites. The user can also choose to put limits on his or her gaming which helps preventing addictions. This is unique to Zimpler – no other solutions is able to do this today.
title: Developer (Ruby/ClojureScript) to Zimpler at Zimpler (Gothenburg, Sweden)

description:
WAS WIRST DU MACHEN?

description: Jaama is a fleet, leasing and rental management software and driver risk services company. As a certified Microsoft® Gold partner, Jaama uses the latest technology to provide customers with greater integration, control and automation. It brings innovative fleet management software and driver licence checking software to fleet operators, contract hire and leasing companies. Jaama is the first to combine fleet software and risk management services to help customers meet their driver health and safety responsibilities under occupational road safety regulations. After a successful bid, Robert Walters is exclusively working with Jaama and assisting them with multiple vacancies for Software Developers (Winforms, VB.Net, C#), which will work as part of this growing team in a rapidly growing company.
title: Software Developer (Winforms, VB.Net, C#) at Jaama (Tamworth, UK)

description:
Apple’s Siri group develops the market leading personal assistant Siri. We are looking to grow our team in Cambridge, UK by recruiting a senior software engineer with exceptional technical skills and personality to be an effective team member. You will be working in a team of highly talented software engineers and speech scientists to expand the capabilities of Siri.


Description


We are entering an exciting phase in Siri development, and we are aiming high both in terms of what Siri can do and the software engineering practices we follow in developing it. You will be developing software using world class tools and practices to deliver great new capabilities to Siri. You will be working on the bleeding edge of machine learning applied to speech systems.
title: Senior Software Engineer - Siri Development at Apple (Cambridge, UK)

description:
Our Snow Device Manager Team is looking for a .NET developer with a passion for mobile development and technology, to join their experienced team. 


The Snow Device Manager app enables organizations to manage the full life cycle of smartphones and tablets across the iOS, Android and Windows platforms. It extends the high levels of control and oversight already applied to desktops, datacenters and cloud computing to mobile devices. It is a platform for managing software and apps across all platforms and locations, and it implements smarter processes for service desks, enables information sharing between users on the move as well as configures devices and raises the bar on productivity.


For this position we are looking for a skilled C# developer to contribute in the development of new features along with supporting the team in server-side and client development.
title: .NET DEVELOPER FOR ENTERPRISE MOBILE APP at Snow Software (Solna, Sweden)

description:
ipt ist ein Schweizer IT-Beratungsunternehmen mit über 100 Mitarbeitenden. Leading-edge Technologien sind genauso unser Credo wie eine motivierende Unternehmenskultur. Gemeinsam vor Ort mit unseren Kunden realisieren wir innovative Software-Lösungen für komplexe geschäftliche Herausforderungen.


Wir entwickeln Individualsoftware mit «asset-based Software Solutions» unter Einsatz von führenden Softwareprodukten – mit so wenig Code wie möglich. Unsere vielfältigen Themen sind SOA, ESB, Java EE, BPM, Middleware, Security, Testing, API-Management, DevOps und Cloud Integration.


Was Sie bei uns tun


Sie entwickeln in einem kleinen, schlagkräftigen Projekt-Team innovative Lösungen für unsere Kunden. Sie beraten und begleiten den Kunden durch den ganzen SW-Entwicklungszyklus, vom Requirements Engineering über die Realisierung bis zum Testing und Go-Live. Dank Modellierung und Konfiguration auf modernsten Cloud-Technologien wie ServicNow PaaS oder Dell Boomi iPaaS setzen Sie Business Requirements agil und effizient um. Sie nutzen vorhandene APIs und realisieren neue APIs z.B. für mobile Apps.


Arbeitsort


Unsere Kunden sind grosse Unternehmen mit eigener IT-Abteilung in der Deutschschweiz. Deren Standorte sind schwerpunktmässig im Raum Bern, Basel, Luzern und Zürich. Deshalb ist betreffend Arbeitsplatz Flexibilität gefordert und die Bereitschaft zu pendeln. Dafür fahren Sie 1. Klasse und können auch im Zug arbeiten, solange das Projekt dies ermöglicht.


Einstieg


Der Start bei ipt läuft individuell ab. Gemeinsam definieren wir Themen und Technologien, Sie arbeiten sich selbständig ein. Selbstverständlich unterstützt Sie das ipt-Team und beantwortet gerne Ihre Fragen.


Weiterbildung


«We hire for attitude and we train for skills» ist ein Kernprinzip von ipt. Wir investieren viel in Sie. Deshalb sind Aus- und Weiterbildung für uns sehr wichtig. Wer welche Zertifizierung macht respektive welche Konferenz-Teilnahme sinnvoll ist, wird auf individueller Basis besprochen, ebenso die finanzielle und zeitliche Unterstützung
title: Cloud Entwickler (m/w) at ipt Innovation Process Technology (Zürich, ZH, Schweiz)

As a developer at Snow Software you will implement your own ideas to create great services for our customers. You will work closely with fellow teammates as well as our product management and design team to deliver quality products and solutions on time. In this position you are actively involved in the whole design and development process of our products, making them perform better and become even more user friendly. We offer an environment with exiting and developing assignment as well as the chance to join tech conferences and meet-ups in the Stockholm area.

description:
Är du i början av din karriär och söker ett jobb som webbutvecklare? Då har du kommit rätt! Hos Infor i Linköping kommer du att arbeta med UX (User Experience) och vidareutvecklingen av Infors molnbaserade e-handelsplattform ”Rhythm”. Utvecklingen sker med den senaste tekniken och enligt agila arbetsmetoder. Hos Infor får du också möjlighet att lära mer av erfarna kollegor. Låter det intressant? Sök då tjänsten idag!


OM TJÄNSTEN


Academic Work söker för Infors räkning webbutvecklare. ”Rhythm” är ett högt prioriterat projekt internt hos Infor, och därför vill man ta in konsulter som kan stötta upp vid utvecklingen av plattformen.


Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten eller om uppdraget får du gärna höra av dig till mig via mail eller på telefon: 07366444830.


Uppdraget är en del av vår personaluthyrning. Du kommer vara anställd av Academic Work och arbeta som konsult hos Infor under en period om 6 månader. Efter den initiala konsultperioden har du goda möjligheter att erbjudas anställning direkt hos Infor, förutsatt att bägge parter är nöjda med samarbetet.


ARBETSUPPGIFTER


Som webbutvecklare på Infor kommer du att arbeta med vidareutvecklingen av Infors molnbaserade e-handelsplattform ”Rhythm”. Med ”Rhythm” vill Infor förändra hur kunder handlar online. Syftet med ”Rhythm” är att skapa en lika stark köpupplevelse via dator, tablet och mobil som kunden upplever i den fysiska butiken. Utvecklingen sker i HTML5, CSS3 och JavaScript. Om du har erfarenhet av nyss nämnda språk är det mycket meriterande för tjänsten.


Tjänsten passar dig som vill arbeta i ett globalt företag och med den senaste tekniken inom webbutveckling.
title: WEBBUTVECKLARE TILL INFOR I LINKÖPING at INFOR (Linköping, Sweden)

description:
We are now looking for a System Developer to join our Multi- Platform Audit Solution team called Snow Inventory. In the role as a System Developer you will help scope new features, break them down to a manageable design and implement them, as well as maintain existing functionality.


The Snow Inventory team develops a multi-platform inventory solution designed to find devices, audit software installs and track usage. In order to collect this information the team develops small footprint agents that are installed to all devices and servers in the customer environment, regardless of platform. We have agents for all major OS such as Windows, Linux, Mac OS and UNIX. The agents are written in C++ or Java depending on the target platform. The information collected helps managers to proactively manage software usage, actively resolve issues and analyze changes across the network.
title: SYSTEM DEVELOPER FOR MULTI-PLATFORM AUDIT SOLUTION at Snow Software (Solna, Sweden)

description:
Bei uns gibt es 75 Entwickler-Teams. Und ich finde für dich genau das Richtige!


KOMM IN UNSER SOURCE CENTER!


Hallo, ich bin Matthias und zuständig für das 1&1 Source Center. Da wir über 75 Entwicklerteams haben, ist es meine Aufgabe, das jeweils passende für meine Mitarbeiter zu finden. Oder besser gesagt umgekehrt: Ich ermögliche meinen Mitarbeitern, verschiedene Teams kennenzulernen und dort zu bleiben, wo es passt. Und weil unsere Teams oft auf unterschiedliche Technologien und Konzepte rund um Java und JavaEE wie REST, BPM, ELK, Docker, Hadoop etc. setzen, wird es sicher nie langweilig.


Finde heraus, ob Du in einem agilen Team mit Scrum oder Kanban besser arbeiten kannst, als in einem, das seinen Entwicklungsprozess selbst definiert. Vernetze Dich auf dem Weg zum richtigen Team mit neuen Kollegen, lerne kontinuierlich dazu und gib Dein Wissen auch weiter. Wann Du dauerhaft aus dem Source Center in ein Team wechselst, entscheidest Du selbst. Interessiert? Dann melde Dich bei mir! matthias@1und1.de


Klingt spannend? Im Video erzähle ich noch mehr dazu:


http://1u1.de/matthias
title: Software-Entwickler - 1&1 Source Center - Komm in unser Team! at 1&1 (Karlsruhe, Deutschland)

description:
Lust, mit EJB3.1, JEE, CDI und JPA2 5 MIO. Kunden glücklich zu machen?


KOMM IN MEIN TEAM!

Hi, ich bin Nelli und arbeite als Software-Entwicklerin in der Abteilung Mobile Products. Wir kümmern uns darum, die rund 5 Mio. Mobilfunk-Kunden von 1&1 mit allen notwendigen Services zu versorgen, die man rund um sein Handy so braucht. Dabei ist jedes Team spezialisiert, was die Technologien angeht. Prozesse zur Bereitstellung der Services für den Kunden werden zum Beispiel auf Basis von Camunda BPM realisiert, und die Anbindung der verschiedenen Netzbetreiber erfolgt durch eine selbstgestrickte State Machine, die die jeweiligen Eigenarten der Provider abstrahiert. Alle Teams verwenden EJB3.1 und JEE auf JBoss 7 sowie CDI und JPA2.


In unseren Scrum-Teams arbeiten wir mit viel Spaß, gegenseitiger Unterstützung und hoher Motivation zusammen. Dabei sind uns neben guter Code-Qualität auch automatisierte Tests wichtig. Durch Code Reviews lernen wir viel voneinander und stellen sicher, dass unsere Qualität passt. Klingt gut? Dann melde Dich bei mir! nelli@1und1.de


Du willst mehr über mich und meine Arbeit erfahren? Dann jetzt das Video anschauen:


http://1u1.de/Nelli

Interesse, den Breitband-Ausbau von morgen zu sichern?


KOMM IN MEIN TEAM!

Du interessierst Dich für JavaEE und bevorzugst Open Source Software? Begriffe wie Maven, JBoss, WildFly und REST sind für Dich keine Fremdwörter? Frameworks, SQL und Linux gehören zu Deinem täglichen Handwerkszeug? Netze haben Dich schon immer interessiert, aber Deine VDSL-Leitung ist einfach zu langsam? Auch der Kabel-Zugang kann nicht mit Dir Schritt halten? Dann hast Du hier und jetzt die einmalige Möglichkeit, aktiv den Breitband-Internet-Ausbau in Deutschland mitzugestalten!



Mein Name ist Patrick, ich bin Software-Developer und Architekt in einem Team motivierter Backend-Entwickler, die Kommunikation und Team-Spirit schon lange als den Schlüssel zu nachhaltigem Erfolg identifiziert haben. Schließe Dich uns an, genieße die Vorteile eines funktionierenden SCRUM Workflows, verwirkliche Deine Ideen, lerne ständig dazu und lasse andere an Deinem Wissen und Deinen Erfahrungen teilhaben. description: There is a lot of excitement around NoSQL databases like MongoDB and Cassandra. We are designing a database that will supersede them all by combining the best of NoSQL and NewSQL. This will be the key infrastructure that will run tomorrow's cloud-scale applications. Our goal is to do this while providing the enterprise capabilities that Oracle is known for.  The database cloud architecture that we are designing makes a set of globally distributed database shards appear to database clients as a single, highly available and scalable virtual database. This new architecture will optimize the performance of a wide variety of applications through intelligent utilization of globally distributed resources and by transparently routing client work requests to the proper shards.  This is an opportunity for you to join the team that is setting the new standard for massively scalable and available databases. Pretty cool!  We are looking for highly motivated and talented individuals who want to make significant contributions to a highly visible and strategic project by solving complex problems in networking, distributed computing, high availability and extreme scalability.
title: Senior Software Engineer at Oracle (Redwood City, CA) (allows remote)
